restsms.type.title: Type of a configuration entity
restsms.type.description: The type of a configuration entity is described as its ID, its name and whether or not it is a collection

_id.title: ID
_id.description: The identifier of the type

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the type

collection.title: Is Collection
collection.description: Whether the type is a collection or singleton configuration type

authenticationLevel.title: Authentication Level
authenticationLevel.description:
The authentication level associated with this module.

Each authentication module has an authentication level that can be used to indicate the level of security associated with the module; 0 is the lowest (and the default).

defaultAnonymousUsername.title: Default Anonymous User Name
defaultAnonymousUsername.description: The default username to use if no username is supplied during authentication.

caseSensitiveUsernameMatchingEnabled.title: Case Sensitive User IDs
caseSensitiveUsernameMatchingEnabled.description: If enabled, username matching will be case sensitive.

validAnonymousUsers.title: Valid Anonymous Users
validAnonymousUsers.description:
List of accounts that are allowed to login without providing credentials.

Any username on this list will be allows anonymous access to OpenAM. Usernames listed here must have matching profiles in the data store or the user profile requirement must be disabled. The username can be specified during anonymous authentication as follows:

/openam/UI/Login?module=anonymous&IDToken1=username

am.encryption.pwd.title: Password Encryption Key
am.encryption.pwd.description: The encryption key value for decrypting passwords stored in the Service Management System configuration. (property name: am.encryption.pwd)

com.iplanet.security.encryptor.title: Encryption class
com.iplanet.security.encryptor.description: The default encryption class. (property name: com.iplanet.security.encryptor)

com.iplanet.security.SecureRandomFactory.title: Secure Random Factory Class
com.iplanet.security.SecureRandomFactory.description: This property is used for specifying SecureRandomFactory class. Available values for this property are com.iplanet.am.util.JSSSecureRandomFactoryImpl that is using JSS and com.iplanet.am.util.SecureRandomFactoryImpl that is using pure Java only. (property name: com.iplanet.security.SecureRandomFactoryImpl)

com.iplanet.services.comm.server.pllrequ.title: Platform Low Level Comm. Max. Content Length
com.iplanet.services.comm.server.pllrequ.description: Maximum content-length for an HttpRequest. (property name: com.iplanet.services.comm.server.pllrequest.maxContentLength)

com.iplanet.am.clientIPCheckEnabled.title: Client IP Address Check
com.iplanet.am.clientIPCheckEnabled.description: Specifies whether or not the IP address of the client is checked in all single sign on token creations or validations. (property name: com.iplanet.am.clientIPCheckEnabled)

com.iplanet.am.cookie.name.title: Cookie Name
com.iplanet.am.cookie.name.description: The cookie name used by Authentication Service to set the valid session handler ID. This name is used to retrieve the valid session information. (property name: com.iplanet.am.cookie.name)

com.iplanet.am.cookie.secure.title: Secure Cookie
com.iplanet.am.cookie.secure.description: Specifies whether to set cookie in a secure mode in which the browser will only return the cookie when a secure protocol such as HTTP(s) is used. (property name: com.iplanet.am.cookie.secure)

com.iplanet.am.cookie.encode.title: Encode Cookie Value
com.iplanet.am.cookie.encode.description: Specifies whether to URL encode the cookie value. (property name: com.iplanet.am.cookie.encode)

com.sun.identity.saml.xmlsig.keystore.title: Keystore File
com.sun.identity.saml.xmlsig.keystore.description: Specifies the location of the keystore file. (property name: com.sun.identity.saml.xmlsig.keystore)

com.sun.identity.saml.xmlsig.storetype.title: Keystore Type
com.sun.identity.saml.xmlsig.storetype.description: Specifies the keystore type. (property name: com.sun.identity.saml.xmlsig.storetype)

com.sun.identity.saml.xmlsig.storepass.title: Keystore Password File
com.sun.identity.saml.xmlsig.storepass.description: Specifies the location of the file that contains the password used to access the keystore file. (property name: com.sun.identity.saml.xmlsig.storepass)

com.sun.identity.saml.xmlsig.keypass.title: Private Key Password File
com.sun.identity.saml.xmlsig.keypass.description: Specifies the location of the file that contains the password used to protect the private key of a generated key pair. (property name: com.sun.identity.saml.xmlsig.keypass)

com.sun.identity.crl.cache.directory.sea.title: Search Attributes
com.sun.identity.crl.cache.directory.sea.description: Any DN component of issuer's subjectDN can be used to retrieve CRL from local LDAP server. It is single value string, like, "cn". All Root CA need to use the same search attribute.

openam.deserialisation.classes.whitelist.title: Whitelist
openam.deserialisation.classes.whitelist.description: The list of classes that are considered valid when OpenAM performs Object deserialisation operations. The defaults should work for most installations. (property name: openam.deserialisation.classes.whitelist)

1.0.title: Security Properties
1.0.description: An object of property key-value pairs

parameters.name: serverName
parameters.description: Server identifier - either the server URL, or server number

quotaLimit.title: Active User Sessions
quotaLimit.description: Maximum number of concurrent CTS-based sessions OpenAM allows a user to have.

maxSessionTime.title: Maximum Session Time
maxSessionTime.description: Maximum time a session can remain valid before OpenAM requires the user to authenticate again, in minutes.

maxCachingTime.title: Maximum Caching Time
maxCachingTime.description: Maximum time that external clients of AM are recommended to cache the session for, in minutes.

maxIdleTime.title: Maximum Idle Time
maxIdleTime.description: Maximum time a CTS-based session can remain idle before OpenAM requires the user to authenticate again, in minutes.

deviceIdSettingsEncryptionKeystore.title: Encryption Key Store
deviceIdSettingsEncryptionKeystore.description: Path to the key store from which to load encryption keys.

deviceIdSettingsEncryptionKeystoreKeyPai.title: Key-Pair Alias
deviceIdSettingsEncryptionKeystoreKeyPai.description: Alias of the certificate and private key in the key store. The private key is used to encrypt and decrypt device profiles.

deviceIdSettingsEncryptionKeystoreType.title: Key Store Type
deviceIdSettingsEncryptionKeystoreType.description:
Type of key store to load.

Note: PKCS#11 key stores require hardware support such as a security device or smart card and is not available by default in most JVM installations.

See the JDK 8 PKCS#11 Reference Guide for more details.

deviceIdSettingsEncryptionKeystorePasswo.title: Key Store Password
deviceIdSettingsEncryptionKeystorePasswo.description: Password to unlock the key store. This password is encrypted when it is saved in the OpenAM configuration. You should modify the default value.

deviceIdSettingsEncryptionKeystorePrivat.title: Private Key Password
deviceIdSettingsEncryptionKeystorePrivat.description: Password to unlock the private key.

deviceIdAttrName.title: Profile Storage Attribute
deviceIdAttrName.description:
The user's attribute in which to store Device ID profiles.

The default attribute is added to the schema when you prepare a user store for use with OpenAM. If you want to use a different attribute, you must make sure to add it to your user store schema prior to enabling the Device ID authentication module. OpenAM must be able to write to the attribute.

deviceIdSettingsEncryptionScheme.title: Device Profile Encryption Scheme
deviceIdSettingsEncryptionScheme.description:
Encryption scheme to use to secure device profiles stored on the server.

If enabled, each device profile is encrypted using a unique random secret key using the given strength of AES encryption in CBC mode with PKCS#5 padding. An HMAC-SHA of the given strength (truncated to half-size) is used to ensure integrity protection and authenticated encryption. The unique random key is encrypted with the given RSA key pair and stored with the device profile.

Note: AES-256 may require installation of the JCE Unlimited Strength policy files.

createdBy.title: Created by
createdBy.description: A string containing the universal identifier DN of the subject that created the script

name.title: Script name
name.description: The name provided for the script

lastModifiedBy.title: Last modifier
lastModifiedBy.description: A string containing the universal identifier DN of the subject that most recently updated the script. If the script has not been modified since it was created, this property will have the same value as createdBy

lastModifiedDate.title: Last modification date
lastModifiedDate.description: A string containing the last modified date and time, in ISO 8601 format. If the script has not been modified since it was created, this property will have the same value as creationDate

description.title: Script description
description.description: An optional text string to help identify the script

creationDate.title: Creation date
creationDate.description: An integer containing the creation date and time, in ISO 8601 format

language.title: Script language
language.description: The language the script is written in - JAVASCRIPT or GROOVY

script.title: Script
script.description: The source code of the script. The source code is in UTF-8 format and encoded into Base64

context.title: Script type
context.description: The script type. Supported values are: POLICY_CONDITION : Policy Condition  AUTHENTICATION_SERVER_SIDE : Server-side Authentication  AUTHENTICATION_CLIENT_SIDE : Client-side Authentication - Note Client-side scripts must be written in JavaScript OIDC_CLAIMS : OIDC Claims

queries.description: Get the full list of instances of this collection. This query only supports `_queryFilter=true` filter.

clientId.title: Client Id
clientId.description:
OAuth client_id parameter

For more information on the OAuth client_id parameter refer to the RFC 6749, section 2.3.1

smtpHostName.title: SMTP host
smtpHostName.description: The mail host that will be used by the Email Gateway implementation

accountMapperConfiguration.title: Account Mapper Configuration
accountMapperConfiguration.description:
Mapping of OAuth account to local OpenAM account

Attribute configuration that will be used to map the account of the user authenticated in the OAuth 2.0 Provider to the local data store in the OpenAM. Example: OAuth2.0_attribute=local_attribute

attributeMapperConfiguration.title: Attribute Mapper Configuration
attributeMapperConfiguration.description:
Mapping of OAuth attributes to local OpenAM attributes

Attribute configuration that will be used to map the user info obtained from the OAuth 2.0 Provider to the local user data store in the OpenAM.

Example: OAuth2.0_attribute=local_attribute

smtpPassword.title: SMTP User Password
smtpPassword.description: The Password of the SMTP User Name

smtpHostPort.title: SMTP port
smtpHostPort.description: The TCP port that will be used by the SMTP gateway

mapToAnonymousUser.title: Map to anonymous user
mapToAnonymousUser.description:
Enabled anonymous user access to OpenAM for OAuth authenticated users

If selected, the authenticated users in the OAuth 2.0 Provider will be mapped to the anonymous user configured in the next parameter.
If not selected the users authenticated will be mapped by the parameters configured in the account mapper.

NB If Create account if it does not exist is enabled, that parameter takes precedence.

userProfileServiceUrl.title: User Profile Service URL
userProfileServiceUrl.description:
User profile information URL

This URL endpoint provides user profile information and is provided by the OAuth Identity Provider

NB This URL should return JSON objects in response

accountMapperClass.title: Account Mapper
accountMapperClass.description:
Name of the class implementing the attribute mapping for the account search.

This class is used by the module to map from the account information received from the OAuth Identity Provider into OpenAM.

The class must implement the org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.AttributeMapper interface.
Provided implementations are:
  • org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.JsonAttributeMapper
  • org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.oidc.JwtAttributeMapper (can only be used when using the openid scope)
String constructor parameters can be provided by appending | separated values.

openidConnectContextType.title: OpenID Connect validation configuration type
openidConnectContextType.description: Required when the 'openid' scope is included. Please select either 1. the issuer discovery url, 2. the issuer jwk url, or 3. the client_secret.

smtpSslEnabled.title: SMTP SSL Enabled
smtpSslEnabled.description: Tick this option if the SMTP Server provides SSL

logoutBehaviour.title: Logout options
logoutBehaviour.description:
Controls how Logout options will be presented to the user.

The OAuth module has the following logout options for the user:

  • Prompt: Prompt the user to logout from the OAuth 2.0 Provider
  • Logout: Logout from the OAuth 2.0 Provider and do not prompt
  • Do not logout: Do not logout the user from the OAuth 2.0 Provider and do not prompt

mixUpMitigation.title: OAuth 2.0 Mix-Up Mitigation enabled
mixUpMitigation.description:
Enables OAuth 2.0 mix-up mitigation

The authorization server must support the OAuth 2.0 Mix-Up Mitigation draft, otherwise OpenAM will fail to validate responses from the authorization server. If only the OAuth 2.0 protocol is utilized, make sure that the accepted issuer value is set in the "Token Issuer" setting.

mailGatewayClass.title: Mail Server Gateway implementation class
mailGatewayClass.description:
The class used by the module to send email.

This class is used by the module to send email. A custom implementation can be provided.

The custom implementation must implement the org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.oauth2.EmailGateway

smtpUsername.title: SMTP User Name
smtpUsername.description: If the SMTP Service requires authentication, configure the user name here

oauth2EmailAttribute.title: Email attribute in OAuth2 Response
oauth2EmailAttribute.description:
Attribute from the OAuth2 response used to send activation code emails.

The attribute in the response from the profile service in the OAuth 2.0 Provider that contains the email address of the authenticated user. This address will be used to send an email with an activation code when the accounts are allowed to be created dynamically.

openidConnectIssuer.title: Token Issuer
openidConnectIssuer.description:
Required when the 'openid' scope is included. Value must match the iss field in issued ID Token
e.g. accounts.google.com

The issuer value MUST be provided when OAuth 2.0 Mix-Up Mitigation is enabled.

clientSecret.title: Client Secret
clientSecret.description:
OAuth client_secret parameter

For more information on the OAuth client_secret parameter refer to the RFC 6749, section 2.3.1

accessTokenParameterName.title: OAuth2 Access Token Profile Service Parameter name
accessTokenParameterName.description: The name of the parameter that will contain the access token value when accessing the profile service

ssoProxyUrl.title: Proxy URL
ssoProxyUrl.description:
The URL to the OpenAM OAuth proxy JSP

This URL should only be changed from the default, if an external server is performing the GET to POST proxying. The default is /openam/oauth2c/OAuthProxy.jsp

openidConnectContextValue.title: OpenID Connect validation configuration value
openidConnectContextValue.description:
Required when the 'openid' scope is included. The discovery url, or jwk url, or the client_secret, corresponding to the selection above.

If discovery or jwk url entered, entry must be in valid url format,
e.g. https://accounts.google.com/.well-known/openid-configuration
NB If client_secret entered, entry is ignored and the value of the Client Secret is used.

accountProviderClass.title: Account Provider
accountProviderClass.description:
Name of the class implementing the account provider.

This class is used by the module to find the account from the attributes mapped by the Account Mapper org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.AccountProvider interface.
String constructor parameters can be provided by appending | separated values.

anonymousUserName.title: Anonymous User
anonymousUserName.description:
Username of the OpenAM anonymous user

The username of the user that will represent the anonymous user. This user account must already exist in the realm.

attributeMappingClasses.title: Attribute Mapper
attributeMappingClasses.description:
Name of the class that implements the attribute mapping

This class maps the OAuth properties into OpenAM properties. A custom attribute mapper can be provided.

A custom attribute mapper must implement the org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.AttributeMapper interface.
Provided implementations are:
  • org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.JsonAttributeMapper
  • org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.oidc.JwtAttributeMapper (can only be used when using the openid scope)
String constructor parameters can be provided by appending | separated values.

accessTokenEndpointUrl.title: Access Token Endpoint URL
accessTokenEndpointUrl.description:
OAuth access token endpoint URL

This is the URL endpoint for access token retrieval provided by the OAuth Identity Provider. Refer to the RFC 6749, section 3.2

createAccount.title: Create account if it does not exist
createAccount.description:
If the OAuth2 account does not exist in the local OpenAM data store, an account will be created dynamically.

If this is enabled, the account mapper could create the account dynamically if there is no account mapped. Before creating the account, a dialog prompting for a password and asking for an activation code can be shown if the parameter "Prompt for password setting and activation code" is enabled.

If this flag is not enabled, 3 alternative options exist:

  1. The accounts need to have a user profile in the OpenAM User Data Store
  2. The user does not have a user profile and the "Ignore Profile" is set in the Authentication Service of the realm.
  3. The account is mapped to an anonymous account (see parameter "Map to anonymous user" and "Anonymous User")

authenticationLevel.title: Authentication Level
authenticationLevel.description:
The authentication level associated with this module.

Each authentication module has an authentication level that can be used to indicate the level of security associated with the module; 0 is the lowest (and the default).

scope.title: Scope
scope.description:
OAuth scope; list of user profile properties

According to the OAuth 2.0 Authorization Framework, scope is a space-separated list of user profile attributes that the client application requires. The list depends on the permissions that the resource owner grants to the client application.

Some authorization servers use non-standard separators for scopes. For example, Facebook takes a comma-separated list.

Default: email, read_stream (Facebook example)

authenticationEndpointUrl.title: Authentication Endpoint URL
authenticationEndpointUrl.description:
OAuth authentication endpoint URL

This is the URL endpoint for OAuth authentication provided by the OAuth Identity Provider

oauth2LogoutServiceUrl.title: OAuth 2.0 Provider logout service
oauth2LogoutServiceUrl.description:
The URL of the OAuth Identity Providers Logout service

OAuth 2.0 Identity Providers can have a logout service. If this logout functionality is required then the URL of the Logout endpoint should configured here.

promptForPassword.title: Prompt for password setting and activation code
promptForPassword.description:
Users must set a password and complete the activation flow during dynamic profile creation.

If this is enabled, the user must set a password before the system creates an account dynamically and an activation code will be sent to the user's email address. The account will be created only if the password and activation code are properly set.
If this is disabled, the account will be created transparently without prompting the user.

smtpFromAddress.title: SMTP From address
smtpFromAddress.description: The email address on behalf of whom the messages will be sent

saveAttributesInSession.title: Save attributes in the session
saveAttributesInSession.description: If this option is enabled, the attributes configured in the attribute mapper will be saved into the OpenAM session

googleLink.title: Google Play URL
googleLink.description: URL of the app to download on Google Play.

timeoutInMilliSecconds.title: Registration Response Timeout (ms)
timeoutInMilliSecconds.description: The period of time (in milliseconds) within which the registration QR code should be replied to.

issuer.title: Issuer Name
issuer.description: The Name of the service as it will appear on the registered device.

imgUrl.title: Image URL
imgUrl.description: The location of the image to download and display as your identity issuer's logo within the mobile app.

bgcolour.title: Background Colour
bgcolour.description: The background colour of the image to display behind your identity issuer's logo within the mobile app.

resourceSchema.title: Audit event schema
resourceSchema.description: The schema contains properties that are common to all topics and some that are unique to a specific topic. The description of each property indicates which topic the property applies to.

_id.title: ID
_id.description: The ID of the event, used by all topics

timestamp.title: Timestamp
timestamp.description: The time at which the event occurred, used by all topics

eventName.title: Event name
eventName.description: The name of the event, used by all topics

transactionId.title: Transaction ID
transactionId.description: The transaction ID of the event, used by all topics

userId.title: User ID
userId.description: The ID of the user responsible for the event, used by all topics

trackingIds.title: Tracking IDs
trackingIds.description: The tracking IDs of the event, used by all topics

component.title: Component
component.description: The component responsible for the event, used by all topics

realm.title: Realm
realm.description: The realm in which the event occurred, used by all topics

server.title: Server
server.description: The server details for an access event

ip.title: Server IP address
ip.description: The server ip address for an access event

port.title: Server port
port.description: The server port for an access event

client.title: Client
client.description: The client details for an access event

ip.title: Client IP address
ip.description: The client IP address for an access event

port.title: Client port
port.description: The client port for an access event

request.title: Request
request.description: The request details for an access event

protocol.title: Request protocol
protocol.description: The request protocol for an access event

1.0.title: Audit Event
1.0.description: Audit events are logged through a realm audit service.

create.description: Create a new audit event, which will be handled and logged by the configured audit service.

parameters.name: topic
parameters.description: The topic under which to log the audit event.

tokenEndpointAuthMethod.title: Token Endpoint Authentication Method
tokenEndpointAuthMethod.description: The authentication method with which a client authenticates to the authorization server at the token endpoint. The authentication method applies to OIDC requests with the openid scope.

subjectType.title: Subject Type
subjectType.description: The subject type added to responses for this client.

contacts.title: Contacts
contacts.description: Email addresses of users who can administrate this client.

updateAccessToken.title: Access Token
updateAccessToken.description: The access token used to update the client.

descriptions.title: Display description
descriptions.description:
A description of the client or other information that may be relevant to the resource owner when considering approval.

The description may be entered as a single string or as pipe separated strings for locale and localized name; e.g. "en|The company intranet is requesting the following access permission". Locale strings are in the format language + "_" + country + "_" + variant, e.g. en, en_GB, en_US_WIN. If the locale is omitted, the description is displayed to all users having undefined locales. e.g. "The company intranet is requesting the following access permission".

clientUri.title: Client URI
clientUri.description: The URI for finding further information about the client from user-facing UIs.

isConsentImplied.title: Implied consent
isConsentImplied.description: When enabled, the resource owner will not be asked for consent during authorization flows. The OAuth2 Provider must be configured to allow clients to skip consent.

policyUri.title: Privacy Policy URI
policyUri.description: The URI for the client's privacy policy, for use in user-facing consent pages.

grantTypes.title: Grant Types
grantTypes.description:
The set of Grant Types (OAuth2 Flows) that are permitted to be used by this client.

If no Grant Types (OAuth2 Flows) are configured then AUTHORIZATION_CODE flow would be permitted by default.

mixUpMitigation.title: OAuth 2.0 Mix-Up Mitigation enabled
mixUpMitigation.description:
Enables OAuth 2.0 mix-up mitigation on the authorization server side.

Enable this setting only if this OAuth 2.0 client supports the OAuth 2.0 Mix-Up Mitigation draft, otherwise AM will fail to validate access token requests received from this client.

name.title: Display name
name.description:
A client name that may be relevant to the resource owner when considering approval.

The name may be entered as a single string or as pipe separated strings for locale and localized name; e.g. "en|The ExampleCo Intranet". Locale strings are in the format language + "_" + country + "_" + variant, e.g. en, en_GB, en_US_WIN. If the locale is omitted, the name is displayed to all users having undefined locales. e.g. "The ExampleCo Intranet".

sectorIdentifierUri.title: Sector Identifier URI
sectorIdentifierUri.description: The Host component of this URL is used in the computation of pairwise Subject Identifiers.

logoUri.title: Logo URI
logoUri.description: The URI for the client's logo, for use in user-facing UIs such as consent pages and application pages.

requestUris.title: Request uris
requestUris.description:
Array of request_uri values that are pre-registered by the RP for use at the OP.

The entire Request URI MUST NOT exceed 512 ASCII characters and MUST use either HTTP or HTTPS. Otherwise the value will be ignored.

responseTypes.title: Response Types
responseTypes.description: Response types this client will support and use.

accessTokenLifetime.title: Access Token Lifetime (seconds)
accessTokenLifetime.description: The time in seconds an access token is valid for. NB If this field is set to zero, Access Token Lifetime of the OAuth2 Provider is used instead of.

scopes.title: Scope(s)
scopes.description:
Scope(s). Scopes are strings that are presented to the user for approval and included in tokens so that the protected resource may make decisions about what to give access to.

Scopes may be entered as simple strings or pipe separated strings representing the internal scope name, locale, and localized description; e.g. "read|en|Permission to view email messages in your account". Locale strings are in the format language + "_" + country + "_" + variant, e.g. en, en_GB, en_US_WIN. If the locale and pipe is omitted, the description is displayed to all users having undefined locales. e.g. "read|Permission to view email messages in your account". NB If the description is also omitted, nothing is displayed to all users, e.g. specifying "read|" would allow the scope "read" to be used by the client, but would not display it to the user when it was requested.

authorizationCodeLifetime.title: Authorization Code Lifetime (seconds)
authorizationCodeLifetime.description: The time in seconds an authorization code is valid for. NB If this field is set to zero, Authorization Code Lifetime of the OAuth2 Provider is used instead of.

redirectionUris.title: Redirection URIs
redirectionUris.description: Redirection URIs (optional for confidential clients). Complete URIs or URIs consisting of protocol + authority + path are registered so that the OAuth 2.0 provider can trust that tokens are sent to trusted entities. If multiple URI's are registered, the client MUST specify the URI that the user should be redirected to following approval. May not contain a fragment (#).

clientType.title: Client type
clientType.description: Type of OAuth 2.0 client. Confidential clients can keep their password secret, and are typically web apps or other server-based clients. Public clients run the risk of exposing their password to a host or user agent, such as rich browser applications or desktop clients.

refreshTokenLifetime.title: Refresh Token Lifetime (seconds)
refreshTokenLifetime.description: The time in seconds a refresh token is valid for. NB If this field is set to zero, Refresh Token Lifetime of the OAuth2 Provider is used instead. If this field is set to -1, the token will never expire.

defaultScopes.title: Default Scope(s)
defaultScopes.description:
Default Scope(s). Scopes automatically given to tokens.

Default Scopes may be entered as simple strings or pipe separated strings representing the internal scope name, locale, and localized description; e.g. "read|en|Permission to view email messages in your account". Locale strings are in the format language + "_" + country + "_" + variant, e.g. en, en_GB, en_US_WIN. If the locale and pipe is omitted, the description is displayed to all users having undefined locales. e.g. "read|Permission to view email messages in your account". NB If the description is also omitted, nothing is displayed to all users, e.g. specifying "read|" would allow the scope "read" to be used by the client, but would not display it to the user when it was requested.

clientName.title: Client Name
clientName.description: This value is a readable name for this client.

mTLSSubjectDN.title: mTLS Subject DN
mTLSSubjectDN.description: Expected Subject DN of certificate used for mTLS client certificate authentication. Defaults to CN=<client_id>. Only applicable when using CA-signed certificates.

clientJwtPublicKey.title: Client JWT Bearer Public Key
clientJwtPublicKey.description: A Base64 encoded X509 certificate, containing the public key, represented as a UTF-8 PEM file, of the key pair for signing the Client Bearer JWT.

jwkSet.title: Json Web Key
jwkSet.description: Raw JSON Web Key value containing the client's public keys.

idTokenEncryptionEnabled.title: Enable ID Token Encryption
idTokenEncryptionEnabled.description: Select to enable ID token encryption.

idTokenSignedResponseAlg.title: ID Token Signing Algorithm
idTokenSignedResponseAlg.description: Algorithm the ID Token for this client must be signed with.

idTokenPublicEncryptionKey.title: Client ID Token Public Encryption Key
idTokenPublicEncryptionKey.description: A Base64 encoded public key for encrypting ID Tokens.

jwksCacheTimeout.title: JWKs URI content cache timeout in ms
jwksCacheTimeout.description: To avoid loading the JWKS URI content for every token encryption, the JWKS content is cached. This timeout defines the maximum of time the JWKS URI content can be cached before being refreshed.

jwkStoreCacheMissCacheTime.title: JWKs URI content cache miss cache time
jwkStoreCacheMissCacheTime.description: To avoid loading the JWKS URI content for every token signature verification, especially when the kid is not in the jwks content already cached, the JWKS content will be cache for a minimum period of time. This cache miss cache time defines the minimum of time the JWKS URI content is cache.

mTLSCertificateBoundAccessTokens.title: Use Certificate-Bound Access Tokens
mTLSCertificateBoundAccessTokens.description: Whether access tokens issued to this client should be bound to the X.509 certificate it uses to authenticate to the token endpoint. If enabled (and the provider supports it) then an x5t#S256 confirmation key will be added to all access tokens with the SHA-256 hash of the client's certificate.

userinfoEncryptedResponseEncryptionAlgor.title: User info encrypted response encryption algorithm
userinfoEncryptedResponseEncryptionAlgor.description:
JWE enc algorithm for encrypting UserInfo Responses. If userinfo encrypted response algorithm is specified, the default for this value is A128CBC-HS256. When user info encrypted response encryption is included, user info encrypted response algorithm MUST also be provided.

AM supports the following token encryption algorithms:
  • A128GCM, A192GCM, and A256GCM - AES in Galois Counter Mode (GCM) authenticated encryption mode.
  • A128CBC-HS256, A192CBC-HS384, and A256CBC-HS512 - AES encryption in CBC mode, with HMAC-SHA-2 for integrity.

requestParameterEncryptedAlg.title: Request parameter encryption algorithm
requestParameterEncryptedAlg.description: JWE algorithm for encrypting the request parameter.

requestParameterEncryptedEncryptionAlgor.title: Request parameter encryption method
requestParameterEncryptedEncryptionAlgor.description:
JWE enc algorithm for encrypting the request parameter.

AM supports the following token encryption algorithms:
  • A128GCM, A192GCM, and A256GCM - AES in Galois Counter Mode (GCM) authenticated encryption mode.
  • A128CBC-HS256, A192CBC-HS384, and A256CBC-HS512 - AES encryption in CBC mode, with HMAC-SHA-2 for integrity.

userinfoSignedResponseAlg.title: User info signed response algorithm
userinfoSignedResponseAlg.description: JWS algorithm for signing UserInfo Responses. If this is specified, the response will be JWT JWT serialized, and signed using JWS. The default, if omitted, is for the UserInfo Response to return the Claims as a UTF-8 encoded JSON object using the application/json content-type.

tokenEndpointAuthSigningAlgorithm.title: Token Endpoint Authentication Signing Algorithm
tokenEndpointAuthSigningAlgorithm.description: The JWS algorithm that MUST be used for signing the JWT used to authenticate the Client at the Token Endpointfor the private_key_jwt and client_secret_jwt authentication methods. All Token Requests using these authentication methods from this Client MUST be rejected, if the JWT is not signed with this algorithm.

publicKeyLocation.title: Public key selector
publicKeyLocation.description: Select the public key for this client to come from either the jwks_uri, manual jwks or X509 field.

jwksUri.title: Json Web Key URI
jwksUri.description: The uri that contains the client's public keys in Json Web Key format.

idTokenEncryptionAlgorithm.title: ID Token Encryption Algorithm
idTokenEncryptionAlgorithm.description: Algorithm the ID Token for this client must be encrypted with.

idTokenEncryptionMethod.title: ID Token Encryption Method
idTokenEncryptionMethod.description: Encryption method the ID Token for this client must be encrypted with.

requestParameterSignedAlg.title: Request parameter signing algorithm
requestParameterSignedAlg.description: JWS algorithm for signing the request parameter.

userinfoResponseFormat.title: User info response format.
userinfoResponseFormat.description: The user info endpoint offers different output format. See http://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html#UserInfoResponse

mTLSTrustedCert.title: mTLS Self-Signed Certificate
mTLSTrustedCert.description: Self-signed PEM-encoded X.509 certificate for mTLS client certificate authentication.

userinfoEncryptedResponseAlg.title: User info encrypted response algorithm
userinfoEncryptedResponseAlg.description: JWE algorithm for encrypting UserInfo Responses. If both signing and encryption are requested, the response will be signed then encrypted, with the result being a Nested JWT. The default, if omitted, is that no encryption is performed.

claimsRedirectionUris.title: Claims Redirection URIs
claimsRedirectionUris.description: Redirection URIs for returning to the client from UMA claims collection (not yet supported). If multiple URIs are registered, the client MUST specify the URI that the user should be redirected to following approval. May not contain a fragment (#).

jwtTokenLifetime.title: OpenID Connect JWT Token Lifetime (seconds)
jwtTokenLifetime.description: The time in seconds a JWT is valid for. NB If this field is set to zero, JWT Token Lifetime of the OAuth2 Provider is used instead of.

defaultMaxAge.title: Default Max Age
defaultMaxAge.description: Minimum value 1. Sets the maximum length of time in seconds a session may be active after the authorization service has succeeded before the user must actively re-authenticate.

clientSessionUri.title: Client Session URI
clientSessionUri.description: This is the URI that will be used to check messages sent to the session management endpoints. This URI must match the origin of the message

postLogoutRedirectUri.title: Post Logout Redirect URIs
postLogoutRedirectUri.description: URIs that can be redirected to after the client logout process.

claims.title: Claim(s)
claims.description:
List of claim name translations, which will override those specified for the AS. Claims are values that are presented to the user to inform them what data is being made available to the Client.

Claims may be entered as simple strings or pipe separated strings representing the internal claim name, locale, and localized description; e.g. "name|en|Your full name". Locale strings are in the format language + "_" + country + "_" + variant, e.g. en, en_GB, en_US_WIN. If the locale and pipe is omitted, the description is displayed to all users having undefined locales. e.g. "name|Your full name". NB If the description is also omitted, nothing is displayed to all users, e.g. specifying "name|" would allow the claim "name" to be used by the client, but would not display it to the user when it was requested.

If a value is not given here, the value will be computed from the OAuth 2 Provider settings.

defaultAcrValues.title: Default ACR values
defaultAcrValues.description:
Default requested Authentication Context Class Reference values.

Array of strings that specifies the default acr values that the OP is being requested to use for processing requests from this Client, with the values appearing in order of preference. The Authentication Context Class satisfied by the authentication performed is returned as the acr Claim Value in the issued ID Token. The acr Claim is requested as a Voluntary Claim by this parameter. The acr_values_supported discovery element contains a list of the acr values supported by this server. Values specified in the acr_values request parameter or an individual acr Claim request override these default values.

defaultMaxAgeEnabled.title: Default Max Age Enabled
defaultMaxAgeEnabled.description: Whether or not the default max age is enforced.

1.0.title: OAuth2 Client Agent Groups
1.0.description: Agent Groups handler that is responsible for managing agent groups

org.forgerock.openam.session.service.acc.title: Maximum Session Cache Size
org.forgerock.openam.session.service.acc.description: The maximum number of sessions to cache in the per-server internal session cache. (property name: org.forgerock.openam.session.service.access.persistence.caching.maxsize)

com.iplanet.am.session.invalidsessionmax.title: Invalidate Session Max Time
com.iplanet.am.session.invalidsessionmax.description: Duration in minutes after which the invalid session will be removed from the session table if it is created and the user does not login. This value should always be greater than the timeout value in the Authentication module properties file. (property name: com.iplanet.am.session.invalidsessionmaxtime)

com.iplanet.am.stats.interval.title: Logging Interval (in seconds)
com.iplanet.am.stats.interval.description: Number of seconds to elapse between statistics logging. The interval should be at least 5 seconds to avoid CPU saturation. An interval value less than 5 seconds will be interpreted as 5 seconds. (property name: com.iplanet.am.stats.interval)

com.iplanet.services.stats.state.title: State
com.iplanet.services.stats.state.description: Statistics state 'file' will write to a file under the specified directory, and 'console' will write into webserver log files. (property name: com.iplanet.services.stats.state)

com.iplanet.services.stats.directory.title: Directory
com.iplanet.services.stats.directory.description: Directory where the statistic files will be created. Use forward slashes "/" to separate directories, not backslash "\". Spaces in the file name are allowed for Windows. (property name: com.iplanet.services.stats.directory)

com.sun.am.session.enableHostLookUp.title: Enable Host Lookup
com.sun.am.session.enableHostLookUp.description: Enables or disables host lookup during session logging. (property name: com.sun.am.session.enableHostLookUp)

com.iplanet.am.notification.threadpool.s.title: Notification Pool Size
com.iplanet.am.notification.threadpool.s.description: Specifies the size of the notification thread pool (total number of threads). (property name: com.iplanet.am.notification.threadpool.size)

com.iplanet.am.notification.threadpool.t.title: Notification Thread Pool Threshold
com.iplanet.am.notification.threadpool.t.description: Specifies the maximum task queue length for serving notification threads. (property name: com.iplanet.am.notification.threadpool.threshold)

com.sun.am.session.caseInsensitiveDN.title: Case Insensitive client DN comparison
com.sun.am.session.caseInsensitiveDN.description: Specifies if client distinguished name comparison is case insensitive/sensitive. (property name: com.sun.am.session.caseInsensitiveDN)

1.0.title: Default Session Properties
1.0.description: An object of property key-value pairs

resourceSchema.title: Policy Resource Schema
resourceSchema.description: Json schema for the policy resource

name.title: Name
name.description: String matching the name of the application

active.title: Active flag
active.description: Boolean indicating whether OpenAM considers the policy active for evaluation purposes, defaults to false

applicationName.title: Application name
applicationName.description: String containing the application name, such as "iPlanetAMWebAgentService", or "mypolicyset"

actionValues.title: Action values
actionValues.description: Set of string action names, each set to a boolean indicating whether the action is allowed. Chosen from the available actions provided by the associated Managing Resource Types resource type

resources.title: Resources
resources.description: List of the resource name pattern strings to which the policy applies. Must conform to the pattern templates provided by the associated Managing Resource Types resource type

subject.title: Subject
subject.description: Specifies the subject conditions to which the policy applies, where subjects can be combined by using the built-in types "AND", "OR", and "NOT", and where subject implementations are pluggable

condition.title: Condition
condition.description: Specifies environment conditions, where conditions can be combined by using the built-in types "AND", "OR", and "NOT", and where condition implementations are pluggable

conditions.title: Condition
conditions.description: Specifies environment conditions, where conditions can be combined by using the built-in types "AND", "OR", and "NOT", and where condition implementations are pluggable

resourceTypeUuid.title: Resource Type UUID
resourceTypeUuid.description: The UUIDs of the resource type associated with the policy

resourceAttributes.title: Resource Attributes
resourceAttributes.description: List of attributes to return with decisions. These attributes are known as response attributes

lastModifiedBy.title: Last Modified By
lastModifiedBy.description: A string containing the universal identifier DN of the subject that most recently updated the policy

lastModifiedDate.title: Last Modified date
lastModifiedDate.description: An integer containing the last modified date and time, in number of seconds

createdBy.title: Created By
createdBy.description: A string containing the universal identifier DN of the subject that created the policy

creationDate.title: Creation Date
creationDate.description: An integer containing the creation date and time, in number of seconds

1.0.title: User Policies
1.0.description: The User Policy resource endpoint is responsible for managing a user's policies. The available operations are create, read, update, delete, query. Policies are realm specific, hence the URI for the policies API can contain a realm component. If the realm is not specified in the URI, the top level realm is used.

* Missing privilege name
* Invalid json provided in the request

* Invalid policy name provided in json
* Resource name and JSON body name do not match

* Invalid query id
* Invalid search filter
* Empty privilege name
* Entitlement value was NULL
* No resource type was expected
* Policy defines invalid resource type

pathParameter.name: resourceId
pathParameter.description: The unique identifier of the policy

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: The user that owns the policies.

autoStoreProfiles.title: Automatically store new profiles
autoStoreProfiles.description:
Select this checkbox to assume user consent to store every new profile

If this checkbox is selected user won't be prompted for storing new profiles. After successful OTP confirmation profile will be stored automatically.

maxProfilesAllowed.title: Maximum stored profile quantity
maxProfilesAllowed.description: No more than specified profiles quantity will be stored in user record

authenticationLevel.title: Authentication Level
authenticationLevel.description:
The authentication level associated with the authentication module.

Each authentication module has an authentication level that can be used to indicate the level of security associated with the module; 0 is the lowest (and the default).

ignorePathInfo.title: Ignore Path Info in Request URL
ignorePathInfo.description:
The path info will be stripped from the request URL while doing Not Enforced List check and url policy evaluation if the value is set to true. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.ignore.path.info)
Hot-swap: Yes

encodeProfileAttributes.title: Native Encoding of Profile Attributes
encodeProfileAttributes.description:
Agent encodes the ldap header values in the default encoding of OS locale. If false, UTF-8 gets used. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.convert.mbyte.enable)
Hot-swap: Yes

anonymousUserEnabled.title: Anonymous User
anonymousUserEnabled.description:
Enable/Disable REMOTE_USER processing for anonymous users. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.anonymous.user.enable)
Hot-swap: Yes

caseInsensitiveUrlComparison.title: URL Comparison Case Sensitivity Check
caseInsensitiveUrlComparison.description:
Enforces case insensitivity in both policy and not enforced url evaluation. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.url.comparison.case.ignore)
Hot-swap: Yes

encodeUrlSpecialCharacters.title: Encode URL's Special Characters
encodeUrlSpecialCharacters.description:
Encodes the url which has special characters before doing policy evaluation. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.encode.url.special.chars.enable)
Hot-swap: Yes

agentLocale.title: Agent Locale
agentLocale.description:
The default locale for the product. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.locale)
Hot-swap: No

encodeSpecialCharsInCookies.title: Encode special chars in Cookies
encodeSpecialCharsInCookies.description:
Encode special chars in cookie by URL encoding. Useful when profile, session and response attributes contain special chars and attributes fetch mode is set to HTTP_COOKIE. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.encode.cookie.special.chars.enable)
Hot-swap: Yes

gotoParameterName.title: Goto Parameter Name
gotoParameterName.description:
Property used only when CDSSO is enabled. Default value should be changed only when the login URL has a landing page specified
Example : com.sun.identity.agents.config.cdsso.cdcservlet.url = http://host:port/opensso/cdcservlet?goto=http://agent:port/landing.jsp
The parameter is used by the Agent to append the original request URL to this cdcserlet URL. This parameter is consumed by the landing page to redirect to the original URL. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.redirect.param)
Hot-swap: Yes
Example: com.sun.identity.agents.config.redirect.param = goto2
The complete URL sent for authentication will be
http://host:port/opensso/cdcservlet?goto=http://agent:port/landing.jsp?goto2=http://agent.port/original.jsp

profileAttributesCookieMaxAge.title: Profile Attributes Cookie Maxage
profileAttributesCookieMaxAge.description:
Maxage of attributes cookie headers. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.profile.attribute.cookie.maxage)
Hot-swap: Yes

anonymousUserId.title: Anonymous User Default Value
anonymousUserId.description:
User id of unauthenticated users. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.anonymous.user.id)
Hot-swap: Yes

ignoreServerCheck.title: Ignore Server Check
ignoreServerCheck.description:
Agent uses this value to check AM is up before doing a 302 redirect. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.ignore.server.check)
Hot-swap: Yes

ignorePreferredNamingUrl.title: Ignore Preferred Naming URL in Naming Request
ignorePreferredNamingUrl.description:
Agent uses this value to send preferred naming url in the naming request. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.ignore.preferred.naming.url)
Hot-swap: Yes

profileAttributesCookiePrefix.title: Profile Attributes Cookie Prefix
profileAttributesCookiePrefix.description:
Sets cookie prefix in the attributes headers. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.profile.attribute.cookie.prefix)
Hot-swap: Yes

fqdnMapping.title: FQDN Virtual Host Map
fqdnMapping.description:
Maps virtual, invalid, or partial hostnames, and IP addresses to the FQDN to access protected resources. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.fqdn.mapping)
Hot-swap: Yes
Examples:
To map the partial hostname myserver to myserver.mydomain.com: enter myserver in the Map Key field and myserver.mydomain.com in the Corresponding Map Value field. To map a virtual server rst.hostname.com that points to the actual server abc.hostname.com: enter valid1 in the Map Key field and rst.hostname.com in the Corresponding Map Value field.

agentNotificationUrl.title: Agent Notification URL
agentNotificationUrl.description:
(Not used in Agent 5 onwards)
URL used by agent to register notification listeners. (property name: com.sun.identity.client.notification.url)
Hot-swap: No

ssoOnlyMode.title: SSO Only Mode
ssoOnlyMode.description:
Agent will just enforce authentication (SSO), but no authorization for policies. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.sso.only)
Hot-swap: Yes

auditAccessType.title: Audit Access Types
auditAccessType.description:
Types of messages to log based on user URL access attempts. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.audit.accesstype)
Hot-swap: Yes

localAuditLogRotation.title: Rotate Local Audit Log
localAuditLogRotation.description:
Flag to indicate that audit log files should be rotated when reaching a certain size. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.local.log.rotate)
Hot-swap: Yes

remoteLogSendInterval.title: Remote Audit Log Interval
remoteLogSendInterval.description:
Periodic interval in minutes in which audit log messages are sent to remote log file. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.remote.log.interval)
Hot-swap: No

webSocketConnectionIntervalInMinutes.title: Web Socket Connection Interval
webSocketConnectionIntervalInMinutes.description: Interval in minutes by which agents reopen their web socket connection to ensure a fair distribution of connections across AM servers. (Agent 5 only).

notificationsEnabled.title: Enable Notifications
notificationsEnabled.description:
The notifications help in maintaining agent's sso, policy and configuration caches. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.notification.enable)
Hot-swap: No

debugRotationSize.title: Agent Debug File Size
debugRotationSize.description:
Agent debug file size in bytes. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.debug.file.size)
Hot-swap: Yes

localAuditRotationSize.title: Local Audit Log Rotation Size
localAuditRotationSize.description:
Size limit in bytes when a local audit log file is rotated to a new file. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.local.log.size)
Hot-swap: Yes

configurationCleanupInterval.title: Configuration Cleanup Interval
configurationCleanupInterval.description:
Interval in minutes to cleanup old agent configuration entries. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.cleanup.interval)
Hot-swap: No

debugLogRotation.title: Agent Debug File Rotation
debugLogRotation.description:
Debug file gets rotated based on the size specified. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.debug.file.rotate)
Hot-swap: Yes

fqdnDefault.title: FQDN Default
fqdnDefault.description:
Fully qualified hostname that the users should use in order to access resources. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.fqdn.default)
Hot-swap: Yes

agentConfigChangeNotificationsEnabled.title: Agent Configuration Change Notification
agentConfigChangeNotificationsEnabled.description:
Enable agent to receive notification messages from AM server for configuration changes. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.change.notification.enable)
Hot-swap: Yes

fqdnCheck.title: FQDN Check
fqdnCheck.description:
Enables checking of fqdn default value and fqdn map values. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.fqdn.check.enable)
Hot-swap: Yes

cdssoRootUrl.title: Agent Root URL for CDSSO
cdssoRootUrl.description:
The agent root URL for CDSSO. The valid value is in the following format:
protocol://hostname:port/
The protocol represents the protocol used, such as http or https. The hostname represents the host name of the machine on which the agent resides. The port represents the port number on which the agent is installed. The slash following the port number is required.

jwtName.title: JWT Cookie Name
jwtName.description: The name used by the agent to set the OIDC JWT on the user's browser. (Agent 5 only).

auditLogLocation.title: Audit Log Location
auditLogLocation.description:
Specifies where audit messages should be logged. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.log.disposition)
Hot-swap: Yes

remoteLogFilename.title: Remote Log Filename
remoteLogFilename.description:
(Not used in Agent 5 onwards)
Name of file stored on AM server that contains agent audit messages. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.remote.logfile)
Hot-swap: No

configurationPollingInterval.title: Configuration Reload Interval
configurationPollingInterval.description:
Interval in minutes to fetch agent configuration from AM. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.polling.interval)
Hot-swap: No

accessDeniedUrl.title: Resources Access Denied URL
accessDeniedUrl.description:
The URL of the customized access denied page. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.access.denied.url)
Hot-swap: Yes

responseAttributeMap.title: Response Attribute Map
responseAttributeMap.description:
Maps the policy response attributes to be populated under specific names for the currently authenticated user. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.response.attribute.mapping)
Hot-swap: Yes
Example:
To populate the value of response attribute uid under name CUSTOM-USER-NAME: enter uid in Map Key field, and enter CUSTOM-USER-NAME in Corresponding Map Value field.

notEnforcedIps.title: Not Enforced Client IP List
notEnforcedIps.description:
No authentication and authorization are required for the requests coming from these client IP addresses. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.notenforced.ip)
Hot-swap: Yes
Examples:
192.18.145.*
192.18.146.123

invertNotEnforcedUrls.title: Invert Not Enforced URLs
invertNotEnforcedUrls.description:
Only not enforced list of urls will be enforced. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.notenforced.url.invert)
Hot-swap: Yes

sessionAttributeMap.title: Session Attribute Map
sessionAttributeMap.description:
Maps the session attributes to be populated under specific names for the currently authenticated user. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.session.attribute.mapping)
Hot-swap: Yes
Example:
To populate the value of session attribute UserToken under name CUSTOM-userid: enter UserToken in Map Key field, and enter CUSTOM-userid in Corresponding Map Value field.

continuousSecurityCookies.title: Continuous Security Cookies
continuousSecurityCookies.description: The name of the cookies to be sent as part of the payload during policy evaluation, which can be accessed via the 'environment' variable in a policy script. The 'key' is the name of the cookie to be sent, and the 'value' is the name which it will appear as in the policy evaluation script. It is possible to map multiple cookies to the same name (they will simply appear as an array in the evaluation script). If the cookie doesn't exist, then the empty string will be sent.

clientIpValidation.title: Client IP Validation
clientIpValidation.description:
This validates if the subsequent browser requests come from the same ip address that the SSO token is initially issued against. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.client.ip.validation.enable)
Hot-swap: Yes

fetchAttributesForNotEnforcedUrls.title: Fetch Attributes for Not Enforced URLs
fetchAttributesForNotEnforcedUrls.description:
Agent fetches profile attributes for not enforced urls by doing policy evaluation. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.notenforced.url.attributes.enable)
Hot-swap: Yes

continuousSecurityHeaders.title: Continuous Security Headers
continuousSecurityHeaders.description: The name of the headers in the user's original request, that will be sent as part of the payload during policy evaluation, which can then be accessed via the 'environment' variable in a policy script. The 'key' is the name of the header to be sent, and the 'value' is the name which it will appear as in the policy evaluation script.It is possible to map multiple headers to the same name (they will simply appear as an array in the evaluation script). If the header doesn't exist, then the empty string will be sent.

notEnforcedUrls.title: Not Enforced URLs
notEnforcedUrls.description:
List of urls for which no authentication required. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.notenforced.url)
Hot-swap: Yes
Example:
http://myagent.mydomain.com/*.gif

ignorePathInfoForNotEnforcedUrls.title: Ignore Path Info for Not Enforced URLs
ignorePathInfoForNotEnforcedUrls.description:
Indicate whether the path info and query should be stripped from the request URL before being compared with the URLs of the not enforced list when those URLs have a wildcard '*' character. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.ignore.path.info.for.not.enforced.list)
Hot-swap: Yes

profileAttributeMap.title: Profile Attribute Map
profileAttributeMap.description:
Maps the profile attributes to be populated under specific names for the currently authenticated user. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.profile.attribute.mapping)
Hot-swap: Yes
Example:
To populate the value of profile attribute cn under name CUSTOM-Common-Name: enter cn in Map Key field, and enter CUSTOM-Common-Name in Corresponding Map Value field.
To populate the value of profile attribute mail under name CUSTOM-Email: enter mail in Map Key field, and enter CUSTOM-Email in Corresponding Map Value field.

attributeMultiValueSeparator.title: Attribute Multi Value Separator
attributeMultiValueSeparator.description:
Specifies separator for multiple values. Applies to all types of attributes i.e. profile, session and response attributes. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.attribute.multi.value.separator)
Hot-swap: Yes

customProperties.title: Custom Properties
customProperties.description:
Additional properties that allow users to augment the set of properties supported by agent. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.freeformproperties)
Hot-swap: Yes
Examples:
customproperty=custom-value1
customlist[0]=customlist-value-0
customlist[1]=customlist-value-1
custommap[key1]=custommap-value-1
custommap[key2]=custommap-value-2

ltpaTokenCookieName.title: LTPA Token Cookie Name
ltpaTokenCookieName.description: The name of the cookie that contains the LTPA token. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.domino.ltpa.cookie.name)

clientIpHeader.title: Client IP Address Header
clientIpHeader.description:
HTTP header name that holds the IP address of the client. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.client.ip.header)
Hot-swap: Yes

ltpaTokenConfigurationname.title: LTPA Token Configuration Name
ltpaTokenConfigurationname.description: The configuration name that the agent uses in order to employ the LTPA token mechanism. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.domino.ltpa.config.name)

overrideRequestProtocol.title: Override Request URL Protocol
overrideRequestProtocol.description:
Set to true if the agent is sitting behind a ssl/tls off-loader, load balancer, or proxy to override the protocol with the value from the property com.sun.identity.agents.config.agenturi.prefix. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.override.protocol)
Hot-swap: Yes

postDataPreservation.title: POST Data Preservation
postDataPreservation.description:
Enables POST data preservation. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.postdata.preserve.enable)
Note that this feature is not supported in all the web agents. Please refer individual agents documentation for more details.
Hot-swap: Yes

ltpaTokenOrganizationName.title: LTPA Token Organization Name
ltpaTokenOrganizationName.description: The organization name to which the LTPA token belongs. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.domino.ltpa.org.name)

overrideRequestHost.title: Override Request URL Host
overrideRequestHost.description:
Set to true if the agent is sitting behind a ssl/tls off-loader, load balancer, or proxy to override the host with the value from the property com.sun.identity.agents.config.agenturi.prefix. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.override.host)
Hot-swap: Yes

overrideRequestPort.title: Override Request URL Port
overrideRequestPort.description:
Set to true if the agent is sitting behind a ssl/tls off-loader, load balancer, or proxy to override the port with the value from the property com.sun.identity.agents.config.agenturi.prefix. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.override.port)
Hot-swap: Yes

idleSessionTimeoutUrl.title: Idle Session Timeout Page URL
idleSessionTimeoutUrl.description: URL of the local idle session timeout page. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.iis.owa.enable.session.timeout.url)

clientHostnameHeader.title: Client Hostname Header
clientHostnameHeader.description:
HTTP header name that holds the Hostname of the client. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.client.hostname.header)
Hot-swap: Yes

filterPriority.title: Filter Priority
filterPriority.description: The loading priority of filter. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.iis.filter.priority)

filterConfiguredWithOwa.title: Filter configured with OWA
filterConfiguredWithOwa.description: Set to true if the IIS agent filter is configured for OWA. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.iis.owa.enable)

overrideProxyHostAndPort.title: Override Proxy Server's Host and Port

postDataCachePeriod.title: POST Data Entries Cache Period
postDataCachePeriod.description:
POST cache entry lifetime in minutes. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.postcache.entry.lifetime)
Hot-swap: Yes

loadBalanced.title: Load Balancer Setup
loadBalanced.description:
Set to true if a load balancer is used for AM services. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.load.balancer.enable)
Hot-swap: No

useLtpaToken.title: Use LTPA token
useLtpaToken.description: Set to true if agent needs to use LTPA Token. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.domino.ltpa.enable)

logonAndImpersonation.title: Logon and Impersonation
logonAndImpersonation.description: Set to true if agent should do Windows Logon and User Impersonation. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.iis.logonuser)

replayPasswordKey.title: Replay Password Key
replayPasswordKey.description: DES key for decrypting the basic authentication password in the session. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.replaypasswd.key)

overrideNotificationUrl.title: Override Notification URL
overrideNotificationUrl.description:
Set to true if the agent is sitting behind a ssl/tls off-loader, load balancer, or proxy to override the URL with the value from the property com.sun.identity.agents.config.agenturi.prefix. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.override.notification.url)
Hot-swap: Yes

showPasswordInHeader.title: Show Password in HTTP Header
showPasswordInHeader.description: Set to true if encrypted password should be set in HTTP header AUTH_PASSWORD. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.iis.password.header)

checkUserInDomino.title: Check User in Domino Database
checkUserInDomino.description: If true, agent checks user existence in Domino name database. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.domino.check.name.database)

changeProtocolToHttps.title: Change URL Protocol to https
changeProtocolToHttps.description: If true, avoids IE6 security pop-ups. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.iis.owa.enable.change.protocol)

cdssoCookieDomain.title: Cookies Domain List
cdssoCookieDomain.description:
List of domains in which cookies have to be set in CDSSO. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.cdsso.cookie.domain)
Hot-swap: Yes
Example:
.sun.com

cdssoRedirectUri.title: CDSSO Redirect URI
cdssoRedirectUri.description:
An intermediate URI that is used by the Agent for processing CDSSO requests. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.cdsso.redirect.uri)
Hot-swap: Yes

secureCookies.title: Cookie Security
secureCookies.description:
Agent sends secure cookies if communication is secure. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.cookie.secure)
Hot-swap: No

cdsso.title: Cross Domain SSO
cdsso.description:
Enables Cross-Domain Single Sign On. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.cdsso.enable)
Hot-swap: Yes

cookieResetList.title: Cookies Reset Name List
cookieResetList.description:
List of cookies in the format: name[=value][;Domain=value]. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.cookie.reset)
Hot-swap: Yes
Examples:
Cookie1
Cookie2=value;Domain=subdomain.domain.com

cdssoUrls.title: CDSSO Servlet URL
cdssoUrls.description:
List of URLs of the available CDSSO controllers that may be used by the Agent for CDSSO processing. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.cdsso.cdcservlet.url)
Hot-swap: Yes
Example:
http://host:port/opensso/cdcservlet

cookieResetEnabled.title: Cookie Reset
cookieResetEnabled.description:
Agent reset cookies in the response before redirecting to authentication. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.cookie.reset.enable)
Hot-swap: Yes

cookieName.title: Cookie Name
cookieName.description:
Name of the SSO Token cookie used between the AM server and the Agent. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.cookie.name)
Hot-swap: No

policyCachePollingInterval.title: Policy Cache Polling Period
policyCachePollingInterval.description:
Polling interval in minutes to refresh agent's policy cache. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.policy.cache.polling.interval)
Hot-swap: No

fetchPoliciesFromRootResource.title: Fetch Policies from Root Resource
fetchPoliciesFromRootResource.description:
Agent caches policy decision of the resource and all resources from the root of the resource down. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.fetch.from.root.resource)
Hot-swap: No

policyClockSkew.title: Policy Clock Skew
policyClockSkew.description:
Time in seconds used adjust time difference between Agent machine and AM. Clock skew in seconds = AgentTime - AMServerTime. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.policy.clock.skew)
Hot-swap: No

agentConnectionTimeout.title: Agent Connection Timeout
agentConnectionTimeout.description:
Timeout period in seconds for an agent connection with AM auth server. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.auth.connection.timeout)
Hot-swap: Yes

primaryServerPollingPeriod.title: Polling Period for Primary Server
primaryServerPollingPeriod.description:
Interval in minutes, agent polls to check the primary server is up and running. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.poll.primary.server)
Hot-swap: No

logoutRedirectUrl.title: Logout Redirect URL
logoutRedirectUrl.description:
User gets redirected to this url after logout. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.logout.redirect.url). This property should be specified along with the above Logout URL List.
Hot-swap: Yes

policyEvaluationApplication.title: Application
policyEvaluationApplication.description:
Which application contains the policies to evaluate with (property name: org.forgerock.openam.agents.config.policy.evaluation.application)
Hot-swap: Yes

amLoginUrl.title: AM Login URL
amLoginUrl.description:
AM login page URL. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.login.url)
Hot-swap: Yes
Example:
http://host:port/opensso/UI/Login

logoutResetCookies.title: Logout Cookies List for Reset
logoutResetCookies.description:
Any cookies to be reset upon logout in the same format as cookie reset list. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.logout.cookie.reset)
Hot-swap: Yes
Cookie1
Cookie2=value;Domain=subdomain.domain.com

userIdParameterType.title: User ID Parameter Type
userIdParameterType.description:
User ID can be fetched from either SESSION and LDAP attributes. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.userid.param.type)
Hot-swap: Yes

applicationLogoutUrls.title: Logout URL List
applicationLogoutUrls.description:
List of application logout URLs. User gets logged out from AM session when these urls accessed. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.agent.logout.url). If this property is used, user should specify a value for the below Logout Redirect URL property.
Hot-swap: Yes
Example:
http://myagent.mydomain.com/logout.html

amLogoutUrl.title: AM Logout URL
amLogoutUrl.description:
AM logout page URL. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.logout.url)
Hot-swap: Yes
Example:
http://host:port/opensso/UI/Logout

ssoCachePollingInterval.title: SSO Cache Polling Period
ssoCachePollingInterval.description:
Polling interval in minutes to refresh agent's sso cache. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.sso.cache.polling.interval)
Hot-swap: No

policyEvaluationRealm.title: Realm
policyEvaluationRealm.description:
Which realm to start evaluating from (property name: org.forgerock.openam.agents.config.policy.evaluation.realm)
Hot-swap: Yes

userIdParameter.title: User ID Parameter
userIdParameter.description:
Agent sets value of User Id to REMOTE_USER server variable. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.userid.param)
Hot-swap: Yes

retrieveClientHostname.title: Retrieve Client Hostname
retrieveClientHostname.description:
Gets the client's hostname through DNS reverse lookup for use in policy evaluation. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.get.client.host.name)
Hot-swap: Yes

1.0.title: Web Agent Groups
1.0.description: Agent Groups handler that is responsible for managing agent groups

actions.description: Obtain the collection of all secondary configuration types related to the resource.
actions.name: getAllTypes

response.title: Types response
response.description: A collection of type objects in response to the request

actions.description: Obtain the collection of secondary configuration types that have yet to be added to the resource.
actions.name: getCreatableTypes

response.title: Types response
response.description: A collection of type objects in response to the request

actions.description: Obtain the collection of secondary configuration instances that have been added to the resource.
actions.name: nextdescendents

response.title: Next Descendents response
response.description: The collection of next descendents beneath this endpoint

_id.title: ID

retentionMaxNumberOfHistoryFiles.title: Maximum Number of Historical Files
retentionMaxNumberOfHistoryFiles.description: Maximum number of backup audit files allowed. A value of -1 disables pruning of old history files.

retentionMinFreeSpaceRequired.title: Minimum Free Space Required
retentionMinFreeSpaceRequired.description: Minimum amount of disk space required, in bytes, on the system where audit files are stored. A negative or zero value indicates this policy is disabled.

retentionMaxDiskSpaceToUse.title: Maximum Disk Space
retentionMaxDiskSpaceToUse.description: The maximum amount of disk space the audit files can occupy, in bytes. A negative or zero value indicates this policy is disabled.

rotationTimes.description: Durations after midnight to trigger file rotation, in seconds.

rotationMaxFileSize.title: Maximum File Size
rotationMaxFileSize.description: Maximum size, in bytes, which an audit file can grow to before rotation is triggered. A negative or zero value indicates this policy is disabled.

rotationFileSuffix.title: File Rotation Suffix
rotationFileSuffix.description: Suffix to append to audit files when they are rotated. Suffix should be a timestamp.

rotationFilePrefix.title: File Rotation Prefix
rotationFilePrefix.description: Prefix to prepend to audit files when rotating audit files.

rotationInterval.title: Rotation Interval
rotationInterval.description: Interval to trigger audit file rotations, in seconds. A negative or zero value disables this feature.

rotationEnabled.title: Rotation Enabled
rotationEnabled.description: Enables and disables audit file rotation.

bufferingWriteInterval.title: Write interval
bufferingWriteInterval.description: Interval at which buffered events are written to a file, in milliseconds.

bufferingMaxSize.title: Batch Size
bufferingMaxSize.description: Maximum number of events that can be buffered (default/minimum: 100000)

handlerFactory.title: Factory Class Name
handlerFactory.description: The fully qualified class name of the factory responsible for creating the Audit Event Handler. The class must implement org.forgerock.openam.audit.AuditEventHandlerFactory.
