fields.title: Configurable Log Fields
fields.description:
Controls the fields that are logged by OpenAM.

This property is the list of fields that are logged by default. Administrators can choose to limit the information logged by OpenAM.

certificateStore.title: Logging Certificate Store Location
certificateStore.description:
The path to the Java keystore containing the logging system certificate.

The secure logging system will use the certificate alias of Logger to locate the certificate in the specified keystore.

jdkLoggingLevel.title: Logging Level
jdkLoggingLevel.description: Control the level of JDK logging within OpenAM.

signaturePeriod.title: Log Signature Time
signaturePeriod.description:
The frequency (in seconds) that OpenAM will digitally sign the log records.

When secure logging is enabled, this is the period that OpenAM will digitally signed the contents of the log files. The log signatures form the basis of the log file integrity checking.

filesPerKeystore.title: Number of Files per Archive
filesPerKeystore.description: Controls the number of logs files that will be archived by the secure logging system.

signingAlgorithm.title: Secure Logging Signing Algorithm
signingAlgorithm.description: Determines the algorithm used to digitally sign the log records.

resolveHostName.title: Log Record Resolve Host Name
resolveHostName.description:
Enable this to have OpenAM perform a DNS host lookup to populate the host name field for log records.

Note: Enabling this functionality will increase the load of the logging system and the OpenAM host must have DNS configured.

bufferSize.title: Buffer Size
bufferSize.description: The number of log records held in memory before the log records will be flushed to the logfile or the database.

verifyPeriod.title: Log Verification Frequency
verifyPeriod.description:
The frequency (in seconds) that OpenAM verifies security of the log files.

When secure logging is enabled, this is the period that OpenAM will check the integrity of the log files.

security.title: Secure Logging
security.description:
Enable or Disable secure logging.

Enabling this setting will cause OpenAM to digitally sign and verify the contents of the log files to help prevent and detect log file tampering. A certificate must be configured for this functionality to be enabled.

type.title: Logging Type
type.description:
Specifies whether to log to a database, Syslog, or to the filing system.

If you choose database then be sure to set the connection attributes correctly, including the JDBC driver to use.

bufferTime.title: Buffer Time
bufferTime.description: The maximum time (in seconds) OpenAM will hold log records in memory before flushing to the underlying repository.

status.title: Log Status
status.description:
Enable the OpenAM logging system.

OpenAM supports two Audit Logging Services: the legacy Logging Service, which is based on a Java SDK and is available in OpenAM versions prior to OpenAM 13.5, and a new common REST-based Audit Logging Service available from OpenAM 13.5.

The legacy Logging Service will be deprecated in a future release.

buffering.title: Time Buffering
buffering.description:
Enable or Disable log buffering

When enabled OpenAM holds all log records in a memory buffer that it periodically flush to the repository. The period is set in the Buffer Time property.

numberHistoryFiles.title: Number of History Files
numberHistoryFiles.description:
Sets the number of history files for each log that OpenAM keeps, including time-based histories.

The previously live file is moved and is included in the history count, and a new log is created to serve as the live log file. Any log file in the history count that goes over the number specified here will be deleted.

For time-based logs, a new set of logs will be created when OpenAM is started because of the time-based file names that are used.

suffix.title: Logfile Rotation Suffix
suffix.description:
The name of the log files will be suffixed with the supplied value.

This field defines the log file suffix. If no suffix is provided, then the following default suffix format will be used: -MM.dd.yy-kk.mm. The suffix allows use of Date and Time patterns defined in SimpleDateFormat

Note: This field is only used if the time based rotation is enabled.

rotationEnabled.title: Log Rotation
rotationEnabled.description: Enable log rotation to cause new log files to be created when configured thresholds are reached, such as Maximum Log Size or Logfile Rotation Interval.

maxFileSize.title: Maximum Log Size
maxFileSize.description: Maximum size of a log file, in bytes.

rotationInterval.title: Logfile Rotation Interval
rotationInterval.description:
The rotation interval (in minutes).

The rotation interval determines the frequency of when the log files will be rotated. If the value is -1, then time based rotation is disabled and log file size based rotation is enabled.

prefix.title: Logfile Rotation Prefix
prefix.description:
The name of the log files will be prefixed with the supplied value.

This field defines the log file prefix. The prefix will be added to the name of all logfiles.

Note: Only used when time-based log rotation is enabled.

location.title: Log File Location
location.description:
The path to the location of the log files

This property controls the location of the log files; the value of this property varies on whether File or DB logging is in use:

  • File: The full pathname to the directory containing the log files.
  • DB: The JDBC URL to the database used to store the log file database.

host.title: Syslog server host
host.description: The URL or IP address of the syslog server, for example http://mysyslog.example.com, or localhost.

port.title: Syslog server port
port.description: The port number the syslog server is configured to listen to.

timeout.title: Syslog connection timeout
timeout.description: The amount of time to wait when attempting to connect to the syslog server before reporting a failure, in seconds.

protocol.title: Syslog transport protocol
protocol.description: The protocol to use to connect to the syslog server.

facility.title: Syslog facility
facility.description: Syslog uses the facility level to determine the type of program that is logging the message.

user.title: Database User Name
user.description: When logging to a database, set this to the user name used to connect to the database. If this attribute is incorrectly set, OpenAM performance suffers.

password.title: Database User Password
password.description: When logging to a database, set this to the password used to connect to the database. If this attribute is incorrectly set, OpenAM performance suffers.

maxRecords.title: Maximum Number of Records
maxRecords.description: The maximum number of records read from the logs via the Logging API

driver.title: Database Driver Name
driver.description:
When logging to a database, set this to the class name of the JDBC driver used to connect to the database.

The default is for Oracle. OpenAM also works with the MySQL database driver.

databaseFailureMemoryBufferSize.title: DB Failure Memory Buffer Size
databaseFailureMemoryBufferSize.description:
Max number of log records held in memory if DB logging fails.

This is the maximum number of log records that will be held in memory if the database is unavailable. When the buffer is full, new log records cause the oldest record in the buffer to be cleared. OpenAM monitoring records the number of log entries cleared when the database was unavailable.

If the value of this property is less than that of the Buffer Size then the buffer size value will take precedence.

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: The identifier for the user for which the request is regarding.

xssDetectionRedirectUri.title: XSS detection redirect URI
xssDetectionRedirectUri.description:
An application-specific Map that identifies a URI of the customized page if XSS code has been deteced. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.xss.redirect.uri)
Hot-swap: Yes
Examples:
To set a redirect target for application BankApp: enter BankApp in Map Key field, and enter a redirect URI in Corresponding Map Value field.

possibleXssCodeElements.title: Possible XSS code elements
possibleXssCodeElements.description:
If one of these strings occurs in the request, the client is redirected to an error page. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.xss.code.elements)
Hot-swap: Yes

postDataPreserveCacheEntryMaxEntries.title: PDP Maximum Number of Cache Entries
postDataPreserveCacheEntryMaxEntries.description: Maximum number of entries to hold in the PDP cache (Property name: org.forgerock.openam.agents.config.postdata.preserve.cache.entry.max.entries) (Agent 5 only).

alternativeAgentProtocol.title: Alternative Agent Protocol
alternativeAgentProtocol.description:
Protocol being used (http/https) by the client browsers to communicate with the Agent protected server if different from the actual protocol used by the server. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.agent.protocol)
Hot-swap: Yes

postDataPreserveCacheEntryMaxTotalSizeMb.title: PDP Maximum Cache Size
postDataPreserveCacheEntryMaxTotalSizeMb.description: Maximum size of the PDP cache, in megabytes (Property name: org.forgerock.openam.agents.config.postdata.preserve.cache.entry.max.total.size.mb). (Agent 5 only)

webServiceResponseProcessor.title: Web Service Response Processor
webServiceResponseProcessor.description:
An implementation class of interface com.sun.identity.agents.filter.IWebServiceResponseProcessor that can be used to process the web-service responses. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.webservice.responseprocessor)
Hot-swap: Yes

webServiceEnabled.title: Web Service Enable
webServiceEnabled.description:
Flag specifies if Web Service processing is enabled. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.webservice.enable)
Hot-swap: Yes

postDataStickySessionKeyValue.title: PDP Stickysession key-value
postDataStickySessionKeyValue.description:
The provided key-value pair will be used for adding to the URL or creating the cookie.
Example:
Set 'lb=server1' to append to the querystring or to have 'lb' cookie with 'server1' value. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.postdata.preserve.stickysession.value)

jbossWebAuthenticationAvailable.title: WebAuthentication Available
jbossWebAuthenticationAvailable.description:
(Not used in Agent 5 onwards)
Enable agent to make programmatic authentication with the JBoss web container using WebAuthentication feature. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.jboss.webauth.available)
Hot-swap: Yes

clientHostnameHeader.title: Client Hostname Header
clientHostnameHeader.description:
HTTP header name that holds the Hostname of the client. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.client.hostname.header)
Hot-swap: Yes

webServiceInternalErrorContentFile.title: Web Service Internal Error Content File
webServiceInternalErrorContentFile.description:
The name of file that contains content used by the Agent to generate an internal error fault for clients. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.webservice.internalerror.content)
Hot-swap: Yes

missingPostDataPreservationEntryUri.title: Missing PDP entry URI
missingPostDataPreservationEntryUri.description:
An application-specific URI Map that is used in case the referenced PDP entry cannot be found in the local cache (due to ttl). In such cases it will redirect to the specified URI, otherwise it will show a HTTP 403 Forbidden error. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.postdata.preservce.cache.noentry.url)
Examples:
To set a redirect target for application BankApp: enter Bankapp in Map Key field and enter a redirect URI in corresponding Map Value field.

webServiceEndpoints.title: Web Service End Points
webServiceEndpoints.description:
A list of Web Application end points that represent Web Services. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.webservice.endpoint)
Hot-swap: Yes

alternativeAgentHostname.title: Alternative Agent Host Name
alternativeAgentHostname.description:
Host name identifying the Agent protected server to the client browsers if different from the actual host name. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.agent.host)
Hot-swap: Yes

postDataCacheTtl.title: PDP entry TTL
postDataCacheTtl.description: This value tells how long a given POST entry should be stored in the local cache (in milliseconds), default value is 300000. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.postdata.preserve.cache.entry.ttl)

postDataStickySessionMode.title: PDP Stickysession mode
postDataStickySessionMode.description: The PDP mechanism needs sticky loadbalancing, the URL mode will append a querystring, while the Cookie mode will create a cookie. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.postdata.preserve.stickysession.mode)

alternativeAgentPort.title: Alternative Agent Port Name
alternativeAgentPort.description:
Port number identifying the Agent protected server listening port to the client browsers if different from the actual listening port. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.agent.port)
Hot-swap: Yes

webServiceAuthenticator.title: Web Service Authenticator
webServiceAuthenticator.description:
An implementation class of interface com.sun.identity.agents.filter.IWebServiceAuthenticator that can be used to authenticate web-service requests. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.webservice.authenticator)
Hot-swap: Yes

webServiceAuthorizationErrorContentFile.title: Web Service Authorization Error Content File
webServiceAuthorizationErrorContentFile.description:
The name of file that contains content used by the Agent to generate an authorization error fault for clients. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.webservice.autherror.content)
Hot-swap: Yes

postDataPreservation.title: Post Data Preservation enabled
postDataPreservation.description: Post Data Preservation functionality basically stores any POST data before redirecting the user to the login screen and after successful login the agent will generate a page that autosubmits the same POST to the original URL. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.postdata.preserve.enable)

clientIpHeader.title: Client IP Address Header
clientIpHeader.description:
HTTP header name that holds the IP address of the client. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.client.ip.header)
Hot-swap: Yes

webServiceProcessGetEnabled.title: Web Service Process GET Enable
webServiceProcessGetEnabled.description:
Flag to indicates if the processing of HTTP GET requests for Web Service endpoints is enabled. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.webservice.process.get.enable)
Hot-swap: Yes

customProperties.title: Custom Properties
customProperties.description:
Additional properties that allow users to augment the set of properties supported by agent. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.freeformproperties)
Hot-swap: Yes
Examples:
customproperty=custom-value1
customlist[0]=customlist-value-0
customlist[1]=customlist-value-1
custommap[key1]=custommap-value-1
custommap[key2]=custommap-value-2

ignorePathInfo.title: Ignore Path Info in Request URL
ignorePathInfo.description:
The path info will be stripped from the request URL while doing Not Enforced List check and url policy evaluation if the value is set to true. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.ignore.path.info)
Hot-swap: Yes

legacyUserAgentSupport.title: Legacy User Agent Support Enable
legacyUserAgentSupport.description:
Enables support for legacy user agents (browser). (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.legacy.support.enable)
Hot-swap: Yes

portCheckFile.title: Port Check File
portCheckFile.description:
Name or complete path of a file that has the necessary content needed to handle requests that need port correction. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.port.check.file)
Hot-swap: Yes

legacyUserAgentList.title: Legacy User Agent List
legacyUserAgentList.description:
List of user agent header values that identify legacy browsers. Entries in this list can have wild card character '*'. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.legacy.user.agent)
Hot-swap: Yes

portCheckEnabled.title: Port Check Enable
portCheckEnabled.description:
Indicates if port check functionality is enabled or disabled. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.port.check.enable)
Hot-swap: Yes

encryptionProvider.title: Encryption Provider
encryptionProvider.description:
Specifies the encryption provider implementation to be used by the Agent. (property name: com.iplanet.security.encryptor)
Hot-swap: No

portCheckSetting.title: Port Check Setting
portCheckSetting.description:
Map of port versus protocol entries with the key being the listening port number and value being the listening protocol to be used by the Agent to identify requests with invalid port numbers. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.port.check.setting)
Hot-swap: Yes
Example:
To map port 80 to protocol http: enter 80 in Map Key field, and enter http in Corresponding Map Value field.

bypassPrincipalList.title: Bypass Principal List
bypassPrincipalList.description:
List of principals that are bypassed by the Agent for authentication and search purposes. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.bypass.principal)
Hot-swap: Yes
Examples:
guest
testuser

legacyRedirectUri.title: Legacy User Agent Redirect URI
legacyRedirectUri.description:
An intermediate URI used by the Agent to redirect legacy user agent requests. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.legacy.redirect.uri)
Hot-swap: Yes

gotoParameterName.title: Goto Parameter Name
gotoParameterName.description:
Property used only when CDSSO is enabled. Default value should be changed only when the login URL has a landing page specified
Example : com.sun.identity.agents.config.cdsso.cdcservlet.url = http://host:port/opensso/cdcservlet?goto=http://agent:port/landing.jsp
The parameter is used by the Agent to append the original request URL to this cdcserlet URL. This parameter is consumed by the landing page to redirect to the original URL. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.redirect.param)
Hot-swap: Yes
Example: com.sun.identity.agents.config.redirect.param = goto2
The complete URL sent for authentication will be
http://host:port/opensso/cdcservlet?goto=http://agent:port/landing.jsp?goto2=http://agent.port/original.jsp

enableClientPolling.title: Enable Client Polling
enableClientPolling.description:
Specifies if the session client must use polling for updating session information and not depend upon server notifications. (property name: com.iplanet.am.session.client.polling.enable)
Hot-swap: No

logoutProbeTimeout.title: Logout URL Probe Timeout
logoutProbeTimeout.description:
The connect timeout value in milliseconds, if also Logout URL Probe is set to true. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.logout.url.probe.timeout)
Hot-swap: Yes

userDataCachePollingTime.title: User Data Cache Polling Time
userDataCachePollingTime.description:
Cache update time in minutes for user management data. If set to '0' no updates happen. (property name: com.iplanet.am.sdk.remote.pollingTime)
Hot-swap: No

urlPolicyEnvJsessionParameters.title: URL Policy Env jsession Parameters
urlPolicyEnvJsessionParameters.description:
List of HTTP SESSION attributes whose names and values will be set in the environment map for URL policy evaluation at AM server. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.policy.env.jsession.param)
Hot-swap: Yes
Examples:
name
phonenumber

useRedirectForCompositeAdvice.title: Use HTTP-Redirect for composite advice
useRedirectForCompositeAdvice.description:
Configure remote policy client to use HTTP-redirect instead of HTTP-POST for composite advices. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.policy.advice.use.redirect)
Hot-swap: Yes

authServiceHost.title: AM Authentication Service Host Name
authServiceHost.description:
Host name to be used by the AM authentication service. (property name: com.iplanet.am.server.host)
Hot-swap: No

policyEvaluationRealm.title: Realm
policyEvaluationRealm.description:
Which realm to start evaluating from. (property name: org.forgerock.openam.agents.config.policy.evaluation.realm)
Hot-swap: Yes

urlPolicyEnvGetParameters.title: URL Policy Env GET Parameters
urlPolicyEnvGetParameters.description:
List of HTTP GET request parameters whose names and values will be set in the environment map for URL policy evaluation at AM server. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.policy.env.get.param)
Hot-swap: Yes
Examples:
name
phonenumber

policyActionBooleanValues.title: Policy Client Boolean Action Values
policyActionBooleanValues.description:
Boolean action values for policy action names. (property name: com.sun.identity.policy.client.booleanActionValues)
Hot-swap: No

policyNotifications.title: Enable Policy Notifications
policyNotifications.description:
Enable Notifications for remote policy client. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.notification.enabled)
Hot-swap: No

loginUrlPrioritized.title: Login URL Prioritized
loginUrlPrioritized.description:
Specifies if failover sequence for Login URLs or CDSSO URLs should be prioritized as defined in the AM Login URL list. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.login.url.prioritized)
Hot-swap: Yes

conditionalLoginUrl.title: AM Conditional Login URL
conditionalLoginUrl.description:
(Only used in Agent 5 onwards) (property name: org.forgerock.openam.agents.config.conditional.login.url)
Hot-swap: Yes
Examples:
match|url?param1=value1¶m2=value2
match/path|?param1=value1¶m2=value2¶m3=value3

serviceDataCacheNotifications.title: Enable Notification of Service Data Caches
serviceDataCacheNotifications.description:
Enable the notifications for service management caches. (property name: com.sun.identity.sm.notification.enabled)
Hot-swap: No

authServiceProtocol.title: AM Authentication Service Protocol
authServiceProtocol.description:
Protocol to be used by the AM authentication service. (property name: com.iplanet.am.server.protocol)
Hot-swap: No

serviceDataCacheTime.title: Service Data Cache Time
serviceDataCacheTime.description:
Cache update time in minutes for service configuration data. If set to '0' no updates happen. (property name: com.sun.identity.sm.cacheTime)
Hot-swap: No

loginProbeTimeout.title: Login URL Probe Timeout
loginProbeTimeout.description:
The connect timeout value in milliseconds, if also Login URL Probe is set to true. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.login.url.probe.timeout)
Hot-swap: Yes

policyClientPollingInterval.title: Policy Client Polling Interval
policyClientPollingInterval.description:
Duration in minutes after which the cached entries are refreshed by remote policy client. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.polling.interval)
Hot-swap: No

policyClientResourceComparators.title: Policy Client Resource Comparators
policyClientResourceComparators.description:
Resource Comparators to be used for different service names. (property name: com.sun.identity.policy.client.resourceComparators)
Hot-swap: No

amLoginUrl.title: AM Login URL
amLoginUrl.description:
AM login page URL. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.login.url)
Hot-swap: Yes
Example:
http://host:port/opensso/UI/Login

conditionalLogoutUrl.title: AM Conditional Logout URL
conditionalLogoutUrl.description:
(Only used in Agent 5 onwards) (property name: org.forgerock.openam.agents.config.conditional.logout.url)
Hot-swap: Yes
Examples:
match|url?param1=value1¶m2=value2
match/path|?param1=value1¶m2=value2¶m3=value3

policyClientClockSkew.title: Policy Client Clock Skew
policyClientClockSkew.description:
Time in seconds which is allowed to accommodate the time difference between the AM server machine and the remote policy client machine. (property name: com.sun.identity.policy.client.clockSkew)
Hot-swap: No

authServicePort.title: AM Authentication Service Port
authServicePort.description:
Port to be used by the AM authentication service. (property name: com.iplanet.am.server.port)
Hot-swap: No

clientPollingPeriod.title: Client Polling Period
clientPollingPeriod.description:
(Not used in Agent 5 onwards)
Time in seconds after which the session client will request update of cached session information from the server. (property name: com.iplanet.am.session.client.polling.period)
Hot-swap: No

urlPolicyEnvPostParameters.title: URL Policy Env POST Parameters
urlPolicyEnvPostParameters.description:
List of HTTP POST request parameters whose names and values will be set in the environment map for URL policy evaluation at AM server. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.policy.env.post.param)
Hot-swap: Yes
Examples:
name
phonenumber

policyClientCacheMode.title: Policy Client Cache Mode
policyClientCacheMode.description:
Mode of caching to be used by remote policy client. (property name: com.sun.identity.policy.client.cacheMode)
Hot-swap: No

probeLoginUrl.title: Login URL Probe
probeLoginUrl.description:
Specifies if agent will check the availability of these urls before redirecting to them. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.login.url.probe.enabled)
Hot-swap: Yes

userDataCacheNotifications.title: Enable Notification of User Data Caches
userDataCacheNotifications.description:
Enable notifications for amsdk and IdRepo Caches. (property name: com.sun.identity.idm.remote.notification.enabled)
Hot-swap: No

amLogoutUrl.title: AM Logout URL
amLogoutUrl.description:
AM logout page URL. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.logout.url)
Hot-swap: Yes
Example:
http://host:port/opensso/UI/Logout

policyEvaluationApplication.title: Application
policyEvaluationApplication.description:
Which application contains the policies to evaluate with. (property name: org.forgerock.openam.agents.config.policy.evaluation.application)
Hot-swap: Yes

logoutUrlPrioritized.title: Logout URL Prioritized
logoutUrlPrioritized.description:
Specifies if failover sequence for Logout URLs should be prioritized as defined in the AM Login URL list. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.logout.url.prioritized)
Hot-swap: Yes

probeLogoutUrl.title: Logout URL Probe
probeLogoutUrl.description:
Specifies if agent will check the availability of these urls before redirecting to them. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.logout.url.probe.enabled)
Hot-swap: Yes

userAttributeName.title: User Attribute Name
userAttributeName.description:
Name of the attribute which contains the user-ID. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.user.attribute.name)
Hot-swap: Yes

remoteLogFilename.title: Remote Log File Name
remoteLogFilename.description:
Name of file stored on AM server that contains agent audit messages. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.remote.logfile)
Hot-swap: Yes

agentNotificationUrl.title: Agent Notification URL
agentNotificationUrl.description:
URL used by agent to register notification listeners. (property name: com.sun.identity.client.notification.url)
Hot-swap: No

customResponseHeader.title: Custom Response Header
customResponseHeader.description:
Map specifies the custom headers that are set by the Agent on the client browser. The key is the header name and the value represents the header value. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.response.header)
Hot-swap: Yes
Example:
To set the custom header Cache-Control to value no-cache: enter Cache-Control in Map Key field, and enter no-cache in Corresponding Map Value field.

userMappingMode.title: User Mapping Mode
userMappingMode.description:
Specifies mechanism agent uses to determine user-ID. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.user.mapping.mode)
Hot-swap: Yes

auditAccessType.title: Audit Access Types
auditAccessType.description:
Types of messages to log based on user URL access attempts. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.audit.accesstype)
Hot-swap: Yes

userTokenName.title: User Token Name
userTokenName.description:
Session property name for user-ID of the authenticated user in session. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.user.token)
Hot-swap: Yes

fqdnCheck.title: FQDN Check
fqdnCheck.description:
Enables checking of fqdn default value and fqdn map values. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.fqdn.check.enable)
Hot-swap: Yes

filterMode.title: Agent Filter Mode
filterMode.description:
Specifies the mode of operation of the Filter. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.filter.mode)
Valid key: the web application name.
Valid values: ALL, J2EE_POLICY (Not used in Agent 5 onwards), URL_POLICY, SSO_ONLY, NONE
For this property, a global value can be set to apply to all the applications that don't have their own specific filter mode.
Hot-swap: No
Examples:
To set ALL as the global filter mode: leave Map Key field empty, and enter ALL in Corresponding Map Value field.
To set URL_POLICY as the filter mode for application BankApp: enter BankApp in Map Key field, and enter URL_POLICY in Corresponding Map Value field.

userPrincipalFlag.title: User Principal Flag
userPrincipalFlag.description:
Use principal instead of just the user-ID for authenticating the user. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.user.principal)
Hot-swap: Yes

jwtName.title: JWT Cookie Name
jwtName.description: The name used by the agent to set the OIDC JWT on the user's browser. (Agent 5 only).

configurationReloadInterval.title: Configuration Reload Interval
configurationReloadInterval.description:
Interval in seconds between configuration reloads. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.load.interval)
Hot-swap: Yes

debugLevel.title: Agent Debug Level
debugLevel.description:
Specifies type of agent debug messages to log. (property name: com.iplanet.services.debug.level)
Hot-swap: Yes

fqdnDefault.title: FQDN Default
fqdnDefault.description:
Fully qualified hostname that the users should use in order to access resources. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.fqdn.default)
Hot-swap: Yes

webSocketConnectionIntervalInMinutes.title: Web Socket Connection Interval
webSocketConnectionIntervalInMinutes.description: Interval in minutes by which agents reopen their web socket connection to ensure a fair distribution of connections across AM servers. (Agent 5 only).

localAuditLogRotation.title: Rotate Local Audit Log
localAuditLogRotation.description:
Flag to indicate that audit log files should be rotated when reaching a certain size. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.local.log.rotate)
Hot-swap: Yes

fqdnMapping.title: FQDN Virtual Host Map
fqdnMapping.description:
Maps virtual, invalid, or partial hostnames, and IP addresses to the FQDN to access protected resources. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.fqdn.mapping)
Hot-swap: Yes
Examples:
To map the partial hostname myserver to myserver.mydomain.com: enter myserver in the Map Key field and myserver.mydomain.com in the Corresponding Map Value field. To map a virtual server rst.hostname.com that points to the actual server abc.hostname.com: enter valid1 in the Map Key field and rst.hostname.com in the Corresponding Map Value field.

redirectAttemptLimit.title: Redirect Attempt Limit
redirectAttemptLimit.description:
Number of successive single point redirects that a user can make using a single browser session which will trigger the blocking of the user request. Set to 0 to disable this feature. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.redirect.attempt.limit)
Hot-swap: Yes

loginAttemptLimit.title: Login Attempt Limit
loginAttemptLimit.description:
Limit of failed login attempts for a user's single browser session until triggering the blocking of the user request. Value of 0 disables this feature. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.login.attempt.limit)
Hot-swap: Yes

localAuditRotationSize.title: Local Audit Log Rotation Size
localAuditRotationSize.description:
Size limit when a local audit log file is rotated to a new file. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.local.log.size)
Hot-swap: Yes

agentConfigChangeNotificationsEnabled.title: Agent Configuration Change Notification
agentConfigChangeNotificationsEnabled.description:
Enable agent to receive notification messages from AM server for configuration changes. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.change.notification.enable)
Hot-swap: Yes

cdssoRootUrl.title: Agent Root URL for CDSSO
cdssoRootUrl.description:
The agent root URL for CDSSO. The valid value is in the following format:
protocol://hostname:port/
The protocol represents the protocol used, such as http or https. The hostname represents the host name of the machine on which the agent resides. The port represents the port number on which the agent is installed. The slash following the port number is required.

httpSessionBinding.title: HTTP Session Binding
httpSessionBinding.description:
If true will invalidate the http session when login has failed, user has no SSO session, or principal user name does not match SSO user name. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.httpsession.binding)
Hot-swap: Yes

auditLogLocation.title: Audit Log Location
auditLogLocation.description:
Specifies where audit messages should be logged. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.log.disposition)
Hot-swap: Yes

useInternalLogin.title: Use Internal Login
useInternalLogin.description:
Set to false if want to customize Login Content File instead of default internal content provided. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.login.use.internal)
Hot-swap: Yes

notEnforcedIps.title: Not Enforced Client IP List
notEnforcedIps.description:
No authentication and authorization protection from agent are required for the requests coming from these client IP addresses. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.notenforced.ip)
Hot-swap: Yes
Examples:
192.18.145.*
192.18.146.123

loginErrorUri.title: Login Error URI
loginErrorUri.description:
List of absolute URIs corresponding to an application's web.xml form-error-page element. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.login.error.uri)
Hot-swap: Yes
Example:
/BankApp/jsp/error.jsp

privilegedAttributeMap.title: Privileged Attribute Mapping
privilegedAttributeMap.description:
(Not used in Agent 5 onwards)
Map if using Enable Privileged Attribute Mapping. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.privileged.attribute.mapping)
Hot-swap: Yes
Examples:
To map UUID id=manager,ou=group,dc=openam,dc=forgerock,dc=org to the principal name am_manager_role specified in webapp's deployment descriptor: enter id=manager,ou=group,dc=openam,dc=forgerock,dc=org in Map Key field, and enter am_manager_role in Corresponding Map Value field.
To map UUID id=employee,ou=group,dc=openam,dc=forgerock,dc=org to the principal name am_employee_role specified in webapp's deployment descriptor: enter id=employee,ou=group,dc=openam,dc=forgerock,dc=org in Map Key field, and enter am_employee_role in Corresponding Map Value field.

profileAttributeFetchMode.title: Profile Attribute Fetch Mode
profileAttributeFetchMode.description:
The mode of fetching profile attributes. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.profile.attribute.fetch.mode)
Hot-swap: Yes

privilegedAttributesToLowerCase.title: Privileged Attributes To Lower Case
privilegedAttributesToLowerCase.description:
(Not used in Agent 5 onwards)
Maps the privileged attribute types to whether they should be converted to lowercase. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.privileged.attribute.tolowercase)
Valid Keys: the privileged attribute types, such as Group, Role.
Valid value: true, false.
Hot-swap: Yes
Example:
Enter Group in Map Key field, and enter false in Corresponding Map Value field.

logoutIntrospection.title: Logout Introspect Enabled
logoutIntrospection.description:
Allows the Agent to search HTTP request body to locate logout parameter. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.logout.introspect.enabled)
Hot-swap: Yes

privilegedAttributeMappingEnabled.title: Enable Privileged Attribute Mapping
privilegedAttributeMappingEnabled.description:
(Not used in Agent 5 onwards)
Enable a mapping from the original value of an attribute to another value. To satisfy container-specific restrictions on character set being used in certain configuration files. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.privileged.attribute.mapping.enable)
Hot-swap: Yes

customVerificationHandlers.title: Custom Verification Handler
customVerificationHandlers.description:
Application specific verification handler to validate the user credentials with the local repository. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.verification.handler)
Valid key: the web application name.
Valid value: the verification handler class name.
Hot-swap: Yes
Example:
To set verification handler for application BankApp: enter BankApp in Map Key field, and enter verification handler class name BankVerificationHandler in Corresponding Map Value field.

logoutRequestParameters.title: Logout Request Parameter
logoutRequestParameters.description:
An application-specific Map that identifies a parameter which when present in the HTTP request indicates a logout event. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.logout.request.param)
Valid key: the web application name.
Valid value: the logout request parameter.
For this property, a global value can be set to apply to all the applications that don't have their own specific logout request parameter.
Hot-swap: Yes
Examples:
To set a global application logout request parameter: leave Map Key field empty, and enter the global application logout request parameter logoutparam in Corresponding Map Value field.
To set the logout request parameter for application BankApp: enter BankApp in Map Key field, and enter the logout request parameter logoutparam in Corresponding Map Value field.

applicationLogoutUris.title: Application Logout URI
applicationLogoutUris.description:
An application-specific Map that identifies a request URI which indicates a logout event. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.logout.uri)
Valid key: the web application name.
Valid value: the application logout URI.
For this property, a global value can be set to apply to all the applications that don't have their own specific logout URI.
Hot-swap: Yes
Examples:
To set a global application logout URI: leave Map Key field empty, and enter the global application logout URI /logout.jsp in Corresponding Map Value field.
To set the logout URI for application BankApp: enter BankApp in Map Key field, and enter the application logout URI /BankApp/logout.jsp in Corresponding Map Value field.

continuousSecurityHeaders.title: Continuous Security Headers
continuousSecurityHeaders.description: The name of the headers in the user's original request, that will be sent as part of the payload during policy evaluation, which can then be accessed via the 'environment' variable in a policy script. The 'key' is the name of the header to be sent, and the 'value' is the name which it will appear as in the policy evaluation script.It is possible to map multiple headers to the same name (they will simply appear as an array in the evaluation script). If the header doesn't exist, then the empty string will be sent.

continuousSecurityCookies.title: Continuous Security Cookies
continuousSecurityCookies.description: The name of the cookies to be sent as part of the payload during policy evaluation, which can be accessed via the 'environment' variable in a policy script. The 'key' is the name of the cookie to be sent, and the 'value' is the name which it will appear as in the policy evaluation script. It is possible to map multiple cookies to the same name (they will simply appear as an array in the evaluation script). If the cookie doesn't exist, then the empty string will be sent.

notEnforcedIpsCacheSize.title: Not Enforced IP Cache Size
notEnforcedIpsCacheSize.description:
Size of the cache to be used if Not Enforced IP Cache Flag is enabled. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.notenforced.ip.cache.size)
Hot-swap: Yes

notEnforcedIpsCacheEnabled.title: Not Enforced IP Cache Flag
notEnforcedIpsCacheEnabled.description:
Enable caching of not-enforced IP list evaluation results. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.notenforced.ip.cache.enable)
Hot-swap: Yes

defaultPrivilegedAttributes.title: Default Privileged Attribute
defaultPrivilegedAttributes.description:
(Not used in Agent 5 onwards)
List of privileged attributes that will be granted to all users who have a valid AM session. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.default.privileged.attribute)
Hot-swap: Yes
Example:
AUTHENTICATED_USERS

cookieAttributeUrlEncoded.title: Attribute Cookie Encode
cookieAttributeUrlEncoded.description:
Indicates if the value of the attribute should be URL encoded before being set as a cookie. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.attribute.cookie.encode)
Hot-swap: Yes

notEnforcedUrisRefreshSessionIdleTime.title: Refresh Session Idle Time
notEnforcedUrisRefreshSessionIdleTime.description:
Indicates if opensso session idle time should be refreshed or reset for not enforced URIs. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.notenforced.refresh.session.idletime)
Hot-swap: Yes

shortenedPrivilegeAttributeValues.title: Shortened privilege attribute values
shortenedPrivilegeAttributeValues.description:
When using privileged attribute type, this setting will ensure that the membership details will be stored in a shortened format and not in the default universal ID format.

By default the agent maps identity memberships using their universal IDs (e.g. id=admin,ou=group,dc=openam,dc=forgerock,dc=org), however this may not be always acceptable. Using this setting the identity membership details will be mapped in a shortened format, only including the group's/role's name (e.g. admin). Be aware that in case there are both roles and groups in the data store, this setting will make them indistinguishable from each other, i.e. if there is a group and a role with the same name it will not be possible to differentiate them.

headerAttributeDateFormat.title: Fetch Attribute Date Format
headerAttributeDateFormat.description:
Format of date attribute values to be used when the attribute is being set as HTTP header. Format is based on java.text.SimpleDateFormat. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.attribute.date.format)
Hot-swap: Yes

notEnforcedUrisCacheEnabled.title: Not Enforced URIs Cache Enabled
notEnforcedUrisCacheEnabled.description:
Enables the caching of the Not Enforced URIs list evaluation results. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.notenforced.uri.cache.enable)
Hot-swap: Yes

cookieAttributeMultiValueSeparator.title: Cookie Separator Character
cookieAttributeMultiValueSeparator.description:
Character that will be used to separate multiple values of the same attribute when it is being set as a cookie. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.attribute.cookie.separator)
Hot-swap: Yes

sessionAttributeMap.title: Session Attribute Mapping
sessionAttributeMap.description:
Maps the session attributes to be populated under specific names for the currently authenticated user. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.session.attribute.mapping)
Hot-swap: Yes
Example:
To populate the value of session attribute UserToken under name CUSTOM-userid: enter UserToken in Map Key field, and enter CUSTOM-userid in Corresponding Map Value field.

loginFormUri.title: Login Form URI
loginFormUri.description:
List of absolute URIs corresponding to an application's web.xml form-login-page element. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.login.form)
Hot-swap: Yes
Example:
/BankApp/jsp/login.jsp

privilegedSessionAttribute.title: Privileged Session Attribute
privilegedSessionAttribute.description:
(Not used in Agent 5 onwards)
List of session property names which hold privileged attributes for the authenticated user. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.privileged.session.attribute)
Hot-swap: Yes
Example:
UserToken

applicationLogoutHandlers.title: Application Logout Handler
applicationLogoutHandlers.description:
An application-specific Map that identifies a handler to be used for logout processing. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.logout.application.handler)
Valid key: the web application name.
Valid value: the application logout handler class name.
For this property, a global value can be set to apply to all the applications that don't have their own specific logout handler.
Hot-swap: Yes
Examples:
To set a global application logout handler: leave Map Key field empty, and enter the global application logout handler class name GlobalApplicationLogoutHandler in Corresponding Map Value field.
To set the logout handler for application BankApp: enter BankApp in Map Key field, and enter the application logout handler class name BankAppLogoutHandler in Corresponding Map Value field.

customAuthenticationHandlers.title: Custom Authentication Handler
customAuthenticationHandlers.description:
Application specific authentication handler to authenticate the logged on user with the application server. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.auth.handler)
Valid key: the web application name.
Valid value: the authentication handler class name.
Hot-swap: Yes
Example:
To set authentication handler for application BankApp: enter BankApp in Map Key field, and enter authentication handler class name BankAuthHandler in Corresponding Map Value field.

privilegedAttributeType.title: Privileged Attribute Type
privilegedAttributeType.description:
(Not used in Agent 5 onwards)
List of privileged attribute types that will be fetched for each user. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.privileged.attribute.type)
Hot-swap: Yes
Example:
Group

customLogoutHandlers.title: Custom Logout Handler
customLogoutHandlers.description:
Application specific logout handler to log out a user with the application server. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.logout.handler)
Valid key: the web application name.
Valid value: the logout handler class name.
Hot-swap: Yes
Example:
To set logout handler for application BankApp: enter BankApp in Map Key field, and enter logout handler class name BankLogoutHandler in Corresponding Map Value field.

loginContentFile.title: Login Content File Name
loginContentFile.description:
Complete path and name of custom login content file. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.login.content.file)
Hot-swap: Yes

resourceAccessDeniedUri.title: Resource Access Denied URI
resourceAccessDeniedUri.description:
An application-specific Map that identifies a URI of the customized access denied page. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.access.denied.uri)
Valid key: the web application name.
Valid value: the customized application access denied page URI.
For this property, a global value can be set to apply to all the applications that don't have their own specific access denied page.
Hot-swap: Yes
Examples:
To set a global access denied page: leave Map Key field empty, and enter the global access denied page URI /sample/accessdenied.html in Corresponding Map Value field.
To set the access denied page URI for application BankApp: enter BankApp in Map Key field, and enter the application access denied page URI /BankApp/accessdenied.html in Corresponding Map Value field.

responseAttributeMap.title: Response Attribute Mapping
responseAttributeMap.description:
Maps the policy response attributes to be populated under specific names for the currently authenticated user. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.response.attribute.mapping)
Hot-swap: Yes
Example:
To populate the value of response attribute uid under name CUSTOM-USER-NAME: enter uid in Map Key field, and enter CUSTOM-USER-NAME in Corresponding Map Value field.

notEnforcedRuleCompoundSeparator.title: Not Enforced Compound Rule Separator
notEnforcedRuleCompoundSeparator.description: Specifies a separator for not enforced compound rules (Agent 5 only). The format for compound rules requires a list of IP rules, a separator (by default the | character), and a list of URI rules. For example, GET 192.168.1.1-192.168.4.3 | /images/* Configure a different separator (for example, &&) when working with the REGEX keyword to avoid invalid regular expressions.

notEnforcedUrisCacheSize.title: Not Enforced URIs Cache Size
notEnforcedUrisCacheSize.description:
Size of the cache to be used if caching of not enforced URI list evaluation results is enabled. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.notenforced.uri.cache.size)
Hot-swap: Yes

invertNotEnforcedUris.title: Invert Not Enforced URIs
invertNotEnforcedUris.description:
Inverts protection of URIs specified in Not Enforced URIs list. When set to true, it indicates that the URIs specified should be enforced and all other URIs should be not enforced by the Agent. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.notenforced.uri.invert)
Hot-swap: Yes

logoutEntryUri.title: Logout Entry URI
logoutEntryUri.description:
An application-specific Map that identifies a URI to be used as an entry point after successful logout and subsequent successful authentication if applicable. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.logout.entry.uri)
Valid key: the web application name.
Valid value: the logout entry URI.
For this property, a global value can be set to apply to all the applications that don't have their own specific logout entry URI.
Hot-swap: Yes
Examples:
To set a global application logout entry URI: leave Map Key field empty, and enter the global application logout entry URI /welcome.html in Corresponding Map Value field.
To set the logout entry URI for application BankApp: enter BankApp in Map Key field, and enter the logout entry URI /BankApp/welcome.html in Corresponding Map Value field.

responseAttributeFetchMode.title: Response Attribute Fetch Mode
responseAttributeFetchMode.description:
The mode of fetching policy response attributes. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.response.attribute.fetch.mode)
Hot-swap: Yes

invertNotEnforcedIps.title: Not Enforced IP Invert List
invertNotEnforcedIps.description:
Client IP Addresses to invert protection of IP addresses listed in the related Not Enforced Client IP List. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.notenforced.ip.invert)
Hot-swap: Yes

notEnforcedUris.title: Not Enforced URIs
notEnforcedUris.description:
List of URIs for which protection is not enforced by the Agent. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.notenforced.uri)
Hot-swap: Yes
Examples:
/BankApp/public/*
/BankApp/images/*

sessionAttributeFetchMode.title: Session Attribute Fetch Mode
sessionAttributeFetchMode.description:
The mode of fetching session attributes. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.session.attribute.fetch.mode)
Hot-swap: Yes

profileAttributeMap.title: Profile Attribute Mapping
profileAttributeMap.description:
Maps the profile attributes to be populated under specific names for the currently authenticated user. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.profile.attribute.mapping)
Hot-swap: Yes
Example:
To populate the value of profile attribute cn under name CUSTOM-Common-Name: enter cn in Map Key field, and enter CUSTOM-Common-Name in Corresponding Map Value field.
To populate the value of profile attribute mail under name CUSTOM-Email: enter mail in Map Key field, and enter CUSTOM-Email in Corresponding Map Value field.

amCookieName.title: Cookie Name
amCookieName.description:
Name of the SSO Token cookie used between the AM server and the Agent. (property name: com.iplanet.am.cookie.name)
Hot-swap: No

cdssoTrustedIdProvider.title: CDSSO Trusted ID Provider
cdssoTrustedIdProvider.description:
List of AM Server/ID providers that should be trusted by the agent, when evaluating the CDC Liberty Responses. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.cdsso.trusted.id.provider)
Hot-swap: Yes
Example:
http://host:port/opensso/cdcservlet

cdssoRedirectUri.title: CDSSO Redirect URI
cdssoRedirectUri.description:
An intermediate URI that is used by the Agent for processing CDSSO requests. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.cdsso.redirect.uri)
Hot-swap: Yes

cdssoUrls.title: CDSSO Servlet URL
cdssoUrls.description:
List of URLs of the available CDSSO controllers that may be used by the Agent for CDSSO processing. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.cdsso.cdcservlet.url)
Hot-swap: Yes
Example:
http://host:port/opensso/cdcservlet

cookieResetDomains.title: Cookies Reset Domain Map
cookieResetDomains.description:
Maps cookie names specified in Cookie Reset Name List to value being the domain of this cookie to be used when a reset event occurs. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.cookie.reset.domain)
Hot-swap: Yes

cdsso.title: Cross Domain SSO
cdsso.description:
Enables Cross Domain Single SignOn. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.cdsso.enable)
Hot-swap: Yes

cdssoSecureCookies.title: CDSSO Secure Enable
cdssoSecureCookies.description:
The SSO Token cookie set by the agent in the different domains in CDSSO mode will be marked secure. Only transmitted if the communications channel with host is a secure one. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.cdsso.secure.enable)
Hot-swap: Yes

ssoCacheEnabled.title: SSO Cache Enable
ssoCacheEnabled.description:
Specifies if the SSO Cache is active for the agent. Cache is used through public APIs exposed by the agent SDK. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.amsso.cache.enable)
Hot-swap: Yes

cookieResetPaths.title: Cookies Reset Path Map
cookieResetPaths.description:
Maps cookie names specified in Cookie Reset Name List to value being the path of this cookie to be used when a reset event occurs. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.cookie.reset.path)
Hot-swap: Yes

cookieResetNames.title: Cookies Reset Name List
cookieResetNames.description:
Cookie names that will be reset by the Agent if Cookie Reset is enabled. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.cdsso.cookie.reset.name)
Hot-swap: Yes

cdssoClockSkew.title: CDSSO Clock Skew
cdssoClockSkew.description:
Time in seconds to be used by the Agent to determine the validity of the CDSSO AuthnResponse assertion. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.cdsso.clock.skew)
Hot-swap: Yes

cookieResetEnabled.title: Cookie Reset
cookieResetEnabled.description:
Agent resets cookies in the response before redirecting to authentication. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.cookie.reset.enable)
Hot-swap: Yes

cdssoDomainList.title: CDSSO Domain List
cdssoDomainList.description:
Domains for which cookies have to be set in a CDSSO scenario. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.cdsso.domain)
Hot-swap: Yes
Example:
.sun.com

resourceSchema.description: Pending request schema for the user resource access requests.

_id.title: Pending request id
_id.description: Unique identifier of the pending request.

user.description: The user name who is requesting access to the resource.

resource.title: Resource name
resource.description: The resource name which the user requested access to.

when.title: Request time
when.description: The time of the user access request.

permissions.title: Permissions
permissions.description: The list of the permissions the user requested.

1.0.description: Pending UMA requests provider is responsible for allowing, denying and querying the guest requests for user resources. Awailable actions are Query, Read, Deny (all requests or one request), Approve (all requests or one request)

pathParameter.name: pendingRequestId
pathParameter.description: Unique identifier of the pending request.

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: The identifier for the user for which the request is regarding.

userpassword.title: Client secret
userpassword.description: Client secret. Used when the client authenticates to AM.

redirectionUris.title: Redirection URIs
redirectionUris.description: Redirection URIs (optional for confidential clients). Complete URIs or URIs consisting of protocol + authority + path are registered so that the OAuth 2.0 provider can trust that tokens are sent to trusted entities. If multiple URI's are registered, the client MUST specify the URI that the user should be redirected to following approval. May not contain a fragment (#).

refreshTokenLifetime.title: Refresh Token Lifetime (seconds)
refreshTokenLifetime.description: The time in seconds a refresh token is valid for. NB If this field is set to zero, Refresh Token Lifetime of the OAuth2 Provider is used instead. If this field is set to -1, the token will never expire.

clientName.title: Client Name
clientName.description: This value is a readable name for this client.

accessTokenLifetime.title: Access Token Lifetime (seconds)
accessTokenLifetime.description: The time in seconds an access token is valid for. NB If this field is set to zero, Access Token Lifetime of the OAuth2 Provider is used instead of.

authorizationCodeLifetime.title: Authorization Code Lifetime (seconds)
authorizationCodeLifetime.description: The time in seconds an authorization code is valid for. NB If this field is set to zero, Authorization Code Lifetime of the OAuth2 Provider is used instead of.

clientType.title: Client type
clientType.description: Type of OAuth 2.0 client. Confidential clients can keep their password secret, and are typically web apps or other server-based clients. Public clients run the risk of exposing their password to a host or user agent, such as rich browser applications or desktop clients.

defaultScopes.title: Default Scope(s)
defaultScopes.description:
Default Scope(s). Scopes automatically given to tokens.

Default Scopes may be entered as simple strings or pipe separated strings representing the internal scope name, locale, and localized description; e.g. "read|en|Permission to view email messages in your account". Locale strings are in the format language + "_" + country + "_" + variant, e.g. en, en_GB, en_US_WIN. If the locale and pipe is omitted, the description is displayed to all users having undefined locales. e.g. "read|Permission to view email messages in your account". NB If the description is also omitted, nothing is displayed to all users, e.g. specifying "read|" would allow the scope "read" to be used by the client, but would not display it to the user when it was requested.

agentgroup.title: Group
agentgroup.description:
Add the client to a group to allow inheritance of property values from the group.
Changing the group will update inherited property values.
Inherited property values are copied to the client.

scopes.title: Scope(s)
scopes.description:
Scope(s). Scopes are strings that are presented to the user for approval and included in tokens so that the protected resource may make decisions about what to give access to.

Scopes may be entered as simple strings or pipe separated strings representing the internal scope name, locale, and localized description; e.g. "read|en|Permission to view email messages in your account". Locale strings are in the format language + "_" + country + "_" + variant, e.g. en, en_GB, en_US_WIN. If the locale and pipe is omitted, the description is displayed to all users having undefined locales. e.g. "read|Permission to view email messages in your account". NB If the description is also omitted, nothing is displayed to all users, e.g. specifying "read|" would allow the scope "read" to be used by the client, but would not display it to the user when it was requested.

requestUris.title: Request uris
requestUris.description:
Array of request_uri values that are pre-registered by the RP for use at the OP.

The entire Request URI MUST NOT exceed 512 ASCII characters and MUST use either HTTP or HTTPS. Otherwise the value will be ignored.

mixUpMitigation.title: OAuth 2.0 Mix-Up Mitigation enabled
mixUpMitigation.description:
Enables OAuth 2.0 mix-up mitigation on the authorization server side.

Enable this setting only if this OAuth 2.0 client supports the OAuth 2.0 Mix-Up Mitigation draft, otherwise AM will fail to validate access token requests received from this client.

tokenEndpointAuthMethod.title: Token Endpoint Authentication Method
tokenEndpointAuthMethod.description: The authentication method with which a client authenticates to the authorization server at the token endpoint. The authentication method applies to OIDC requests with the openid scope.

logoUri.title: Logo URI
logoUri.description: The URI for the client's logo, for use in user-facing UIs such as consent pages and application pages.

clientUri.title: Client URI
clientUri.description: The URI for finding further information about the client from user-facing UIs.

sectorIdentifierUri.title: Sector Identifier URI
sectorIdentifierUri.description: The Host component of this URL is used in the computation of pairwise Subject Identifiers.

name.title: Display name
name.description:
A client name that may be relevant to the resource owner when considering approval.

The name may be entered as a single string or as pipe separated strings for locale and localized name; e.g. "en|The ExampleCo Intranet". Locale strings are in the format language + "_" + country + "_" + variant, e.g. en, en_GB, en_US_WIN. If the locale is omitted, the name is displayed to all users having undefined locales. e.g. "The ExampleCo Intranet".

grantTypes.title: Grant Types
grantTypes.description:
The set of Grant Types (OAuth2 Flows) that are permitted to be used by this client.

If no Grant Types (OAuth2 Flows) are configured then AUTHORIZATION_CODE flow would be permitted by default.

descriptions.title: Display description
descriptions.description:
A description of the client or other information that may be relevant to the resource owner when considering approval.

The description may be entered as a single string or as pipe separated strings for locale and localized name; e.g. "en|The company intranet is requesting the following access permission". Locale strings are in the format language + "_" + country + "_" + variant, e.g. en, en_GB, en_US_WIN. If the locale is omitted, the description is displayed to all users having undefined locales. e.g. "The company intranet is requesting the following access permission".

isConsentImplied.title: Implied consent
isConsentImplied.description: When enabled, the resource owner will not be asked for consent during authorization flows. The OAuth2 Provider must be configured to allow clients to skip consent.

responseTypes.title: Response Types
responseTypes.description: Response types this client will support and use.

contacts.title: Contacts
contacts.description: Email addresses of users who can administrate this client.

policyUri.title: Privacy Policy URI
policyUri.description: The URI for the client's privacy policy, for use in user-facing consent pages.

subjectType.title: Subject Type
subjectType.description: The subject type added to responses for this client.

updateAccessToken.title: Access Token
updateAccessToken.description: The access token used to update the client.

requestParameterEncryptedAlg.title: Request parameter encryption algorithm
requestParameterEncryptedAlg.description: JWE algorithm for encrypting the request parameter.

jwkStoreCacheMissCacheTime.title: JWKs URI content cache miss cache time
jwkStoreCacheMissCacheTime.description: To avoid loading the JWKS URI content for every token signature verification, especially when the kid is not in the jwks content already cached, the JWKS content will be cache for a minimum period of time. This cache miss cache time defines the minimum of time the JWKS URI content is cache.

tokenEndpointAuthSigningAlgorithm.title: Token Endpoint Authentication Signing Algorithm
tokenEndpointAuthSigningAlgorithm.description: The JWS algorithm that MUST be used for signing the JWT used to authenticate the Client at the Token Endpointfor the private_key_jwt and client_secret_jwt authentication methods. All Token Requests using these authentication methods from this Client MUST be rejected, if the JWT is not signed with this algorithm.

userinfoResponseFormat.title: User info response format.
userinfoResponseFormat.description: The user info endpoint offers different output format. See http://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html#UserInfoResponse

mTLSTrustedCert.title: mTLS Self-Signed Certificate
mTLSTrustedCert.description: Self-signed PEM-encoded X.509 certificate for mTLS client certificate authentication.

idTokenEncryptionEnabled.title: Enable ID Token Encryption
idTokenEncryptionEnabled.description: Select to enable ID token encryption.

jwkSet.title: Json Web Key
jwkSet.description: Raw JSON Web Key value containing the client's public keys.

idTokenSignedResponseAlg.title: ID Token Signing Algorithm
idTokenSignedResponseAlg.description: Algorithm the ID Token for this client must be signed with.

requestParameterSignedAlg.title: Request parameter signing algorithm
requestParameterSignedAlg.description: JWS algorithm for signing the request parameter.

idTokenPublicEncryptionKey.title: Client ID Token Public Encryption Key
idTokenPublicEncryptionKey.description: A Base64 encoded public key for encrypting ID Tokens.

idTokenEncryptionMethod.title: ID Token Encryption Method
idTokenEncryptionMethod.description: Encryption method the ID Token for this client must be encrypted with.

jwksCacheTimeout.title: JWKs URI content cache timeout in ms
jwksCacheTimeout.description: To avoid loading the JWKS URI content for every token encryption, the JWKS content is cached. This timeout defines the maximum of time the JWKS URI content can be cached before being refreshed.

jwksUri.title: Json Web Key URI
jwksUri.description: The uri that contains the client's public keys in Json Web Key format.

publicKeyLocation.title: Public key selector
publicKeyLocation.description: Select the public key for this client to come from either the jwks_uri, manual jwks or X509 field.

userinfoEncryptedResponseAlg.title: User info encrypted response algorithm
userinfoEncryptedResponseAlg.description: JWE algorithm for encrypting UserInfo Responses. If both signing and encryption are requested, the response will be signed then encrypted, with the result being a Nested JWT. The default, if omitted, is that no encryption is performed.

clientJwtPublicKey.title: Client JWT Bearer Public Key
clientJwtPublicKey.description: A Base64 encoded X509 certificate, containing the public key, represented as a UTF-8 PEM file, of the key pair for signing the Client Bearer JWT.

requestParameterEncryptedEncryptionAlgor.title: Request parameter encryption method
requestParameterEncryptedEncryptionAlgor.description:
JWE enc algorithm for encrypting the request parameter.

AM supports the following token encryption algorithms:
  • A128GCM, A192GCM, and A256GCM - AES in Galois Counter Mode (GCM) authenticated encryption mode.
  • A128CBC-HS256, A192CBC-HS384, and A256CBC-HS512 - AES encryption in CBC mode, with HMAC-SHA-2 for integrity.

idTokenEncryptionAlgorithm.title: ID Token Encryption Algorithm
idTokenEncryptionAlgorithm.description: Algorithm the ID Token for this client must be encrypted with.

userinfoEncryptedResponseEncryptionAlgor.title: User info encrypted response encryption algorithm
userinfoEncryptedResponseEncryptionAlgor.description:
JWE enc algorithm for encrypting UserInfo Responses. If userinfo encrypted response algorithm is specified, the default for this value is A128CBC-HS256. When user info encrypted response encryption is included, user info encrypted response algorithm MUST also be provided.

AM supports the following token encryption algorithms:
  • A128GCM, A192GCM, and A256GCM - AES in Galois Counter Mode (GCM) authenticated encryption mode.
  • A128CBC-HS256, A192CBC-HS384, and A256CBC-HS512 - AES encryption in CBC mode, with HMAC-SHA-2 for integrity.

mTLSCertificateBoundAccessTokens.title: Use Certificate-Bound Access Tokens
mTLSCertificateBoundAccessTokens.description: Whether access tokens issued to this client should be bound to the X.509 certificate it uses to authenticate to the token endpoint. If enabled (and the provider supports it) then an x5t#S256 confirmation key will be added to all access tokens with the SHA-256 hash of the client's certificate.

userinfoSignedResponseAlg.title: User info signed response algorithm
userinfoSignedResponseAlg.description: JWS algorithm for signing UserInfo Responses. If this is specified, the response will be JWT JWT serialized, and signed using JWS. The default, if omitted, is for the UserInfo Response to return the Claims as a UTF-8 encoded JSON object using the application/json content-type.

mTLSSubjectDN.title: mTLS Subject DN
mTLSSubjectDN.description: Expected Subject DN of certificate used for mTLS client certificate authentication. Defaults to CN=<client_id>. Only applicable when using CA-signed certificates.

claimsRedirectionUris.title: Claims Redirection URIs
claimsRedirectionUris.description: Redirection URIs for returning to the client from UMA claims collection (not yet supported). If multiple URIs are registered, the client MUST specify the URI that the user should be redirected to following approval. May not contain a fragment (#).

clientSessionUri.title: Client Session URI
clientSessionUri.description: This is the URI that will be used to check messages sent to the session management endpoints. This URI must match the origin of the message

defaultMaxAge.title: Default Max Age
defaultMaxAge.description: Minimum value 1. Sets the maximum length of time in seconds a session may be active after the authorization service has succeeded before the user must actively re-authenticate.

defaultAcrValues.title: Default ACR values
defaultAcrValues.description:
Default requested Authentication Context Class Reference values.

Array of strings that specifies the default acr values that the OP is being requested to use for processing requests from this Client, with the values appearing in order of preference. The Authentication Context Class satisfied by the authentication performed is returned as the acr Claim Value in the issued ID Token. The acr Claim is requested as a Voluntary Claim by this parameter. The acr_values_supported discovery element contains a list of the acr values supported by this server. Values specified in the acr_values request parameter or an individual acr Claim request override these default values.

postLogoutRedirectUri.title: Post Logout Redirect URIs
postLogoutRedirectUri.description: URIs that can be redirected to after the client logout process.

jwtTokenLifetime.title: OpenID Connect JWT Token Lifetime (seconds)
jwtTokenLifetime.description: The time in seconds a JWT is valid for. NB If this field is set to zero, JWT Token Lifetime of the OAuth2 Provider is used instead of.

claims.title: Claim(s)
claims.description:
List of claim name translations, which will override those specified for the AS. Claims are values that are presented to the user to inform them what data is being made available to the Client.

Claims may be entered as simple strings or pipe separated strings representing the internal claim name, locale, and localized description; e.g. "name|en|Your full name". Locale strings are in the format language + "_" + country + "_" + variant, e.g. en, en_GB, en_US_WIN. If the locale and pipe is omitted, the description is displayed to all users having undefined locales. e.g. "name|Your full name". NB If the description is also omitted, nothing is displayed to all users, e.g. specifying "name|" would allow the claim "name" to be used by the client, but would not display it to the user when it was requested.

If a value is not given here, the value will be computed from the OAuth 2 Provider settings.

defaultMaxAgeEnabled.title: Default Max Age Enabled
defaultMaxAgeEnabled.description: Whether or not the default max age is enforced.

1.0.title: OAuth2 Client Agents
1.0.description: Agents handler that is responsible for managing agents
