emailGateway.title: Mail Server Gateway implementation class
emailGateway.description:
The class used by the module to send email.

This class is used by the module to send email. A custom implementation can be provided.

The custom implementation must implement the org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.oauth2.EmailGateway

smtpUsername.title: SMTP User Name
smtpUsername.description: If the SMTP Service requires authentication, configure the user name here

smtpSslEnabled.title: SMTP SSL Enabled
smtpSslEnabled.description: Tick this option if the SMTP Server provides SSL

smtpPort.title: SMTP port
smtpPort.description: The TCP port that will be used by the SMTP gateway

smtpFromAddress.title: SMTP From address
smtpFromAddress.description: The email address on behalf of whom the messages will be sent

smtpPassword.title: SMTP User Password
smtpPassword.description: The Password of the SMTP User Name

emailAttribute.title: Email attribute in the Response
emailAttribute.description:
Attribute from the response used to send activation code emails.

The attribute in the response from the profile service of the Provider that contains the email address of the authenticated user. This address will be used to send an email with an activation code when the accounts are allowed to be created dynamically.

smtpHost.title: SMTP host
smtpHost.description: The mail host that will be used by the Email Gateway implementation

anonymousUserName.title: Anonymous User
anonymousUserName.description:
Username of the OpenAM anonymous user

The username of the user that will represent the anonymous user. This user account must already exist in the realm.

attributeMappingClasses.title: Attribute Mapper
attributeMappingClasses.description:
Name of the class that implements the attribute mapping

This class maps the OAuth properties into OpenAM properties. A custom attribute mapper can be provided.

A custom attribute mapper must implement the org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.AttributeMapper interface.
Provided implementations are:
  • org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.JsonAttributeMapper
  • org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.oidc.JwtAttributeMapper (can only be used when using the openid scope)
String constructor parameters can be provided by appending | separated values.

accountMapperConfiguration.title: Account Mapper Configuration
accountMapperConfiguration.description:
Mapping of OAuth account to local OpenAM account

Attribute configuration that will be used to map the account of the user authenticated in the OAuth 2.0 Provider to the local data store in the OpenAM. Example: OAuth2.0_attribute=local_attribute

enableRegistrationService.title: Use IDM as Registration Service
enableRegistrationService.description:
Whether to use IDM as an external Registration Service to complete registration for new users.

IDM is called and passed these parameters:

  • clientToken: Signed, encrypted JWT of the OAuth 2.0 authentication state.
  • returnParams: Encoded URL parameters, required to be returned to AM to resume authentication after registration in IDM is complete.

saveAttributesInSession.title: Save attributes in the session
saveAttributesInSession.description: If this option is enabled, the attributes configured in the attribute mapper will be saved into the OpenAM session

createAccount.title: Create account if it does not exist
createAccount.description:
If the OAuth2 account does not exist in the local OpenAM data store, an account will be created dynamically.

If this is enabled, the account mapper could create the account dynamically if there is no account mapped. Before creating the account, a dialog prompting for a password and asking for an activation code can be shown if the parameter "Prompt for password setting and activation code" is enabled.

If this flag is not enabled, 3 alternative options exist:

  1. The accounts need to have a user profile in the OpenAM User Data Store
  2. The user does not have a user profile and the "Ignore Profile" is set in the Authentication Service of the realm.
  3. The account is mapped to an anonymous account (see parameter "Map to anonymous user" and "Anonymous User")

mapToAnonymousUser.title: Map to anonymous user
mapToAnonymousUser.description:
Enabled anonymous user access to OpenAM for OAuth authenticated users

If selected, the authenticated users in the OAuth 2.0 Provider will be mapped to the anonymous user configured in the next parameter.
If not selected the users authenticated will be mapped by the parameters configured in the account mapper.

NB If Create account if it does not exist is enabled, that parameter takes precedence.

attributeMapperConfiguration.title: Attribute Mapper Configuration
attributeMapperConfiguration.description:
Mapping of OAuth attributes to local OpenAM attributes

Attribute configuration that will be used to map the user info obtained from the OAuth 2.0 Provider to the local user data store in the OpenAM.

Example: OAuth2.0_attribute=local_attribute

accountMapperClass.title: Account Mapper
accountMapperClass.description:
Name of the class implementing the attribute mapping for the account search.

This class is used by the module to map from the account information received from the OAuth Identity Provider into OpenAM.

The class must implement the org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.AttributeMapper interface.
Provided implementations are:
  • org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.JsonAttributeMapper
  • org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.oidc.JwtAttributeMapper (can only be used when using the openid scope)
String constructor parameters can be provided by appending | separated values.

promptPasswordFlag.title: Prompt for password setting and activation code
promptPasswordFlag.description:
Users must set a password and complete the activation flow during dynamic profile creation.

If this is enabled, the user must set a password before the system creates an account dynamically and an activation code will be sent to the user's email address. The account will be created only if the password and activation code are properly set.
If this is disabled, the account will be created transparently without prompting the user.

accountProviderClass.title: Account Provider
accountProviderClass.description:
Name of the class implementing the account provider.

This class is used by the module to find the account from the attributes mapped by the Account Mapper org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.AccountProvider interface.
String constructor parameters can be provided by appending | separated values.

userInfoEndpoint.title: User Profile Service URL
userInfoEndpoint.description:
User profile information URL

This URL endpoint provides user profile information and is provided by the OAuth Identity Provider

NB This URL should return JSON objects in response

scopeDelimiter.title: Scope Delimiter
scopeDelimiter.description: Delimiter used to separate scope values. Default value is space.

tokenEndpoint.title: Access Token Endpoint URL
tokenEndpoint.description:
OAuth access token endpoint URL

This is the URL endpoint for access token retrieval provided by the OAuth Identity Provider. Refer to the RFC 6749, section 3.2

authenticationLevel.title: Authentication Level
authenticationLevel.description:
The authentication level associated with this module.

Each authentication module has an authentication level that can be used to indicate the level of security associated with the module; 0 is the lowest (and the default).

mixUpMitigation.title: OAuth 2.0 Mix-Up Mitigation enabled
mixUpMitigation.description:
Enables OAuth 2.0 mix-up mitigation

The authorization server must support the OAuth 2.0 Mix-Up Mitigation draft, otherwise OpenAM will fail to validate responses from the authorization server. If only the OAuth 2.0 protocol is utilized, make sure that the accepted issuer value is set in the "Token Issuer" setting.

logoutServiceUrl.title: OAuth 2.0 Provider Logout Service
logoutServiceUrl.description:
The URL of the Identity Provider's logout service.

To enable IdP logout, you must also add org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.oauth2.OAuth2PostAuthnPlugin to the Authentication Post Processing Classes setting. Navigate to Authentication > Settings > Post Authentication Processing.

subjectProperty.title: Subject Property
subjectProperty.description: Property used to identify which attribute an auth server identifies a user by.

scope.title: Scope
scope.description:
OAuth scope; list of user profile properties

According to the OAuth 2.0 Authorization Framework, scope is a space-separated list of user profile attributes that the client application requires. The list depends on the permissions that the resource owner grants to the client application.

Some authorization servers use non-standard separators for scopes. For example, Facebook takes a comma-separated list.

authorizeEndpoint.title: Authentication Endpoint URL
authorizeEndpoint.description:
OAuth authentication endpoint URL

This is the URL endpoint for OAuth authentication provided by the OAuth Identity Provider

ssoProxyUrl.title: Proxy URL
ssoProxyUrl.description:
The URL to the OpenAM OAuth proxy JSP

This URL should only be changed from the default, if an external server is performing the GET to POST proxying. The default is /openam/oauth2c/OAuthProxy.jsp

clientSecret.title: Client Secret
clientSecret.description:
OAuth client_secret parameter

For more information on the OAuth client_secret parameter refer to the RFC 6749, section 2.3.1

issuerName.title: Token Issuer
issuerName.description:
Required when the 'openid' scope is included. Value must match the iss field in issued ID Token
e.g. accounts.google.com

The issuer value MUST be provided when OAuth 2.0 Mix-Up Mitigation is enabled.

provider.title: Social Provider
provider.description: Social Provider for which this module is being setup.

usesBasicAuth.title: Use Basic Auth
usesBasicAuth.description: When enabled, the client will use basic auth for authenticating with  the social auth provider. Enabled by default.

logoutBehaviour.title: Logout Options
logoutBehaviour.description:
Specify logout behavior.

The following options are available for logging out of the OAuth 2.0 Provider when the user logs out of AM:
  • prompt: Ask the user whether to log out from the OAuth 2.0 Provider
  • logout: Log out from the OAuth 2.0 Provider without asking the user
  • donotlogout: Do not log out the user from the OAuth 2.0 Provider

To enable IdP logout, you must also add org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.oauth2.OAuth2PostAuthnPlugin to the Authentication Post Processing Classes setting. Navigate to Authentication > Settings > Post Authentication Processing.

clientId.title: Client Id
clientId.description:
OAuth client_id parameter

For more information on the OAuth client_id parameter refer to the RFC 6749, section 2.3.1

_id.title: ID
_id.description: The identifier of the item within its type

additionalProperties.title: Other properties
additionalProperties.description: Any additional properties for the item (varies based on the schema of the type)

primaryLdapServer.title: Primary LDAP Server
primaryLdapServer.description:
Use this list to set the primary LDAP server used for authentication.

The LDAP authentication module will use this list as the primary server for authentication. A single entry must be in the format:

ldap_server:port

Multiple entries allow associations between OpenAM servers and a LDAP server. The format is:

local server name | server:port

The local server name is the full name of the server from the list of servers and sites.

operationTimeout.title: LDAP operations timeout
operationTimeout.description:
Defines the timeout in seconds OpenAM should wait for a response of the Directory Server - 0 means no timeout.

If the Directory Server's host is down completely or the TCP connection became stale OpenAM waits until operation timeouts from the OS or the JVM are applied. However this setting allows more granular control within OpenAM itself. A value of 0 means NO timeout is applied on OpenAM level and the timeouts from the JVM or OS will apply.

userBindPassword.title: Bind User Password
userBindPassword.description: The password of the administration account.

userSearchStartDN.title: DN to Start User Search
userSearchStartDN.description:
The search for accounts to be authenticated start from this base DN

For a single server just enter the Base DN to be searched. Multiple OpenAM servers can have different base DNs for the search The format is as follows:

local server name | search DN

NB The local server name is the full name of the server from the list of servers and sites.

minimumPasswordLength.title: Minimum Password Length
minimumPasswordLength.description:
Enforced when the user is resetting their password as part of the authentication.

If the user needs to reset their password as part of the authentication process, the authentication module can enforce a minimum password length. This is separate from any password length controls from the underlying LDAP server. If the external LDAP server password policy is enforcing password length, set this value to 0 to avoid confusion.

returnUserDN.title: Return User DN to DataStore
returnUserDN.description: Controls whether the DN or the username is returned as the authentication principal.

beheraPasswordPolicySupportEnabled.title: LDAP Behera Password Policy Support
beheraPasswordPolicySupportEnabled.description:
Enables support for modern LDAP password policies

LDAP Behera Password policies are supported by modern LDAP servers such as OpenDJ. If this functionality is disabled then only the older Netscape VCHU password policy standard will be enforced.

userProfileRetrievalAttribute.title: Attribute Used to Retrieve User Profile
userProfileRetrievalAttribute.description:
The LDAP module will use this attribute to search of the profile of an authenticated user.

This is the attribute used to find the profile of the authenticated user. Normally this will be the same attribute used to find the user account. The value will be the name of the user used for authentication.

userSearchAttributes.title: Attributes Used to Search for a User to be Authenticated
userSearchAttributes.description:
The attributes specified in this list form the LDAP search filter.

The default value of uid will form the following search filter of uid=user, if there are multiple values such as uid and cn, the module will create a search filter as follows (|(uid=user)(cn=user))

secondaryLdapServer.title: Secondary LDAP Server
secondaryLdapServer.description:
Use this list to set the secondary (failover) LDAP server used for authentication.

If the primary LDAP server fails, the LDAP authentication module will failover to the secondary server. A single entry must be in the format:

ldap_server:port

Multiple entries allow associations between OpenAM servers and a LDAP server. The format is:

local server name | server:port

NB The local server name is the full name of the server from the list of servers and sites.

trustAllServerCertificates.title: Trust All Server Certificates
trustAllServerCertificates.description:
Enables a X509TrustManager that trusts all certificates.

This feature will allow the LDAP authentication module to connect to LDAP servers protected by self signed or invalid certificates (such as invalid hostname).

NB Use this feature with care as it bypasses the normal certificate verification process

userSearchFilter.title: User Search Filter
userSearchFilter.description:
This search filter will be appended to the standard user search filter.

This attribute can be used to append a custom search filter to the standard filter. For example: (objectClass=person)would result in the following user search filter:

(&(uid=user)(objectClass=person))

connectionHeartbeatTimeUnit.title: LDAP Connection Heartbeat Time Unit
connectionHeartbeatTimeUnit.description:
Defines the time unit corresponding to the Heartbeat Interval setting.

This setting controls how often OpenAM should send a heartbeat search request to the configured directory. If a connection becomes unresponsive (e.g. due to a network error) then it may take up to the interval period before the problem is detected. Use along with the Heartbeat Interval parameter to define the exact interval.

connectionHeartbeatInterval.title: LDAP Connection Heartbeat Interval
connectionHeartbeatInterval.description:
Specifies how often should OpenAM send a heartbeat request to the directory.

This setting controls how often OpenAM should send a heartbeat search request to the configured directory. If a connection becomes unresponsive (e.g. due to a network error) then it may take up to the interval period before the problem is detected. Use along with the Heartbeat Time Unit parameter to define the exact interval. Zero or negative value will result in disabling heartbeat requests.

profileAttributeMappings.title: User Creation Attributes
profileAttributeMappings.description:
Controls the mapping of local attribute to external attribute for dynamic profile creation.

If dynamic profile creation is enabled; this feature allows for a mapping between the attribute/values retrieved from the users authenticated profile and the attribute/values that will be provisioned into their matching account in the data store.

The format of this property is:

local attr1|external attr1

userBindDN.title: Bind User DN
userBindDN.description:
The DN of an admin user used by the module to authentication to the LDAP server

The LDAP module requires an administration account in order to perform functionality such as password reset.

NB cn=Directory Manager should not be used in production systems.

openam-auth-ldap-connection-mode.title: LDAP Connection Mode
openam-auth-ldap-connection-mode.description:
Defines which protocol/operation is used to establish the connection to the LDAP Directory Server.

If 'LDAP' is selected, the connection won't be secured and passwords are transferred in cleartext over the network.
If 'LDAPS' is selected, the connection is secured via SSL or TLS.
If 'StartTLS' is selected, the connection is secured by using StartTLS extended operation.

searchScope.title: Search Scope
searchScope.description:
The level in the Directory Server that will be searched for a matching user profile.

This attribute controls how the directory is searched.

  • OBJECT: Only the Base DN is searched.
  • ONELEVEL: Only the single level below (and not the Base DN) is searched
  • SUBTREE: The Base DN and all levels below are searched

authenticationLevel.title: Authentication Level
authenticationLevel.description:
The authentication level associated with this module.

Each authentication module has an authentication level that can be used to indicate the level of security associated with the module; 0 is the lowest (and the default).

additionalProperties.description: Any additional properties for the item (varies based on the schema of the type)

softwareStatementSigningAlgorithm.title: Software statement signing Algorithm
softwareStatementSigningAlgorithm.description: Signing algorithm to be used when verifying software statement signatures.

agentgroup.title: Group
agentgroup.description:
Add the agent to a group to allow inheritance of property values from the group.
Changing the group will update inherited property values.
Inherited property values are copied to the agent.

jwksCacheTimeout.title: JWKs URI content cache timeout in ms
jwksCacheTimeout.description: To avoid loading the JWKS URI content for every operation, the JWKS content is cached. This timeout defines the maximum amount of time the JWKS URI content can be cached before being refreshed.

issuer.title: Software publisher issuer
issuer.description: Identifier for the software publisher, generally represented as a URL.

jwksUri.title: Json Web Key URI
jwksUri.description: The URI that contains the Software Publisher's public keys in Json Web Key format.

userpassword.title: Software publisher secret
userpassword.description: Software publisher secret. Used when software statement signatures are HMAC based.

jwkSet.title: Json Web Key
jwkSet.description: Raw JSON Web Key value containing the Software Publisher's public keys.

publicKeyLocation.title: Public key selector
publicKeyLocation.description: Select how the Software Publisher's public keys should be retrieved by the provider when validating software statement signatures.

jwkStoreCacheMissCacheTime.title: JWKs URI content cache miss cache time
jwkStoreCacheMissCacheTime.description: To avoid loading the JWKS URI content for every operation, especially when the kid is not in the jwks content already cached, the JWKS content will be cached for a minimum period of time. This cache miss cache time defines the minimum amount of time the JWKS URI content is cached.

1.0.title: OAuth2 Software Publisher Agents
1.0.description: Agents handler that is responsible for managing agents

resourceSchema.description: Site schema.

_id.title: Name
_id.description: Site name.

id.title: Server id
id.description: Server's unique identifier for the site.

1.0.title: Sites Resource
1.0.description: This version 1.0 sites service represents a Sites resource with CQ operations on the users collection and CRUDPA operations available for the site item. Items can have server version 1.0 subresources.

errors.description:
Internal server error happened during the read process. Cause can be: * Site with id already exists
* Could not create site
* Could not read site just created

pathParameter.name: sitesId
pathParameter.description: The site name from the path

charsetMappings.title: Charsets Supported by Each Locale
charsetMappings.description: This table lets you configure the order of supported character sets used for each supported locale. Change the settings only if the defaults are not appropriate.

sun-identity-g11n-settings-charset-alias.title: Charset Aliases
sun-identity-g11n-settings-charset-alias.description: Use this list to map between different character set names used in Java and in MIME.

commonNameFormats.title: Auto Generated Common Name Format
commonNameFormats.description:
Use this list to configure how OpenAM formats names shown in the console banner.

This setting allows the name of the authenticated user shown in the OpenAM console banner to be customised based on the locale of the user.

samlErrorPageHttpBinding.title: SAML Error Page HTTP Binding
samlErrorPageHttpBinding.description: The possible values are HTTP-Redirect or HTTP-POST.

samlErrorPageUrl.title: SAML Error Page URL
samlErrorPageUrl.description:
OpenAM redirects users here when an error occurs in the SAML2 engine.

Both relative and absolute URLs are supported. Users are redirected to an absolute URL using the configured HTTP Binding whereas relative URLs are displayed within the request.

certificateChecking.title: Check presence of certificates
certificateChecking.description:
Enable checking of certificates against local copy

Whether to verify that the partner's signing certificate included in the Federation XML document is the same as the one stored in the said partner's meta data.

maxContentLength.title: Maximum allowed content length
maxContentLength.description: The maximum content length allowed in federation communications, in bytes.

monitoringAgentClass.title: Monitoring Agent Provider Class
monitoringAgentClass.description:
The Federation system uses this class to gain access to the monitoring system.

The default implementation uses the built-in OpenAM monitoring system. A custom implementation must implement the com.sun.identity.plugin.monitoring.FedMonAgent interface.

monitoringSaml1Class.title: Monitoring Provider Class for SAML1
monitoringSaml1Class.description:
The SAMLv1 engine uses this class to gain access to the monitoring system

The default implementation uses the built-in OpenAM monitoring system. A custom implementation must implement the com.sun.identity.plugin.monitoring.FedMonSAML1Svc interface.

monitoringSaml2Class.title: Monitoring Provider Class for SAML2
monitoringSaml2Class.description:
The SAML2 engine uses this class to gain access to the monitoring system.

The default implementation uses the built-in OpenAM monitoring system. A custom implementation must implement the com.sun.identity.plugin.monitoring.FedMonSAML2Svc interface.

monitoringIdffClass.title: Monitoring Provider Class for ID-FF
monitoringIdffClass.description:
The ID-FF engine uses this class to gain access to the monitoring system.

The default implementation uses the built-in OpenAM monitoring system. A custom implementation must implement the com.sun.identity.plugin.monitoring.FedMonIDFFSvc interface.

configurationClass.title: ConfigurationInstance SPI implementation class
configurationClass.description:
The Federation system uses this class to fetch service configuration.

The default implementation uses the SMS APIs to access service configuration. A custom implementation must implement the com.sun.identity.plugin.configuration.ConfigurationInstance interface.

passwordDecoderClass.title: PasswordDecoder SPI implementation class
passwordDecoderClass.description:
The Federation system uses this class to decode password encoded by OpenAM.

The default implementation uses the internal OpenAM decryption API to decode passwords. A custom implementation must implement the com.sun.identity.saml.xmlsig.PasswordDecoder interface.

datastoreClass.title: Datastore SPI implementation class
datastoreClass.description:
The Federation system uses this class to get/set user profile attributes.

The default implementation uses the Identity repository APIs to access user profile attributes. A custom implementation must implement the com.sun.identity.plugin.datastore.DataStoreProvider interface.

keyProviderClass.title: KeyProvider SPI implementation class
keyProviderClass.description:
The Federation system uses this class to provide access to the underlying Java keystore.

The default implementation uses the Java Cryptographic Engine to provide access to the Java keystore. A custom implementation must implement the com.sun.identity.saml.xmlsig.KeyProvider interface.

signatureProviderClass.title: SignatureProvider SPI implementation class
signatureProviderClass.description:
The Federation system uses this class to digitally sign SAML documents.

The default implementation uses the XERCES APIs to sign the documents. A custom implementation must implement the com.sun.identity.saml.xmlsig.SignatureProvider interface.

loggerClass.title: Logger SPI implementation class
loggerClass.description:
The Federation system uses this class to record log entries.

The default implementation uses the Logging APIs to record log entries. A custom implementation must implement the com.sun.identity.plugin.log.Logger interface.

sessionProviderClass.title: SessionProvider SPI implementation class
sessionProviderClass.description:
The Federation system uses this class to interface with the session service.

The default implementation uses the standard authentication and SSO APIs to access the session service. A custom implementation must implement the com.sun.identity.plugin.session.SessionProvider interface.

QuerySignatureAlgorithmRSA.title: Query String signature algorithm (RSA)
QuerySignatureAlgorithmRSA.description: The default signature algorithm to use in case of RSA keys.

transformationAlgorithm.title: XML transformation algorithm
transformationAlgorithm.description: The algorithm used to transform XML documents.

maskGenerationFunction.title: Mask Generation Function Algorithm
maskGenerationFunction.description: Which MGF algorithm to use when encrypting the symmetric encryption key using RSA OAEP algorithm.

canonicalizationAlgorithm.title: XML canonicalization algorithm
canonicalizationAlgorithm.description: The algorithm used to canonicalize XML documents.

signatureAlgorithm.title: XML signature algorithm
signatureAlgorithm.description: The algorithm used to sign XML documents.

QuerySignatureAlgorithmDSA.title: Query String signature algorithm (DSA)
QuerySignatureAlgorithmDSA.description: The default signature algorithm to use in case of DSA keys.

QuerySignatureAlgorithmEC.title: Query String signature algorithm (EC)
QuerySignatureAlgorithmEC.description: The default signature algorithm to use in case of EC keys.

DigestAlgorithm.title: XML digest algorithm
DigestAlgorithm.description: The default digest algorithm to use in signing XML.

iplanet-am-session-quota-limit.description: Maximum number of concurrent CTS-based sessions OpenAM allows a user to have.

iplanet-am-session-max-idle-time.title: Maximum Idle Time
iplanet-am-session-max-idle-time.description: Maximum time a CTS-based session can remain idle before OpenAM requires the user to authenticate again, in minutes.

iplanet-am-session-max-session-time.title: Maximum Session Time
iplanet-am-session-max-session-time.description: Maximum time a session can remain valid before OpenAM requires the user to authenticate again, in minutes.

iplanet-am-session-max-caching-time.title: Maximum Caching Time
iplanet-am-session-max-caching-time.description: Maximum time that external clients of AM are recommended to cache the session for, in minutes.

resourceSchema.title: UMA Resource Set Label

id.title: Id

name.description: The displayed text of the label
name.title: Name

type.description: The type of the label e.g. 'System'
type.title: Type

1.0.title: UMA Resource Set Labels
1.0.description: Provides create, delete and query operations for UMA resource set labels

create.description: Creates a UMA Resource Set Label

errors.description: Occurs if openAM is unable to get a connection to the data layer
Occurs if the label already exists

queries.description: Queries the collection of UMA labels

create.description: Creates a UMA Resource Set Label

errors.description: Occurs if openAM is unable to get a connection to the data layer
Occurs if the label already exists

delete.description: Deletes a UMA Resource Set Label

pathParameter.name: umaLabelId
pathParameter.description: The unique identifier of the UMA Resource Set

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: The identifier for the user for which the UMA Resource Set is regarding.

index.title: Elasticsearch Index
index.description: Specifies the name of the Elasticsearch index to be used for OpenAM audit logging.

port.title: Server Port
port.description: Specifies the port number used to access Elasticsearch's REST API.

host.title: Server Hostname
host.description: Host name or IP address of the Elasticsearch server.

sslEnabled.title: SSL Enabled
sslEnabled.description:
Specifies whether SSL is configured on the Elasticsearch server.

If SSL is enabled, be sure to import the CA certificate used to sign Elasticsearch node certificates into the Java keystore on the host that runs OpenAM before attempting to log audit events to Elasticsearch.

enabled.title: Enabled
enabled.description: Enables or disables an audit event handler.

topics.title: Topics
topics.description: List of topics handled by an audit event handler.

handlerFactory.title: Factory Class Name
handlerFactory.description: The fully qualified class name of the factory responsible for creating the Audit Event Handler. The class must implement org.forgerock.openam.audit.AuditEventHandlerFactory.

username.title: Username
username.description:
Specifies the username to access the Elasticsearch server.

Required if Elasticsearch Shield authentication is configured.

password.title: Password
password.description:
Specifies the password to access the Elasticsearch server.

Required if Elasticsearch Shield authentication is configured.

writeInterval.title: Write interval (in milliseconds)
writeInterval.description: Specifies the interval in milliseconds at which buffered events are written to Elasticsearch.

maxEvents.title: Queue Capacity
maxEvents.description: Maximum number of audit logs in the batch queue. Additional audit events are dropped.

batchSize.title: Batch Size
batchSize.description: Maximum number of events that can be buffered (default: 10000)

openidConnectIssuer.title: Token Issuer
openidConnectIssuer.description:
Required when the 'openid' scope is included. Value must match the iss field in issued ID Token
e.g. accounts.google.com

The issuer value MUST be provided when OAuth 2.0 Mix-Up Mitigation is enabled.

smtpSslEnabled.title: SMTP SSL Enabled
smtpSslEnabled.description: Tick this option if the SMTP Server provides SSL

scope.title: Scope
scope.description:
OAuth scope; list of user profile properties

According to the OAuth 2.0 Authorization Framework, scope is a space-separated list of user profile attributes that the client application requires. The list depends on the permissions that the resource owner grants to the client application.

Some authorization servers use non-standard separators for scopes. For example, Facebook takes a comma-separated list.

Default: email, read_stream (Facebook example)

accessTokenParameterName.title: OAuth2 Access Token Profile Service Parameter name
accessTokenParameterName.description: The name of the parameter that will contain the access token value when accessing the profile service

smtpFromAddress.title: SMTP From address
smtpFromAddress.description: The email address on behalf of whom the messages will be sent

smtpUsername.title: SMTP User Name
smtpUsername.description: If the SMTP Service requires authentication, configure the user name here

openidConnectContextType.title: OpenID Connect validation configuration type
openidConnectContextType.description: Required when the 'openid' scope is included. Please select either 1. the issuer discovery url, 2. the issuer jwk url, or 3. the client_secret.

authenticationLevel.title: Authentication Level
authenticationLevel.description:
The authentication level associated with this module.

Each authentication module has an authentication level that can be used to indicate the level of security associated with the module; 0 is the lowest (and the default).

accountMapperConfiguration.title: Account Mapper Configuration
accountMapperConfiguration.description:
Mapping of OAuth account to local OpenAM account

Attribute configuration that will be used to map the account of the user authenticated in the OAuth 2.0 Provider to the local data store in the OpenAM. Example: OAuth2.0_attribute=local_attribute

mailGatewayClass.title: Mail Server Gateway implementation class
mailGatewayClass.description:
The class used by the module to send email.

This class is used by the module to send email. A custom implementation can be provided.

The custom implementation must implement the org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.oauth2.EmailGateway

smtpPassword.title: SMTP User Password
smtpPassword.description: The Password of the SMTP User Name

userProfileServiceUrl.title: User Profile Service URL
userProfileServiceUrl.description:
User profile information URL

This URL endpoint provides user profile information and is provided by the OAuth Identity Provider

NB This URL should return JSON objects in response

promptForPassword.title: Prompt for password setting and activation code
promptForPassword.description:
Users must set a password and complete the activation flow during dynamic profile creation.

If this is enabled, the user must set a password before the system creates an account dynamically and an activation code will be sent to the user's email address. The account will be created only if the password and activation code are properly set.
If this is disabled, the account will be created transparently without prompting the user.

clientId.title: Client Id
clientId.description:
OAuth client_id parameter

For more information on the OAuth client_id parameter refer to the RFC 6749, section 2.3.1

smtpHostName.title: SMTP host
smtpHostName.description: The mail host that will be used by the Email Gateway implementation

authenticationEndpointUrl.title: Authentication Endpoint URL
authenticationEndpointUrl.description:
OAuth authentication endpoint URL

This is the URL endpoint for OAuth authentication provided by the OAuth Identity Provider

mapToAnonymousUser.title: Map to anonymous user
mapToAnonymousUser.description:
Enabled anonymous user access to OpenAM for OAuth authenticated users

If selected, the authenticated users in the OAuth 2.0 Provider will be mapped to the anonymous user configured in the next parameter.
If not selected the users authenticated will be mapped by the parameters configured in the account mapper.

NB If Create account if it does not exist is enabled, that parameter takes precedence.

anonymousUserName.title: Anonymous User
anonymousUserName.description:
Username of the OpenAM anonymous user

The username of the user that will represent the anonymous user. This user account must already exist in the realm.

oauth2LogoutServiceUrl.title: OAuth 2.0 Provider logout service
oauth2LogoutServiceUrl.description:
The URL of the OAuth Identity Providers Logout service

OAuth 2.0 Identity Providers can have a logout service. If this logout functionality is required then the URL of the Logout endpoint should configured here.

smtpHostPort.title: SMTP port
smtpHostPort.description: The TCP port that will be used by the SMTP gateway

attributeMapperConfiguration.title: Attribute Mapper Configuration
attributeMapperConfiguration.description:
Mapping of OAuth attributes to local OpenAM attributes

Attribute configuration that will be used to map the user info obtained from the OAuth 2.0 Provider to the local user data store in the OpenAM.

Example: OAuth2.0_attribute=local_attribute

saveAttributesInSession.title: Save attributes in the session
saveAttributesInSession.description: If this option is enabled, the attributes configured in the attribute mapper will be saved into the OpenAM session

accountProviderClass.title: Account Provider
accountProviderClass.description:
Name of the class implementing the account provider.

This class is used by the module to find the account from the attributes mapped by the Account Mapper org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.AccountProvider interface.
String constructor parameters can be provided by appending | separated values.

openidConnectContextValue.title: OpenID Connect validation configuration value
openidConnectContextValue.description:
Required when the 'openid' scope is included. The discovery url, or jwk url, or the client_secret, corresponding to the selection above.

If discovery or jwk url entered, entry must be in valid url format,
e.g. https://accounts.google.com/.well-known/openid-configuration
NB If client_secret entered, entry is ignored and the value of the Client Secret is used.

clientSecret.title: Client Secret
clientSecret.description:
OAuth client_secret parameter

For more information on the OAuth client_secret parameter refer to the RFC 6749, section 2.3.1

accessTokenEndpointUrl.title: Access Token Endpoint URL
accessTokenEndpointUrl.description:
OAuth access token endpoint URL

This is the URL endpoint for access token retrieval provided by the OAuth Identity Provider. Refer to the RFC 6749, section 3.2

accountMapperClass.title: Account Mapper
accountMapperClass.description:
Name of the class implementing the attribute mapping for the account search.

This class is used by the module to map from the account information received from the OAuth Identity Provider into OpenAM.

The class must implement the org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.AttributeMapper interface.
Provided implementations are:
  • org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.JsonAttributeMapper
  • org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.oidc.JwtAttributeMapper (can only be used when using the openid scope)
String constructor parameters can be provided by appending | separated values.

oauth2EmailAttribute.title: Email attribute in OAuth2 Response
oauth2EmailAttribute.description:
Attribute from the OAuth2 response used to send activation code emails.

The attribute in the response from the profile service in the OAuth 2.0 Provider that contains the email address of the authenticated user. This address will be used to send an email with an activation code when the accounts are allowed to be created dynamically.

createAccount.title: Create account if it does not exist
createAccount.description:
If the OAuth2 account does not exist in the local OpenAM data store, an account will be created dynamically.

If this is enabled, the account mapper could create the account dynamically if there is no account mapped. Before creating the account, a dialog prompting for a password and asking for an activation code can be shown if the parameter "Prompt for password setting and activation code" is enabled.

If this flag is not enabled, 3 alternative options exist:

  1. The accounts need to have a user profile in the OpenAM User Data Store
  2. The user does not have a user profile and the "Ignore Profile" is set in the Authentication Service of the realm.
  3. The account is mapped to an anonymous account (see parameter "Map to anonymous user" and "Anonymous User")

ssoProxyUrl.title: Proxy URL
ssoProxyUrl.description:
The URL to the OpenAM OAuth proxy JSP

This URL should only be changed from the default, if an external server is performing the GET to POST proxying. The default is /openam/oauth2c/OAuthProxy.jsp

attributeMappingClasses.title: Attribute Mapper
attributeMappingClasses.description:
Name of the class that implements the attribute mapping

This class maps the OAuth properties into OpenAM properties. A custom attribute mapper can be provided.

A custom attribute mapper must implement the org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.AttributeMapper interface.
Provided implementations are:
  • org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.JsonAttributeMapper
  • org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.oidc.JwtAttributeMapper (can only be used when using the openid scope)
String constructor parameters can be provided by appending | separated values.

mixUpMitigation.title: OAuth 2.0 Mix-Up Mitigation enabled
mixUpMitigation.description:
Enables OAuth 2.0 mix-up mitigation

The authorization server must support the OAuth 2.0 Mix-Up Mitigation draft, otherwise OpenAM will fail to validate responses from the authorization server. If only the OAuth 2.0 protocol is utilized, make sure that the accepted issuer value is set in the "Token Issuer" setting.

logoutBehaviour.title: Logout options
logoutBehaviour.description:
Controls how Logout options will be presented to the user.

The OAuth module has the following logout options for the user:

  • Prompt: Prompt the user to logout from the OAuth 2.0 Provider
  • Logout: Logout from the OAuth 2.0 Provider and do not prompt
  • Do not logout: Do not logout the user from the OAuth 2.0 Provider and do not prompt

operationTimeout.title: LDAP operations timeout
operationTimeout.description:
Defines the timeout in seconds OpenAM should wait for a response of the Directory Server - 0 means no timeout.

If the Directory Server's host is down completely or the TCP connection became stale OpenAM waits until operation timeouts from the OS or the JVM are applied. However this setting allows more granular control within OpenAM itself. A value of 0 means NO timeout is applied on OpenAM level and the timeouts from the JVM or OS will apply.

authenticationLevel.title: Authentication Level
authenticationLevel.description:
The authentication level associated with this module.

Each authentication module has an authentication level that can be used to indicate the level of security associated with the module; 0 is the lowest (and the default).

userSearchFilter.title: User Search Filter
userSearchFilter.description:
This search filter will be appended to the standard user search filter.

This attribute can be used to append a custom search filter to the standard filter. For example: (objectClass=person)would result in the following user search filter:

(&(uid=user)(objectClass=person))

userBindDN.title: Bind User DN
userBindDN.description:
The DN of an admin user used by the module to authentication to the LDAP server

The LDAP module requires an administration account in order to perform functionality such as password reset.

NB cn=Directory Manager should not be used in production systems.

returnUserDN.title: Return User DN to DataStore
returnUserDN.description: Controls whether the DN or the username is returned as the authentication principal.

openam-auth-ldap-connection-mode.title: LDAP Connection Mode
openam-auth-ldap-connection-mode.description:
Defines which protocol/operation is used to establish the connection to the LDAP Directory Server.

If 'LDAP' is selected, the connection won't be secured and passwords are transferred in cleartext over the network.
If 'LDAPS' is selected, the connection is secured via SSL or TLS.
If 'StartTLS' is selected, the connection is secured by using StartTLS extended operation.

primaryLdapServer.title: Primary Active Directory Server
primaryLdapServer.description:
Use this list to set the primary Active Directory server used for authentication.

The Active Directory authentication module will use this list as the primary server for authentication. A single entry must be in the format:

server:port

Multiple entries allow associations between OpenAM servers and an Active Directory server. The format is:

local server name | server:port

The local server name is the full name of the server from the list of servers and sites.

userSearchStartDN.title: DN to Start User Search
userSearchStartDN.description:
The search for accounts to be authenticated start from this base DN

For a single server just enter the Base DN to be searched. Multiple OpenAM servers can have different base DNs for the search The format is as follows:

local server name | search DN

NB The local server name is the full name of the server from the list of servers and sites.

trustAllServerCertificates.title: Trust All Server Certificates
trustAllServerCertificates.description:
Enables a X509TrustManager that trusts all certificates.

This feature will allow the LDAP authentication module to connect to LDAP servers protected by self signed or invalid certificates (such as invalid hostname).

NB Use this feature with care as it bypasses the normal certificate verification process

secondaryLdapServer.title: Secondary Active Directory Server
secondaryLdapServer.description:
Use this list to set the secondary (failover) Active Directory server used for authentication.

If the primary Active Directory server fails, the Active Directory authentication module will failover to the secondary server. A single entry must be in the format:

server:port

Multiple entries allow associations between OpenAM servers and an Active Directory server. The format is:

local server name | server:port

NB The local server name is the full name of the server from the list of servers and sites.

userBindPassword.title: Bind User Password
userBindPassword.description: The password of the administration account.

connectionHeartbeatTimeUnit.title: LDAP Connection Heartbeat Time Unit
connectionHeartbeatTimeUnit.description:
Defines the time unit corresponding to the Heartbeat Interval setting.

Use this option in case a firewall/loadbalancer can close idle connections, since the heartbeat requests will ensure that the connections won't become idle.

searchScope.title: Search Scope
searchScope.description:
The level in the Directory Server that will be searched for a matching user profile.

This attribute controls how the directory is searched.

  • OBJECT: Only the Base DN is searched.
  • ONELEVEL: Only the single level below (and not the Base DN) is searched
  • SUBTREE: The Base DN and all levels below are searched

profileAttributeMappings.title: User Creation Attributes
profileAttributeMappings.description:
Controls the mapping of local attribute to external attribute for dynamic profile creation.

If dynamic profile creation is enabled; this feature allows for a mapping between the attribute/values retrieved from the users authenticated profile and the attribute/values that will be provisioned into their matching account in the data store.

The format of this property is:

local attr1|external attr1

userSearchAttributes.title: Attributes Used to Search for a User to be Authenticated
userSearchAttributes.description:
The attributes specified in this list form the LDAP search filter.

The default value of uid will form the following search filter of uid=user, if there are multiple values such as uid and cn, the module will create a search filter as follows (|(uid=user)(cn=user))

userProfileRetrievalAttribute.title: Attribute Used to Retrieve User Profile
userProfileRetrievalAttribute.description:
The LDAP module will use this attribute to search of the profile of an authenticated user.

This is the attribute used to find the profile of the authenticated user. Normally this will be the same attribute used to find the user account. The value will be the name of the user used for authentication.

connectionHeartbeatInterval.title: LDAP Connection Heartbeat Interval
connectionHeartbeatInterval.description:
Specifies how often should OpenAM send a heartbeat request to the directory.

Use this option in case a firewall/loadbalancer can close idle connections, since the heartbeat requests will ensure that the connections won't become idle. Use along with the Heartbeat Time Unit parameter to define the correct interval. Zero or negative value will result in disabling heartbeat requests.

provisioningEncryptionKeyAlias.title: Encryption Key Alias
provisioningEncryptionKeyAlias.description: Alias of the encryption asymmetric key in AM's default keystore. Must be a duplicate of the asymmetric key used by IDM.

jwtSigningCompatibilityMode.title: Signing Compatibility Mode
jwtSigningCompatibilityMode.description:
Enable OpenAM to communicate with OpenIDM 6 and earlier.

When this option is enabled, OpenAM will sign JWTs in a way that is compatible with versions of OpenIDM 6 and earlier. The approach used is incompatible with non-extractable HSM keys. Disable this option if you have upgraded to OpenIDM 6.5, or later.

provisioningSigningKeyAlias.title: Signing Key Alias
provisioningSigningKeyAlias.description: Alias of the signing symmetric key in AM's default keystore. Must be a duplicate of the symmetric key used by IDM.

org.forgerock.services.resourcesets.stor.title: Connection String(s)
org.forgerock.services.resourcesets.stor.description: An ordered list of connection strings for LDAP directories. Each connection string is composed as follows: HOST:PORT[|SERVERID[|SITEID]], where server and site IDs are optional parameters that will prioritize that connection to use from the specified nodes. Multiple connection strings should be comma-separated, e.g. host1:389,host2:50389|server1|site1,host3:50389.

org.forgerock.services.umaaudit.store.di.title: Connection String(s)
org.forgerock.services.umaaudit.store.di.description: An ordered list of connection strings for LDAP directories. Each connection string is composed as follows: HOST:PORT[|SERVERID[|SITEID]], where server and site IDs are optional parameters that will prioritize that connection to use from the specified nodes. Multiple connection strings should be comma-separated, e.g. host1:389,host2:50389|server1|site1,host3:50389.

org.forgerock.services.uma.pendingreques.title: Connection String(s)
org.forgerock.services.uma.pendingreques.description: An ordered list of connection strings for LDAP directories. Each connection string is composed as follows: HOST:PORT[|SERVERID[|SITEID]], where server and site IDs are optional parameters that will prioritize that connection to use from the specified nodes. Multiple connection strings should be comma-separated, e.g. host1:389,host2:50389|server1|site1,host3:50389.

com.iplanet.security.encryptor.description: The default encryption class. (property name: com.iplanet.security.encryptor)

com.iplanet.am.clientIPCheckEnabled.title: Client IP Address Check
com.iplanet.am.clientIPCheckEnabled.description: Specifies whether or not the IP address of the client is checked in all single sign on token creations or validations. (property name: com.iplanet.am.clientIPCheckEnabled)

com.iplanet.am.cookie.name.title: Cookie Name
com.iplanet.am.cookie.name.description: The cookie name used by Authentication Service to set the valid session handler ID. This name is used to retrieve the valid session information. (property name: com.iplanet.am.cookie.name)

com.iplanet.am.cookie.secure.title: Secure Cookie
com.iplanet.am.cookie.secure.description: Specifies whether to set cookie in a secure mode in which the browser will only return the cookie when a secure protocol such as HTTP(s) is used. (property name: com.iplanet.am.cookie.secure)

com.iplanet.am.cookie.encode.title: Encode Cookie Value
com.iplanet.am.cookie.encode.description: Specifies whether to URL encode the cookie value. (property name: com.iplanet.am.cookie.encode)

com.sun.identity.saml.xmlsig.keystore.title: Keystore File
com.sun.identity.saml.xmlsig.keystore.description: Specifies the location of the keystore file. (property name: com.sun.identity.saml.xmlsig.keystore)

com.sun.identity.saml.xmlsig.storetype.title: Keystore Type
com.sun.identity.saml.xmlsig.storetype.description: Specifies the keystore type. (property name: com.sun.identity.saml.xmlsig.storetype)

com.sun.identity.saml.xmlsig.storepass.title: Keystore Password File
com.sun.identity.saml.xmlsig.storepass.description: Specifies the location of the file that contains the password used to access the keystore file. (property name: com.sun.identity.saml.xmlsig.storepass)

com.sun.identity.saml.xmlsig.keypass.title: Private Key Password File
com.sun.identity.saml.xmlsig.keypass.description: Specifies the location of the file that contains the password used to protect the private key of a generated key pair. (property name: com.sun.identity.saml.xmlsig.keypass)

com.sun.identity.crl.cache.directory.sea.title: Search Attributes
com.sun.identity.crl.cache.directory.sea.description: Any DN component of issuer's subjectDN can be used to retrieve CRL from local LDAP server. It is single value string, like, "cn". All Root CA need to use the same search attribute.

openam.deserialisation.classes.whitelist.title: Whitelist
openam.deserialisation.classes.whitelist.description: The list of classes that are considered valid when OpenAM performs Object deserialisation operations. The defaults should work for most installations. (property name: openam.deserialisation.classes.whitelist)

ldapUserBindDN.title: LDAP Server Authentication User
ldapUserBindDN.description:
DN of the user used by the module to authenticate to the LDAP server

The MSISDN module authenticates to the LDAP server in order to search for a matching number. The DN entered here represents the account used for said authentication and must have read/search access to the LDAP server.

trustedGatewayIPAddresses.title: Trusted Gateway IP Address
trustedGatewayIPAddresses.description:
The list of IP address that are trusted to send MSISDN authentication requests.

The client IP address of the authentication request is checked against this list, if the client IP is not listed then the authentication module will fail.

NB If the list is empty then all hosts will be trusted.

msisdnUserNamingAttribute.title: LDAP Attribute Used to Retrieve User Profile
msisdnUserNamingAttribute.description: The name of the attribute returned from the user profile matched against the supplied MSISDN number

baseSearchDN.title: LDAP Start Search DN
baseSearchDN.description:
The start point in the LDAP server for the MSISDN search

When entering multiple entries, each entry must be prefixed with a local server name. Multiple entries allow different search Base DNs depending on the OpenAM server in use. The format is:

local server name | base dn

The local server name is the full name of the server from the list of servers and sites.

ldapProviderUrl.title: LDAP Server and Port
ldapProviderUrl.description:
Use this list to set the LDAP server used to search for the MSISDN number.

The MSISDN authentication module will use this list as the server that is searched for a matching MSISDN number. A single entry must be in the format:

ldap_server:port

Multiple entries allow associations between OpenAM servers and a LDAP server. The format is:

local server name | server:port

The local server name is the full name of the server from the list of servers and sites.

ldapUserBindPassword.title: LDAP Server Authentication Password
ldapUserBindPassword.description: The password for the authentication user

userProfileMsisdnAttribute.title: Attribute To Use To Search LDAP
userProfileMsisdnAttribute.description: The name of the attribute searched in the user profiles for the MSISDN number

returnUserDN.title: Return User DN to DataStore
returnUserDN.description: Controls whether the DN or the username is returned as the authentication principal.

msisdnRequestSearchLocations.title: MSISDN Header Search Attribute
msisdnRequestSearchLocations.description: Controls the elements that are searched by the authentication module

authenticationLevel.title: Authentication Level
authenticationLevel.description:
The authentication level associated with this module.

Each authentication module has an authentication level that can be used to indicate the level of security associated with the module; 0 is the lowest (and the default).

msisdnParameterNames.title: MSISDN Number Search Parameter Name
msisdnParameterNames.description:
Name of the HTTP cookie, header or query parameter containing the MSISDN number

The MSISDN authentication module will check the incoming HTTP cookie, header or query parameter of the request for the MSISDN number. The order of checking is as follows:

  1. Cookie
  2. Header
  3. Query


NB The MSISDN Header Search Attribute controls what elements of the request is searched

authenticatorOATHDeviceSettingsEncryptio.title: Encryption Key Store
authenticatorOATHDeviceSettingsEncryptio.description: Path to the key store from which to load encryption keys.

authenticatorOATHDeviceSettingsEncryptio.title: Key Store Type
authenticatorOATHDeviceSettingsEncryptio.description:
Type of encryption key store.

Note: PKCS#11 keys tores require hardware support such as a security device or smart card and is not available by default in most JVM installations.

See the JDK 8 PKCS#11 Reference Guide for more details.

oathAttrName.title: Profile Storage Attribute
oathAttrName.description:
Attribute for storing ForgeRock Authenticator OATH profiles.

The default attribute is added to the user store during OpenAM installation. If you want to use a different attribute, you must make sure to add it to your user store schema prior to deploying two-step verification with a ForgeRock OATH authenticator app in OpenAM. OpenAM must be able to write to the attribute.

authenticatorOATHSkippableName.title: ForgeRock Authenticator (OATH) Device Skippable Attribute Name
authenticatorOATHSkippableName.description: The data store attribute that holds the user's decision to enable or disable obtaining and providing a password obtained from the ForgeRock Authenticator app. This attribute must be writeable.

authenticatorOATHDeviceSettingsEncryptio.title: Private Key Password
authenticatorOATHDeviceSettingsEncryptio.description: Password to unlock the private key.

authenticatorOATHDeviceSettingsEncryptio.title: Key Store Password
authenticatorOATHDeviceSettingsEncryptio.description: Password to unlock the key store. This password will be encrypted.

authenticatorOATHDeviceSettingsEncryptio.title: Key-Pair Alias
authenticatorOATHDeviceSettingsEncryptio.description: Alias of the certificate and private key in the key store. The private key is used to encrypt and decrypt device profiles.

authenticatorOATHDeviceSettingsEncryptio.title: Device Profile Encryption Scheme
authenticatorOATHDeviceSettingsEncryptio.description:
Encryption scheme for securing device profiles stored on the server.

If enabled, each device profile is encrypted using a unique random secret key using the given strength of AES encryption in CBC mode with PKCS#5 padding. An HMAC-SHA of the given strength (truncated to half-size) is used to ensure integrity protection and authenticated encryption. The unique random key is encrypted with the given RSA key pair and stored with the device profile.

Note: AES-256 may require installation of the JCE Unlimited Strength policy files.

forgerock-oath-observed-clock-drift-attr.title: Clock Drift Attribute Name
forgerock-oath-observed-clock-drift-attr.description:
The name of the attribute in the user profile to store the clock drift. If left empty then clock drift checking is disabled.

The name of the attribute used to store the last observed clock drift which is used to indicated when a manual resynchronisation is required.

oathAlgorithm.title: OATH Algorithm to Use
oathAlgorithm.description:
Choose the algorithm your device uses to generate the OTP.

HOTP uses a counter value that is incremented every time a new OTP is generated. TOTP generates a new OTP every few seconds as specified by the time step interval.

stepsInWindow.title: TOTP Time Steps
stepsInWindow.description:
The number of time steps to check before and after receiving a OTP.

This is the number of time step intervals to check the received OTP against both forward in time and back in time. For example, with 2 time steps and a time step interval of 30 seconds the server will allow a clock drift between client and server of 89 seconds. (2-30 second steps and 29 seconds for the interval that the OTP arrived in)

passwordLength.title: One Time Password Length
passwordLength.description: The length of the generated OTP in digits. Must be 6 digits or longer.

addChecksum.title: Add Checksum Digit
addChecksum.description:
This adds a checksum digit to the OTP.

This adds a digit to the end of the OTP generated to be used as a checksum to verify the OTP was generated correctly. This is in addition to the actual password length. You should only set this if your device supports it.

forgerock-oath-maximum-clock-drift.title: Maximum Allowed Clock Drift
forgerock-oath-maximum-clock-drift.description:
Number of time steps a client is allowed to get out of sync with the server before manual resynchronisation is required. This should be greater than the TOTP Time Steps value.

As this checks the time drift over multiple requests it needs to be greater than the value specified in TOTP Time Steps.

forgerock-oath-sharedsecret-implementati.title: The Shared Secret Provider Class
forgerock-oath-sharedsecret-implementati.description:
The fully qualified class name for the Shared Secret Provider extension.

The class that is used to process the user profile attribute used to store the user secret key.

lastLoginTimeAttribute.title: Last Login Time Attribute
lastLoginTimeAttribute.description:
Attribute to store the time of the users last login. This is required if TOTP is chosen as the OATH algorithm.

This attribute stores the last time a user logged in to prevent time based attacks. The value is stored as a number (Unix Time).

truncationOffset.title: Truncation Offset
truncationOffset.description:
This adds an offset to the generation of the OTP.

This is an option used by the HOTP algorithm that not all devices support. This should be left default unless you know your device uses a offset.

minimumSecretKeyLength.title: Minimum Secret Key Length
minimumSecretKeyLength.description: Number of hexadecimal characters allowed for the Secret Key.

hotpWindowSize.title: HOTP Window Size
hotpWindowSize.description:
The size of the window to resynchronize with the client.

This sets the window that the OTP device and the server counter can be out of sync. For example, if the window size is 100 and the servers last successful login was at counter value 2, then the server will accept a OTP from the OTP device that is from device counter 3 to 102.

oathOtpMaxRetry.title: One Time Password Max Retry
oathOtpMaxRetry.description: The number of times entry of the OTP may be attempted. Minimum is 1 maximum is 10 and default is 3.

timeStepSize.title: TOTP Time Step Interval
timeStepSize.description:
The TOTP time step in seconds that the OTP device uses to generate the OTP.

This is the time interval that one OTP is valid for. For example, if the time step is 30 seconds, then a new OTP will be generated every 30 seconds. This makes a single OTP valid for only 30 seconds.

secretKeyAttribute.title: Secret Key Attribute Name
secretKeyAttribute.description: The name of the attribute in the user profile to store the user secret key.

hotpCounterAttribute.title: Counter Attribute Name
hotpCounterAttribute.description: The name of the attribute in the user profile to store the user counter. This is required if HOTP is chosen as the OATH algorithm.

authenticationLevel.title: Authentication Level
authenticationLevel.description:
The authentication level associated with this module.

Each authentication module has an authentication level that can be used to indicate the level of security associated with the module; 0 is the lowest (and the default).
