deployment-offloaded-two-way-tls-header-.title: Client Certificate Header Key
deployment-offloaded-two-way-tls-header-.description:
TLS-offload host certificate header key

Token transformation which take X509 Certificates as the input token require that the X509 Certificate be presented via two-way TLS, so that the TLS handshake can validate client certificate ownership. A standard means of obtaining the client certificate presented via two-way TLS is via the javax.servlet.request.X509Certificate attribute in the ServletRequest. However, in TLS-offloaded deployments, the TLS-offloader must communicate the client certificate to its ultimate destination via an Http header. If this rest-sts instance is to support token transformations with X509 Certificate input, and OpenAM will be deployed in a TLS-offloaded context, then this value must be set to the header value which the TLS-offloading engine will use to set client certificates presented via the TLS handshake.

deployment-tls-offload-engine-hosts.title: Trusted Remote Hosts
deployment-tls-offload-engine-hosts.description:
IP addresses of TLS-Offload Hosts

Token transformation which take X509 Certificates as the input token require that the X509 Certificate be presented via two-way TLS, so that the TLS handshake can validate client certificate ownership. If OpenAM is deployed in a TLS-offloaded environment, in which the TLS-offloader must communicate the client certificate to the rest-sts via an Http header, this certificate will only be accepted if the ip address(es) of the TLS-offload engines are specified in this list. Specify 'any' if a client certificate can be presented in the specified header by any rest-sts client.

deployment-auth-target-mappings.title: Authentication Target Mappings
deployment-auth-target-mappings.description:
Configuration of consumption of OpenAM's rest-authN. For each validated token type (other than OpenAM), the REST authN elements which will validate token instances.
Entry format: TokenType;authIndexType;authIndexValue;context_key=context_value,context_key1=context_value1.
The context_key=context_value entries are optional.

Each deployed STS is configured with the authentication targets for each input token type for each supported token transformation. For example, if the transformation OPENIDCONNECT->SAML2 is supported, the STS instance must be configured with information specifying which elements of the OpenAM restful authentication context needs to be consumed to validate the OPENIDCONNECT token. The elements of the configuration tuple are separated by '|'.
The first element is the input token type in the token transform: i.e. X509, OPENIDCONNECT, USERNAME, or OPENAM. The second element is the authentication target - i.e. either 'module' or 'service', and the third element is the name of the authentication module or service. The fourth (optional) element provides the STS authentication context information about the to-be-consumed authentication context.
When transforming OpenID Connect Id tokens, the OpenID Connect authentication module must be consumed, and thus a deployed rest-sts instance must be configured with the name of the header/cookie element where the OpenID Connect Id token will be placed. For this example, the following string would define these configurations: OPENIDCONNECT|module|oidc|oidc_id_token_auth_target_header_key=oidc_id_token. In this case, 'oidc' is the name of the OpenID Connect authentication module created to authenticate OpenID Connect tokens.
When transforming a X509 Certificate, the Certificate module must be consumed, and the published rest-sts instance must be configured with the name of the Certificate module (or the service containing the module), and the header name configured for the Certificate module corresponding to where the Certificate module can expect to find the to-be-validated Certificate. The following string would define these configurations: X509|module|cert_module|x509_token_auth_target_header_key=client_cert. In this case 'cert_module' is the name of the Certificate module, and client_cert is the header name where Certificate module has been configured to find the client's Certificate.

saml2-key-transport-algorithm.title: Key Transport Algorithm
saml2-key-transport-algorithm.description:
This setting controls the encryption algorithm used to encrypt the symmetric encryption key when SAML2 token encryption is enabled. Valid values include: 
http://www.w3.org/2001/04/xmlenc#rsa-1_5
, 
http://www.w3.org/2001/04/xmlenc#rsa-oaep-mgf1p
, and 
http://www.w3.org/2009/xmlenc11#rsa-oaep

saml2-encrypt-attributes.title: Encrypt Attributes
saml2-encrypt-attributes.description: Check this box if the assertion Attributes should be encrypted. If this box is checked, the Encrypt Assertion box cannot be checked.

saml2-name-id-format.title: NameIdFormat
saml2-name-id-format.description:
The default value is urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.1:nameid-format:unspecified

See section 8.3 of Assertions and Protocols for the OASIS Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) V2.0 for details on possible values.

saml2-custom-attribute-statements-provid.title: Custom AttributeStatements Class Name
saml2-custom-attribute-statements-provid.description: If the AttributeStatements of the issued SAML2 assertion need to be customized, implement the org.forgerock.openam.sts.tokengeneration.saml2.statements.AttributeStatementsProvider interface, and specify the class name of the implementation here.

saml2-attribute-map.title: Attribute Mappings
saml2-attribute-map.description:
Contains the mapping of assertion attribute names (Map keys) to local OpenAM attributes (Map values) in configured data stores. Format: assertion_attr_name=ldap_attr_name

The DefaultAttributeMapper looks at profile attributes in configured data stores, or in Session properties. The keys will define the name of the attributes included in the Assertion Attribute statements, and the data pulled from the subject's directory entry or session state corresponding to the map value will define the value corresponding to this attribute name. The keys can have the format [NameFomatURI|]SAML ATTRIBUTE NAME. If the attribute value is enclosed in quotes, that quoted value will be included in the attribute without mapping. Binary attributes should be followed by ';binary'.
Examples:
  • EmailAddress=mail
  • Address=postaladdress
  • urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:attrname-format:uri|urn:mace:dir:attribute-def:cn=cn
  • partnerID="staticPartnerIDValue"
  • urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:attrname-format:uri|nameID="staticNameIDValue"
  • photo=photo;binary
  • urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:attrname-format:uri|photo=photo;binary

saml2-encrypt-assertion.title: Encrypt Assertion
saml2-encrypt-assertion.description: Check this box if the entire assertion should be encrypted. If this box is checked, the Encrypt NameID and Encrypt Attributes boxes cannot be checked.

saml2-encryption-key-alias.title: Encryption Key Alias
saml2-encryption-key-alias.description: This alias corresponds to the SP's x509 Certificate identified by the SP Entity ID for this rest-sts instance. Not necessary unless assertions are to be encrypted.

saml2-custom-authentication-statements-p.title: Custom AuthenticationStatements Class Name
saml2-custom-authentication-statements-p.description: If the AuthenticationStatements of the issued SAML2 assertion need to be customized, implement the org.forgerock.openam.sts.tokengeneration.saml2.statements.AuthenticationStatementsProvider interface, and specify the class name of the implementation here.

saml2-custom-conditions-provider-class-n.title: Custom Conditions Provider Class Name
saml2-custom-conditions-provider-class-n.description: If the Conditions of the issued SAML2 assertion need to be customized, implement the org.forgerock.openam.sts.tokengeneration.saml2.statements.ConditionsProvider interface, and specify the class name of the implementation here.

saml2-custom-attribute-mapper-class-name.title: Custom Attribute Mapper Class Name
saml2-custom-attribute-mapper-class-name.description: If the class implementing attribute mapping for attributes contained in the issued SAML2 assertion needs to be customized, implement the org.forgerock.openam.sts.tokengeneration.saml2.statements.AttributeMapper interface, and specify the class name of the implementation here.

saml2-custom-authn-context-mapper-class-.title: Custom Authentication Context Class Name
saml2-custom-authn-context-mapper-class-.description: If the AuthnContext mapping implemented by the org.forgerock.openam.sts.rest.token.provider.saml.DefaultSaml2JsonTokenAuthnContextMapper class needs to be customized, implement the org.forgerock.openam.sts.rest.token.provider.saml.Saml2JsonTokenAuthnContextMapper interface, and specify the name of the implementation here.

issuer-name.title: The SAML2 Issuer Id
issuer-name.description:
The name of the issuer

This name will appear in some issued tokens - e.g. in the saml:Issuer of issued SAML2 assertions.

saml2-token-lifetime-seconds.title: Token Lifetime (Seconds)
saml2-token-lifetime-seconds.description: Set to over-ride the default of 600 (10 minutes).

saml2-custom-subject-provider-class-name.title: Customs Subject Provider Class Name
saml2-custom-subject-provider-class-name.description: If the Subject of the issued SAML2 assertion needs to be customized, implement the org.forgerock.openam.sts.tokengeneration.saml2.statements.SubjectProvider interface, and specify the class name of the implementation here.

saml2-custom-authz-decision-statements-p.title: Custom Authorization Decision Statements Class Name
saml2-custom-authz-decision-statements-p.description: If the AuthorizationDecisionStatements of the issued SAML2 assertion need to be customized, implement the org.forgerock.openam.sts.tokengeneration.saml2.statements.AuthzDecisionStatementsProvider interface, and specify the class name of the implementation here.

saml2-encrypt-nameid.title: Encrypt NameID
saml2-encrypt-nameid.description: Check this box if the assertion NameID should be encrypted. If this box is checked, the Encrypt Assertion box cannot be checked.

saml2-sp-acs-url.title: Service Provider Assertion Consumer Service Url
saml2-sp-acs-url.description: When issuing bearer assertions, the recipient attribute of the SubjectConfirmation element must be set to the Service Provider Assertion Consumer Service Url. See section 4.1.4.2 of Profiles for the OASIS Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) V2.0 for details. Value required when issuing Bearer assertions.

saml2-sp-entity-id.title: Service Provider Entity Id
saml2-sp-entity-id.description: Values will be used to populate the Audiences of the AudienceRestriction element of the Conditions element. This value is required when issuing Bearer assertions. See section 4.1.4.2 of Profiles for the OASIS Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) V2.0 for details.

saml2-signature-key-alias.title: Signature Key Alias
saml2-signature-key-alias.description: Corresponds to the private key of the IdP. Will be used to sign assertions. Value can remain unspecified unless assertions are signed.

saml2-keystore-filename.title: KeystorePath
saml2-keystore-filename.description:
Path to keystore

Provide either the full filesystem path to a filesystem resident keystore, or a classpath-relative path to a keystore bundled in the OpenAM .war file. This keystore contains the IdP public/private keys and SP public key for signed and/or encrypted assertions. If assertions are neither signed nor encrypted, these values need not be specified.

saml2-encryption-algorithm.title: Encryption Algorithm
saml2-encryption-algorithm.description: Algorithm used to encrypt generated assertions.

oidc-public-key-reference-type.title: Public Key Reference Type
oidc-public-key-reference-type.description: For tokens signed with RSA, how should corresponding public key be referenced in the issued jwt

oidc-custom-authn-context-mapper-class.title: Custom Authn Context Mapper Class
oidc-custom-authn-context-mapper-class.description: If issued OIDC tokens are to contain acr claims, implement the org.forgerock.openam.sts.rest.token.provider.oidc.OpenIdConnectTokenAuthnContextMapper interface, and specify the class name of the implementation here.

oidc-custom-authn-method-references-mapp.title: Custom Authn Methods References Mapper Class
oidc-custom-authn-method-references-mapp.description: If issued OIDC tokens are to contain amr claims, implement the org.forgerock.openam.sts.rest.token.provider.oidc.OpenIdConnectTokenAuthMethodReferencesMapper interface, and specify the class name of the implementation here.

oidc-custom-claim-mapper-class.title: Custom Claim Mapper Class
oidc-custom-claim-mapper-class.description: If the class implementing attribute mapping for attributes contained in issued OpenID Connect tokens needs to be customized, implement the org.forgerock.openam.sts.tokengeneration.oidc.OpenIdConnectTokenClaimMapper interface, and specify the class name of the implementation here.

oidc-claim-map.title: Claim Map
oidc-claim-map.description:
Contains the mapping of OIDC token claim names (Map keys) to local OpenAM attributes (Map values) in configured data stores. Format: claim_name=attribute_name

The keys in the map will be claim entries in the issued OIDC token, and the value of these claims will be the principal attribute state resulting from LDAP datastore lookup of the map values. If no values are returned from the LDAP datastore lookup of the attribute corresponding to the map value, no claim will be set in the issued OIDC token.

oidc-issuer.title: The OpenID Connect Token Provider Issuer Id

oidc-client-secret.title: Client Secret
oidc-client-secret.description:
For HMAC-signed tokens, the client secret used as the HMAC key.

For HMAC-signed tokens, the KeyStore location, password, signature key alias and password configurations are not required.

oidc-signature-algorithm.title: Token Signature Algorithm
oidc-signature-algorithm.description: Algorithm used to sign issued OIDC tokens

oidc-audience.title: Issued Tokens Audience
oidc-audience.description: Contents will be set in the aud claim

oidc-keystore-location.title: KeyStore Location
oidc-keystore-location.description:
For RSA-signed tokens, the filesystem or classpath location of the KeyStore containing signing key entry

For RSA-signed tokens, the KeyStore location, password, signing-key alias, and signing key password must be specified. The client secret is not required for RSA-signed tokens.

custom-token-validators.title: Custom Token Validators
custom-token-validators.description:
If validator of a custom token type is desired, specify the name of the custom token here, followed by '|', followed by the class name of the org.forgerock.openam.sts.rest.token.validator.RestTokenTransformValidator implementation which will be invoked to validate the custom tokens.

Example: MY_CUSTOM_INPUT_TOKEN|org.mycompany.tokens.MyCustomTokenValidator
Note that MY_CUSTOM_INPUT_TOKEN would then be specified as the value corresponding to the token_type key in the input_token_state json object specified in rest-sts token transformation invocations.

custom-token-providers.title: Custom Token Providers
custom-token-providers.description:
If a rest-sts instance is to produce a custom token, specify the name of the custom token here, followed by '|', followed by the class name of the org.forgerock.openam.sts.rest.token.provider.RestTokenProvider implementation which will be invoked to produce an instance of the custom token.

Example: MY_CUSTOM_OUTPUT_TOKEN|org.mycompany.tokens.MyCustomTokenProvider
Note that MY_CUSTOM_OUTPUT_TOKEN would then be specified as the value corresponding to the token_type key in the output_token_state json object specified in rest-sts token transformation invocations.

supported-token-transforms.title: Supported Token Transformations
supported-token-transforms.description:
Entry format:input_token_type;output_token_type;{true|false}, where true|false indicates whether the interim OpenAM session is invalidated following token issuance.

Example: for the transform USERNAME:SAML2, it is likely that the OpenAM session generated as part of validating the USERNAME token should be invalidated, and thus the config entry would be USERNAME;SAML2;true. If this value is false, each USERNAME->SAML2 transformation will result in a 'left-over' OpenAM session. Note that currently, any transformation which starts with an OPENAM session, e.g. OPENAM;SAML2, will not invalidate this OPENAM session, as it was not created as part of the token transformation.

custom-token-transforms.title: Custom Token Transforms
custom-token-transforms.description:
If either custom token validators or providers are specified, they must also be specified in a custom rest-sts token transformation. These input or output tokens can be specified in a transformation with standard, or other custom, tokens.

The format of these token transformation definitions is the same as the standard token transformation definitions. The first field defines the input token type, the second the output token type, and the third field specifies whether the OpenAM session, produced as part of the validation of the input token type, is invalidated following the production of the output token.

Example 1: MY_CUSTOM_INPUT_TOKEN|SAML2|true
Example 1 specifies a MY_CUSTOM_INPUT_TOKEN as the input token (requires the specification of a custom token validator) SAML2 as the produced token, and that the interim OpenAM Session should be invalidated after the SAML2 token is produced.

Example 2: OPENIDCONNECT|MY_CUSTOM_OUTPUT_TOKEN|true
Example 2 specifies that an OPENIDCONNECT token should be authenticated to assert the identity of a token of type MY_CUSTOM_OUTPUT_TOKEN (requires the specification of a custom token provider) and that the interim OpenAM Session should be invalidated.

Example 3: MY_CUSTOM_INPUT_TOKEN|MY_CUSTOM_OUTPUT_TOKEN|false
Example 3 specifies that a MY_CUSTOM_INPUT_TOKEN should be transformed into a MY_CUSTOM_OUTPUT_TOKEN (requires the specification of both a custom provider and a custom validator), and that the interim OpenAM session should not be invalidated.

persist-issued-tokens-in-cts.title: Persist Issued Tokens in Core Token Store
persist-issued-tokens-in-cts.description:
Necessary to support token validation and cancellation

Validation of STS-issued tokens will involve determining whether the token has been issued, has not expired, and has not been cancelled. Token cancellation involves removing the record of this token from the CTS. Thus CTS persistence of STS-issued tokens is required to support these features.

1.0.title: REST Security Token Services
1.0.description: The REST STS endpoint is responsible for storing the configuration of instances of REST Security Token Services (STS). Available operations are create, read, update, delete, query, schema and template.

queries.description: Get the full list of instances of this collection. This query only supports `_queryFilter=true` filter.

operationTimeout.title: LDAP operations timeout
operationTimeout.description:
Defines the timeout in seconds OpenAM should wait for a response of the Directory Server - 0 means no timeout.

If the Directory Server's host is down completely or the TCP connection became stale OpenAM waits until operation timeouts from the OS or the JVM are applied. However this setting allows more granular control within OpenAM itself. A value of 0 means NO timeout is applied on OpenAM level and the timeouts from the JVM or OS will apply.

userSearchFilter.title: User Search Filter
userSearchFilter.description:
This search filter will be appended to the standard user search filter.

This attribute can be used to append a custom search filter to the standard filter. For example: (objectClass=person)would result in the following user search filter:

(&(uid=user)(objectClass=person))

authenticationLevel.title: Authentication Level
authenticationLevel.description:
The authentication level associated with this module.

Each authentication module has an authentication level that can be used to indicate the level of security associated with the module; 0 is the lowest (and the default).

connectionHeartbeatTimeUnit.title: LDAP Connection Heartbeat Time Unit
connectionHeartbeatTimeUnit.description:
Defines the time unit corresponding to the Heartbeat Interval setting.

Use this option in case a firewall/loadbalancer can close idle connections, since the heartbeat requests will ensure that the connections won't become idle.

secondaryLdapServer.title: Secondary Active Directory Server
secondaryLdapServer.description:
Use this list to set the secondary (failover) Active Directory server used for authentication.

If the primary Active Directory server fails, the Active Directory authentication module will failover to the secondary server. A single entry must be in the format:

server:port

Multiple entries allow associations between OpenAM servers and an Active Directory server. The format is:

local server name | server:port

NB The local server name is the full name of the server from the list of servers and sites.

profileAttributeMappings.title: User Creation Attributes
profileAttributeMappings.description:
Controls the mapping of local attribute to external attribute for dynamic profile creation.

If dynamic profile creation is enabled; this feature allows for a mapping between the attribute/values retrieved from the users authenticated profile and the attribute/values that will be provisioned into their matching account in the data store.

The format of this property is:

local attr1|external attr1

userSearchStartDN.title: DN to Start User Search
userSearchStartDN.description:
The search for accounts to be authenticated start from this base DN

For a single server just enter the Base DN to be searched. Multiple OpenAM servers can have different base DNs for the search The format is as follows:

local server name | search DN

NB The local server name is the full name of the server from the list of servers and sites.

openam-auth-ldap-connection-mode.title: LDAP Connection Mode
openam-auth-ldap-connection-mode.description:
Defines which protocol/operation is used to establish the connection to the LDAP Directory Server.

If 'LDAP' is selected, the connection won't be secured and passwords are transferred in cleartext over the network.
If 'LDAPS' is selected, the connection is secured via SSL or TLS.
If 'StartTLS' is selected, the connection is secured by using StartTLS extended operation.

userSearchAttributes.title: Attributes Used to Search for a User to be Authenticated
userSearchAttributes.description:
The attributes specified in this list form the LDAP search filter.

The default value of uid will form the following search filter of uid=user, if there are multiple values such as uid and cn, the module will create a search filter as follows (|(uid=user)(cn=user))

userProfileRetrievalAttribute.title: Attribute Used to Retrieve User Profile
userProfileRetrievalAttribute.description:
The LDAP module will use this attribute to search of the profile of an authenticated user.

This is the attribute used to find the profile of the authenticated user. Normally this will be the same attribute used to find the user account. The value will be the name of the user used for authentication.

userBindPassword.title: Bind User Password
userBindPassword.description: The password of the administration account.

primaryLdapServer.title: Primary Active Directory Server
primaryLdapServer.description:
Use this list to set the primary Active Directory server used for authentication.

The Active Directory authentication module will use this list as the primary server for authentication. A single entry must be in the format:

server:port

Multiple entries allow associations between OpenAM servers and an Active Directory server. The format is:

local server name | server:port

The local server name is the full name of the server from the list of servers and sites.

searchScope.title: Search Scope
searchScope.description:
The level in the Directory Server that will be searched for a matching user profile.

This attribute controls how the directory is searched.

  • OBJECT: Only the Base DN is searched.
  • ONELEVEL: Only the single level below (and not the Base DN) is searched
  • SUBTREE: The Base DN and all levels below are searched

returnUserDN.title: Return User DN to DataStore
returnUserDN.description: Controls whether the DN or the username is returned as the authentication principal.

trustAllServerCertificates.title: Trust All Server Certificates
trustAllServerCertificates.description:
Enables a X509TrustManager that trusts all certificates.

This feature will allow the LDAP authentication module to connect to LDAP servers protected by self signed or invalid certificates (such as invalid hostname).

NB Use this feature with care as it bypasses the normal certificate verification process

userBindDN.title: Bind User DN
userBindDN.description:
The DN of an admin user used by the module to authentication to the LDAP server

The LDAP module requires an administration account in order to perform functionality such as password reset.

NB cn=Directory Manager should not be used in production systems.

connectionHeartbeatInterval.title: LDAP Connection Heartbeat Interval
connectionHeartbeatInterval.description:
Specifies how often should OpenAM send a heartbeat request to the directory.

Use this option in case a firewall/loadbalancer can close idle connections, since the heartbeat requests will ensure that the connections won't become idle. Use along with the Heartbeat Time Unit parameter to define the correct interval. Zero or negative value will result in disabling heartbeat requests.

usersSearchScope.title: LDAP Users Search Scope
usersSearchScope.description: Search scope to find user entries.

checkIfResourceTypeExists.title: Check resources exist when Resource Server is updated
checkIfResourceTypeExists.description:
Check all registered resources exist when updating Resource Server.

Policy Set will check each registered Resource Types one by one against config datastore if enabled. Consider disabling this option if you have large number of Resource Types registered to a Policy Set.

bindPassword.title: LDAP Bind Password
bindPassword.description: Bind password to connect to the directory server for policy information.

searchTimeout.title: Search Timeout
searchTimeout.description: Time after which OpenAM returns an error for an incomplete search, in seconds.

policyHeartbeatInterval.title: Heartbeat Interval
policyHeartbeatInterval.description:
Specifies how often should OpenAM send a heartbeat request to the directory.

Use this option in case a firewall/loadbalancer can close idle connections, since the heartbeat requests will ensure that the connections won't become idle.

userAliasEnabled.title: User Alias
userAliasEnabled.description: If enabled, OpenAM can evaluate policy for remote users aliased to local users.

bindDn.title: LDAP Bind DN
bindDn.description: Bind DN to connect to the directory server for policy information.

policyHeartbeatTimeUnit.title: Heartbeat Unit
policyHeartbeatTimeUnit.description:
Defines the time unit corresponding to the Heartbeat Interval setting.

Use this option in case a firewall/loadbalancer can close idle connections, since the heartbeat requests will ensure that the connections won't become idle.

connectionPoolMinimumSize.title: LDAP Connection Pool Minimum Size
connectionPoolMinimumSize.description: Minimum number of connections in the pool.

ldapServer.title: Primary LDAP Server
ldapServer.description:
Configuration directory server host:port that OpenAM searches for policy information.

Format: local OpenAM server name | hostname:port

Multiple entries must be prefixed by local server name. Make sure to place the multiple entries on a single line and separate the hostname:port URLs with a space.

For example, openam.example.com|opendj.example.com:1389 opendj.example.com:2389

sslEnabled.title: LDAP SSL/TLS
sslEnabled.description: If enabled, OpenAM connects securely to the directory server. This requires that you install the directory server certificate.

usersBaseDn.title: LDAP Users Base DN
usersBaseDn.description: Base DN for LDAP Users subject searches.

subjectsResultTTL.title: Subjects Result Time to Live
subjectsResultTTL.description: Maximum time that OpenAM caches a subject result for evaluating policy requests, in minutes. A value of 0 prevents OpenAM from caching subject evaluations for policy decisions.

connectionPoolMaximumSize.title: LDAP Connection Pool Maximum Size
connectionPoolMaximumSize.description: Maximum number of connections in the pool.

usersSearchFilter.title: LDAP Users Search Filter
usersSearchFilter.description: Search filter to match user entries.

realmSearchFilter.title: LDAP Organization Search Filter
realmSearchFilter.description: Search filter to match organization entries.

resourceSchema.title: KBA Resource
resourceSchema.description: A list of Security questions and configuration.

.*.title: Locale and Question
.*.description: The language local and the question.

minimumAnswersToDefine.title: Minimum Answers to Define
minimumAnswersToDefine.description: Number of security questions the user must provide during registration.

minimumAnswersToVerify.title: Minimum Answers to Verify
minimumAnswersToVerify.description: Number of security answers the user must provide during the forgotten flows.

1.0.title: KBA
1.0.description: KBA resource is responsible for delivering up configured security questions.

read.description: Read the configured security questions.

errors.description: If an error occurs while reading the questions from the data store.

providerGuiceKey.title: Provider Guice Key Name
providerGuiceKey.description: The name of a Guice key that can be used to obtain an initialised provider from which the HSM keystore can be obtained.

leaseExpiryDuration.title: Key lease expiry
leaseExpiryDuration.description: The amount of minutes a key can be cached from the keystore before it needs to be reloaded.

file.title: Configuration File
file.description: The file containing initialisation configuration for the HSM.

storePassword.title: HSM PIN/password secret ID
storePassword.description: The secret ID using which the HSM's PIN/password can be obtained. This secret ID will be resolved using one of the other secret stores configured.

facility.title: Facility
facility.description: Syslog facility value to apply to all events.

connectTimeout.title: Connection timeout
connectTimeout.description: Timeout for connecting to syslog server, in seconds.

host.title: Server hostname
host.description: Host name or IP address of receiving syslog server.

port.title: Server port
port.description: Port number of receiving syslog server.

enabled.title: Enabled
enabled.description: Enables or disables an audit event handler.

topics.title: Topics
topics.description: List of topics handled by an audit event handler.

bufferingEnabled.title: Buffering Enabled
bufferingEnabled.description: Enables or disables audit event buffering.

bufferingMaxSize.title: Buffer Size
bufferingMaxSize.description: Maximum number of events that can be buffered (default/minimum: 5000)

handlerFactory.title: Factory Class Name
handlerFactory.description: The fully qualified class name of the factory responsible for creating the Audit Event Handler. The class must implement org.forgerock.openam.audit.AuditEventHandlerFactory.

leaseExpiryDuration.description: The amount of minutes a key can be cached from the keystore before it needs to be reloaded.

file.title: Configuration File
file.description: The file containing initialisation configuration for the HSM.

providerGuiceKey.title: Provider Guice Key Name
providerGuiceKey.description: The name of a Guice key that can be used to obtain an initialised provider from which the HSM keystore can be obtained.

storePassword.title: HSM PIN/password secret ID
storePassword.description: The secret ID using which the HSM's PIN/password can be obtained. This secret ID will be resolved using one of the other secret stores configured.

queries.description: Get the full list of instances of this collection. This query only supports `_queryFilter=true` filter.

lockoutEmailAddress.title: Email Address to Send Lockout Notification
lockoutEmailAddress.description:
An email address or set of email addresses that receive notifications about account lockout events.

OpenAM can be configured to send a localisable email message to a set of email addresses when account lockout events occur. The contents of the email message is configured using the following properties in the amAuth.properties file.
  • lockOutEmailFrom : The "From" address of the email message
  • lockOutEmailSub : The subject of the email message
  • lockOutEmailMsg : The contents of the email message

The identity for whom the account has been locked is included in the email message.

The format of this property is:
emailaddress|locale|charset. Multiple email addresses are space-separated.
Email addresses must include the domain name, such as admin@example.com.

invalidAttemptsDataAttributeName.title: Invalid Attempts Data Attribute Name
invalidAttemptsDataAttributeName.description:
The name of the attribute used to store information about failed authentications.

OpenAM can be configured to store information about invalid authentications in the users profile. This allows multiple instances of OpenAM in the same site to share information about a users invalid authentication attempts. By default the custom attribute; sunAMAuthInvalidAttemptsData defined in the sunAMAuthAccountLockout objectclass is used to store this data. Use this property to change the attribute used by OpenAM to store this information.

NB Any attribute specified must be a valid attribute in the data store.

loginFailureDuration.title: Login Failure Lockout Interval
loginFailureDuration.description:
The lockout interval time is in minutes.

OpenAM tracks the failed authentication count for a user over the lockout interval.

For example: If the lockout interval is 5 minutes and the lockout count is 5; the user will have to have failed to authenticate 5 times over the previous 5 minutes for the account to be locked. Failed authentications the occurred outside of the 5 minute interval are ignored.

loginFailureLockoutMode.title: Login Failure Lockout Mode
loginFailureLockoutMode.description:
Enables account lockout functionality for users authenticating to this realm.

OpenAM can track the number of failed authentications by a user over time and if a pre-defined limit is breached, OpenAM can lockout the users account and perform additional functions.

NB This functionality is in addition to any account lockout behaviour implemented by the LDAP Directory Server.

lockoutWarnUserCount.title: Warn User After N Failures
lockoutWarnUserCount.description:
Warn the user when they reach this level of failed authentications.

The user will be given a warning when they reach this level of failed authentications during the lockout interval.
The text of the lockout warning is configured using the lockOutWarning property in the amAuth.properties file.

lockoutAttributeValue.title: Lockout Attribute Value
lockoutAttributeValue.description:
Value to set in custom lockout attribute

This is the value that will be set on the custom attribute in the users profile when they account is locked.

lockoutDuration.title: Login Failure Lockout Duration
lockoutDuration.description:
The duration of the users account lockout, in minutes.

OpenAM can either lockout the users account indefinitely (until administration action) by setting the duration to 0, (the default) or OpenAM can lock the users account for a given number of minutes. After the lockout interval, the user will be able to successfully authenticate to OpenAM.

loginFailureCount.title: Login Failure Lockout Count
loginFailureCount.description:
The maximum number of failed authentications for a user before their account is locked.

This setting controls the maximum number of failed authentications a user can have during the lockout interval before OpenAM locks the users account.

lockoutAttributeName.title: Lockout Attribute Name
lockoutAttributeName.description:
Name of custom lockout attribute

When OpenAM locks an account, the inetuserstatus attribute in the locked account is set to Inactive. In addition, OpenAM can set the value of another attribute in the users profile.

lockoutDurationMultiplier.title: Lockout Duration Multiplier
lockoutDurationMultiplier.description:
Value multiplied to the Login Failure Lockout Duration for each successive lockout.

This property is used to enable OpenAM to increase the account lockout duration for each successive account lockout. For example: If the lockout duration is set to 10 and the duration multiplier is set to 2; the duration of the first lockout will be 10 minutes and the duration of the second lockout will be 20 minutes.

The default value of 1 disables this function.

storeInvalidAttemptsInDataStore.title: Store Invalid Attempts in Data Store
storeInvalidAttemptsInDataStore.description:
Enables sharing of login failure attempts across AM Instances

When this setting is enabled OpenAM will store the users invalid authentication information in the data store under the attribute configured in the Invalid Attempts Data Attribute Name property.

dynamicProfileCreation.title: User Profile
dynamicProfileCreation.description:
Controls the result of the user profile success post successful authentication.

Controls whether a user profile is required for authentication to be successful or if the profile will be dynamically created if none already exists. Choose ignore if you do not have a data store configured in the realm.

defaultRole.title: User Profile Dynamic Creation Default Roles
defaultRole.description:
List of roles of which dynamically created users will be a member.

Enter the DN for each role that will be assigned to a new user when their profile has been dynamically created by OpenAM.

NB Deprecated functionality in OpenAM.

aliasAttributeName.title: Alias Search Attribute Name
aliasAttributeName.description:
The secondary LDAP attribute retrieves the user profile if the primary LDAP attribute specified in 'User Naming Attribute' fails.

This list of LDAP attributes is used to extend the set of attributes searched by OpenAM to find the users profile.
For example:
  • cn
  • mail
  • givenname

A user authenticates to OpenAM under the id of steve, OpenAM will first search using the naming attribute (uid by default) so uid=steve, if no match is found then cn=steve will be searched until a match is found or the list is exhausted.


NB Only used when User Profile searching is enabled.

moduleBasedAuthEnabled.title: Module Based Authentication
moduleBasedAuthEnabled.description:
Allows a user to authenticate via module based authentication.

The feature allow users to override the realm configuration and use a named authentication module to authenticate.

NB Recommended to turn this feature off in production environments.

zeroPageLoginEnabled.title: Zero Page Login
zeroPageLoginEnabled.description:
Allows a user to authenticate using GET request parameters without showing the login screen.

Enable this feature if the authentication mechanism uses a single authentication screen or the first authentication screen should always be invisible to users (since it is auto-submitted). Use caution when enabling this feature as it can be used to authenticate using regular GET parameters, which could be cached by browsers and logged in server and proxy access logs exposing the values of the GET parameters.

sharedSecret.title: Organization Authentication Signing Secret
sharedSecret.description:
HMAC shared secret for signing RESTful Authentication requests.

This is the shared secret for signing state used in RESTful authentication requests. Should be at Base-64 encoded and at least 128-bits in length. By default a cryptographically secure random value is generated.

zeroPageLoginAllowedWithoutReferrer.title: Zero Page Login Allowed without Referer?
zeroPageLoginAllowedWithoutReferrer.description:
Whether to allow Zero Page Login if the HTTP Referer header is missing.

The HTTP Referer header is sometimes missing from requests (e.g., if making a request to HTTP from HTTPS). This setting controls whether such requests should be allowed or not. Setting to 'true' will reduce the risk of Login CSRF attacks with Zero Page Login, but may potentially deny legitimate requests.

zeroPageLoginReferrerWhiteList.title: Zero Page Login Referer Whitelist
zeroPageLoginReferrerWhiteList.description:
List of allowed HTTP Referer (sic) URLs from which Zero Page Login requests are allowed.

Enter here all URLs from which you want to allow Zero Page Login. This provides some mitigation against Login CSRF attacks. Leave empty to allow from any Referer. Applies to both GET and POST login requests.

keyAlias.title: Persistent Cookie Encryption Certificate Alias
keyAlias.description:
Keystore Alias for encrypting Persistent Cookies.

This is the alias for the private/public keys in the Keystore used in Persistent Cookie authentication requests.

loginFailureUrl.title: Default Failure Login URL
loginFailureUrl.description:
Failed logins will be forwarded to this URL

This is the URL to which clients will be forwarded upon failed authentication. Enter a URL or URI relative to the local OpenAM. URL or URI can be prefixed with ClientType|URL if client specific. URL without http(s) protocol will be appended to the current URI of OpenAM.

usernameGeneratorClass.title: Pluggable User Name Generator Class
usernameGeneratorClass.description:
The name of the default implementation of the user name generator class.

The name of the class used to return a list of usernames to the Membership auth module.

NB This class must implement the interface com.sun.identity.authentication.spi.UserIDGenerator

loginSuccessUrl.title: Default Success Login URL
loginSuccessUrl.description:
Successful logins will be forwarded to this URL

This is the URL to which clients will be forwarded upon successful authentication. Enter a URL or URI relative to the local OpenAM. URL or URI can be prefixed with the ClientType|URL if client specific. URL without http(s) protocol will be appended to the current URI of OpenAM.

loginPostProcessClass.title: Authentication Post Processing Classes
loginPostProcessClass.description:
A list of post authentication processing classes for all users in this realm.

This is a list of Post Processing Classes that will be called by OpenAM for all users that authenticate to this realm. Refer to the documentation for the places where the list of post authentication classes can be set and their precedence.

For example: org.forgerock.auth.PostProcessClass
NB OpenAM must be able to find these classes on the CLASSPATH and must implement the interface com.sun.identity.authentication.spi.AMPostAuthProcessInterface.

usernameGeneratorEnabled.title: Generate UserID Mode
usernameGeneratorEnabled.description:
Enables this mode in the Membership auth module.

When this mode is enabled, if the Membership auth module detects that the supplied username already exists in the data store then a list of valid usernames can be shown to the user, if requested by said user.

userAttributeSessionMapping.title: User Attribute Mapping to Session Attribute
userAttributeSessionMapping.description:
Mapping of user profile attribute name to session attribute name.

The setting causes OpenAM to read the named attributes from the users profile in the data store and store their values in the users session.

Format: User Profile Attribute|Session Attribute name.

twoFactorRequired.title: Two Factor Authentication Mandatory
twoFactorRequired.description: Enforces ALL 2FA (OATH and Push) authentication Modules (not nodes) only for this authentication realm.

defaultAuthLevel.title: Default Authentication Level
defaultAuthLevel.description:
The default authentication level for modules in this realm.

If the authentication module does not set it's own auth level then the module will have the default authentication level for the realm.

statelessSessionsEnabled.title: Use Client-based Sessions
statelessSessionsEnabled.description:
Enables client-based sessions.

Client-based sessions provide elastic scalability by storing all session state as a JWT in a cookie stored on the client. It is highly recommended to enable signing and encryption of the JWT in the global session service.

userStatusCallbackPlugins.title: Pluggable User Status Event Classes
userStatusCallbackPlugins.description:
List of classes to be called when status of the user account changes.

When the status of a users account changes, OpenAM can be configured to call into a custom class. The custom class can then be used to perform some action as required. The built in status change events are:

  • Account locked
  • Password changed

Custom code can also extend this mechanism.

authenticationSessionsWhitelist.title: Enable whitelisting
authenticationSessionsWhitelist.description:
Enables explicit whitelisting of valid authentication states to prevent replay attacks.

If enabled, each time a response is sent to the user a randomly generated state parameter is also sent back to user. This state parameter is stored accessible to AM and must be sent in with the subsequent request. After a request has been received with a valid state parameter, the next response contains a new state, and the server's view of the valid state parameter is updated.

authenticationSessionsStateManagement.title: Authentication session state management scheme
authenticationSessionsStateManagement.description:
Specify how the authentication session state is managed.

CTS option will write the state down to the underlying core token store.
JWT option will transmit the state in a JWT to the client.
In-Memory option will maintain the state in the memory (requires sticky loadbalancing).

To configure JWT signing, encryption, and blacklisting use the options in the Client-based Sessions section of the Sessions global service.

authenticationSessionsMaxDuration.title: Max duration (minutes)
authenticationSessionsMaxDuration.description:
Specify how long an authentication session can last.

From the time an authentication session is generated, the session will be invalid after this number of minutes. Values from 1 upwards are allowed.

orgConfig.title: Organization Authentication Configuration
orgConfig.description:
Default Authentication Service for users

This is the authentication service that will be used to authenticate users to this realm.

adminAuthModule.title: Administrator Authentication Configuration
adminAuthModule.description:
Default Authentication Service for administrators

This is the authentication service that will be used to authentication administrative users to this realm.

parameters.description: Server identifier - either the server URL, or server number

resourceSchema.title: Decision combiner schema
resourceSchema.description: Decision combiner schema

1.0.title: Decision Combiners
1.0.description: Service for querying and reading decision combiners information. Decision combiners describe how to resolve policy decisions when multiple policies apply

queries.description: Lists all decision combiners

read.description: Reads an individual decision combiner specified by its name

errors.description: Not found error. Requested combiner short name not found

pathParameter.name: resourceId
pathParameter.description: Decision combiner name unique identifier

enabled.title: Enabled
enabled.description: Enables or disables an audit event handler.

topics.title: Topics
topics.description: List of topics handled by an audit event handler.

batchEnabled.title: Batch enabled
batchEnabled.description: Boolean for batch delivery of audit events.

maxBatchedEvents.title: Max Batched
maxBatchedEvents.description: Maximum number of events per batch.

shutdownTimeoutSec.title: Shutdown Timeout
shutdownTimeoutSec.description: Application waiting period (seconds) for worker thread termination.

insertTimeoutSec.title: Insert Timeout
insertTimeoutSec.description: Waiting period (seconds) for available capacity, when a new event enters the queue.

batchThreadCount.title: Thread Count
batchThreadCount.description: Number of concurrent threads that pull events from the batch queue.

pollTimeoutSec.title: Polling Timeout
pollTimeoutSec.description: Worker thread waiting period (seconds) for the next event, before going idle.

batchCapacity.title: Capacity
batchCapacity.description: Maximum event count in the batch queue; additional events are dropped.

jndiTopicName.title: JMS Topic Name
jndiTopicName.description: JNDI lookup name for the JMS topic

jndiConnectionFactoryName.title: JMS Connection Factory Name
jndiConnectionFactoryName.description:
Specifies the JNDI lookup name for the connection factory exposed by your JMS message broker. OpenAM performs a JNDI lookup on this name to locate your broker's connection factory.

See the documentation for your JMS message broker for the required value.

The default is the connection factory name for Apache ActiveMQ.

jndiContextProperties.title: JNDI Context Properties
jndiContextProperties.description:
Specifies JNDI properties that OpenAM uses to connect to the JMS message broker to which OpenAM will publish audit events.

OpenAM acts as a JMS client, using a JMS connection factory to connect to your JMS message broker. In order for OpenAM to connect to the broker, the JNDI context properties must conform to those needed by the broker. See the documentation for your JMS message broker for required values.

The default properties are example properties for connecting to Apache ActiveMQ.

deliveryMode.title: Delivery Mode
deliveryMode.description:
Specifies whether JMS messages used to transmit audit events use persistent or non-persistent delivery.

With persistent delivery, the JMS provider ensures that messages are not lost in transit in case of a provider failure by logging messages to storage when they are sent.

Specify the delivery mode as persistent if it is unacceptable for delivery of audit events to be lost in JMS transit. If the possible loss of audit events is acceptable, choose non-persistent delivery, which provides better performance.

sessionMode.title: Session Mode
sessionMode.description:
Specifies the JMS session acknowledgement mode: AUTO, CLIENT, or DUPS_OK.

  • Auto mode guarantees once-only delivery of JMS messages used to transmit audit events.
  • Duplicates OK mode ensures that messages are delivered at least once.
  • Client mode does not ensure delivery.

Use the default setting unless your JMS broker implementation requires otherwise. See your broker documentation for more information.

handlerFactory.title: Factory Class Name
handlerFactory.description: The fully qualified class name of the factory responsible for creating the Audit Event Handler. The class must implement org.forgerock.openam.audit.AuditEventHandlerFactory.

authenticationLevel.title: Authentication Level
authenticationLevel.description:
The authentication level associated with this module.

Each authentication module has an authentication level that can be used to indicate the level of security associated with the module; 0 is the lowest (and the default).

defaultUserRoles.title: Default User Roles
defaultUserRoles.description:
The role DN's that will be assigned to the user.

NB Roles are only supported in Sun Directory Server Enterprise Edition

minimumPasswordLength.title: Minimum Password Length
minimumPasswordLength.description:
The minimum length of the user password.

Setting this value to 0 disables this functionality.

NB This feature is separate from any password policy in the underlying data store

defaultUserStatus.title: User Status After Registration
defaultUserStatus.description: Determines if the user account should be automatically active after registration completes.

smtpSslEnabled.title: Mail Server Secure Connection
smtpSslEnabled.description: This setting controls whether the authentication module communicates with the mail server using SSL/TLS

autoSendOTP.title: Auto Send OTP Code
autoSendOTP.description: Select this checkbox if the OTP should be sent automatically

smtpFromAddress.title: Email From Address
smtpFromAddress.description: Emails from the HOTP Authentication module will come from this address.

smsGatewayClass.title: SMS Gateway Implementation Class
smsGatewayClass.description:
The HOTP authentication module uses this class to send SMS messages.

The SMS gateway class must implement the following interface

com.sun.identity.authentication.modules.hotp.SMSGateway

authenticationLevel.title: Authentication Level
authenticationLevel.description:
The authentication level associated with this module.

Each authentication module has an authentication level that can be used to indicate the level of security associated with the module; 0 is the lowest (and the default).

otpLength.title: One Time Password Length
otpLength.description: The length of the generated One Time Password (in digits)

smtpHostPort.title: Mail Server Host Port
smtpHostPort.description:
The port of the mail server.

The default port for SMTP is 25, if using SSL the default port is 465.

otpValidityDuration.title: One Time Password Validity Length
otpValidityDuration.description: This One Time Password will remain valid for this period (in minutes)

userProfileEmailAttribute.title: Email Attribute Name
userProfileEmailAttribute.description: This is the attribute name used by the OTP to email the user

smtpUsername.title: Mail Server Authentication Username
smtpUsername.description: The username to use if the mail server is using SMTP authentication

otpMaxRetry.title: One Time Password Max Retry
otpMaxRetry.description: The number of times entry of the OTP may be attempted. Minimum is 1 maximum is 10 and default is 3.

smtpHostname.title: Mail Server Host Name
smtpHostname.description: The name of the mail server; OpenAM will use SMTP to send the messages.

smtpUserPassword.title: Mail Server Authentication Password
smtpUserPassword.description: The password to use if the mail server is using SMTP authentication

otpDeliveryMethod.title: One Time Password Delivery
otpDeliveryMethod.description: The mechanism used to deliver the One Time Password

userProfileTelephoneAttribute.title: Mobile Phone Number Attribute Name
userProfileTelephoneAttribute.description: This is the attribute name used for a requested text message

mobileCarrierAttribute.title: Mobile Carrier Attribute Name
mobileCarrierAttribute.description: This is the attribute name used for a mobile carrier domain for sending SMS messages

cfgAttributeMappingClasses.title: Attribute Mapper
cfgAttributeMappingClasses.description: Name of the class that implements the attribute mapping This class maps the OAuth properties into OpenAM properties. A custom attribute mapper can be provided. A custom attribute mapper must implement the org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.AttributeMapper interface. Provided implementations are: org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.JsonAttributeMapper org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.oidc.JwtAttributeMapper (can only be used when using the openid scope)

cfgAccountMapperClass.title: Account Mapper
cfgAccountMapperClass.description: Name of the class implementing the attribute mapping for the account search. This class is used by the module to map from the account information received from the OAuth Identity Provider into OpenAM. The class must implement the org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.AttributeMapper interface. Provided implementations are: org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.JsonAttributeMapper org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.oidc.JwtAttributeMapper(can only be used when using the openid scope) String constructor parameters can be provided by appending | separated values.

scopeString.title: OAuth Scope
scopeString.description:
List of user profile properties

According to the OAuth 2.0 Authorization Framework, scope is a space-separated list of user profile attributes that the client application requires. The list depends on the permissions that the resource owner grants to the client application. Some authorization servers use non-standard separators for scopes.

basicAuth.title: Use Basic Auth
basicAuth.description: When enabled, the client will use basic auth for authenticating with the social auth provider. Enabled by default.

cfgAttributeMappingConfiguration.title: Attribute Mapper Configuration
cfgAttributeMappingConfiguration.description: Mapping of OAuth attributes to local OpenAM attributes Attribute configuration that will be used to map the user info obtained from the OAuth 2.0 Provider to the local user data store in the OpenAM. Example: OAuth2.0_attribute=local_attribute

tokenEndpoint.title: Access Token Endpoint URL
tokenEndpoint.description: OAuth access token endpoint URL This is the URL endpoint for access token retrieval provided by the OAuth Identity Provider.Refer to the RFC 6749 (http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749#section-3.2), section 3.2

cfgAccountMapperConfiguration.title: Account Mapper Configuration
cfgAccountMapperConfiguration.description: Mapping of OAuth account to local OpenAM account Attribute configuration that will be used to map the account of the user authenticated in the OAuth 2.0 Provider to the local data store in the OpenAM. Example: OAuth2.0_attribute=local_attribute

cfgMixUpMitigation.title: OAuth 2.0 Mix-Up Mitigation Enabled
cfgMixUpMitigation.description: Enables OAuth 2.0 mix-up mitigation The authorization server must support the OAuth 2.0 Mix-Up Mitigation draft (https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-oauth-mix-up-mitigation-01#section-3.1), otherwise OpenAM will fail to validate responses from the authorization server. If only the OAuth 2.0 protocol is utilized, make sure that the accepted issuer value is set in the "Token Issuer" setting.

userInfoEndpoint.title: User Profile Service URL
userInfoEndpoint.description:
User profile information URL

This URL endpoint provides user profile information and is provided by the OAuth Identity Provider NB This URL should return JSON objects in response

issuer.title: Token Issuer
issuer.description: Required when the 'openid' scope is included. Value must match the iss field in issued ID Token e.g. accounts.google.com The issuer value MUST be provided when OAuth 2.0 Mix-Up Mitigation is enabled.

clientId.title: Client ID
clientId.description:
OAuth client_id parameter

For more information on the OAuth client_id parameter refer to the RFC 6749 (http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749#section-2.3.1), section 2.3.1

authorizeEndpoint.title: Authentication Endpoint URL
authorizeEndpoint.description:
OAuth authentication endpoint URL

This is the URL endpoint for OAuth authentication provided by the OAuth Identity Provider

cfgAccountProviderClass.title: Account Provider
cfgAccountProviderClass.description: Name of the class implementing the account provider. This class is used by the module to find the account from the attributes mapped by the Account Mapper org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.AccountProvider interface. sun-idrepo-ldapv3-config-dftgroupmember.title: Default Group Member's User DN
sun-idrepo-ldapv3-config-dftgroupmember.description: User automatically added when group is created.

sun-idrepo-ldapv3-config-authid.title: LDAP Bind DN
sun-idrepo-ldapv3-config-authid.description: A user or admin with sufficient access rights to perform the supported operations.

sun-idrepo-ldapv3-config-ldap-server.title: LDAP Server
sun-idrepo-ldapv3-config-ldap-server.description: Format: LDAP server host name:port | server_ID | site_ID

openam-idrepo-ldapv3-heartbeat-timeunit.title: LDAP Connection Heartbeat Time Unit
openam-idrepo-ldapv3-heartbeat-timeunit.description:
Defines the time unit corresponding to the Heartbeat Interval setting.

This setting controls how often OpenAM should send a heartbeat search request to the configured directory. If a connection becomes unresponsive (e.g. due to a network error) then it may take up to the interval period before the problem is detected. Use along with the Heartbeat Interval parameter to define the exact interval.

sun-idrepo-ldapv3-config-connection-mode.title: LDAP Connection Mode
sun-idrepo-ldapv3-config-connection-mode.description:
Defines which protocol/operation is used to establish the connection to the LDAP Directory Server.

If 'LDAP' is selected, the connection won't be secured and passwords are transferred in cleartext over the network.
If 'LDAPS' is selected, the connection is secured via SSL or TLS.
If 'StartTLS' is selected, the connection is secured by using StartTLS extended operation.

openam-idrepo-ldapv3-behera-support-enab.title: Behera Support Enabled
openam-idrepo-ldapv3-behera-support-enab.description: When enabled, Behera draft control will be used in the outgoing requests for operations that may modify password value. This will allow OpenAM to display password policy related error messages when password policies are not met.

openam-idrepo-ldapv3-heartbeat-interval.title: LDAP Connection Heartbeat Interval
openam-idrepo-ldapv3-heartbeat-interval.description:
Specifies how often should OpenAM send a heartbeat request to the directory.

This setting controls how often OpenAM should send a heartbeat search request to the configured directory. If a connection becomes unresponsive (e.g. due to a network error) then it may take up to the interval period before the problem is detected. Use along with the Heartbeat Time Unit parameter to define the exact interval. Zero or negative value will result in disabling heartbeat requests.

sunIdRepoSupportedOperations.title: LDAPv3 Plug-in Supported Types and Operations

sun-idrepo-ldapv3-config-auth-kba-attemp.title: Knowledge Based Authentication Attempts Attribute Name

sun-idrepo-ldapv3-dncache-size.title: DN Cache Size
sun-idrepo-ldapv3-dncache-size.description: In DN items, only used when DN Cache is enabled.

sun-idrepo-ldapv3-dncache-enabled.title: DN Cache
sun-idrepo-ldapv3-dncache-enabled.description:
Used to enable/disable the DN Cache within the OpenAM repository implementation.

The DN Cache is used to cache DN lookups which tend to happen in bursts during authentication. The DN Cache can become out of date when a user is moved or renamed in the underlying LDAP store and this is not reflected in a persistent search result. Enable when the underlying LDAP store supports persistent search and move/rename (mod_dn) results are available.

adRecursiveGroupMembership.title: AD Recursive Group Membership Evaluation
adRecursiveGroupMembership.description:
Used to enable/disable Active Directory Recursive Group Membership evaluation.

Enables an Active Directory specific extensible filter called LDAP_MATCHING_RULE_IN_CHAIN that according to MSDN "walks the chain of ancestry in objects all the way to the root until it finds a match", meaning that it will resolve all group memberships, including nested groups. This will add a performance overhead on the Active Directory server, indexes may need to be created.

issuer.title: Software publisher issuer

jwksUri.title: Json Web Key URI
jwksUri.description: The URI that contains the Software Publisher's public keys in Json Web Key format.

jwksCacheTimeout.title: JWKs URI content cache timeout in ms
jwksCacheTimeout.description: To avoid loading the JWKS URI content for every operation, the JWKS content is cached. This timeout defines the maximum amount of time the JWKS URI content can be cached before being refreshed.

jwkStoreCacheMissCacheTime.title: JWKs URI content cache miss cache time
jwkStoreCacheMissCacheTime.description: To avoid loading the JWKS URI content for every operation, especially when the kid is not in the jwks content already cached, the JWKS content will be cached for a minimum period of time. This cache miss cache time defines the minimum amount of time the JWKS URI content is cached.

softwareStatementSigningAlgorithm.title: Software statement signing Algorithm
softwareStatementSigningAlgorithm.description: Signing algorithm to be used when verifying software statement signatures.

publicKeyLocation.title: Public key selector
publicKeyLocation.description: Select how the Software Publisher's public keys should be retrieved by the provider when validating software statement signatures.

jwkSet.title: Json Web Key
jwkSet.description: Raw JSON Web Key value containing the Software Publisher's public keys.

1.0.title: OAuth2 Software Publisher Agent Groups
1.0.description: Agent Groups handler that is responsible for managing agent groups

allowCreate.title: Allow IdP to Create NameID
allowCreate.description: Use this parameter to indicate whether the identity provider can create a new identifier for the principal if none exists (true) or not (false).

entityName.title: IdP Entity ID
entityName.description: The entity name of the SAML2 IdP Service to use for this module (must be configured).

metaAlias.title: SP MetaAlias
metaAlias.description:
MetaAlias for Service Provider. The format of this parameter is 
/realm_name/SP

authComparison.title: Comparison Type
authComparison.description:
(Optional) Use this parameter to specify a comparison method to evaluate the requested context classes or statements. OpenAM accepts the following values: 
better
, 
exact
, 
maximum
, and 
minimum
.

isPassive.title: Passive Authentication
isPassive.description: Use this parameter to indicate whether the identity provider should authenticate passively (true) or not (false).

forceAuthn.title: Force IdP Authentication
forceAuthn.description: Use this parameter to indicate whether the identity provider should force authentication (true) or can reuse existing security contexts (false).

authnContextDeclRef.title: Authentication Context Declaration Reference
authnContextDeclRef.description: (Optional) Use this parameter to specify authentication context declaration references. Separate multiple values with pipe characters (|).

sloEnabled.title: Single Logout Enabled
sloEnabled.description:
Enable to attempt logout of the user's IdP session at the point of session logout. Required the 
org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.saml2.SAML2PostAuthenticationPlugin
to be active on the chain that includes this SAML2 module.

nameIdFormat.title: NameID Format
nameIdFormat.description:
(Optional) Use this parameter to specify a SAML Name Identifier format identifier such as 
urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:nameid-format:persistent
urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:nameid-format:transient
urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:nameid-format:unspecified

authenticationLevel.title: Authentication Level
authenticationLevel.description:
The authentication level associated with this module.

Each authentication module has an authentication level that can be used to indicate the level of security associated with the module; 0 is the lowest (and the default).

authnContextClassRef.title: Authentication Context Class Reference
authnContextClassRef.description: (Optional) Use this parameter to specify authentication context class references. Separate multiple values with pipe characters (|).

sloRelay.title: Single Logout URL
sloRelay.description: If Single Logout is enabled, this is the URL to which the user should be forwarded after successful IdP logout. This must be a fully-qualified URL (start with http...), or the redirect will not function.

loginChain.title: Linking Authentication Chain
loginChain.description: The authentication chain that will be executed when a user is required to be authenticated locally to match their user account with that of a remotely authenticated assertion.

reqBinding.title: Request Binding
reqBinding.description: Use this parameter to indicate what binding the SP should use when communicating with the IdP.

binding.title: Response Binding
binding.description: Use this parameter to indicate what binding the IdP should use when communicating with this SP.

topics.description: List of topics handled by an audit event handler.

maxPoolSize.title: Maximum Connections
maxPoolSize.description: Specifies the maximum number of connections in the connection pool.

password.title: Database Password
password.description: Specifies the password to access the database server.

databaseType.title: Database Type
databaseType.description:
Select the database to use for logging audit events.

Identifies the database in use, for example MySQL, Oracle, or SQL.

connectionTimeout.title: Connection Timeout (seconds)
connectionTimeout.description: Specifies the maximum wait time before failing the connection, in seconds.

username.title: Database Username
username.description: Specifies the username to access the database server.

minIdle.title: Minimum Idle Connections
minIdle.description: Specifies the minimum number of idle connections in the connection pool.

maxLifetime.title: Maximum Connection Time (seconds)
maxLifetime.description: Specifies the maximum time a JDBC connection can be open, in seconds.

idleTimeout.title: Maximum Connection Idle Timeout (seconds)
idleTimeout.description: Specifies the maximum idle time before the connection is closed, in seconds.

driverClassName.title: JDBC Driver
driverClassName.description: Fully qualified JDBC driver class name.

bufferingWriterThreads.title: Writer Threads
bufferingWriterThreads.description: Specifies the number of threads used to write the buffered events.

bufferingMaxBatchedEvents.title: Max Batched Events
bufferingMaxBatchedEvents.description: Specifies the maximum number of batched statements the database can support per connection.

bufferingMaxSize.title: Buffer Size (number of events)
bufferingMaxSize.description:
Size of the queue where events are buffered before they are written to the database.

This queue has to be big enough to store all incoming events that have not yet been written to the database.

If the queue reaches capacity, the process will block until a write occurs.

bufferingWriteInterval.title: Write Interval
bufferingWriteInterval.description: Specifies the interval (seconds) at which buffered events are written to the database.

bufferingEnabled.title: Buffering Enabled
bufferingEnabled.description: Enables or disables audit event buffering.

handlerFactory.title: Factory Class Name
handlerFactory.description: The fully qualified class name of the factory responsible for creating the Audit Event Handler. The class must implement org.forgerock.openam.audit.AuditEventHandlerFactory.

crlMatchingCertificateAttribute.title: Issuer DN Attribute(s) Used to Search LDAP for CRLs
crlMatchingCertificateAttribute.description:
This is the name of the attribute taken from the CA certificate that will be used to search the CRL.

If only one attribute name is specified, the ldap searchfilter will be (attrName=Value_of_the_corresponding_Attribute_from_SubjectDN)
e.g. SubjectDN of issuer cert 'C=US, CN=Some CA, serialNumber=123456',attribute name specified is 'CN', searchfilter used will be (CN=Some CA)

If serveral attribute names are specified, they have to separated by ,. The resulting ldap searchfilter value will be a comma separated list of name attribute values, the search attribute will be cn
e.g. SubjectDN of issuer cert 'C=US, CN=Some CA, serialNumber=123456',attribute names specified are 'CN,serialNumber', searchfilter used will be cn=CN=Some CA,serialNumber=123456
The order of the values of the attribute names matter as they must match the value of the cn attribute of a crlDistributionPoint entry in the directory server.

otherCertificateAttributeToProfileMappin.title: Other Certificate Field Used to Access User Profile
otherCertificateAttributeToProfileMappin.description: This field is only used if the Certificate Field Used to Access User Profile attribute is set to other. This field allows a custom certificate field to be used as the basis of the user search.

userBindDN.title: LDAP Server Authentication User
userBindDN.description:
DN of the user used by the module to authenticate to the LDAP server

The Certificate module authenticates to the LDAP server in order to search for a matching certificate. The DN entered here represents the account used for said authentication and must have read/search access to the LDAP server.

authenticationLevel.title: Authentication Level
authenticationLevel.description:
The authentication level associated with this module.

Each authentication module has an authentication level that can be used to indicate the level of security associated with the module; 0 is the lowest (and the default).

sslEnabled.title: Use SSL/TLS for LDAP Access
sslEnabled.description: The certificate module will use SSL/TLS to access the LDAP server

cacheCRLsInMemory.title: Cache CRLs in memory
cacheCRLsInMemory.description: The CRLs will be cached in memory

matchCertificateToCRL.title: Match Certificate to CRL
matchCertificateToCRL.description:
The Client Certificate will be checked against the Certificate Revocation list held in the directory

A Certificate Revocation List can be provisioned into the directory. Having this option enabled will cause all client certificates to be checked against this list.

ocspValidationEnabled.title: OCSP Validation
ocspValidationEnabled.description:
Enable Online Certificate Status Protocol validation for OCSP aware certificates

If the certificate contains OCSP validation information then OpenAM will use this information to check the validity of the certificate as part of the authentication process.

NB The OpenAM server must have Internet connectivity for OCSP to work

userBindPassword.title: LDAP Server Authentication Password
userBindPassword.description: The password for the authentication user

certificateAttributeToProfileMapping.title: Certificate Field Used to Access User Profile
certificateAttributeToProfileMapping.description: The certificate module needs to read a value from the client certificate that can be used to search the LDAP server for a matching certificate.

trustedRemoteHosts.title: Trusted Remote Hosts
trustedRemoteHosts.description:
A list of IP addresses trusted to supply client certificates.

If SSL/TLS is being terminated at a load balancer or at the Distributed Authentication server then this option can be used to ensure that only specified trusted hosts (identified by IP address) are allowed to supply client certificates to the certificate module,

Valid values for this list are as follows:
  • none
  • any
  • multiple IP addresses


The default value of none disables this functionality

ldapSearchStartDN.title: LDAP Search Start or Base DN
ldapSearchStartDN.description:
The start point in the LDAP server for the certificate search

When entering multiple entries, each entry must be prefixed with a local server name. Multiple entries allow different search Base DNs depending on the OpenAM server in use. The format is:

local server name | base dn

The local server name is the full name of the server from the list of servers and sites.

certificateAttributeProfileMappingExtens.title: SubjectAltNameExt Value Type to Access User Profile
certificateAttributeProfileMappingExtens.description:
Use the Subject Alternative Name Field in preference to one of the standard certificate fields.

Selecting RFC822Name or UPN will cause this field to have have precedence over the Certificate Field Used to Access User Profile or Other Certificate Field Used to Access User Profile attribute.

NB The client certificate must contain the Subject Alternate Name Extension for this function to operate.

matchCACertificateToCRL.title: Match CA Certificate to CRL
matchCACertificateToCRL.description: The CA certificate that issued the client certificate will also be checked against the CRL.

updateCRLsFromDistributionPoint.title: Update CA CRLs from CRLDistributionPoint
updateCRLsFromDistributionPoint.description:
Fetch new CA CRLs from CRLDistributionPoint and update it in Directory Server

If the CA certificate includes an IssuingDistributionPoint or has an CRLDistributionPoint extension set OpenAM tries to update the CRLs if neeed (i.e. CRL is out-of-date).
This property controls if the update should be performed.
This property is only used if CA CRL checking is enabled.

matchCertificateInLdap.title: Match Certificate in LDAP
matchCertificateInLdap.description: The client certificate must exist in the directory for the authentication to be successful.

clientCertificateHttpHeaderName.title: HTTP Header Name for Client Certificate
clientCertificateHttpHeaderName.description: The name of the HTTP request header containing the certificate, only used when Trusted Remote Hosts mode is enabled.

crlHttpParameters.title: HTTP Parameters for CRL Update
crlHttpParameters.description:
These parameters will be included in any HTTP CRL call to the Certificate Authority

If the Client or CA certificate contains the Issuing Distribution Point Extension then OpenAM will use this information to retrieve the CRL from the distribution point. This property allow custom HTTP parameters to be included in the CRL request.

The format of the parameter is as follows:

param1=value1,param2=value

certificateLdapServers.title: LDAP Server Where Certificates are Stored
certificateLdapServers.description:
Use this list to set the LDAP server used to search for certificates.

The Certificate authentication module will use this list for the LDAP server used to search for certificates. A single entry must be in the format:

ldap_server:port

Multiple entries allow associations between OpenAM servers and a LDAP server. The format is:

local server name | server:port

The local server name is the full name of the server from the list of servers and sites.

ldapCertificateAttribute.title: Subject DN Attribute Used to Search LDAP for Certificates
ldapCertificateAttribute.description:
This is the attribute used to search the directory for the certificate

The Certificate module will search the directory for the certificate using the search filter based on this attribute and the value of the Subject DN taken from the certificate.

iplanet-am-auth-cert-gw-cert-preferred.title: Use only Certificate from HTTP request header
iplanet-am-auth-cert-gw-cert-preferred.description: Strictly use client cert from HTTP header over cert from HTTPS connection/servlet attribute
