resourceTypesManagedInternally.title: Resource Types Managed Internally
resourceTypesManagedInternally.description:
Disable this setting if the policy engine resource types for use in creating policies for UMA resources will be managed externally. This is possible when the list of types of UMA resources is finite, and so the policy engine does not need to support completely dynamic actions on each resource, and the resource types can be managed by the administrator.

If this setting is enabled, AM will create a policy engine resource type for each registered UMA resource, and policy management is expected to be done via the /users/{user}/uma/policies endpoint.

If this setting is disabled, policy management is expected to be done via the /users/{user}/policies endpoint, which supports the full policy engine policy structure as per /policies.

deletePoliciesOnDeleteRS.title: Delete user policies when Resource Server is removed
deletePoliciesOnDeleteRS.description: Delete all user policies that relate to a Resource Server when removing the OAuth2 agent entry or removing the uma_protection scope from the OAuth2 agent.

emailRequestingPartyOnPendingRequestAppr.title: Email Requesting Party on Pending Request approval
emailRequestingPartyOnPendingRequestAppr.description: Specifies whether to send an email to the Requesting Party when a Pending Request is approved by the Resource Owner.

userProfileLocaleAttribute.title: User profile preferred Locale attribute
userProfileLocaleAttribute.description: User profile attribute storing the user's preferred locale.

pendingRequestsEnabled.title: Pending Requests Enabled
pendingRequestsEnabled.description: Specifies whether to use the Pending Requests subsystem that notifies the resource owner that an attempt to access a resource was made.

grantRptConditions.title: Grant RPTs...
grantRptConditions.description: In UMA, scope comes from both the permission ticket and from the token request. An RPT is always granted when all scope matches, and is never granted when no scope matches. You can configure when RPTs are granted for partial match conditions here. For more information, see the UMA Grant Type specification section onAuthorization Assessment and Results Determination.

deleteResourceSetsOnDeleteRS.title: Delete resources when Resource Server is removed
deleteResourceSetsOnDeleteRS.description: Delete all resources that relate to a Resource Server when removing the OAuth2 agent entry or removing the uma_protection scope from the OAuth2 agent.

permissionTicketLifetime.title: Permission Ticket Lifetime (seconds)
permissionTicketLifetime.description: The maximum life of a permission ticket before it expires, in seconds.

resharingMode.title: Re-Sharing Mode
resharingMode.description: Specifies whether re-sharing is off or on implicitly for all users, allowing all users to re-share resources that have been shared with them.

emailResourceOwnerOnPendingRequestCreati.title: Email Resource Owner on Pending Request creation
emailResourceOwnerOnPendingRequestCreati.description: Specifies whether to send an email to the Resource Owner when a Pending Request is created when a Requesting Party requests authorization to a resource.

matchCACertificateToCRL.title: Match CA Certificate to CRL
matchCACertificateToCRL.description: The CA certificate that issued the client certificate will also be checked against the CRL.

certificateAttributeToProfileMapping.title: Certificate Field Used to Access User Profile
certificateAttributeToProfileMapping.description: The certificate module needs to read a value from the client certificate that can be used to search the LDAP server for a matching certificate.

matchCertificateInLdap.title: Match Certificate in LDAP
matchCertificateInLdap.description: The client certificate must exist in the directory for the authentication to be successful.

userBindDN.title: LDAP Server Authentication User
userBindDN.description:
DN of the user used by the module to authenticate to the LDAP server

The Certificate module authenticates to the LDAP server in order to search for a matching certificate. The DN entered here represents the account used for said authentication and must have read/search access to the LDAP server.

iplanet-am-auth-cert-gw-cert-preferred.title: Use only Certificate from HTTP request header
iplanet-am-auth-cert-gw-cert-preferred.description: Strictly use client cert from HTTP header over cert from HTTPS connection/servlet attribute

certificateLdapServers.title: LDAP Server Where Certificates are Stored
certificateLdapServers.description:
Use this list to set the LDAP server used to search for certificates.

The Certificate authentication module will use this list for the LDAP server used to search for certificates. A single entry must be in the format:

ldap_server:port

Multiple entries allow associations between OpenAM servers and a LDAP server. The format is:

local server name | server:port

The local server name is the full name of the server from the list of servers and sites.

cacheCRLsInMemory.title: Cache CRLs in memory
cacheCRLsInMemory.description: The CRLs will be cached in memory

userBindPassword.title: LDAP Server Authentication Password
userBindPassword.description: The password for the authentication user

crlHttpParameters.title: HTTP Parameters for CRL Update
crlHttpParameters.description:
These parameters will be included in any HTTP CRL call to the Certificate Authority

If the Client or CA certificate contains the Issuing Distribution Point Extension then OpenAM will use this information to retrieve the CRL from the distribution point. This property allow custom HTTP parameters to be included in the CRL request.

The format of the parameter is as follows:

param1=value1,param2=value

clientCertificateHttpHeaderName.title: HTTP Header Name for Client Certificate
clientCertificateHttpHeaderName.description: The name of the HTTP request header containing the certificate, only used when Trusted Remote Hosts mode is enabled.

matchCertificateToCRL.title: Match Certificate to CRL
matchCertificateToCRL.description:
The Client Certificate will be checked against the Certificate Revocation list held in the directory

A Certificate Revocation List can be provisioned into the directory. Having this option enabled will cause all client certificates to be checked against this list.

authenticationLevel.title: Authentication Level
authenticationLevel.description:
The authentication level associated with this module.

Each authentication module has an authentication level that can be used to indicate the level of security associated with the module; 0 is the lowest (and the default).

ldapSearchStartDN.title: LDAP Search Start or Base DN
ldapSearchStartDN.description:
The start point in the LDAP server for the certificate search

When entering multiple entries, each entry must be prefixed with a local server name. Multiple entries allow different search Base DNs depending on the OpenAM server in use. The format is:

local server name | base dn

The local server name is the full name of the server from the list of servers and sites.

crlMatchingCertificateAttribute.title: Issuer DN Attribute(s) Used to Search LDAP for CRLs
crlMatchingCertificateAttribute.description:
This is the name of the attribute taken from the CA certificate that will be used to search the CRL.

If only one attribute name is specified, the ldap searchfilter will be (attrName=Value_of_the_corresponding_Attribute_from_SubjectDN)
e.g. SubjectDN of issuer cert 'C=US, CN=Some CA, serialNumber=123456',attribute name specified is 'CN', searchfilter used will be (CN=Some CA)

If serveral attribute names are specified, they have to separated by ,. The resulting ldap searchfilter value will be a comma separated list of name attribute values, the search attribute will be cn
e.g. SubjectDN of issuer cert 'C=US, CN=Some CA, serialNumber=123456',attribute names specified are 'CN,serialNumber', searchfilter used will be cn=CN=Some CA,serialNumber=123456
The order of the values of the attribute names matter as they must match the value of the cn attribute of a crlDistributionPoint entry in the directory server.

sslEnabled.title: Use SSL/TLS for LDAP Access
sslEnabled.description: The certificate module will use SSL/TLS to access the LDAP server

ocspValidationEnabled.title: OCSP Validation
ocspValidationEnabled.description:
Enable Online Certificate Status Protocol validation for OCSP aware certificates

If the certificate contains OCSP validation information then OpenAM will use this information to check the validity of the certificate as part of the authentication process.

NB The OpenAM server must have Internet connectivity for OCSP to work

trustedRemoteHosts.title: Trusted Remote Hosts
trustedRemoteHosts.description:
A list of IP addresses trusted to supply client certificates.

If SSL/TLS is being terminated at a load balancer or at the Distributed Authentication server then this option can be used to ensure that only specified trusted hosts (identified by IP address) are allowed to supply client certificates to the certificate module,

Valid values for this list are as follows:
  • none
  • any
  • multiple IP addresses


The default value of none disables this functionality

certificateAttributeProfileMappingExtens.title: SubjectAltNameExt Value Type to Access User Profile
certificateAttributeProfileMappingExtens.description:
Use the Subject Alternative Name Field in preference to one of the standard certificate fields.

Selecting RFC822Name or UPN will cause this field to have have precedence over the Certificate Field Used to Access User Profile or Other Certificate Field Used to Access User Profile attribute.

NB The client certificate must contain the Subject Alternate Name Extension for this function to operate.

otherCertificateAttributeToProfileMappin.title: Other Certificate Field Used to Access User Profile
otherCertificateAttributeToProfileMappin.description: This field is only used if the Certificate Field Used to Access User Profile attribute is set to other. This field allows a custom certificate field to be used as the basis of the user search.

ldapCertificateAttribute.title: Subject DN Attribute Used to Search LDAP for Certificates
ldapCertificateAttribute.description:
This is the attribute used to search the directory for the certificate

The Certificate module will search the directory for the certificate using the search filter based on this attribute and the value of the Subject DN taken from the certificate.

updateCRLsFromDistributionPoint.title: Update CA CRLs from CRLDistributionPoint
updateCRLsFromDistributionPoint.description:
Fetch new CA CRLs from CRLDistributionPoint and update it in Directory Server

If the CA certificate includes an IssuingDistributionPoint or has an CRLDistributionPoint extension set OpenAM tries to update the CRLs if neeed (i.e. CRL is out-of-date).
This property controls if the update should be performed.
This property is only used if CA CRL checking is enabled.

userProfileMsisdnAttribute.title: Attribute To Use To Search LDAP
userProfileMsisdnAttribute.description: The name of the attribute searched in the user profiles for the MSISDN number

ldapProviderUrl.title: LDAP Server and Port
ldapProviderUrl.description:
Use this list to set the LDAP server used to search for the MSISDN number.

The MSISDN authentication module will use this list as the server that is searched for a matching MSISDN number. A single entry must be in the format:

ldap_server:port

Multiple entries allow associations between OpenAM servers and a LDAP server. The format is:

local server name | server:port

The local server name is the full name of the server from the list of servers and sites.

msisdnParameterNames.title: MSISDN Number Search Parameter Name
msisdnParameterNames.description:
Name of the HTTP cookie, header or query parameter containing the MSISDN number

The MSISDN authentication module will check the incoming HTTP cookie, header or query parameter of the request for the MSISDN number. The order of checking is as follows:

  1. Cookie
  2. Header
  3. Query


NB The MSISDN Header Search Attribute controls what elements of the request is searched

authenticationLevel.title: Authentication Level
authenticationLevel.description:
The authentication level associated with this module.

Each authentication module has an authentication level that can be used to indicate the level of security associated with the module; 0 is the lowest (and the default).

msisdnRequestSearchLocations.title: MSISDN Header Search Attribute
msisdnRequestSearchLocations.description: Controls the elements that are searched by the authentication module

trustedGatewayIPAddresses.title: Trusted Gateway IP Address
trustedGatewayIPAddresses.description:
The list of IP address that are trusted to send MSISDN authentication requests.

The client IP address of the authentication request is checked against this list, if the client IP is not listed then the authentication module will fail.

NB If the list is empty then all hosts will be trusted.

ldapUserBindDN.title: LDAP Server Authentication User
ldapUserBindDN.description:
DN of the user used by the module to authenticate to the LDAP server

The MSISDN module authenticates to the LDAP server in order to search for a matching number. The DN entered here represents the account used for said authentication and must have read/search access to the LDAP server.

ldapUserBindPassword.title: LDAP Server Authentication Password
ldapUserBindPassword.description: The password for the authentication user

baseSearchDN.title: LDAP Start Search DN
baseSearchDN.description:
The start point in the LDAP server for the MSISDN search

When entering multiple entries, each entry must be prefixed with a local server name. Multiple entries allow different search Base DNs depending on the OpenAM server in use. The format is:

local server name | base dn

The local server name is the full name of the server from the list of servers and sites.

msisdnUserNamingAttribute.title: LDAP Attribute Used to Retrieve User Profile
msisdnUserNamingAttribute.description: The name of the attribute returned from the user profile matched against the supplied MSISDN number

returnUserDN.title: Return User DN to DataStore
returnUserDN.description: Controls whether the DN or the username is returned as the authentication principal.

fieldFilterPolicy.title: Field exclusion policies
fieldFilterPolicy.description:
A list of fields or values (JSON pointers) to exclude from the audit event.

To specify a field or value within a field to be filtered out of the event, start the pointer with the event topic, for example access, activity, authentication, or config, followed by the field name or the path to the value in the field.

For example, to filter out the userId field in an access event the pointer will be /access/userId.

To filter out the content-type value in the http.request.headers field the pointer will be /access/http/request/headers/content-type.

Only values that are made up of JSON strings can be manipulated in this way.

rotationInterval.title: Rotation Interval
rotationInterval.description: Interval to trigger audit file rotations, in seconds. A negative or zero value disables this feature.

rotationMaxFileSize.title: Maximum File Size
rotationMaxFileSize.description: Maximum size, in bytes, which an audit file can grow to before rotation is triggered. A negative or zero value indicates this policy is disabled.

rotationFilePrefix.title: File Rotation Prefix
rotationFilePrefix.description: Prefix to prepend to audit files when rotating audit files.

rotationTimes.title: Rotation Times
rotationTimes.description: Durations after midnight to trigger file rotation, in seconds.

rotationEnabled.title: Rotation Enabled
rotationEnabled.description: Enables and disables audit file rotation.

rotationFileSuffix.title: File Rotation Suffix
rotationFileSuffix.description: Suffix to append to audit files when they are rotated. Suffix should be a timestamp.

location.title: Log Directory
location.description: Directory in which to store audit log CSV files.

retentionMinFreeSpaceRequired.title: Minimum Free Space Required
retentionMinFreeSpaceRequired.description: Minimum amount of disk space required, in bytes, on the system where audit files are stored. A negative or zero value indicates this policy is disabled.

retentionMaxNumberOfHistoryFiles.title: Maximum Number of Historical Files
retentionMaxNumberOfHistoryFiles.description: Maximum number of backup audit files allowed. A value of -1 disables pruning of old history files.

retentionMaxDiskSpaceToUse.title: Maximum Disk Space
retentionMaxDiskSpaceToUse.description: The maximum amount of disk space the audit files can occupy, in bytes. A negative or zero value indicates this policy is disabled.

topics.title: Topics
topics.description: List of topics handled by an audit event handler.

enabled.title: Enabled
enabled.description: Enables or disables an audit event handler.

bufferingAutoFlush.title: Flush Each Event Immediately
bufferingAutoFlush.description: Performance may be improved by writing all buffered events before flushing.

securityEnabled.title: Is Enabled
securityEnabled.description: Enables the CSV tamper evident feature.

handlerFactory.title: Factory Class Name
handlerFactory.description: The fully qualified class name of the factory responsible for creating the Audit Event Handler. The class must implement org.forgerock.openam.audit.AuditEventHandlerFactory.

accessKey.title: SNS Access Key ID
accessKey.description: Amazon Simple Notification Service Access Key ID. For more information, see https://aws.amazon.com/developers/access-keys/.

region.title: SNS Client Region
region.description: Region of your registered Amazon Simple Notification Service client. For more information, see https://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html.

mdDuration.title: Response Cache Duration
mdDuration.description: The minimum lifetime to keep unanswered message records in the message dispatcher cache, in seconds. To keep unanswered message records indefinitely, set this property to 0.Should be tuned so that it is applicable to the use case of this service. For example, the ForgeRock Authenticator (Push) authentication module has a default timeout of 120 seconds.

appleEndpoint.title: SNS Endpoint for APNS
appleEndpoint.description: The Simple Notification Service endpoint in Amazon Resource Name format, used to send push messages to the Apple Push Notification Service (APNS).

mdConcurrency.title: Response Cache Concurrency
mdConcurrency.description: Level of concurrency to use when accessing the message dispatcher cache. Defaults to 16, and must be greater than 0. Choose a value to accommodate as many threads as will ever concurrently access the message dispatcher cache.

googleEndpoint.title: SNS Endpoint for GCM
googleEndpoint.description: The Simple Notification Service endpoint in Amazon Resource Name format, used to send push messages over Google Cloud Messaging (GCM).

delegateFactory.title: Message Transport Delegate Factory
delegateFactory.description: The fully qualified class name of the factory responsible for creating the PushNotificationDelegate. The class must implement org.forgerock.openam.services.push.PushNotificationDelegate.

mdCacheSize.title: Response Cache Size
mdCacheSize.description: Maximum size of the message dispatcher cache, in number of records. If set to 0 the cache can grow indefinitely. If the number of records that need to be stored exceeds this maximum, then older items in the cache will be removed to make space.

secret.title: SNS Access Key Secret
secret.description: Amazon Simple Notification Service Access Key Secret. For more information, see https://aws.amazon.com/developers/access-keys/.

authenticatorPushDeviceSettingsEncryptio.title: Key Store Password
authenticatorPushDeviceSettingsEncryptio.description: Password to unlock the key store. This password is encrypted when it is saved in the OpenAM configuration. You should modify the default value.

authenticatorPushSkippableName.title: ForgeRock Authenticator (Push) Device Skippable Attribute Name
authenticatorPushSkippableName.description: Name of the attribute on a user's profile used to store their selection of whether to skip ForgeRock Authenticator (Push) 2FA modules.

authenticatorPushDeviceSettingsEncryptio.title: Device Profile Encryption Scheme
authenticatorPushDeviceSettingsEncryptio.description:
Encryption scheme to use to secure device profiles stored on the server.

If enabled, each device profile is encrypted using a unique random secret key using the given strength of AES encryption in CBC mode with PKCS#5 padding. An HMAC-SHA of the given strength (truncated to half-size) is used to ensure integrity protection and authenticated encryption. The unique random key is encrypted with the given RSA key pair and stored with the device profile.

Note: AES-256 may require installation of the JCE Unlimited Strength policy files.

authenticatorPushDeviceSettingsEncryptio.title: Key-Pair Alias
authenticatorPushDeviceSettingsEncryptio.description: Alias of the certificate and private key in the key store. The private key is used to encrypt and decrypt device profiles.

authenticatorPushDeviceSettingsEncryptio.title: Encryption Key Store
authenticatorPushDeviceSettingsEncryptio.description: Path to the key store from which to load encryption keys.

authenticatorPushDeviceSettingsEncryptio.title: Private Key Password
authenticatorPushDeviceSettingsEncryptio.description: Password to unlock the private key.

authenticatorPushDeviceSettingsEncryptio.title: Key Store Type
authenticatorPushDeviceSettingsEncryptio.description:
Type of key store to load.

Note: PKCS#11 key stores require hardware support such as a security device or smart card and is not available by default in most JVM installations.

See the JDK 8 PKCS#11 Reference Guide for more details.

pushAttrName.title: Profile Storage Attribute
pushAttrName.description:
The user's attribute in which to store Push Notification profiles.

The default attribute is added to the schema when you prepare a user store for use with OpenAM. If you want to use a different attribute, you must make sure to add it to your user store schema prior to deploying push notifications with the ForgeRock Authenticator app in OpenAM. OpenAM must be able to write to the attribute.

csrfFilterEnabled.title: Enable CSRF Protection
csrfFilterEnabled.description:
If enabled, all non-read/query requests will require the X-Requested-With header to be present.

Requiring a non-standard header ensures requests can only be made via methods (XHR) that have stricter same-origin policy protections in Web browsers, preventing Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) attacks. Without this filter, cross-origin requests are prevented by the use of the application/json Content-Type header, which is less robust.

descriptionsState.title: API Descriptions
descriptionsState.description: Whether API Explorer and API Docs are enabled in OpenAM and how the documentation for them is generated. Dynamic generation includes descriptions from any custom services and authentication modules you may have added. Static generation only includes services and authentication modules that were present when OpenAM was built. Note that dynamic documentation generation may not work in some application containers.

defaultVersion.title: Default Resource Version
defaultVersion.description:
The API resource version to use when the REST request does not specify an explicit version. Choose from:

  • Latest. If an explicit version is not specified, the latest resource version of an API is used.
  • Oldest. If an explicit version is not specified, the oldest supported resource version of an API is used. Note that since APIs may be deprecated and fall out of support, the oldest supported version may not be the first version.
  • None. If an explicit version is not specified, the request will not be handled and an error status is returned.

warningHeader.title: Warning Header
warningHeader.description: Whether to include a warning header in the response to a request which fails to include the Accept-API-Version header.

defaultProtocolVersion.title: Default Protocol Version
defaultProtocolVersion.description:
The API protocol version to use when a REST request does not specify an explicit version. Choose from:

  • Oldest. If an explicit version is not specified, the oldest protocol version is used.
  • Latest. If an explicit version is not specified, the latest protocol version is used.
  • None. If an explicit version is not specified, the request will not be handled and an error status is returned.

_id.title: Client ID
_id.description: The OAuth 2.0 client ID for the application.

name.title: Display Name
name.description: The human-readable display name for the OAuth 2.0 client

expiryDateTime.title: Expiry Time
expiryDateTime.description: When the tokens will currently expire (may be null).

scopes.title: Scopes
scopes.description: The total set of scopes granted to the application.

.*.title: Scope Descriptions
.*.description: The human-readable descriptions for the scope values.

1.1.title: OAuth 2.0 User Applications
1.1.description: This endpoint exposes a list of all the applications (clients) that the user authorized using OAuth 2.0. Access for those applications can then be revoked on a per-client basis.

queries.description: Get a list of the applications that have been granted OAuth 2.0 access. Only `_queryFilter=true` is supported.

errors.description: Returned if the list of applications cannot be produced due to an internal error.

delete.description: Delete the tokens for the specified client ID.

errors.description: Returned if the list of applications cannot be produced due to an internal error.

pathParameter.name: clientId
pathParameter.description: The OAuth 2.0 client ID for the application.

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: The identifier for the user for which the request is regarding.

authenticationLevel.title: Authentication Level
authenticationLevel.description:
The authentication level associated with this module.

Each authentication module has an authentication level that can be used to indicate the level of security associated with the module; 0 is the lowest (and the default).

validAnonymousUsers.title: Valid Anonymous Users
validAnonymousUsers.description:
List of accounts that are allowed to login without providing credentials.

Any username on this list will be allows anonymous access to OpenAM. Usernames listed here must have matching profiles in the data store or the user profile requirement must be disabled. The username can be specified during anonymous authentication as follows:

/openam/UI/Login?module=anonymous&IDToken1=username

caseSensitiveUsernameMatchingEnabled.title: Case Sensitive User IDs
caseSensitiveUsernameMatchingEnabled.description: If enabled, username matching will be case sensitive.

defaultAnonymousUsername.title: Default Anonymous User Name
defaultAnonymousUsername.description: The default username to use if no username is supplied during authentication.

cryptoContextValue.title: OpenID Connect validation configuration value
cryptoContextValue.description:
Required when the 'openid' scope is included. The discovery url, or jwk url, or the client_secret, corresponding to the selection above.

If discovery or jwk url entered, entry must be in valid url format,
e.g. https://accounts.google.com/.well-known/openid-configuration
NB If client_secret entered, entry is ignored and the value of the Client Secret is used.

cryptoContextType.title: OpenID Connect validation configuration type
cryptoContextType.description: Required when the 'openid' scope is included. Please select either 1. the issuer discovery url, 2. the issuer jwk url, or 3. the client_secret.

smtpPort.title: SMTP port
smtpPort.description: The TCP port that will be used by the SMTP gateway

emailAttribute.title: Email attribute in the Response
emailAttribute.description:
Attribute from the response used to send activation code emails.

The attribute in the response from the profile service of the Provider that contains the email address of the authenticated user. This address will be used to send an email with an activation code when the accounts are allowed to be created dynamically.

smtpHost.title: SMTP host
smtpHost.description: The mail host that will be used by the Email Gateway implementation

smtpSslEnabled.title: SMTP SSL Enabled
smtpSslEnabled.description: Tick this option if the SMTP Server provides SSL

smtpPassword.title: SMTP User Password
smtpPassword.description: The Password of the SMTP User Name

emailGateway.title: Mail Server Gateway implementation class
emailGateway.description:
The class used by the module to send email.

This class is used by the module to send email. A custom implementation can be provided.

The custom implementation must implement the org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.oauth2.EmailGateway

smtpFromAddress.title: SMTP From address
smtpFromAddress.description: The email address on behalf of whom the messages will be sent

smtpUsername.title: SMTP User Name
smtpUsername.description: If the SMTP Service requires authentication, configure the user name here

anonymousUserName.title: Anonymous User
anonymousUserName.description:
Username of the OpenAM anonymous user

The username of the user that will represent the anonymous user. This user account must already exist in the realm.

mapToAnonymousUser.title: Map to anonymous user
mapToAnonymousUser.description:
Enabled anonymous user access to OpenAM for OAuth authenticated users

If selected, the authenticated users in the OAuth 2.0 Provider will be mapped to the anonymous user configured in the next parameter.
If not selected the users authenticated will be mapped by the parameters configured in the account mapper.

NB If Create account if it does not exist is enabled, that parameter takes precedence.

attributeMapperConfiguration.title: Attribute Mapper Configuration
attributeMapperConfiguration.description:
Mapping of OAuth attributes to local OpenAM attributes

Attribute configuration that will be used to map the user info obtained from the OAuth 2.0 Provider to the local user data store in the OpenAM.

Example: OAuth2.0_attribute=local_attribute

promptPasswordFlag.title: Prompt for password setting and activation code
promptPasswordFlag.description:
Users must set a password and complete the activation flow during dynamic profile creation.

If this is enabled, the user must set a password before the system creates an account dynamically and an activation code will be sent to the user's email address. The account will be created only if the password and activation code are properly set.
If this is disabled, the account will be created transparently without prompting the user.

enableRegistrationService.title: Use IDM as Registration Service
enableRegistrationService.description:
Whether to use IDM as an external Registration Service to complete registration for new users.

IDM is called and passed these parameters:

  • clientToken: Signed, encrypted JWT of the OAuth 2.0 authentication state.
  • returnParams: Encoded URL parameters, required to be returned to AM to resume authentication after registration in IDM is complete.

accountMapperConfiguration.title: Account Mapper Configuration
accountMapperConfiguration.description:
Mapping of OAuth account to local OpenAM account

Attribute configuration that will be used to map the account of the user authenticated in the OAuth 2.0 Provider to the local data store in the OpenAM. Example: OAuth2.0_attribute=local_attribute

attributeMappingClasses.title: Attribute Mapper
attributeMappingClasses.description:
Name of the class that implements the attribute mapping

This class maps the OAuth properties into OpenAM properties. A custom attribute mapper can be provided.

A custom attribute mapper must implement the org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.AttributeMapper interface.
Provided implementations are:
  • org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.JsonAttributeMapper
  • org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.oidc.JwtAttributeMapper (can only be used when using the openid scope)
String constructor parameters can be provided by appending | separated values.

saveAttributesInSession.title: Save attributes in the session
saveAttributesInSession.description: If this option is enabled, the attributes configured in the attribute mapper will be saved into the OpenAM session

accountProviderClass.title: Account Provider
accountProviderClass.description:
Name of the class implementing the account provider.

This class is used by the module to find the account from the attributes mapped by the Account Mapper org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.AccountProvider interface.
String constructor parameters can be provided by appending | separated values.

createAccount.title: Create account if it does not exist
createAccount.description:
If the OAuth2 account does not exist in the local OpenAM data store, an account will be created dynamically.

If this is enabled, the account mapper could create the account dynamically if there is no account mapped. Before creating the account, a dialog prompting for a password and asking for an activation code can be shown if the parameter "Prompt for password setting and activation code" is enabled.

If this flag is not enabled, 3 alternative options exist:

  1. The accounts need to have a user profile in the OpenAM User Data Store
  2. The user does not have a user profile and the "Ignore Profile" is set in the Authentication Service of the realm.
  3. The account is mapped to an anonymous account (see parameter "Map to anonymous user" and "Anonymous User")

accountMapperClass.title: Account Mapper
accountMapperClass.description:
Name of the class implementing the attribute mapping for the account search.

This class is used by the module to map from the account information received from the OAuth Identity Provider into OpenAM.

The class must implement the org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.AttributeMapper interface.
Provided implementations are:
  • org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.JsonAttributeMapper
  • org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.oidc.JwtAttributeMapper (can only be used when using the openid scope)
String constructor parameters can be provided by appending | separated values.

ssoProxyUrl.title: Proxy URL
ssoProxyUrl.description:
The URL to the OpenAM OAuth proxy JSP

This URL should only be changed from the default, if an external server is performing the GET to POST proxying. The default is /openam/oauth2c/OAuthProxy.jsp

clientId.title: Client Id
clientId.description:
OAuth client_id parameter

For more information on the OAuth client_id parameter refer to the RFC 6749, section 2.3.1

issuerName.title: Token Issuer
issuerName.description:
Required when the 'openid' scope is included. Value must match the iss field in issued ID Token
e.g. accounts.google.com

The issuer value MUST be provided when OAuth 2.0 Mix-Up Mitigation is enabled.

authorizeEndpoint.title: Authentication Endpoint URL
authorizeEndpoint.description:
OAuth authentication endpoint URL

This is the URL endpoint for OAuth authentication provided by the OAuth Identity Provider

usesBasicAuth.title: Use Basic Auth
usesBasicAuth.description: When enabled, the client will use basic auth for authenticating with  the social auth provider. Enabled by default.

scopeDelimiter.title: Scope Delimiter
scopeDelimiter.description: Delimiter used to separate scope values. Default value is space.

clientSecret.title: Client Secret
clientSecret.description:
OAuth client_secret parameter

For more information on the OAuth client_secret parameter refer to the RFC 6749, section 2.3.1

mixUpMitigation.title: OAuth 2.0 Mix-Up Mitigation enabled
mixUpMitigation.description:
Enables OAuth 2.0 mix-up mitigation

The authorization server must support the OAuth 2.0 Mix-Up Mitigation draft, otherwise OpenAM will fail to validate responses from the authorization server. If only the OAuth 2.0 protocol is utilized, make sure that the accepted issuer value is set in the "Token Issuer" setting.

subjectProperty.title: Subject Property
subjectProperty.description: Property used to identify which attribute an auth server identifies a user by.

scope.title: Scope
scope.description:
OAuth scope; list of user profile properties

According to the OAuth 2.0 Authorization Framework, scope is a space-separated list of user profile attributes that the client application requires. The list depends on the permissions that the resource owner grants to the client application.

Some authorization servers use non-standard separators for scopes. For example, Facebook takes a comma-separated list.

tokenEndpoint.title: Access Token Endpoint URL
tokenEndpoint.description:
OAuth access token endpoint URL

This is the URL endpoint for access token retrieval provided by the OAuth Identity Provider. Refer to the RFC 6749, section 3.2

authenticationLevel.title: Authentication Level
authenticationLevel.description:
The authentication level associated with this module.

Each authentication module has an authentication level that can be used to indicate the level of security associated with the module; 0 is the lowest (and the default).

provider.title: Social Provider
provider.description: Social Provider for which this module is being setup.

logoutServiceUrl.title: OAuth 2.0 Provider Logout Service
logoutServiceUrl.description:
The URL of the Identity Provider's logout service.

To enable IdP logout, you must also add org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.oauth2.OAuth2PostAuthnPlugin to the Authentication Post Processing Classes setting. Navigate to Authentication > Settings > Post Authentication Processing.

logoutBehaviour.title: Logout Options
logoutBehaviour.description:
Specify logout behavior.

The following options are available for logging out of the OAuth 2.0 Provider when the user logs out of AM:
  • prompt: Ask the user whether to log out from the OAuth 2.0 Provider
  • logout: Log out from the OAuth 2.0 Provider without asking the user
  • donotlogout: Do not log out the user from the OAuth 2.0 Provider

To enable IdP logout, you must also add org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.oauth2.OAuth2PostAuthnPlugin to the Authentication Post Processing Classes setting. Navigate to Authentication > Settings > Post Authentication Processing.

userInfoEndpoint.title: User Profile Service URL
userInfoEndpoint.description:
User profile information URL

This URL endpoint provides user profile information and is provided by the OAuth Identity Provider

NB This URL should return JSON objects in response

Name of the class implementing the attribute mapping for the account search.

This class is used by the module to map from the account information received from the OAuth Identity Provider into OpenAM.

The class must implement the org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.AttributeMapper interface.
Provided implementations are:
  • org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.JsonAttributeMapper
  • org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.oidc.JwtAttributeMapper (can only be used when using the openid scope)
String constructor parameters can be provided by appending | separated values.

saveAttributesInSession.title: Save attributes in the session
saveAttributesInSession.description: If this option is enabled, the attributes configured in the attribute mapper will be saved into the OpenAM session

accountProviderClass.title: Account Provider
accountProviderClass.description:
Name of the class implementing the account provider.

This class is used by the module to find the account from the attributes mapped by the Account Mapper org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.AccountProvider interface.
String constructor parameters can be provided by appending | separated values.

attributeMappingClasses.title: Attribute Mapper
attributeMappingClasses.description:
Name of the class that implements the attribute mapping

This class maps the OAuth properties into OpenAM properties. A custom attribute mapper can be provided.

A custom attribute mapper must implement the org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.AttributeMapper interface.
Provided implementations are:
  • org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.JsonAttributeMapper
  • org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.oidc.JwtAttributeMapper (can only be used when using the openid scope)
String constructor parameters can be provided by appending | separated values.

mapToAnonymousUser.title: Map to anonymous user
mapToAnonymousUser.description:
Enabled anonymous user access to OpenAM for OAuth authenticated users

If selected, the authenticated users in the OAuth 2.0 Provider will be mapped to the anonymous user configured in the next parameter.
If not selected the users authenticated will be mapped by the parameters configured in the account mapper.

NB If Create account if it does not exist is enabled, that parameter takes precedence.

accountMapperConfiguration.title: Account Mapper Configuration
accountMapperConfiguration.description:
Mapping of OAuth account to local OpenAM account

Attribute configuration that will be used to map the account of the user authenticated in the OAuth 2.0 Provider to the local data store in the OpenAM. Example: OAuth2.0_attribute=local_attribute

createAccount.title: Create account if it does not exist
createAccount.description:
If the OAuth2 account does not exist in the local OpenAM data store, an account will be created dynamically.

If this is enabled, the account mapper could create the account dynamically if there is no account mapped. Before creating the account, a dialog prompting for a password and asking for an activation code can be shown if the parameter "Prompt for password setting and activation code" is enabled.

If this flag is not enabled, 3 alternative options exist:

  1. The accounts need to have a user profile in the OpenAM User Data Store
  2. The user does not have a user profile and the "Ignore Profile" is set in the Authentication Service of the realm.
  3. The account is mapped to an anonymous account (see parameter "Map to anonymous user" and "Anonymous User")

enableRegistrationService.title: Use IDM as Registration Service
enableRegistrationService.description:
Whether to use IDM as an external Registration Service to complete registration for new users.

IDM is called and passed these parameters:

  • clientToken: Signed, encrypted JWT of the OAuth 2.0 authentication state.
  • returnParams: Encoded URL parameters, required to be returned to AM to resume authentication after registration in IDM is complete.

attributeMapperConfiguration.title: Attribute Mapper Configuration
attributeMapperConfiguration.description:
Mapping of OAuth attributes to local OpenAM attributes

Attribute configuration that will be used to map the user info obtained from the OAuth 2.0 Provider to the local user data store in the OpenAM.

Example: OAuth2.0_attribute=local_attribute

anonymousUserName.title: Anonymous User
anonymousUserName.description:
Username of the OpenAM anonymous user

The username of the user that will represent the anonymous user. This user account must already exist in the realm.

tokenEndpoint.title: Access Token Endpoint URL
tokenEndpoint.description:
OAuth access token endpoint URL

This is the URL endpoint for access token retrieval provided by the OAuth Identity Provider. Refer to the RFC 6749, section 3.2

usesBasicAuth.title: Use Basic Auth
usesBasicAuth.description: When enabled, the client will use basic auth for authenticating with  the social auth provider. Enabled by default.

authorizeEndpoint.title: Authentication Endpoint URL
authorizeEndpoint.description:

This is the URL endpoint for OAuth authentication provided by the OAuth Identity Provider

clientSecret.title: Client Secret

provider.title: Social Provider

forgotPasswordConfirmationUrl.title: Forgot Password Confirmation Email URL
forgotPasswordConfirmationUrl.description: This page handles the HTTP GET request when the user clicks the link sent by email in the confirmation request.

forgotPasswordTokenLifetime.title: Forgot Password Token Lifetime (seconds)
forgotPasswordTokenLifetime.description: Maximum life time for the token that allows a user to process a forgotten password using the REST API.

userRegisteredDestination.title: Destination After Successful Self-Registration
userRegisteredDestination.description: Specifies the behavior when self-registration has successfully completed.

selfRegistrationTokenLifetime.title: Self-Registration Token LifeTime (seconds)
selfRegistrationTokenLifetime.description: Maximum life time for the token allowing User Self-Registration using the REST API.

confirmationIdHmacKey.title: Confirmation Id HMAC Signing Key
confirmationIdHmacKey.description: 256-bit key (base64-encoded) to use for HMAC signing of the legacy self-service confirmation email links.

selfServiceEnabled.title: Legacy Self-Service REST Endpoint
selfServiceEnabled.description:
Specify whether to enable the legacy self-service endpoint.

OpenAM supports two User Self-Service components: the Legacy User Self-Service, which is based on a Java SDK and is available in OpenAM versions prior to OpenAM 13, and a common REST-based/XUI-based User Self-Service available in OpenAM 13 and later.

The Legacy User Self-Service will be deprecated in a future release.

selfRegistrationEnabled.title: Self-Registration for Users
selfRegistrationEnabled.description: If enabled, new users can sign up using a REST API client.

selfRegistrationConfirmationUrl.title: Self-Registration Confirmation Email URL
selfRegistrationConfirmationUrl.description: This page handles the HTTP GET request when the user clicks the link sent by email in the confirmation request.

forgotPasswordEnabled.title: Forgot Password for Users
forgotPasswordEnabled.description: If enabled, users can assign themselves a new password using a REST API client.

protectedUserAttributes.title: Protected User Attributes
protectedUserAttributes.description: A list of user profile attributes. Users modifying any of the attributes in this list will be required to enter a password as confirmation before the change is accepted. This option applies to XUI deployments only.

additionalProperties.description: Any additional properties for the item (varies based on the schema of the type)

passwordTransformClass.title: Class to Transform Password Syntax
passwordTransformClass.description:
This class is used to transform the supplied credentials from the database.

The default implementation for this property is ClearTextTransform that performs no transformation. If the supplied credentials need to be transformed before comparing with the password field retrieved from the database, a custom implementation should be provided. Any custom implementation must implement the following interface com.sun.identity.authentication.modules.jdbc.JDBCPasswordSyntaxTransform

connectionType.title: Connection Type
connectionType.description:
Controls how the authentication module will obtain the JDBC connection to the database.

If the connection type is non-persistent JDBC connection then the JDBC driver must be available to the OpenAM web-app. If the connection type is JNDI, the OpenAM web application deployment descriptor web.xml must be updated to include the correct JNDI JDBC resource information. The J2EE container must also be configured with the correct JNDI JDBC configuration.

username.title: Database Username
username.description:
This username will be used to authenticate to the database

NB Only used when connection type is JDBC

passwordStatement.title: Prepared Statement
passwordStatement.description:
The SQL statement used to search the database for user passwords

The SQL statement used to search the database for the user password. A single property of the supplied username is provided by the module. The result of the search should be a single row that contains the password for the user under the specified column.

passwordColumn.title: Password Column Name
passwordColumn.description:
The name of the column in the database containing the user passwords

This property will be used to retrieve the correct column containing the password from the results table returned by the database

jdbcDriver.title: JDBC Driver
jdbcDriver.description:
The classname of the JDBC driver to use.

The fully qualified class name of the JDBC driver to use to connect to the database. Only Oracle or MySQL drivers are supported. JDBC drivers for other database may work, but the database will be treated as if it was Oracle.

NB Only used when connection type is JDBC

authenticationLevel.title: Authentication Level
authenticationLevel.description:
The authentication level associated with this module.

Each authentication module has an authentication level that can be used to indicate the level of security associated with the module; 0 is the lowest (and the default).

jdbcUrl.title: JDBC URL
jdbcUrl.description:
The JDBC URL used to initialise the JDBC driver

NB Only used when connection type is JDBC

connectionPoolJndiName.title: Connection Pool JNDI Name
connectionPoolJndiName.description:
The JNDI URL to the JDBC connection pool

The JNDI URL refers to the JDBC connection pool created in the J2EE container for the authentication database.

NB Only used when connection type is JNDI

password.title: Database Password
password.description:
The password used to authenticate to the database

NB Only used when connection type is JDBC

acceptedAuthorizedParties.description:
A list of case sensitive strings which can be either string or URI values

A list of authorized parties which this module will accept ID tokens from. This will be checked against the authorized party claim of the ID token.

principalMapperClass.title: Principal mapper class
principalMapperClass.description:
Class which implements mapping of jwt state to a Principal in the local identity repository

Any custom implementation must implement the org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.AttributeMapper interface.

idTokenHeaderName.title: Name of header referencing the ID Token

clientSecret.title: Client Secret
clientSecret.description:
OAuth client_secret parameter

For more information on the OAuth client_secret parameter refer to the RFC 6749, section 2.3.1

cryptoContextType.title: OpenID Connect validation configuration type
cryptoContextType.description: Please select either 1. the issuer discovery url, 2. the issuer jwk url, or 3. the client_secret.

accountProviderClass.title: Account provider class
accountProviderClass.description:
Name of the class implementing the account provider.

This class is used by the module to find the account from the attributes mapped by the Account Mapper org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.AccountProvider interface.

audienceName.title: Audience name
audienceName.description:
A case sensitive string

The audience name for this OpenID Conenct module. This will be used to check that the ID token received is intended for this module as an audience.

useSubClaimIfNoMatch.title: Use "sub" claim if no match
useSubClaimIfNoMatch.description: If no account is found that matches, whether to use the "sub" claim as the principal name or (if false) to fail.

cryptoContextValue.title: OpenID Connect validation configuration value
cryptoContextValue.description:
The discovery url, or jwk url, or the client_secret, corresponding to the selection above.

If discovery or jwk url entered, entry must be in valid url format,
e.g. https://accounts.google.com/.well-known/openid-configuration
NB If client_secret entered, entry is ignored and the value of the Client Secret is used.

idTokenIssuer.title: Name of OpenID Connect ID Token Issuer
idTokenIssuer.description: Value must match the iss field in issued ID Token

jwtToLdapAttributeMappings.title: Mapping of jwt attributes to local LDAP attributes
jwtToLdapAttributeMappings.description:
Format: jwt_attribute=local_ldap_attribute

Mappings allow jwt entries to drive principal lookup. This entry determines how to translate between local LDAP attributes and the entries in the jwt. See OpenID Connect Core 1.0 Specification section 5.4 on how to request the inclusion of additional attributes in issued ID Tokens.

1.0.title: Forgotten Password
1.0.description: Self Service endpoint for retrieving a forgotten password

read.description: Initialise the forgotten password reclamation process.A set of requirements will be returned that will need to be fulfilled and sent to the submitRequirements action.

actions.description: Submit some fulfilled requirements. Returns either a completion status, or a token along with some more requirements. If requirements are returned, they should be submitted with the token as a fresh request to this action.
actions.name: submitRequirements

request.title: Submit requirements structure
request.description: The structure of a request to the submitRequirements action.

token.title: Token
token.description: The token returned from the previous submitRequirements request.

input.title: Input
input.description: The input as collected from the user that has forgotten their password. This object must conform to the JSON Schema of the requirements property from the last response.

.*.title: Input Property
.*.description: Valid content according to the received JSON Schema.

oneOf.title: More requirements response
oneOf.description: If more requirements need fulfilling before the forgotten password process is completed, this response structure will be returned.

token.title: Token
token.description: A token for the process that must be returned with the next set of requirements when they have been fulfilled.

type.title: Type
type.description: The type of the self service interaction.

requirements.title: Requirements
requirements.description: A JSON Schema object that defines the input that must be submitted to the submitRequirements action.

.*.title: Requirements Properties
.*.description: Any valid JSON Schema properties may be included.

oneOf.title: Completed process response
oneOf.description: If all the requirements have been fulfilled and the forgotten password process is complete, this response structure will be used.

com.iplanet.am.locale.description: Default locale for the product. (property name: com.iplanet.am.locale)

com.sun.identity.client.notification.url.title: Notification URL
com.sun.identity.client.notification.url.description: The location of notification service end point. It is usually the product's deployment URI/notificationservice. (property name: com.sun.identity.client.notification.url)

com.iplanet.am.util.xml.validating.title: XML Validation
com.iplanet.am.util.xml.validating.description: Specifies if validation is required when parsing XML documents. (property name: com.iplanet.am.util.xml.validating)

com.iplanet.services.debug.level.title: Debug Level
com.iplanet.services.debug.level.description: Debug level for all components in the product. (property name: com.iplanet.services.debug.level)

com.sun.services.debug.mergeall.title: Merge Debug Files
com.sun.services.debug.mergeall.description: On : Directs all debug data to a single file (debug.out); Off : creates separate per-component debug files (property name : com.sun.services.debug.mergeall)

com.iplanet.services.debug.directory.title: Debug Directory
com.iplanet.services.debug.directory.description: Directory where debug files reside. (property name: com.iplanet.services.debug.directory)

parameters.name: serverName
parameters.description: Server identifier - either the server URL, or server number

jwksUri.title: JWKs URI
jwksUri.description: URI to retrieve JWK verification keys from to validate the JWT signature.

jwkStoreCacheMissCacheTime.title: JWKs URI content cache miss cache time
jwkStoreCacheMissCacheTime.description: To avoid loading the JWKS URI content for every operation, especially when the kid is not in the jwks content already cached, the JWKS content will be cached for a minimum period of time. This cache miss cache time defines the minimum amount of time the JWKS URI content is cached.

resourceOwnerIdentityClaim.title: Resource Owner Identity Claim
resourceOwnerIdentityClaim.description: Claim in the JWT that identifies the resource owner account in AM. Defaults to "sub".

issuer.title: JWT Issuer
issuer.description: Expected 'iss' claim identifier for this JWT issuer.

jwkSet.title: JWK Set
jwkSet.description: Manually entered JWK Set of verification keys to validate the JWT signature.

allowedSubjects.title: Allowed Subjects
allowedSubjects.description: List of subjects which this provider is allowed to provide consent for. If blank then the provider can provide consent for any user in this realm.

jwksCacheTimeout.title: JWKs URI content cache timeout in ms
jwksCacheTimeout.description: To avoid loading the JWKS URI content for every operation, the JWKS content is cached. This timeout defines the maximum amount of time the JWKS URI content can be cached before being refreshed.

consentedScopesClaim.title: Consented Scopes Claim
consentedScopesClaim.description: Optional claim within the JWT that lists the scopes that the user has consented to. The scopes can be represented either as a JSON array of strings, or as a single space-separated string.

1.0.title: OAuth2 Trusted JWT Issuer Agent Groups
1.0.description: Agent Groups handler that is responsible for managing agent groups

smtpPort.title: SMTP port
smtpPort.description: The TCP port that will be used by the SMTP gateway

smtpSslEnabled.title: SMTP SSL Enabled
smtpSslEnabled.description: Tick this option if the SMTP Server provides SSL

emailGateway.title: Mail Server Gateway implementation class
emailGateway.description:
The class used by the module to send email.

This class is used by the module to send email. A custom implementation can be provided.

The custom implementation must implement the org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.oauth2.EmailGateway

smtpFromAddress.title: SMTP From address
smtpFromAddress.description: The email address on behalf of whom the messages will be sent

smtpHost.title: SMTP host
smtpHost.description: The mail host that will be used by the Email Gateway implementation

emailAttribute.title: Email attribute in the Response
emailAttribute.description:
Attribute from the response used to send activation code emails.

The attribute in the response from the profile service of the Provider that contains the email address of the authenticated user. This address will be used to send an email with an activation code when the accounts are allowed to be created dynamically.

smtpUsername.title: SMTP User Name
smtpUsername.description: If the SMTP Service requires authentication, configure the user name here

smtpPassword.title: SMTP User Password
smtpPassword.description: The Password of the SMTP User Name

accountMapperClass.title: Account Mapper
accountMapperClass.description:
Name of the class implementing the attribute mapping for the account search.

This class is used by the module to map from the account information received from the OAuth Identity Provider into OpenAM.

The class must implement the org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.AttributeMapper interface.
Provided implementations are:
  • org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.JsonAttributeMapper
  • org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.oidc.JwtAttributeMapper (can only be used when using the openid scope)
String constructor parameters can be provided by appending | separated values.

createAccount.title: Create account if it does not exist
createAccount.description:
If the OAuth2 account does not exist in the local OpenAM data store, an account will be created dynamically.

If this is enabled, the account mapper could create the account dynamically if there is no account mapped. Before creating the account, a dialog prompting for a password and asking for an activation code can be shown if the parameter "Prompt for password setting and activation code" is enabled.

If this flag is not enabled, 3 alternative options exist:

  1. The accounts need to have a user profile in the OpenAM User Data Store
  2. The user does not have a user profile and the "Ignore Profile" is set in the Authentication Service of the realm.
  3. The account is mapped to an anonymous account (see parameter "Map to anonymous user" and "Anonymous User")

mapToAnonymousUser.title: Map to anonymous user
mapToAnonymousUser.description:
Enabled anonymous user access to OpenAM for OAuth authenticated users

If selected, the authenticated users in the OAuth 2.0 Provider will be mapped to the anonymous user configured in the next parameter.
If not selected the users authenticated will be mapped by the parameters configured in the account mapper.

NB If Create account if it does not exist is enabled, that parameter takes precedence.

attributeMapperConfiguration.title: Attribute Mapper Configuration
attributeMapperConfiguration.description:
Mapping of OAuth attributes to local OpenAM attributes

Attribute configuration that will be used to map the user info obtained from the OAuth 2.0 Provider to the local user data store in the OpenAM.

Example: OAuth2.0_attribute=local_attribute

anonymousUserName.title: Anonymous User
anonymousUserName.description:
Username of the OpenAM anonymous user

The username of the user that will represent the anonymous user. This user account must already exist in the realm.

attributeMappingClasses.title: Attribute Mapper
attributeMappingClasses.description:
Name of the class that implements the attribute mapping

This class maps the OAuth properties into OpenAM properties. A custom attribute mapper can be provided.

A custom attribute mapper must implement the org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.AttributeMapper interface.
Provided implementations are:
  • org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.JsonAttributeMapper
  • org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.oidc.JwtAttributeMapper (can only be used when using the openid scope)
String constructor parameters can be provided by appending | separated values.

accountProviderClass.title: Account Provider
accountProviderClass.description:
Name of the class implementing the account provider.

This class is used by the module to find the account from the attributes mapped by the Account Mapper org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.AccountProvider interface.
String constructor parameters can be provided by appending | separated values.

enableRegistrationService.title: Use IDM as Registration Service
enableRegistrationService.description:
Whether to use IDM as an external Registration Service to complete registration for new users.

IDM is called and passed these parameters:

  • clientToken: Signed, encrypted JWT of the OAuth 2.0 authentication state.
  • returnParams: Encoded URL parameters, required to be returned to AM to resume authentication after registration in IDM is complete.

accountMapperConfiguration.title: Account Mapper Configuration
accountMapperConfiguration.description:
Mapping of OAuth account to local OpenAM account

Attribute configuration that will be used to map the account of the user authenticated in the OAuth 2.0 Provider to the local data store in the OpenAM. Example: OAuth2.0_attribute=local_attribute

promptPasswordFlag.title: Prompt for password setting and activation code
promptPasswordFlag.description:
Users must set a password and complete the activation flow during dynamic profile creation.

If this is enabled, the user must set a password before the system creates an account dynamically and an activation code will be sent to the user's email address. The account will be created only if the password and activation code are properly set.
If this is disabled, the account will be created transparently without prompting the user.

saveAttributesInSession.title: Save attributes in the session
saveAttributesInSession.description: If this option is enabled, the attributes configured in the attribute mapper will be saved into the OpenAM session

provider.title: Social Provider
provider.description: Social Provider for which this module is being setup.

authenticationLevel.title: Authentication Level
authenticationLevel.description:
The authentication level associated with this module.

Each authentication module has an authentication level that can be used to indicate the level of security associated with the module; 0 is the lowest (and the default).

userInfoEndpoint.title: User Profile Service URL
userInfoEndpoint.description:
User profile information URL

This URL endpoint provides user profile information and is provided by the OAuth Identity Provider

NB This URL should return JSON objects in response

scope.title: Scope
scope.description:
OAuth scope; list of user profile properties

According to the OAuth 2.0 Authorization Framework, scope is a space-separated list of user profile attributes that the client application requires. The list depends on the permissions that the resource owner grants to the client application.

Some authorization servers use non-standard separators for scopes. For example, Facebook takes a comma-separated list.

ssoProxyUrl.title: Proxy URL
ssoProxyUrl.description:
The URL to the OpenAM OAuth proxy JSP

This URL should only be changed from the default, if an external server is performing the GET to POST proxying. The default is /openam/oauth2c/OAuthProxy.jsp

subjectProperty.title: Subject Property
subjectProperty.description: Property used to identify which attribute an auth server identifies a user by.

additionalProperties.description: Any additional properties for the item (varies based on the schema of the type)

locale.title: Platform Locale
locale.description: Set the fallback locale used when the user locale cannot be determined.

cookieDomains.title: Cookie Domains
cookieDomains.description:
Set the list of domains into which OpenAM writes cookies.

If you set multiple cookie domains, OpenAM still only sets the cookie in the domain the client uses to access OpenAM. If this property is left blank, then the fully qualified domain name of the server is used to set the cookie domain, meaning that a host cookie rather than a domain cookie is set.

_id.title: ID
_id.description: The identifier of the item within its type

additionalProperties.title: Other properties
additionalProperties.description: Any additional properties for the item (varies based on the schema of the type)

totpTimeStepsInWindow.title: TOTP Time Steps
totpTimeStepsInWindow.description:
The number of time steps to check before and after receiving a OTP.

This is the number of time step intervals to check the received OTP against both forward in time and back in time. For example, with 1 time steps and a time step interval of 30 seconds the server will allow a code between the previous code, the current code and the next code.

authenticationLevel.title: Authentication Level
authenticationLevel.description:
The authentication level associated with this module.

Each authentication module has an authentication level that can be used to indicate the level of security associated with the module; 0 is the lowest (and the default).

totpMaximumClockDrift.title: Maximum Allowed Clock Drift
totpMaximumClockDrift.description: Number of time steps a client is allowed to get out of sync with the server before manual resynchronisation is required. For example, with 3 allowed drifts and a time step interval of 30 seconds the server will allow codes from up to 90 seconds from the current time to be treated as the current time step. The drift for a user's device is calculated each time they enter a new code. If the drift exceeds this value, the user's authentication code will be rejected.

totpTimeStepInterval.title: TOTP Time Step Interval
totpTimeStepInterval.description:
The TOTP time step in seconds that the OTP device uses to generate the OTP.

This is the time interval that one OTP is valid for. For example, if the time step is 30 seconds, then a new OTP will be generated every 30 seconds. This makes a single OTP valid for only 30 seconds.

oathIssuerName.title: Name of the Issuer
oathIssuerName.description: Name to identify the OTP issuer.

oathAlgorithm.title: OATH Algorithm to Use
oathAlgorithm.description:
Choose the algorithm your device uses to generate the OTP.

HOTP uses a counter value that is incremented every time a new OTP is generated. TOTP generates a new OTP every few seconds as specified by the time step interval.

passwordLength.title: One Time Password Length
passwordLength.description: The length of the generated OTP in digits, must be at least 6 and compatible with the hardware/software OTP generators you expect your end-users to use. For example, Google and ForgeRock authenticators support values of 6 and 8.

addChecksumToOtpEnabled.title: Add Checksum Digit
addChecksumToOtpEnabled.description:
This adds a checksum digit to the OTP.

This adds a digit to the end of the OTP generated to be used as a checksum to verify the OTP was generated correctly. This is in addition to the actual password length. You should only set this if your device supports it.

frOathOtpMaxRetry.title: One Time Password Max Retry
frOathOtpMaxRetry.description: The number of times entry of the OTP may be attempted. Minimum is 1 maximum is 10 and default is 3.

minimumSecretKeyLength.title: Minimum Secret Key Length
minimumSecretKeyLength.description: Number of hexadecimal characters allowed for the Secret Key.

hotpWindowSize.title: HOTP Window Size
hotpWindowSize.description:
The size of the window to resynchronize with the client.

This sets the window that the OTP device and the server counter can be out of sync. For example, if the window size is 100 and the servers last successful login was at counter value 2, then the server will accept a OTP from the OTP device that is from device counter 3 to 102.

truncationOffset.title: Truncation Offset
truncationOffset.description:
This adds an offset to the generation of the OTP.

This is an option used by the HOTP algorithm that not all devices support. This should be left default unless you know your device uses a offset.
