_id.title: ID
_id.description: The identifier of the item within its type

additionalProperties.title: Other properties
additionalProperties.description: Any additional properties for the item (varies based on the schema of the type)

securityEnabled.title: Is Enabled
securityEnabled.description: Enables the CSV tamper evident feature.

location.title: Log Directory
location.description: Directory in which to store audit log CSV files.

rotationFileSuffix.title: File Rotation Suffix
rotationFileSuffix.description: Suffix to append to audit files when they are rotated. Suffix should be a timestamp.

rotationMaxFileSize.title: Maximum File Size
rotationMaxFileSize.description: Maximum size, in bytes, which an audit file can grow to before rotation is triggered. A negative or zero value indicates this policy is disabled.

rotationEnabled.title: Rotation Enabled
rotationEnabled.description: Enables and disables audit file rotation.

rotationInterval.title: Rotation Interval
rotationInterval.description: Interval to trigger audit file rotations, in seconds. A negative or zero value disables this feature.

rotationTimes.title: Rotation Times
rotationTimes.description: Durations after midnight to trigger file rotation, in seconds.

rotationFilePrefix.title: File Rotation Prefix
rotationFilePrefix.description: Prefix to prepend to audit files when rotating audit files.

retentionMaxNumberOfHistoryFiles.title: Maximum Number of Historical Files
retentionMaxNumberOfHistoryFiles.description: Maximum number of backup audit files allowed. A value of -1 disables pruning of old history files.

retentionMinFreeSpaceRequired.title: Minimum Free Space Required
retentionMinFreeSpaceRequired.description: Minimum amount of disk space required, in bytes, on the system where audit files are stored. A negative or zero value indicates this policy is disabled.

retentionMaxDiskSpaceToUse.title: Maximum Disk Space
retentionMaxDiskSpaceToUse.description: The maximum amount of disk space the audit files can occupy, in bytes. A negative or zero value indicates this policy is disabled.

enabled.title: Enabled
enabled.description: Enables or disables an audit event handler.

topics.title: Topics
topics.description: List of topics handled by an audit event handler.

bufferingAutoFlush.title: Flush Each Event Immediately
bufferingAutoFlush.description: Performance may be improved by writing all buffered events before flushing.

handlerFactory.title: Factory Class Name
handlerFactory.description: The fully qualified class name of the factory responsible for creating the Audit Event Handler. The class must implement org.forgerock.openam.audit.AuditEventHandlerFactory.

resourceSchema.title: Structure of requirements specification.
resourceSchema.description: The initial requirements from an initialised forgotten username process.

type.title: Type
type.description: The type of the self service interaction.

requirements.title: Requirements
requirements.description: A JSON Schema object that defines the input that must be submitted to the submitRequirements action.

.*.title: Requirements Properties
.*.description: Any valid JSON Schema properties may be included.

1.0.title: Forgotten Username
1.0.description: Self Service endpoint for retrieving a forgotten username

read.description: Initialise the forgotten username reclamation process.A set of requirements will be returned that will need to be fulfilled and sent to the submitRequirements action.

actions.description: Submit some fulfilled requirements. Returns either a completion status, or a token along with some more requirements. If requirements are returned, they should be submitted with the token as a fresh request to this action.
actions.name: submitRequirements

request.title: Submit requirements structure
request.description: The structure of a request to the submitRequirements action.

token.title: Token
token.description: The token returned from the previous submitRequirements request.

input.title: Input
input.description: The input as collected from the user that has forgotten their username. This object must conform to the JSON Schema of the requirements property from the last response.

.*.title: Input Property
.*.description: Valid content according to the received JSON Schema.

oneOf.title: More requirements response
oneOf.description: If more requirements need fulfilling before the forgotten username process is completed, this response structure will be returned.

token.title: Token
token.description: A token for the process that must be returned with the next set of requirements when they have been fulfilled.

type.title: Type
type.description: The type of the self service interaction.

requirements.title: Requirements
requirements.description: A JSON Schema object that defines the input that must be submitted to the submitRequirements action.

.*.title: Requirements Properties
.*.description: Any valid JSON Schema properties may be included.

oneOf.title: Completed process response
oneOf.description: If all the requirements have been fulfilled and the forgotten username process is complete, this response structure will be used.

reqBinding.title: Request Binding
reqBinding.description: Use this parameter to indicate what binding the SP should use when communicating with the IdP.

allowCreate.title: Allow IdP to Create NameID
allowCreate.description: Use this parameter to indicate whether the identity provider can create a new identifier for the principal if none exists (true) or not (false).

sloEnabled.title: Single Logout Enabled
sloEnabled.description:
Enable to attempt logout of the user's IdP session at the point of session logout. Required the 
org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.saml2.SAML2PostAuthenticationPlugin
to be active on the chain that includes this SAML2 module.

entityName.title: IdP Entity ID
entityName.description: The entity name of the SAML2 IdP Service to use for this module (must be configured).

authnContextClassRef.title: Authentication Context Class Reference
authnContextClassRef.description: (Optional) Use this parameter to specify authentication context class references. Separate multiple values with pipe characters (|).

authenticationLevel.title: Authentication Level
authenticationLevel.description:
The authentication level associated with this module.

Each authentication module has an authentication level that can be used to indicate the level of security associated with the module; 0 is the lowest (and the default).

metaAlias.title: SP MetaAlias
metaAlias.description:
MetaAlias for Service Provider. The format of this parameter is 
/realm_name/SP

nameIdFormat.title: NameID Format
nameIdFormat.description:
(Optional) Use this parameter to specify a SAML Name Identifier format identifier such as 
urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:nameid-format:persistent
urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:nameid-format:transient
urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:nameid-format:unspecified

isPassive.title: Passive Authentication
isPassive.description: Use this parameter to indicate whether the identity provider should authenticate passively (true) or not (false).

loginChain.title: Linking Authentication Chain
loginChain.description: The authentication chain that will be executed when a user is required to be authenticated locally to match their user account with that of a remotely authenticated assertion.

authnContextDeclRef.title: Authentication Context Declaration Reference
authnContextDeclRef.description: (Optional) Use this parameter to specify authentication context declaration references. Separate multiple values with pipe characters (|).

authComparison.title: Comparison Type
authComparison.description:
(Optional) Use this parameter to specify a comparison method to evaluate the requested context classes or statements. OpenAM accepts the following values: 
better
, 
exact
, 
maximum
, and 
minimum
.

sloRelay.title: Single Logout URL
sloRelay.description: If Single Logout is enabled, this is the URL to which the user should be forwarded after successful IdP logout. This must be a fully-qualified URL (start with http...), or the redirect will not function.

forceAuthn.title: Force IdP Authentication
forceAuthn.description: Use this parameter to indicate whether the identity provider should force authentication (true) or can reuse existing security contexts (false).

binding.title: Response Binding
binding.description: Use this parameter to indicate what binding the IdP should use when communicating with this SP.

ssoProxyUrl.title: Proxy URL
ssoProxyUrl.description:
The URL to the OpenAM OAuth proxy JSP

This URL should only be changed from the default, if an external server is performing the GET to POST proxying. The default is /openam/oauth2c/OAuthProxy.jsp

userInfoEndpoint.title: User Profile Service URL
userInfoEndpoint.description:
User profile information URL

This URL endpoint provides user profile information and is provided by the OAuth Identity Provider

NB This URL should return JSON objects in response

authorizeEndpoint.title: Authentication Endpoint URL
authorizeEndpoint.description:
OAuth authentication endpoint URL

This is the URL endpoint for OAuth authentication provided by the OAuth Identity Provider

usesBasicAuth.title: Use Basic Auth
usesBasicAuth.description: When enabled, the client will use basic auth for authenticating with  the social auth provider. Enabled by default.

subjectProperty.title: Subject Property
subjectProperty.description: Property used to identify which attribute an auth server identifies a user by.

clientSecret.title: Client Secret
clientSecret.description:
OAuth client_secret parameter

For more information on the OAuth client_secret parameter refer to the RFC 6749, section 2.3.1

requestTokenEndpoint.title: Request Token Endpoint URL
requestTokenEndpoint.description:
OAuth request token endpoint URL

This is the URL endpoint for OAuth request token provided by the OAuth Identity Provider

provider.title: Social Provider
provider.description: Social Provider for which this module is being setup.

clientId.title: Client Id
clientId.description:
OAuth client_id parameter

For more information on the OAuth client_id parameter refer to the RFC 6749, section 2.3.1

authenticationLevel.title: Authentication Level
authenticationLevel.description:
The authentication level associated with this module.

Each authentication module has an authentication level that can be used to indicate the level of security associated with the module; 0 is the lowest (and the default).

tokenEndpoint.title: Access Token Endpoint URL
tokenEndpoint.description:
OAuth access token endpoint URL

This is the URL endpoint for access token retrieval provided by the OAuth Identity Provider. Refer to the RFC 6749, section 3.2

saveAttributesInSession.title: Save attributes in the session
saveAttributesInSession.description: If this option is enabled, the attributes configured in the attribute mapper will be saved into the OpenAM session

attributeMappingClasses.title: Attribute Mapper
attributeMappingClasses.description:
Name of the class that implements the attribute mapping

This class maps the OAuth properties into OpenAM properties. A custom attribute mapper can be provided.

A custom attribute mapper must implement the org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.AttributeMapper interface.
Provided implementations are:
  • org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.JsonAttributeMapper
  • org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.oidc.JwtAttributeMapper (can only be used when using the openid scope)
String constructor parameters can be provided by appending | separated values.

accountMapperConfiguration.title: Account Mapper Configuration
accountMapperConfiguration.description:
Mapping of OAuth account to local OpenAM account

Attribute configuration that will be used to map the account of the user authenticated in the OAuth 2.0 Provider to the local data store in the OpenAM. Example: OAuth2.0_attribute=local_attribute

enableRegistrationService.title: Use IDM as Registration Service
enableRegistrationService.description:
Whether to use IDM as an external Registration Service to complete registration for new users.

IDM is called and passed these parameters:

  • clientToken: Signed, encrypted JWT of the OAuth 2.0 authentication state.
  • returnParams: Encoded URL parameters, required to be returned to AM to resume authentication after registration in IDM is complete.

accountProviderClass.title: Account Provider
accountProviderClass.description:
Name of the class implementing the account provider.

This class is used by the module to find the account from the attributes mapped by the Account Mapper org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.AccountProvider interface.
String constructor parameters can be provided by appending | separated values.

attributeMapperConfiguration.title: Attribute Mapper Configuration
attributeMapperConfiguration.description:
Mapping of OAuth attributes to local OpenAM attributes

Attribute configuration that will be used to map the user info obtained from the OAuth 2.0 Provider to the local user data store in the OpenAM.

Example: OAuth2.0_attribute=local_attribute

accountMapperClass.title: Account Mapper
accountMapperClass.description:
Name of the class implementing the attribute mapping for the account search.

This class is used by the module to map from the account information received from the OAuth Identity Provider into OpenAM.

The class must implement the org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.AttributeMapper interface.
Provided implementations are:
  • org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.JsonAttributeMapper
  • org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.oidc.JwtAttributeMapper (can only be used when using the openid scope)
String constructor parameters can be provided by appending | separated values.

createAccount.title: Create account if it does not exist
createAccount.description:
If the OAuth2 account does not exist in the local OpenAM data store, an account will be created dynamically.

If this is enabled, the account mapper could create the account dynamically if there is no account mapped. Before creating the account, a dialog prompting for a password and asking for an activation code can be shown if the parameter "Prompt for password setting and activation code" is enabled.

If this flag is not enabled, 3 alternative options exist:

  1. The accounts need to have a user profile in the OpenAM User Data Store
  2. The user does not have a user profile and the "Ignore Profile" is set in the Authentication Service of the realm.
  3. The account is mapped to an anonymous account (see parameter "Map to anonymous user" and "Anonymous User")

mapToAnonymousUser.title: Map to anonymous user
mapToAnonymousUser.description:
Enabled anonymous user access to OpenAM for OAuth authenticated users

If selected, the authenticated users in the OAuth 2.0 Provider will be mapped to the anonymous user configured in the next parameter.
If not selected the users authenticated will be mapped by the parameters configured in the account mapper.

NB If Create account if it does not exist is enabled, that parameter takes precedence.

anonymousUserName.title: Anonymous User
anonymousUserName.description:
Username of the OpenAM anonymous user

The username of the user that will represent the anonymous user. This user account must already exist in the realm.

batchCapacity.title: Capacity
batchCapacity.description: Maximum event count in the batch queue; additional events are dropped.

batchThreadCount.title: Thread Count
batchThreadCount.description: Number of concurrent threads that pull events from the batch queue.

batchEnabled.title: Batch enabled
batchEnabled.description: Boolean for batch delivery of audit events.

insertTimeoutSec.title: Insert Timeout
insertTimeoutSec.description: Waiting period (seconds) for available capacity, when a new event enters the queue.

shutdownTimeoutSec.title: Shutdown Timeout
shutdownTimeoutSec.description: Application waiting period (seconds) for worker thread termination.

pollTimeoutSec.title: Polling Timeout
pollTimeoutSec.description: Worker thread waiting period (seconds) for the next event, before going idle.

maxBatchedEvents.title: Max Batched
maxBatchedEvents.description: Maximum number of events per batch.

jndiConnectionFactoryName.title: JMS Connection Factory Name
jndiConnectionFactoryName.description:
Specifies the JNDI lookup name for the connection factory exposed by your JMS message broker. OpenAM performs a JNDI lookup on this name to locate your broker's connection factory.

See the documentation for your JMS message broker for the required value.

The default is the connection factory name for Apache ActiveMQ.

jndiTopicName.title: JMS Topic Name
jndiTopicName.description: JNDI lookup name for the JMS topic

jndiContextProperties.title: JNDI Context Properties
jndiContextProperties.description:
Specifies JNDI properties that OpenAM uses to connect to the JMS message broker to which OpenAM will publish audit events.

OpenAM acts as a JMS client, using a JMS connection factory to connect to your JMS message broker. In order for OpenAM to connect to the broker, the JNDI context properties must conform to those needed by the broker. See the documentation for your JMS message broker for required values.

The default properties are example properties for connecting to Apache ActiveMQ.

deliveryMode.title: Delivery Mode
deliveryMode.description:
Specifies whether JMS messages used to transmit audit events use persistent or non-persistent delivery.

With persistent delivery, the JMS provider ensures that messages are not lost in transit in case of a provider failure by logging messages to storage when they are sent.

Specify the delivery mode as persistent if it is unacceptable for delivery of audit events to be lost in JMS transit. If the possible loss of audit events is acceptable, choose non-persistent delivery, which provides better performance.

sessionMode.title: Session Mode
sessionMode.description:
Specifies the JMS session acknowledgement mode: AUTO, CLIENT, or DUPS_OK.

  • Auto mode guarantees once-only delivery of JMS messages used to transmit audit events.
  • Duplicates OK mode ensures that messages are delivered at least once.
  • Client mode does not ensure delivery.

Use the default setting unless your JMS broker implementation requires otherwise. See your broker documentation for more information.

topics.title: Topics
topics.description: List of topics handled by an audit event handler.

enabled.title: Enabled
enabled.description: Enables or disables an audit event handler.

handlerFactory.title: Factory Class Name
handlerFactory.description: The fully qualified class name of the factory responsible for creating the Audit Event Handler. The class must implement org.forgerock.openam.audit.AuditEventHandlerFactory.

serverPortNumber.title: Port Number
serverPortNumber.description: Port number on which the RADIUS server is listening.

sharedSecret.title: Shared Secret
sharedSecret.description: The secret shared between the RADIUS server and the authentication module.

healthCheckInterval.title: Health check interval
healthCheckInterval.description:
The interval between checks to unavailable RADIUS servers, in minutes.

Determines how often OpenAM checks an offline server's status. The check will send an invalid authentication request to the RADIUS server. Offline servers will not be used until the healthcheck was successful. Primary servers that become available will be used in preference to secondary servers.

secondaryRadiusServers.title: Secondary Radius Servers
secondaryRadiusServers.description:
A list of secondary Radius servers that will be used for authentication, in case the primary servers are unavailable.

The module will use secondary servers for authentication if all primary servers are unavailable. A single entry must be in the format:

radius_server:port

Multiple entries allow associations between OpenAM servers and a Radius server. The format is:

local server name | radius_server:port

NB The local server name is the full name of the server from the list of servers and sites.

serverTimeout.title: Timeout
serverTimeout.description:
Amount of time in seconds to wait for the RADIUS server response.

This sets the SO_TIMEOUT timeout on the packet.

authenticationLevel.title: Authentication Level
authenticationLevel.description:
The authentication level associated with this module.

Each authentication module has an authentication level that can be used to indicate the level of security associated with the module; 0 is the lowest (and the default).

primaryRadiusServers.title: Primary Radius Servers
primaryRadiusServers.description:
A list of primary Radius servers that will be used for authentication

The module will use these servers in preference to the secondary servers. A single entry must be in the format:

radius_server:port

Multiple entries allow associations between OpenAM servers and a Radius server. The format is:

local server name | radius_server:port

NB The local server name is the full name of the server from the list of servers and sites.

sslState.description: Specifies whether to connect to the SMTP mail server using SSL.

password.title: Mail Server Authentication Password
password.description: Specifies the password for the SMTP user name.

port.title: Mail Server Host Port
port.description: Specifies the port number for the SMTP mail server.

emailAddressAttribute.title: Email Attribute Name
emailAddressAttribute.description: Specifies the profile attribute from which to retrieve the end user's email address.

message.title: Email Content
message.description: Specifies content for notification messages. If you do not set this, OpenAM includes only the confirmation URL in the mail body.

from.title: Email From Address
from.description: Specifies the address from which to send email notifications.

hostname.title: Mail Server Host Name
hostname.description: Specifies the fully qualified domain name of the SMTP mail server through which to send email notifications.

username.title: Mail Server Authentication Username
username.description: Specifies the user name for the SMTP mail server.

subject.title: Email Subject
subject.description: Specifies a subject for notification messages. If you do not set this, OpenAM does not set the subject for notification messages.

emailImplClassName.title: Email Message Implementation Class
emailImplClassName.description: Specifies the class that sends email notifications, such as those sent for user registration and forgotten passwords.

sessionPropertyWhitelist.title: Whitelisted Session Property Names
sessionPropertyWhitelist.description:
A list of properties that users may read, edit the value of, or delete from their session.

Adding properties to sessions can impact OpenAM's performance. Because there is no size constraint limiting the set of properties that you can add to sessions, and no limit on the number of session properties you can add, keep in mind that adding session properties can increase the load on an OpenAM deployment in the following areas:

  • OpenAM server memory
  • OpenDJ storage
  • OpenDJ replication

Protected attributes will NOT be allowed to be set, edited or deleted, even if they are included in this whitelist.

resourceSchema.title: Structure of requirements specification.
resourceSchema.description: The initial requirements from an initialised user registration process.

type.title: Type
type.description: The type of the self service interaction.

requirements.title: Requirements
requirements.description: A JSON Schema object that defines the input that must be submitted to the submitRequirements action.

.*.title: Requirements Properties
.*.description: Any valid JSON Schema properties may be included.

1.0.title: User Registration
1.0.description: Self Service endpoint for registering a new user

read.description: Initialise the user registration process.A set of requirements will be returned that will need to be fulfilled and sent to the submitRequirements action.

actions.description: Submit some fulfilled requirements. Returns either a completion status, or a token along with some more requirements. If requirements are returned, they should be submitted with the token as a fresh request to this action.
actions.name: submitRequirements

request.title: Submit requirements structure
request.description: The structure of a request to the submitRequirements action.

token.title: Token
token.description: The token returned from the previous submitRequirements request.

input.title: Input
input.description: The input as collected from the new user. This object must conform to the JSON Schema of the requirements property from the last response.

.*.title: Input Property
.*.description: Valid content according to the received JSON Schema.

oneOf.title: More requirements response
oneOf.description: If more requirements need fulfilling before the user registration process is completed, this response structure will be returned.

token.title: Token
token.description: A token for the process that must be returned with the next set of requirements when they have been fulfilled.

type.title: Type
type.description: The type of the self service interaction.

requirements.title: Requirements
requirements.description: A JSON Schema object that defines the input that must be submitted to the submitRequirements action.

.*.title: Requirements Properties
.*.description: Any valid JSON Schema properties may be included.

oneOf.title: Completed process response
oneOf.description: If all the requirements have been fulfilled and the user registration process is complete, this response structure will be used.

org.forgerock.services.resourcesets.stor.title: Connection String(s)
org.forgerock.services.resourcesets.stor.description: An ordered list of connection strings for LDAP directories. Each connection string is composed as follows: HOST:PORT[|SERVERID[|SITEID]], where server and site IDs are optional parameters that will prioritize that connection to use from the specified nodes. Multiple connection strings should be comma-separated, e.g. host1:389,host2:50389|server1|site1,host3:50389.

org.forgerock.services.umaaudit.store.di.title: Connection String(s)
org.forgerock.services.umaaudit.store.di.description: An ordered list of connection strings for LDAP directories. Each connection string is composed as follows: HOST:PORT[|SERVERID[|SITEID]], where server and site IDs are optional parameters that will prioritize that connection to use from the specified nodes. Multiple connection strings should be comma-separated, e.g. host1:389,host2:50389|server1|site1,host3:50389.

org.forgerock.services.uma.pendingreques.title: Connection String(s)
org.forgerock.services.uma.pendingreques.description: An ordered list of connection strings for LDAP directories. Multiple connection strings should be comma-separated, e.g. host1:389,host2:50389|server1|site1,host3:50389.

1.0.title: UMA Data Store Properties
1.0.description: An object of property key-value pairs

actions.description: Obtain the value schema for this resource.
actions.name: schema

parameters.name: serverName
parameters.description: Server identifier - either the server URL, or server number

authenticatorOATHDeviceSettingsEncryptio.title: Key-Pair Alias
authenticatorOATHDeviceSettingsEncryptio.description: Alias of the certificate and private key in the key store. The private key is used to encrypt and decrypt device profiles.

authenticatorOATHDeviceSettingsEncryptio.title: Device Profile Encryption Scheme
authenticatorOATHDeviceSettingsEncryptio.description:
Encryption scheme for securing device profiles stored on the server.

If enabled, each device profile is encrypted using a unique random secret key using the given strength of AES encryption in CBC mode with PKCS#5 padding. An HMAC-SHA of the given strength (truncated to half-size) is used to ensure integrity protection and authenticated encryption. The unique random key is encrypted with the given RSA key pair and stored with the device profile.

Note: AES-256 may require installation of the JCE Unlimited Strength policy files.

oathAttrName.title: Profile Storage Attribute
oathAttrName.description:
Attribute for storing ForgeRock Authenticator OATH profiles.

The default attribute is added to the user store during OpenAM installation. If you want to use a different attribute, you must make sure to add it to your user store schema prior to deploying two-step verification with a ForgeRock OATH authenticator app in OpenAM. OpenAM must be able to write to the attribute.

authenticatorOATHSkippableName.title: ForgeRock Authenticator (OATH) Device Skippable Attribute Name
authenticatorOATHSkippableName.description: The data store attribute that holds the user's decision to enable or disable obtaining and providing a password obtained from the ForgeRock Authenticator app. This attribute must be writeable.

authenticatorOATHDeviceSettingsEncryptio.title: Private Key Password
authenticatorOATHDeviceSettingsEncryptio.description: Password to unlock the private key.

See the JDK 8 PKCS#11 Reference Guide for more details.

authenticatorOATHDeviceSettingsEncryptio.title: Key Store Password
authenticatorOATHDeviceSettingsEncryptio.description: Password to unlock the key store. This password will be encrypted.

clientSecret.title: Client Secret
clientSecret.description:
This secret shared between server and client for encryption of the user password.

This secret must be conveyed to the RADIUS client and entered into its configuration before the User-Password field of incoming Access-Request packets can be decrypted to validate the password for the represented by that packet. A default value is generated for you but you can enter a custom value if desired.

handlerClass.title: Handler Class
handlerClass.description:
The fully qualified name of a class to handle incoming RADIUS Access-Requests for this client.

This class must implement the com.sun.identity.authentication.modules.radius.server.spi.AccessRequestHandler interface to handle incoming Access-Request packets and provide a suitable response. An instance of this class is created when configuration is first loaded to validate the class and then once for each new request. The configuration properties will only be passed for the request handling instances and not when validating the class.

handlerConfig.title: Handler Class Configuration Properties
handlerConfig.description:
Properties needed by the handler class for its configuration.

These properties are provided to the handler via its init method prior to the call to handle the request packet. If these values are changed the next handler instance created for an incoming request will receive the updated values. Each entry assumes that the first '=' character incurred separates a key from its value. All entries are placed in a properties file handed to each handler instance.

clientIpAddress.title: Client IP Address
clientIpAddress.description:
The IP Address of the client.

Section 5.4 of the RADIUS Authentication Specification, RFC 2865, indicates that the source IP address of the Access-Request packet MUST be used to identify a configured client and hence determine the shared secret to use for decrypting the User-Password field.

This property should hold the source IP address of the client. This should match the value obtained from Java's InetSocketAddress.getAddress().toString() function.

To verify the value, send an Access-Request packet to OpenAM's RADIUS port and watch for a message stating: "No Defined RADIUS Client matches IP address '/127.0.0.1'. Dropping request.". The value used in this property should match the IP address returned in the single quotes.

clientPacketsLogged.title: Log Packet Contents for this Client
clientPacketsLogged.description:
Indicates if full packet contents should be dumped to the log.

When troubleshooting issues with RADIUS it is helpful to know what was received in a given packet. Enabling this feature will cause packet contents to be logged in a human consumable format. The only caveat is that the USER_PASSWORD field will be obfiscated by replacing with asterisks. This should only be enabled for troubleshooting as it adds significant content to logs and slows processing.

fieldFilterPolicy.title: Field exclusion policies
fieldFilterPolicy.description:
A list of fields or values (JSON pointers) to exclude from the audit event.

To specify a field or value within a field to be filtered out of the event, start the pointer with the event topic, for example access, activity, authentication, or config, followed by the field name or the path to the value in the field.

For example, to filter out the userId field in an access event the pointer will be /access/userId.

To filter out the content-type value in the http.request.headers field the pointer will be /access/http/request/headers/content-type.

Only values that are made up of JSON strings can be manipulated in this way.

fieldFilterPolicy.title: Field exclusion policies
fieldFilterPolicy.description:
A list of fields or values (JSON pointers) to exclude from the audit event.

To specify a field or value within a field to be filtered out of the event, start the pointer with the event topic, for example access, activity, authentication, or config, followed by the field name or the path to the value in the field.

For example, to filter out the userId field in an access event the pointer will be /access/userId.

To filter out the content-type value in the http.request.headers field the pointer will be /access/http/request/headers/content-type.

Only values that are made up of JSON strings can be manipulated in this way.

hotpCounterAttribute.title: Counter Attribute Name
hotpCounterAttribute.description: The name of the attribute in the user profile to store the user counter. This is required if HOTP is chosen as the OATH algorithm.

hotpWindowSize.title: HOTP Window Size
hotpWindowSize.description:
The size of the window to resynchronize with the client.

This sets the window that the OTP device and the server counter can be out of sync. For example, if the window size is 100 and the servers last successful login was at counter value 2, then the server will accept a OTP from the OTP device that is from device counter 3 to 102.

oathAlgorithm.title: OATH Algorithm to Use
oathAlgorithm.description:
Choose the algorithm your device uses to generate the OTP.

HOTP uses a counter value that is incremented every time a new OTP is generated. TOTP generates a new OTP every few seconds as specified by the time step interval.

passwordLength.title: One Time Password Length
passwordLength.description: The length of the generated OTP in digits. Must be 6 digits or longer.

secretKeyAttribute.title: Secret Key Attribute Name
secretKeyAttribute.description: The name of the attribute in the user profile to store the user secret key.

forgerock-oath-maximum-clock-drift.title: Maximum Allowed Clock Drift
forgerock-oath-maximum-clock-drift.description:
Number of time steps a client is allowed to get out of sync with the server before manual resynchronisation is required. This should be greater than the TOTP Time Steps value.

As this checks the time drift over multiple requests it needs to be greater than the value specified in TOTP Time Steps.

forgerock-oath-observed-clock-drift-attr.title: Clock Drift Attribute Name
forgerock-oath-observed-clock-drift-attr.description:
The name of the attribute in the user profile to store the clock drift. If left empty then clock drift checking is disabled.

The name of the attribute used to store the last observed clock drift which is used to indicated when a manual resynchronisation is required.

truncationOffset.title: Truncation Offset
truncationOffset.description:
This adds an offset to the generation of the OTP.

This is an option used by the HOTP algorithm that not all devices support. This should be left default unless you know your device uses a offset.

timeStepSize.title: TOTP Time Step Interval
timeStepSize.description:
The TOTP time step in seconds that the OTP device uses to generate the OTP.

This is the time interval that one OTP is valid for. For example, if the time step is 30 seconds, then a new OTP will be generated every 30 seconds. This makes a single OTP valid for only 30 seconds.

forgerock-oath-sharedsecret-implementati.title: The Shared Secret Provider Class
forgerock-oath-sharedsecret-implementati.description:
The fully qualified class name for the Shared Secret Provider extension.

The class that is used to process the user profile attribute used to store the user secret key.

oathOtpMaxRetry.title: One Time Password Max Retry
oathOtpMaxRetry.description: The number of times entry of the OTP may be attempted. Minimum is 1 maximum is 10 and default is 3.

minimumSecretKeyLength.title: Minimum Secret Key Length
minimumSecretKeyLength.description: Number of hexadecimal characters allowed for the Secret Key.

lastLoginTimeAttribute.title: Last Login Time Attribute
lastLoginTimeAttribute.description:
Attribute to store the time of the users last login. This is required if TOTP is chosen as the OATH algorithm.

This attribute stores the last time a user logged in to prevent time based attacks. The value is stored as a number (Unix Time).

stepsInWindow.title: TOTP Time Steps
stepsInWindow.description:
The number of time steps to check before and after receiving a OTP.

This is the number of time step intervals to check the received OTP against both forward in time and back in time. For example, with 2 time steps and a time step interval of 30 seconds the server will allow a clock drift between client and server of 89 seconds. (2-30 second steps and 29 seconds for the interval that the OTP arrived in)

authenticationLevel.title: Authentication Level
authenticationLevel.description:
The authentication level associated with this module.

Each authentication module has an authentication level that can be used to indicate the level of security associated with the module; 0 is the lowest (and the default).

addChecksum.title: Add Checksum Digit
addChecksum.description:
This adds a checksum digit to the OTP.

This adds a digit to the end of the OTP generated to be used as a checksum to verify the OTP was generated correctly. This is in addition to the actual password length. You should only set this if your device supports it.

1.0.title: Push Notification Response
1.0.description:
Push Authentication depends on the secure verification of information sent from the server to the client, and from the client to the server. This allows the server to verify that the notification was received by the original device, and for the device to verify that only the server sent out the original request.

This endpoint provides the place for the device to return responses to the server to requests received either by QR code or by push notification.

actions.description: Message sent from device to server in response to a request for authentication sent to the device via Push notification. This message is generally sent from the ForgeRock Authenticator app.
actions.name: authenticate

jwt.title: JWT
jwt.description:
Signed JWT containing claims:
* `response`: Response to challenge (Base64 encoding of the HmacSHA256 hashing of the decoded shared secret and the decoded challenge)
* `deny`: Indication that this auth attempt should be shut down (boolean)

errors.description: Either the message ID was invalid, could not be found, or could not be validated using the provided claims in the JWT.

actions.description: Message sent from device to server in response to a registration message received on the device via a QR code. This message is generally sent from the ForgeRock Authenticator app.
actions.name: register

jwt.title: JWT
jwt.description:
Signed JWT containing claims:
* `response`: Response to challenge (Base64 encoding of the HmacSHA256 hashing of the decoded shared secret and the decoded challenge)
* `mechanismUid`: The device-specific identifier for the just-registered mechanism (string)
* `deviceId`: The registration token used by GCM or APNS (string)
* `deviceType`: `android` or `ios` (string)
* `communicationType`: `gcm` or `apns` (string)

errors.description: Either the message ID was invalid, could not be found, or could not be validated using the provided claims in the JWT.

authenticationLevel.title: Authentication Level
authenticationLevel.description:
The authentication level associated with this module.

Each authentication module has an authentication level that can be used to indicate the level of security associated with the module; 0 is the lowest (and the default).

trustedKerberosRealms.title: Trusted Kerberos realms
trustedKerberosRealms.description:
List of trusted Kerberos realms for User Kerberos tickets.

If realms are configured, then Kerberos tickets are only accepted if the realm part of the UserPrincipalName of the Users Kerberos ticket matches a realm from the list.

kerberosRealm.title: Kerberos Realm
kerberosRealm.description: The name of the Kerberos (Active Directory) realm used for authentication

keytabFileName.title: Keytab File Name
keytabFileName.description:
The path of the AD keytab file

This is the absolute pathname of the AD keytab file. The keytab file is generated by the Active Directory server.

principalName.title: Service Principal
principalName.description:
The name of the Kerberos principal used during authentication

This principal must match the name used in the keytab file created from the Active Directory server.
The format of the field is as follows:

HTTP/openam.forgerock.com@AD_DOMAIN.COM

returnPrincipalWithDomainName.title: Return Principal with Domain Name
returnPrincipalWithDomainName.description: Returns the fully qualified name of the authenticated user rather than just the username.

kerberosServiceIsinitiator.title: isInitiator
kerberosServiceIsinitiator.description: Configuration used for JDK Kerbrose LoginModule. True, if initiator. False, if acceptor only. Default is true

kerberosServerName.title: Kerberos Server Name
kerberosServerName.description: The hostname/IP address of the Kerberos (Active Directory) server.

lookupUserInRealm.title: Search for the user in the realm
lookupUserInRealm.description:
Validate that the user has a matched user profile configured in the data store.

If this option is enabled, the module validates whether the account corresponds to a user profile in the Data Store for the realm. The attributes to perform the search are configured under Access Control > Realm Name > Authentication > All Core settings > Alias Search Attribute Name.

Each authentication module has an authentication level that can be used to indicate the level of security associated with the module; 0 is the lowest (and the default).

additionalProperties.title: Other properties
additionalProperties.description: Any additional properties for the item (varies based on the schema of the type)

validQueryAttributes.title: Valid Query Attributes
validQueryAttributes.description: Specifies the valid query attributes used to search for the user. This is a list of attributes used to identify your account for forgotten password and forgotten username.

kbaQuestions.title: Security Questions
kbaQuestions.description:
Specifies the default set of knowledge-based authentication (KBA) security questions. The security questions can be set for the User Self-Registration, forgotten password reset, and forgotten username services, respectively.

Format is unique key|locale|question.

minimumAnswersToDefine.title: Minimum Answers to Define
minimumAnswersToDefine.description: Specifies the minimum number of KBA answers that users must define.

signingSecretKeyAlias.title: Signing Secret Key Alias
signingSecretKeyAlias.description: A signing secret key alias in the OpenAM server's JCEKS keystore. Used to sign the JWT token that OpenAM uses to track end users during User Self-Service operations.

minimumAnswersToVerify.title: Minimum Answers to Verify
minimumAnswersToVerify.description: Specifies the minimum number of KBA questions that users need to answer to be granted the privilege to carry out an action, such as registering for an account, resetting a password, or retrieving a username. Specify a value from 0 to 50.

encryptionKeyPairAlias.title: Encryption Key Pair Alias
encryptionKeyPairAlias.description: An encryption key alias in the OpenAM server's JCEKS keystore. Used to encrypt the JWT token that OpenAM uses to track end users during User Self-Service operations.

userRegistrationServiceConfigClass.title: User Registration Service Config Provider Class
userRegistrationServiceConfigClass.description: Specifies the provider class to configure any custom plugins.

forgottenUsernameServiceConfigClass.title: Forgotten Username Service Config Provider Class
forgottenUsernameServiceConfigClass.description: Specifies the provider class to configure any custom plugins.

forgottenPasswordConfirmationUrl.title: Forgotten Password Confirmation Email URL
forgottenPasswordConfirmationUrl.description: Specifies the confirmation URL that the user receives after confirming their identity during the forgotten password process. The ${realm} string is replaced with the current realm.

userRegistrationConfirmationUrl.title: User Registration Confirmation Email URL
userRegistrationConfirmationUrl.description: Specifies the confirmation URL that the user receives during the self-registration process. The ${realm} string is replaced with the current realm.

forgottenPasswordServiceConfigClass.title: Forgotten Password Service Config Provider Class
forgottenPasswordServiceConfigClass.description: Specifies the provider class to configure any custom plugins.

forgottenPasswordTokenTTL.title: Token Lifetime (seconds)
forgottenPasswordTokenTTL.description:
Maximum lifetime for the token allowing forgotten password reset, in seconds.

Specify a value from 0 to 2147483647.

numberOfAllowedAttempts.title: Lock Out After number of attempts
numberOfAllowedAttempts.description: Can be set to 1 or more attempts for a user to correctly answer all their security questions. After the number of configured attempts the user has not correctly answered them the password reset feature will be disabled.

forgottenPasswordEmailVerificationEnable.title: Email Verification
forgottenPasswordEmailVerificationEnable.description: If enabled, users who reset passwords must perform email address verification.

forgottenPasswordEmailSubject.title: Outgoing Email Subject
forgottenPasswordEmailSubject.description: Customize the forgotten password email subject text. Format is locale|subject text.

forgottenPasswordCaptchaEnabled.title: Captcha
forgottenPasswordCaptchaEnabled.description: If enabled, users must pass a Google reCAPTCHA challenge during password reset to mitigate against software bots.

forgottenPasswordKbaEnabled.title: Security Questions
forgottenPasswordKbaEnabled.description: If enabled, users must answer their security questions during the forgotten password process.

forgottenPasswordEmailBody.title: Outgoing Email Body
forgottenPasswordEmailBody.description: Customize the forgotten password email body text. Format is locale|body text.

numberOfAttemptsEnforced.title: Enforce password reset lockout
numberOfAttemptsEnforced.description: If enabled, users will be prevented from resetting their password after the configured number of failed attempts.

forgottenPasswordEnabled.title: Forgotten Password
forgottenPasswordEnabled.description: If enabled, users can reset their forgotten password.

userRegistrationEmailVerificationEnabled.title: Email Verification
userRegistrationEmailVerificationEnabled.description: If enabled, users who self-register must perform email address verification.

userRegistrationTokenTTL.title: Token Lifetime (seconds)
userRegistrationTokenTTL.description: Maximum lifetime of the token allowing User Self-Registration, in seconds.

userRegistrationValidUserAttributes.title: Valid Creation Attributes
userRegistrationValidUserAttributes.description: Specifies a whitelist of user attributes that can be set during user creation.

userRegisteredDestination.title: Destination After Successful Self-Registration
userRegisteredDestination.description:
Specifies the action to be taken after a user successfully registers a new account. Choose from:
  • default. User is sent to a success page without being logged in.
  • login. User is sent to the login page to authenticate.
  • autologin. User is automatically logged in and sent to the appropriate page.

userRegistrationKbaEnabled.title: Security Questions
userRegistrationKbaEnabled.description: If enabled, users must set up their security questions during the self-registration process.

userRegistrationEnabled.title: User Registration
userRegistrationEnabled.description: If enabled, new users can sign up for an account.

userRegistrationEmailSubject.title: Outgoing Email Subject
userRegistrationEmailSubject.description: Customize the User Self-Registration verification email subject text. Format is locale|subject text.

userRegistrationCaptchaEnabled.title: Captcha
userRegistrationCaptchaEnabled.description: If enabled, users must pass a Google reCAPTCHA challenge during user self-registration to mitigate against software bots.

userRegistrationEmailBody.title: Outgoing Email Body
userRegistrationEmailBody.description: Customize the User Self-Registration verification email body text. Format is: locale|body text.

userRegistrationEmailVerificationFirstEn.title: Verify Email before User Detail
userRegistrationEmailVerificationFirstEn.description: If enabled, email address verification will be performed first before user details screen is displayed. This will take effect only if Verify Email is enabled.

forgottenUsernameEmailSubject.title: Outgoing Email Subject
forgottenUsernameEmailSubject.description: Customizes the forgotten username email subject text. Format is locale|subject text.

forgottenUsernameEmailBody.title: Outgoing Email Body
forgottenUsernameEmailBody.description: Customizes the forgotten username email body text. Format is locale|body text.

forgottenUsernameEmailUsernameEnabled.title: Email Username
forgottenUsernameEmailUsernameEnabled.description: If enabled, users receive their forgotten username by email.

forgottenUsernameKbaEnabled.title: Security Questions
forgottenUsernameKbaEnabled.description: If enabled, users must answer their security questions during the forgotten username process.

forgottenUsernameCaptchaEnabled.title: Captcha
forgottenUsernameCaptchaEnabled.description: If enabled, users must pass a Google reCAPTCHA challenge during the forgotten username retrieval process to mitigate against software bots.

forgottenUsernameShowUsernameEnabled.title: Show Username
forgottenUsernameShowUsernameEnabled.description: If enabled, users see their forgotten username on the browser page.

forgottenUsernameEnabled.title: Forgotten Username
forgottenUsernameEnabled.description: If enabled, users can retrieve their forgotten username.

forgottenUsernameTokenTTL.title: Token LifeTime (seconds)
forgottenUsernameTokenTTL.description: Maximum lifetime for the token allowing forgotten username, in seconds.

profileProtectedUserAttributes.title: Protected Update Attributes
profileProtectedUserAttributes.description: Specifies a profile's protected user attributes, which causes re-authentication when the user attempts to modify these attributes.

remoteConsentResponseSigningAlg.title: Consent response signing algorithm
remoteConsentResponseSigningAlg.description: The signing algorithm to be used by the provider when verifying the signature of the consent response JWT received from the Remote Consent Service.

remoteConsentResponseEncryptionMethod.title: Consent response encryption method
remoteConsentResponseEncryptionMethod.description:
The encryption method to be used by the provider when decrypting the remote consent response JWT received from the Remote Consent Service.

AM supports the following token encryption algorithms:
  • A128GCM, A192GCM, and A256GCM - AES in Galois Counter Mode (GCM) authenticated encryption mode.
  • A128CBC-HS256, A192CBC-HS384, and A256CBC-HS512 - AES encryption in CBC mode, with HMAC-SHA-2 for integrity.

remoteConsentRedirectUrl.title: Redirect URL
remoteConsentRedirectUrl.description: The Remote Consent Service's URL to which the authorization server should redirect the user in order to obtain their consent.

remoteConsentRequestEncryptionEnabled.title: Enable consent request Encryption
remoteConsentRequestEncryptionEnabled.description: Enables encryption of the consent request JWT.

remoteConsentRequestEncryptionAlgorithm.title: Consent request Encryption Algorithm
remoteConsentRequestEncryptionAlgorithm.description: Encryption algorithm to be used when encrypting the consent request JWT.

requestTimeLimit.title: Consent Request Time Limit
requestTimeLimit.description: The amount of seconds for which the consent request JWT sent to the Remote Consent Service should be considered valid.

jwksCacheTimeout.title: JWKs URI content cache timeout in ms
jwksCacheTimeout.description: To avoid loading the JWKS URI content for every operation, the JWKS content is cached. This timeout defines the maximum amount of time the JWKS URI content can be cached before being refreshed.

remoteConsentRequestSigningAlgorithm.title: Consent request Signing Algorithm
remoteConsentRequestSigningAlgorithm.description: Signing algorithm to be used when signing the consent request JWT.

jwkSet.title: Json Web Key
jwkSet.description: Raw JSON Web Key value containing the Remote Consent Service's public keys.

jwksUri.title: Json Web Key URI
jwksUri.description: The URI containing the public keys of the Remote Consent Service secret. The public keys are in the Json Web Key (jwk) format.

jwkStoreCacheMissCacheTime.title: JWKs URI content cache miss cache time
jwkStoreCacheMissCacheTime.description: To avoid loading the JWKS URI content for every operation, especially when the kid is not in the jwks content already cached, the JWKS content will be cached for a minimum period of time. This cache miss cache time defines the minimum amount of time the JWKS URI content is cached.

remoteConsentRequestEncryptionMethod.title: Consent request Encryption Method
remoteConsentRequestEncryptionMethod.description: Encryption method to be used when encrypting the consent request JWT.

remoteConsentResponseEncryptionAlgorithm.title: Consent response encryption algorithm
remoteConsentResponseEncryptionAlgorithm.description: The encryption algorithm to be used by the provider when decrypting the remote consent response JWT received from the Remote Consent Service.

1.0.description: Agent Groups handler that is responsible for managing agent groups

resourceSchema.title: Application
resourceSchema.description: Application schema

name.title: Name
name.description: Unique application identifier.

displayName.title: Display name
displayName.description: When defined, it is displayed in the UI instead of application name.

applicationType.title: Application type
applicationType.description: Name of the application type used as a template for the policy set.

items.title: Conditions
items.description: Condition types allowed in the context of the policy set.

items.title: Subjects
items.description: Subject types allowed in the context of the policy set.

items.title: Resource type uuids
items.description: A list of the UUIDs of the resource types associated with the policy set.

entitlementCombiner.title: Entitlement combiner
entitlementCombiner.description: Name of the decision combiner, such as "DenyOverride".

searchIndex.title: Search index
searchIndex.description: Class name of the implementation for searching indexes for resource names, such as "com.sun.identity.entitlement.util.ResourceNameSplitter" for URL resource names.

saveIndex.title: Save index
saveIndex.description: Class name of the implementation for creating indexes for resource names, such as "com.sun.identity.entitlement.util.ResourceNameIndexGenerator" for URL resource names.

resourceComparator.title: Resource comparator
resourceComparator.description: Class name of the resource comparator implementation used in the context of the policy set. The following implementations are available: "com.sun.identity.entitlement.ExactMatchResourceName", "com.sun.identity.entitlement.PrefixResourceName", "com.sun.identity.entitlement.RegExResourceName", "com.sun.identity.entitlement.URLResourceName".

items.title: Attribute names
items.description: A list of attribute names such as cn. The list is used to aid policy indexing and lookup.

createdBy.title: Created by
createdBy.description: A string containing the universal identifier DN of the subject that created the application.

lastModifiedBy.title: Last modified by
lastModifiedBy.description: A string containing the universal identifier DN of the subject that most recently updated the application. If the application has not been modified since it was created, this will be the same value as createdBy.

creationDate.title: Creation date
creationDate.description: An integer containing the creation date and time, in number of seconds since the Unix Epoch.

lastModifiedDate.title: Last modified date
lastModifiedDate.description: An integer containing the last modified date and time, in number of seconds since the Unix Epoch. If the application has not been modified since it was created, this will be the same value as creationDate.

editable.title: Editable
editable.description: It indicates if application is editable.

1.0.title: Applications
1.0.description: Service for manipulating Applications. It supports the CRUDQ operations.

create.description: Creates a new Application in a realm

errors.description:
Bad request error. The cause can be the following:
* The header "Content-Type"="application/json" is missing in the request
* "applicationType" or "name" properties are missing in the json of the application to be created.

Unauthorized error. The cause can be the following:
The SSO header is missing in the request or user token is not valid.

Conflict error. The cause can be the following:
The application to be created already exists.

errors.description:
Unauthorized error. The cause can be the following:

Not found error. The cause can be the following:
Either application or realm does not exist.

errors.description:
Bad request error. The cause can be the following:
* The header "Content-Type"="application/json" is missing in the request
* Application name specified in URL does not match application name specified in JSON.

Unauthorized error. The cause can be the following:
The SSO header is missing in the request or user token is not valid.

Forbidden error. The cause can be the following:
The user has insufficient privileges.

Not found error. The cause can be the following:
Either application or realm does not exist.

errors.description:

The SSO header is missing in the request or user token is not valid.

Not found error. The cause can be the following:
Either application or realm does not exist.

saveUserAttributesToSession.title: Save Attributes in the Session
saveUserAttributesToSession.description: If this option is enabled, the attributes configured in the attribute mapper will be saved into the OpenAM session

tokenEndpoint.title: Access Token Endpoint URL
tokenEndpoint.description: OAuth access token endpoint URL This is the URL endpoint for access token retrieval provided by the OAuth Identity Provider.Refer to the RFC 6749 (http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749#section-3.2), section 3.2

provider.title: Social Provider
provider.description: Social Provider for which this module is being setup.

scopeString.title: OAuth Scope
scopeString.description:
List of user profile properties

According to the OAuth 2.0 Authorization Framework, scope is a space-separated list of user profile attributes that the client application requires. The list depends on the permissions that the resource owner grants to the client application. Some authorization servers use non-standard separators for scopes.

clientId.title: Client ID
clientId.description:
OAuth client_id parameter

For more information on the OAuth client_id parameter refer to the RFC 6749 (http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749#section-2.3.1), section 2.3.1

cfgAttributeMappingConfiguration.title: Attribute Mapper Configuration
cfgAttributeMappingConfiguration.description: Mapping of OAuth attributes to local OpenAM attributes Attribute configuration that will be used to map the user info obtained from the OAuth 2.0 Provider to the local user data store in the OpenAM. Example: OAuth2.0_attribute=local_attribute

cfgAccountProviderClass.title: Account Provider
cfgAccountProviderClass.description: Name of the class implementing the account provider. This class is used by the module to find the account from the attributes mapped by the Account Mapper org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.AccountProvider interface. String constructor parameters can be provided by appending | separated values.

cfgAccountMapperConfiguration.title: Account Mapper Configuration
cfgAccountMapperConfiguration.description: Mapping of OAuth account to local OpenAM account Attribute configuration that will be used to map the account of the user authenticated in the OAuth 2.0 Provider to the local data store in the OpenAM. Example: OAuth2.0_attribute=local_attribute

cfgAccountMapperClass.title: Account Mapper
cfgAccountMapperClass.description: Name of the class implementing the attribute mapping for the account search. This class is used by the module to map from the account information received from the OAuth Identity Provider into OpenAM. The class must implement the org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.AttributeMapper interface. Provided implementations are: org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.JsonAttributeMapper org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.oidc.JwtAttributeMapper(can only be used when using the openid scope) String constructor parameters can be provided by appending | separated values.

cfgAttributeMappingClasses.title: Attribute Mapper
cfgAttributeMappingClasses.description: Name of the class that implements the attribute mapping This class maps the OAuth properties into OpenAM properties. A custom attribute mapper can be provided. A custom attribute mapper must implement the org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.AttributeMapper interface. Provided implementations are: org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.JsonAttributeMapper org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.oidc.JwtAttributeMapper (can only be used when using the openid scope)

issuer.title: Token Issuer
issuer.description: Required when the 'openid' scope is included. Value must match the iss field in issued ID Token e.g. accounts.google.com The issuer value MUST be provided when OAuth 2.0 Mix-Up Mitigation is enabled.

cfgMixUpMitigation.title: OAuth 2.0 Mix-Up Mitigation Enabled
cfgMixUpMitigation.description: Enables OAuth 2.0 mix-up mitigation The authorization server must support the OAuth 2.0 Mix-Up Mitigation draft (https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-oauth-mix-up-mitigation-01#section-3.1), otherwise OpenAM will fail to validate responses from the authorization server. If only the OAuth 2.0 protocol is utilized, make sure that the accepted issuer value is set in the "Token Issuer" setting.

userInfoEndpoint.title: User Profile Service URL
userInfoEndpoint.description:
User profile information URL

This URL endpoint provides user profile information and is provided by the OAuth Identity Provider NB This URL should return JSON objects in response

clientSecret.title: Client Secret
clientSecret.description:
OAuth client_secret parameter

For more information on the OAuth client_id parameter refer to the RFC 6749 (http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749#section-2.3.1), section 2.3.1

basicAuth.title: Use Basic Auth
basicAuth.description: When enabled, the client will use basic auth for authenticating with the social auth provider. Enabled by default.

authorizeEndpoint.title: Authentication Endpoint URL
authorizeEndpoint.description:
OAuth authentication endpoint URL

This is the URL endpoint for OAuth authentication provided by the OAuth Identity Provider

resourceComparator.title: Resource comparator
resourceComparator.description:
Class name of the resource comparator implementation used in the context of this application type
The following implementations are available:
* "com.sun.identity.entitlement.ExactMatchResourceName"
* "com.sun.identity.entitlement.PrefixResourceName"
* "com.sun.identity.entitlement.RegExResourceName"
* "com.sun.identity.entitlement.URLResourceName"

saveIndex.title: Save index
saveIndex.description: Class name of the implementation for creating indexes for resource names, such as "com.sun.identity.entitlement.util.ResourceNameIndexGenerator" for URL resource names

searchIndex.title: Search index
searchIndex.description: Class name of the implementation for searching indexes for resource names, such as "com.sun.identity.entitlement.util.ResourceNameSplitter" for URL resource names

applicationClassName.title: Application class name
applicationClassName.description: Class name of the application type implementation, such as "com.sun.identity.entitlement.Application"

1.0.title: Application Types
1.0.description: Service for reading and listing the available application types. Application types act as templates for policy sets, and define how to compare resources and index policies. OpenAM provides a default application type that represents web resources called iPlanetAMWebAgentService

queries.description: Lists the application types using a query filter

errors.description: Internal server error. Unknown Subject

read.description: Reads an individual application type by the provided application type name

errors.description: Internal server error. Unknown Subject

pathParameter.name: resourceId
pathParameter.description: Application type name unique identifier

resourceSchema.title: Subject types schema
resourceSchema.description: Subject types schema

title.title: Title
title.description: The title and also the unique identifier of the subject condition type

logical.title: Logical
logical.description: Indicates whether the type is a logical operator or takes a predicate, and a configuration specification

config.title: Configuration
config.description: The configuration specification that describes the subject condition type's Json schema

1.0.title: Subject Types
1.0.description: Service for querying and reading the subject types stored in OpenAM. Subject condition types describe the JSON representation of subject conditions that you can use in policy definitions

queries.description: Query the list of subject condition types

read.description: Read an individual subject condition type by providing the unique identifier title

errors.description: Not found error. Requested subject short name not found

pathParameter.name: resourceId
pathParameter.description: The unique identifier title of subject condition type

password.title: Mail Server Authentication Password
password.description: The password to use when the mail server is using SMTP authentication

smsGatewayImplementationClass.title: Gateway Implementation Class
smsGatewayImplementationClass.description:
The OTP SMS Sender node uses this class to send SMS messages.

The gateway class must implement the following interface:
com.sun.identity.authentication.modules.hotp.SMSGateway

sslOption.title: Mail Server Secure Connection
sslOption.description: This setting controls whether the authentication module communicates with the mail server using SSL/TLS.

username.title: Mail Server Authentication Username
username.description: The username to use when the mail server is using SMTP authentication

fromEmailAddress.title: Email From Address
fromEmailAddress.description: Emails from the OTP Email Sender node will come from this address.

hostPort.title: Mail Server Host Port
hostPort.description: The port of the mail server. The default port for SMTP is 25, if using SSL the default port is 465.

hostName.title: Mail Server Host Name
hostName.description: The name of the mail server OpenAM will use to send the messages.

mobileCarrierAttributeName.title: Mobile Carrier Attribute Name
mobileCarrierAttributeName.description: This is the attribute name used for a mobile carrier domain for sending SMS messages.

mobilePhoneAttributeName.title: Mobile Phone Number Attribute Name
mobilePhoneAttributeName.description: This is the attribute name used for a requested text message.

authenticatorWebAuthnDeviceSettingsEncry.title: Device Profile Encryption Scheme
authenticatorWebAuthnDeviceSettingsEncry.description:
Encryption scheme to use to secure device profiles stored on the server.

If enabled, each device profile is encrypted using a unique random secret key using the given strength of AES encryption in CBC mode with PKCS#5 padding. An HMAC-SHA of the given strength (truncated to half-size) is used to ensure integrity protection and authenticated encryption. The unique random key is encrypted with the given RSA key pair and stored with the device profile.

Note: AES-256 may require installation of the JCE Unlimited Strength policy files.

authenticatorWebAuthnDeviceSettingsEncry.title: Encryption Key Store
authenticatorWebAuthnDeviceSettingsEncry.description: Path to the key store from which to load encryption keys.

authenticatorWebAuthnDeviceSettingsEncry.title: Private Key Password
authenticatorWebAuthnDeviceSettingsEncry.description: Password to unlock the private key.

webauthnAttrName.title: Profile Storage Attribute
webauthnAttrName.description:
The user's attribute in which to store WebAuthn profiles.

The default attribute is added to the schema when you prepare a user store for use with AM. If you want to use a different attribute, you must make sure to add it to your user store schema prior to deploying webauthn with AM. AM must be able to write to the attribute.

authenticatorWebAuthnDeviceSettingsEncry.title: Key-Pair Alias
authenticatorWebAuthnDeviceSettingsEncry.description: Alias of the certificate and private key in the key store. The private key is used to encrypt and decrypt device profiles.

authenticatorWebAuthnDeviceSettingsEncry.title: Key Store Password
authenticatorWebAuthnDeviceSettingsEncry.description: Password to unlock the key store. This password is encrypted when it is saved in the OpenAM configuration. You should modify the default value.

authenticatorWebAuthnDeviceSettingsEncry.title: Key Store Type
authenticatorWebAuthnDeviceSettingsEncry.description:
Type of key store to load.

Note: PKCS#11 key stores require hardware support such as a security device or smart card and is not available by default in most JVM installations.

See the JDK 8 PKCS#11 Reference Guide for more details.
