pathParameter.name: uuid
pathParameter.description: The unique identifier of the Push authentication user device

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: The identifier for the user for which the request is regarding.

emailAttribute.title: Email attribute in the Response
emailAttribute.description:
Attribute from the response used to send activation code emails.

The attribute in the response from the profile service of the Provider that contains the email address of the authenticated user. This address will be used to send an email with an activation code when the accounts are allowed to be created dynamically.

smtpFromAddress.title: SMTP From address
smtpFromAddress.description: The email address on behalf of whom the messages will be sent

smtpHost.title: SMTP host
smtpHost.description: The mail host that will be used by the Email Gateway implementation

emailGateway.title: Mail Server Gateway implementation class
emailGateway.description:
The class used by the module to send email.

This class is used by the module to send email. A custom implementation can be provided.

The custom implementation must implement the org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.oauth2.EmailGateway

smtpPort.title: SMTP port
smtpPort.description: The TCP port that will be used by the SMTP gateway

smtpUsername.title: SMTP User Name
smtpUsername.description: If the SMTP Service requires authentication, configure the user name here

smtpPassword.title: SMTP User Password
smtpPassword.description: The Password of the SMTP User Name

smtpSslEnabled.title: SMTP SSL Enabled
smtpSslEnabled.description: Tick this option if the SMTP Server provides SSL

promptPasswordFlag.title: Prompt for password setting and activation code
promptPasswordFlag.description:
Users must set a password and complete the activation flow during dynamic profile creation.

If this is enabled, the user must set a password before the system creates an account dynamically and an activation code will be sent to the user's email address. The account will be created only if the password and activation code are properly set.
If this is disabled, the account will be created transparently without prompting the user.

enableRegistrationService.title: Use IDM as Registration Service
enableRegistrationService.description:
Whether to use IDM as an external Registration Service to complete registration for new users.

IDM is called and passed these parameters:

  • clientToken: Signed, encrypted JWT of the OAuth 2.0 authentication state.
  • returnParams: Encoded URL parameters, required to be returned to AM to resume authentication after registration in IDM is complete.

anonymousUserName.title: Anonymous User
anonymousUserName.description:
Username of the OpenAM anonymous user

The username of the user that will represent the anonymous user. This user account must already exist in the realm.

createAccount.title: Create account if it does not exist
createAccount.description:
If the OAuth2 account does not exist in the local OpenAM data store, an account will be created dynamically.

If this is enabled, the account mapper could create the account dynamically if there is no account mapped. Before creating the account, a dialog prompting for a password and asking for an activation code can be shown if the parameter "Prompt for password setting and activation code" is enabled.

If this flag is not enabled, 3 alternative options exist:

  1. The accounts need to have a user profile in the OpenAM User Data Store
  2. The user does not have a user profile and the "Ignore Profile" is set in the Authentication Service of the realm.
  3. The account is mapped to an anonymous account (see parameter "Map to anonymous user" and "Anonymous User")

attributeMappingClasses.title: Attribute Mapper
attributeMappingClasses.description:
Name of the class that implements the attribute mapping

This class maps the OAuth properties into OpenAM properties. A custom attribute mapper can be provided.

A custom attribute mapper must implement the org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.AttributeMapper interface.
Provided implementations are:
  • org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.JsonAttributeMapper
  • org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.oidc.JwtAttributeMapper (can only be used when using the openid scope)
String constructor parameters can be provided by appending | separated values.

accountMapperConfiguration.title: Account Mapper Configuration
accountMapperConfiguration.description:
Mapping of OAuth account to local OpenAM account

Attribute configuration that will be used to map the account of the user authenticated in the OAuth 2.0 Provider to the local data store in the OpenAM. Example: OAuth2.0_attribute=local_attribute

attributeMapperConfiguration.title: Attribute Mapper Configuration
attributeMapperConfiguration.description:
Mapping of OAuth attributes to local OpenAM attributes

Attribute configuration that will be used to map the user info obtained from the OAuth 2.0 Provider to the local user data store in the OpenAM.

Example: OAuth2.0_attribute=local_attribute

mapToAnonymousUser.title: Map to anonymous user
mapToAnonymousUser.description:
Enabled anonymous user access to OpenAM for OAuth authenticated users

If selected, the authenticated users in the OAuth 2.0 Provider will be mapped to the anonymous user configured in the next parameter.
If not selected the users authenticated will be mapped by the parameters configured in the account mapper.

NB If Create account if it does not exist is enabled, that parameter takes precedence.

accountProviderClass.title: Account Provider
accountProviderClass.description:
Name of the class implementing the account provider.

This class is used by the module to find the account from the attributes mapped by the Account Mapper org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.AccountProvider interface.
String constructor parameters can be provided by appending | separated values.

saveAttributesInSession.title: Save attributes in the session
saveAttributesInSession.description: If this option is enabled, the attributes configured in the attribute mapper will be saved into the OpenAM session

accountMapperClass.title: Account Mapper
accountMapperClass.description:
Name of the class implementing the attribute mapping for the account search.

This class is used by the module to map from the account information received from the OAuth Identity Provider into OpenAM.

The class must implement the org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.AttributeMapper interface.
Provided implementations are:
  • org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.JsonAttributeMapper
  • org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.oidc.JwtAttributeMapper (can only be used when using the openid scope)
String constructor parameters can be provided by appending | separated values.

subjectProperty.title: Subject Property
subjectProperty.description: Property used to identify which attribute an auth server identifies a user by.

clientSecret.title: Client Secret
clientSecret.description:
OAuth client_secret parameter

For more information on the OAuth client_secret parameter refer to the RFC 6749, section 2.3.1

ssoProxyUrl.title: Proxy URL
ssoProxyUrl.description:
The URL to the OpenAM OAuth proxy JSP

This URL should only be changed from the default, if an external server is performing the GET to POST proxying. The default is /openam/oauth2c/OAuthProxy.jsp

clientId.title: Client Id
clientId.description:
OAuth client_id parameter

For more information on the OAuth client_id parameter refer to the RFC 6749, section 2.3.1

authorizeEndpoint.title: Authentication Endpoint URL
authorizeEndpoint.description:
OAuth authentication endpoint URL

This is the URL endpoint for OAuth authentication provided by the OAuth Identity Provider

usesBasicAuth.title: Use Basic Auth
usesBasicAuth.description: When enabled, the client will use basic auth for authenticating with  the social auth provider. Enabled by default.

userInfoEndpoint.title: User Profile Service URL
userInfoEndpoint.description:
User profile information URL

This URL endpoint provides user profile information and is provided by the OAuth Identity Provider

NB This URL should return JSON objects in response

provider.title: Social Provider
provider.description: Social Provider for which this module is being setup.

scopeDelimiter.title: Scope Delimiter
scopeDelimiter.description: Delimiter used to separate scope values. Default value is space.

authenticationLevel.title: Authentication Level
authenticationLevel.description:
The authentication level associated with this module.

Each authentication module has an authentication level that can be used to indicate the level of security associated with the module; 0 is the lowest (and the default).

tokenEndpoint.title: Access Token Endpoint URL
tokenEndpoint.description:
OAuth access token endpoint URL

This is the URL endpoint for access token retrieval provided by the OAuth Identity Provider. Refer to the RFC 6749, section 3.2

scope.title: Scope
scope.description:
OAuth scope; list of user profile properties

According to the OAuth 2.0 Authorization Framework, scope is a space-separated list of user profile attributes that the client application requires. The list depends on the permissions that the resource owner grants to the client application.

Some authorization servers use non-standard separators for scopes. For example, Facebook takes a comma-separated list.

actions.description: Obtain the collection of all secondary configuration types related to the resource.
actions.name: getAllTypes

response.title: Types response
response.description: A collection of type objects in response to the request

actions.description: Obtain the collection of secondary configuration types that have yet to be added to the resource.
actions.name: getCreatableTypes

response.title: Types response
response.description: A collection of type objects in response to the request

actions.description: Obtain the collection of secondary configuration instances that have been added to the resource.
actions.name: nextdescendents

response.title: Next Descendents response
response.description: The collection of next descendents beneath this endpoint

_id.title: ID
_id.description: The identifier of the item within its type

additionalProperties.title: Other properties
additionalProperties.description: Any additional properties for the item (varies based on the schema of the type)

soap-keystore-filename.title: Soap Keystore Location
soap-keystore-filename.description: The location of the keystore which contains the key state necessary for the CXF and WSS4j runtime to enforce the SecurityPolicy bindings associated with this STS instance.

soap-encryption-key-alias.title: Decryption Key Alias
soap-encryption-key-alias.description: Alias of key used by the STS to decrypt client messages in the asymmetric binding, and to decrypt the client-generated symmetric key in the symmetric binding. Corresponds to an STS PrivateKeyEntry.

soap-signature-key-alias.title: Signature Key Alias
soap-signature-key-alias.description: Alias of key used to sign messages from STS. Necessary for asymmetric binding.

delegation-validated-token-types.title: Delegated Token Types
delegation-validated-token-types.description:
If delegation relationships are supported, out-of-the-box validation support for the validation of username and OpenAM session tokens included as the ActAs/OnBehalfOf element is configured here. If delegation relationships are supported, out-of-the-box validation support for the validation of username and OpenAM session tokens included as the ActAs/OnBehalfOf element is configured here.

If a value is selected in this list, then no Custom Delegation Handlers must be specified. The true/false value indicates whether the interim OpenAM session, created as part of delegated token validation, should be invalidated following token creation.

deployment-am-url.title: OpenAM URL
deployment-am-url.description:
Set to URL of the OpenAM instance or site deployment.

The OpenAM deployment will be consulted for published soap-sts instances, and to authenticate and issue tokens.

deployment-custom-service-port.title: Custom Port QName
deployment-custom-service-port.description:
The name attribute of the wsdl:Port element referenced in the Custom wsdl File, in QName format.

Example: {http://docs.oasis-open.org/ws-sx/ws-trust/200512/}service_port_name

deployment-custom-wsdl-location.title: Custom wsdl File
deployment-custom-wsdl-location.description:
The location (on soap-sts .war accessible filesystem or soap-sts .war classpath) of the custom wsdl file.

If the signing and/or encryption of the request and/or response messages specified in the SecurityPolicy bindings of standard soap-sts wdsl files must be customized, specify the name of the customized wsdl file here. See documentation for additional details.

delegation-relationship-supported.title: Delegation Relationships Supported
delegation-relationship-supported.description:
Check if the RST will include ActAs/OnBehalfOf token elements

If SAML2 assertions with SenderVouches SubjectConfirmation are to be issued, this box must be checked.

deployment-wsdl-location.title: Wsdl File Referencing Security Policy Binding Selection
deployment-wsdl-location.description:
Choose the SupportingToken type and corresponding SecurityPolicy binding which will protect your sts instance. This choice will determine the SecurityPolicy bindings in the wsdl file defining the WS-Trust API

Note that the SupportingToken type selected must correspond to the Security Policy Validated Token selection. Note if a custom wsdl file is chose, the user is responsible for providing a properly formatted wsdl file. See documentation for details.

deployment-auth-target-mappings.title: Authentication Target Mappings
deployment-auth-target-mappings.description:
Configuration of consumption of OpenAM's rest-authN

Each deployed STS is configured with the authentication targets for each input token type for each supported token transformation. For example, if the transformation OPENIDCONNECT->SAML2 is supported, the STS instance must be configured with information specifying which elements of the OpenAM restful authentication context needs to be consumed to validate the OPENIDCONNECT token. The elements of the configuration tuple are separated by '|'.
The first element is the input token type in the token transform: i.e. X509, OPENIDCONNECT, USERNAME, or OPENAM. The second element is the authentication target - i.e. either 'module' or 'service', and the third element is the name of the authentication module or service. The fourth (optional) element provides the STS authentication context information about the to-be-consumed authentication context. When transforming OpenID Connect Id tokens, the OpenID Connect authentication module must be consumed, and thus a deployed rest-sts instance must be configured with the name of the header/cookie element where the OpenID Connect Id token will be placed. For this example, the following string would define these configurations: OPENIDCONNECT|module|oidc|oidc_id_token_auth_target_header_key=oidc_id_token. In this case, 'oidc' is the name of the OpenID Connect authentication module created to authenticate OpenID Connect tokens.
When transforming a X509 Certificate, the Certificate module must be consumed, and the published rest-sts instance must be configured with the name of the Certificate module (or the service containing the module), and the header name configured for the Certificate module corresponding to where the Certificate module can expect to find the to-be-validated Certificate. The following string would define these configurations: X509|module|cert_module|x509_token_auth_target_header_key=client_cert. In this case 'cert_module' is the name of the Certificate module, and client_cert is the header name where Certificate module has been configured to find the client's Certificate.

deployment-custom-service-name.title: Custom Service QName
deployment-custom-service-name.description:
The name attribute of the wsdl:Service element referenced in the Custom wsdl File, in QName format.

Example: {http://docs.oasis-open.org/ws-sx/ws-trust/200512/}service_name

delegation-custom-token-handlers.title: Custom Delegation Handlers
delegation-custom-token-handlers.description:
If delegation relationships are supported, the class names soap-sts .war file classpath resident implementations of the org.apache.cxf.sts.token.delegation.TokenDelegationHandler interface can be specified here.

Custom TokenDelegationHandler implementations will be invoked to validate the potentially custom token element included in the ActAs/OnBehalfOf element in the RequestSecurityToken invocation. Note that a TokenDelegationHandler does not need to be supplied to validate username or OpenAM session tokens. The validation of these tokens are supported out-of-the-box by selecting them in the Delegated Token Types list.

saml2-encryption-algorithm.title: Encryption Algorithm
saml2-encryption-algorithm.description: Algorithm used to encrypt generated assertions.

saml2-encrypt-assertion.title: Encrypt Assertion
saml2-encrypt-assertion.description: Check this box if the entire assertion should be encrypted. If this box is checked, the Encrypt NameID and Encrypt Attributes boxes cannot be checked.

saml2-custom-authn-context-mapper-class-.title: Custom Authentication Context Class Name
saml2-custom-authn-context-mapper-class-.description: If the AuthnContext mapping implemented by the org.forgerock.openam.sts.soap.token.provider.saml2.DefaultSaml2XmlTokenAuthnContextMapper class needs to be customized, implement the org.forgerock.openam.sts.soap.token.provider.saml2.Saml2XmlTokenAuthnContextMapper interface, and specify the name of the implementation here.

saml2-custom-authentication-statements-p.title: Custom AuthenticationStatements Class Name
saml2-custom-authentication-statements-p.description: If the AuthenticationStatements of the issued SAML2 assertion need to be customized, implement the org.forgerock.openam.sts.tokengeneration.saml2.statements.AuthenticationStatementsProvider interface, and specify the class name of the implementation here.

saml2-sp-acs-url.title: Service Provider Assertion Consumer Service Url
saml2-sp-acs-url.description: When issuing bearer assertions, the recipient attribute of the SubjectConfirmation element must be set to the Service Provider Assertion Consumer Service Url. See section 4.1.4.2 of Profiles for the OASIS Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) V2.0 for details. Value required when issuing Bearer assertions.

saml2-encryption-key-alias.title: Encryption Key Alias
saml2-encryption-key-alias.description: This alias corresponds to the SP's x509 Certificate identified by the SP Entity ID for this rest-sts instance. Not necessary unless assertions are to be encrypted.

saml2-encrypt-attributes.title: Encrypt Attributes
saml2-encrypt-attributes.description: Check this box if the assertion Attributes should be encrypted. If this box is checked, the Encrypt Assertion box cannot be checked.

saml2-custom-conditions-provider-class-n.title: Custom Conditions Provider Class Name
saml2-custom-conditions-provider-class-n.description: If the Conditions of the issued SAML2 assertion need to be customized, implement the org.forgerock.openam.sts.tokengeneration.saml2.statements.ConditionsProvider interface, and specify the class name of the implementation here.

saml2-custom-attribute-mapper-class-name.title: Custom Attribute Mapper Class Name
saml2-custom-attribute-mapper-class-name.description: If the class implementing attribute mapping for attributes contained in the issued SAML2 assertion needs to be customized, implement the org.forgerock.openam.sts.tokengeneration.saml2.statements.AttributeMapper interface, and specify the class name of the implementation here.

saml2-custom-authz-decision-statements-p.title: Custom Authorization Decision Statements Class Name
saml2-custom-authz-decision-statements-p.description: If the AuthorizationDecisionStatements of the issued SAML2 assertion need to be customized, implement the org.forgerock.openam.sts.tokengeneration.saml2.statements.AuthzDecisionStatementsProvider interface, and specify the class name of the implementation here.

saml2-encrypt-nameid.title: Encrypt NameID
saml2-encrypt-nameid.description: Check this box if the assertion NameID should be encrypted. If this box is checked, the Encrypt Assertion box cannot be checked.

saml2-signature-key-alias.title: Signature Key Alias
saml2-signature-key-alias.description: Corresponds to the private key of the IdP. Will be used to sign assertions. Value can remain unspecified unless assertions are signed.

saml2-attribute-map.title: Attribute Mappings
saml2-attribute-map.description:
Contains the mapping of assertion attribute names (Map keys) to local OpenAM attributes (Map values) in configured data stores.
Format: assertion_attr_name=ldap_attr_name

The DefaultAttributeMapper looks at profile attributes in configured data stores, or in Session properties. The keys will define the name of the attributes included in the Assertion Attribute statements, and the data pulled from the subject's directory entry or session state corresponding to the map value will define the value corresponding to this attribute name. The keys can have the format [NameFomatURI|]SAML ATTRIBUTE NAME. If the attribute value is enclosed in quotes, that quoted value will be included in the attribute without mapping. Binary attributes should be followed by ';binary'.
Examples:
  • EmailAddress=mail
  • Address=postaladdress
  • urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:attrname-format:uri|urn:mace:dir:attribute-def:cn=cn
  • partnerID="staticPartnerIDValue"
  • urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:attrname-format:uri|nameID="staticNameIDValue"
  • photo=photo;binary
  • urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:attrname-format:uri|photo=photo;binary

saml2-key-transport-algorithm.title: Key Transport Algorithm
saml2-key-transport-algorithm.description:
This setting controls the encryption algorithm used to encrypt the symmetric encryption key when SAML2 token encryption is enabled. Valid values include: 
http://www.w3.org/2001/04/xmlenc#rsa-1_5
, 
http://www.w3.org/2001/04/xmlenc#rsa-oaep-mgf1p
, and 
http://www.w3.org/2009/xmlenc11#rsa-oaep

saml2-sp-entity-id.title: Service Provider Entity Id
saml2-sp-entity-id.description: Values will be used to populate the Audiences of the AudienceRestriction element of the Conditions element. This value is required when issuing Bearer assertions. See section 4.1.4.2 of Profiles for the OASIS Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) V2.0 for details.

saml2-keystore-filename.title: KeystorePath
saml2-keystore-filename.description:
Path to keystore

Provide either the full filesystem path to a filesystem resident keystore, or a classpath-relative path to a keystore bundled in the OpenAM .war file. This keystore contains the IdP public/private keys and SP public key for signed and/or encrypted assertions. If assertions are neither signed nor encrypted, these values need not be specified.

saml2-custom-subject-provider-class-name.title: Custom Subject Provider Class Name
saml2-custom-subject-provider-class-name.description: If the Subject of the issued SAML2 assertion needs to be customized, implement the org.forgerock.openam.sts.tokengeneration.saml2.statements.SubjectProvider interface, and specify the class name of the implementation here.

saml2-custom-attribute-statements-provid.title: Custom AttributeStatements Class Name
saml2-custom-attribute-statements-provid.description: If the AttributeStatements of the issued SAML2 assertion need to be customized, implement the org.forgerock.openam.sts.tokengeneration.saml2.statements.AttributeStatementsProvider interface, and specify the class name of the implementation here.

oidc-signature-key-alias.title: KeyStore Signing Key Alias
oidc-signature-key-alias.description: For RSA-signed tokens, corresponds to the private key of the OIDC OP. Will be used to sign assertions.

oidc-public-key-reference-type.title: Public Key Reference Type
oidc-public-key-reference-type.description: For tokens signed with RSA, how should corresponding public key be referenced in the issued jwt

oidc-client-secret.title: Client Secret
oidc-client-secret.description:
For HMAC-signed tokens, the client secret used as the HMAC key

For HMAC-signed tokens, the KeyStore location, password, signature key alias and password configurations are not required.

oidc-audience.title: Issued Tokens Audience
oidc-audience.description: Contents will be set in the aud claim

oidc-claim-map.title: Claim Map
oidc-claim-map.description:
Contains the mapping of OIDC token claim names (Map keys) to local OpenAM attributes (Map values) in configured data stores. Format: claim_name=attribute_name

The keys in the map will be claim entries in the issued OIDC token, and the value of these claims will be the principal attribute state resulting from LDAP datastore lookup of the map values. If no values are returned from the LDAP datastore lookup of the attribute corresponding to the map value, no claim will be set in the issued OIDC token.

oidc-authorized-party.title: Authorized Party
oidc-authorized-party.description: Optional. Will be set in the azp claim

oidc-signature-algorithm.title: Token Signature Algorithm
oidc-signature-algorithm.description: Algorithm used to sign issued OIDC tokens

oidc-custom-authn-method-references-mapp.title: Custom Authn Methods References Mapper Class
oidc-custom-authn-method-references-mapp.description: If issued OIDC tokens are to contain amr claims, implement the org.forgerock.openam.sts.rest.token.provider.oidc.OpenIdConnectTokenAuthMethodReferencesMapper interface, and specify the class name of the implementation here.

oidc-keystore-location.title: KeyStore Location
oidc-keystore-location.description:
For RSA-signed tokens, the filesystem or classpath location of the KeyStore containing signing key entry

For RSA-signed tokens, the KeyStore location, password, signing-key alias, and signing key password must be specified. The client secret is not required for RSA-signed tokens.

oidc-custom-authn-context-mapper-class.title: Custom Authn Context Mapper Class
oidc-custom-authn-context-mapper-class.description: If issued OIDC tokens are to contain acr claims, implement the org.forgerock.openam.sts.rest.token.provider.oidc.OpenIdConnectTokenAuthnContextMapper interface, and specify the class name of the implementation here.

persist-issued-tokens-in-cts.title: Persist Issued Tokens in Core Token Store
persist-issued-tokens-in-cts.description:
Necessary to support token validation and cancellation

Validation of STS-issued tokens will involve determining whether the token has been issued, has not expired, and has not been cancelled. Token cancellation involves removing the record of this token from the CTS. Thus CTS persistence of STS-issued tokens is required to support these features.

issued-token-types.title: Issued Tokens
issued-token-types.description: Determines which tokens this soap STS instance will issue

security-policy-validated-token-config.title: Security Policy Validated Token
security-policy-validated-token-config.description: Determines the SupportingToken type in the WS-SecurityPolicy bindings in the soap STS' wsdl, and whether the interim OpenAM session resulting from successful SupportingToken validation, should be invalidated following token issue.

1.0.title: SOAP Security Token Services
1.0.description: The SOAP STS endpoint is responsible for storing the configuration of instances of REST Security Token Services (STS). Available operations are create, read, update, delete, query, schema and template.

extensionClassName.title: Extension class name
extensionClassName.description: If Extension class is selected as the Base URL source, enter org.forgerock.openam.services.baseurl.BaseURLProvider in the Extension class name field.

contextPath.title: Context path
contextPath.description:
Specifies the context path for the base URL.

If provided, the base URL includes the deployment context path appended to the calculated URL.

For example, /openam.

fixedValue.title: Fixed value base URL
fixedValue.description: If Fixed value is selected as the Base URL source, enter the base URL in the Fixed value base URL field.

source.title: Base URL Source
source.description:
Specifies the source of the base URL. Choose from the following:
  • Extension class. Specifies that the extension class returns a base URL from a provided HttpServletRequest. In the Extension class name field, enter org.forgerock.openam.services.baseurl.BaseURLProvider.
  • Fixed value. Specifies that the base URL is retrieved from a specific base URL value. In the Fixed value base URL field, enter the base URL value.
  • Forwarded header. Specifies that the base URL is retrieved from a forwarded header field in the HTTP request. The Forwarded HTTP header field is standardized and specified in RFC7239.
  • Host/protocol from incoming request. Specifies that the hostname, server name, and port are retrieved from the incoming HTTP request.
  • X-Forwarded-* headers. Specifies that the base URL is retrieved from non-standard header fields, such as X-Forwarded-For, X-Forwarded-By, and X-Forwarded-Proto.

response.description: A collection of type objects in response to the request

jwtSigningCompatibilityMode.title: Signing Compatibility Mode
jwtSigningCompatibilityMode.description:
Enable OpenAM to communicate with OpenIDM 6 and earlier.

When this option is enabled, OpenAM will sign JWTs in a way that is compatible with versions of OpenIDM 6 and earlier. The approach used is incompatible with non-extractable HSM keys. Disable this option if you have upgraded to OpenIDM 6.5, or later.

provisioningEncryptionKeyAlias.title: Encryption Key Alias
provisioningEncryptionKeyAlias.description: Alias of the encryption asymmetric key in AM's default keystore. Must be a duplicate of the asymmetric key used by IDM.

provisioningSigningKeyAlias.title: Signing Key Alias
provisioningSigningKeyAlias.description: Alias of the signing symmetric key in AM's default keystore. Must be a duplicate of the symmetric key used by IDM.

additionalProperties.description: Any additional properties for the item (varies based on the schema of the type)

connectionType.title: Connection Type
connectionType.description:
Controls how the authentication module will obtain the JDBC connection to the database.

If the connection type is non-persistent JDBC connection then the JDBC driver must be available to the OpenAM web-app. If the connection type is JNDI, the OpenAM web application deployment descriptor web.xml must be updated to include the correct JNDI JDBC resource information. The J2EE container must also be configured with the correct JNDI JDBC configuration.

username.title: Database Username
username.description:
This username will be used to authenticate to the database

NB Only used when connection type is JDBC

passwordColumn.title: Password Column Name
passwordColumn.description:
The name of the column in the database containing the user passwords

This property will be used to retrieve the correct column containing the password from the results table returned by the database

jdbcDriver.title: JDBC Driver
jdbcDriver.description:
The classname of the JDBC driver to use.

The fully qualified class name of the JDBC driver to use to connect to the database. Only Oracle or MySQL drivers are supported. JDBC drivers for other database may work, but the database will be treated as if it was Oracle.

NB Only used when connection type is JDBC

password.title: Database Password
password.description:
The password used to authenticate to the database

NB Only used when connection type is JDBC

jdbcUrl.title: JDBC URL
jdbcUrl.description:
The JDBC URL used to initialise the JDBC driver

NB Only used when connection type is JDBC

passwordStatement.title: Prepared Statement
passwordStatement.description:
The SQL statement used to search the database for user passwords

The SQL statement used to search the database for the user password. A single property of the supplied username is provided by the module. The result of the search should be a single row that contains the password for the user under the specified column.

authenticationLevel.title: Authentication Level
authenticationLevel.description:
The authentication level associated with this module.

Each authentication module has an authentication level that can be used to indicate the level of security associated with the module; 0 is the lowest (and the default).

passwordTransformClass.title: Class to Transform Password Syntax
passwordTransformClass.description:
This class is used to transform the supplied credentials from the database.

The default implementation for this property is ClearTextTransform that performs no transformation. If the supplied credentials need to be transformed before comparing with the password field retrieved from the database, a custom implementation should be provided. Any custom implementation must implement the following interface com.sun.identity.authentication.modules.jdbc.JDBCPasswordSyntaxTransform

connectionPoolJndiName.title: Connection Pool JNDI Name
connectionPoolJndiName.description:
The JNDI URL to the JDBC connection pool

The JNDI URL refers to the JDBC connection pool created in the J2EE container for the authentication database.

NB Only used when connection type is JNDI

com.sun.identity.sm.enableDataStoreNotif.title: Enable Datastore Notification
com.sun.identity.sm.enableDataStoreNotif.description: Specifies if backend datastore notification is enabled. If this value is set to 'false', then in-memory notification is enabled. (property name: com.sun.identity.sm.enableDataStoreNotification)

com.sun.identity.sm.notification.threadp.title: Notification Pool Size
com.sun.identity.sm.notification.threadp.description: Specifies the size of the sm notification thread pool (total number of threads). (property name: com.sun.identity.sm.notification.threadpool.size)

com.iplanet.am.event.connection.num.retr.title: Number of retries for Event Service connections
com.iplanet.am.event.connection.num.retr.description: Specifies the number of attempts made to successfully re-establish the Event Service connections. (property name: com.iplanet.am.event.connection.num.retries)

com.iplanet.am.event.connection.delay.be.title: Delay between Event Service connection retries
com.iplanet.am.event.connection.delay.be.description: Specifies the delay in milliseconds between retries to re-establish the Event Service connections. (property name: com.iplanet.am.event.connection.delay.between.retries)

com.iplanet.am.event.connection.ldap.err.title: Error codes for Event Service connection retries
com.iplanet.am.event.connection.ldap.err.description: This secifies the LDAP exception error codes for which retries to re-establish Event Service connections will trigger. (property name: com.iplanet.am.event.connection.ldap.error.codes.retries)

com.sun.am.event.connection.disable.list.title: Disabled Event Service Connection
com.sun.am.event.connection.disable.list.description: Specifies which event connection (persistent search) to be disabled. There are three valid values - aci, sm and um (case insensitive). Multiple values should be separated with ",". (property name: com.sun.am.event.connection.disable.list)

com.iplanet.am.ldap.connection.num.retri.title: Number of retries for LDAP Connection
com.iplanet.am.ldap.connection.num.retri.description: Specifies the number of attempts made to successfully re-establish LDAP Connection. (property name: com.iplanet.am.ldap.connection.num.retries)

com.iplanet.am.ldap.connection.delay.bet.title: Delay between LDAP connection retries
com.iplanet.am.ldap.connection.delay.bet.description: Specifies the delay in milliseconds between retries to re-establish the LDAP connections. (property name: com.iplanet.am.ldap.connection.delay.between.retries)

com.iplanet.am.ldap.connection.ldap.erro.title: Error codes for LDAP connection retries
com.iplanet.am.ldap.connection.ldap.erro.description: This secifies the LDAP exception error codes for which retries to re-establish LDAP connections will trigger. (property name: com.iplanet.am.ldap.connection.ldap.error.codes.retries)

com.iplanet.am.sdk.cache.maxSize.title: SDK Caching Max. Size
com.iplanet.am.sdk.cache.maxSize.description: Specifies the size of the cache when SDK caching is enabled. The size should be an integer greater than 0, or default size (10000) will be used. Changing this value will reset (clear) the contents of the cache. (property name: com.iplanet.am.sdk.cache.maxSize)

com.iplanet.am.sdk.cache.entry.expire.en.title: Cache Entry Expiration Enabled
com.iplanet.am.sdk.cache.entry.expire.en.description: If this property is set, the cache entries will expire based on the time specified in User Entry Expiration Time property. (property name: com.iplanet.am.sdk.cache.entry.expire.enabled)

com.iplanet.am.sdk.cache.entry.user.expi.title: User Entry Expiration Time
com.iplanet.am.sdk.cache.entry.user.expi.description: This property specifies time in minutes for which the user entries remain valid in cache after their last modification. After this specified period of time elapses (after the last modification/read from the directory), the data for the entry that is cached will expire. At that instant new requests for data for these user entries will result in reading from the Directory. (property name: com.iplanet.am.sdk.cache.entry.user.expire.time)

com.iplanet.am.sdk.cache.entry.default.e.title: Default Entry Expiration Time
com.iplanet.am.sdk.cache.entry.default.e.description: This property specifies time in minutes for which the non-user entries remain valid in cache after their last modification. After this specified period of time elapses (after the last modification/read from the directory), the data for the entry that is cached will expire. At that instant new requests for data for these non-user entries will result in reading from the Directory. (property name: com.iplanet.am.sdk.cache.entry.default.expire.time)

1.0.title: SDK Properties
1.0.description: An object of property key-value pairs

actions.description: Obtain the value schema for this resource.
actions.name: schema

parameters.name: serverName
parameters.description: Server identifier - either the server URL, or server number

smtpFromAddress.title: SMTP From address
smtpFromAddress.description: The email address on behalf of whom the messages will be sent

smtpPort.title: SMTP port
smtpPort.description: The TCP port that will be used by the SMTP gateway

emailGateway.title: Mail Server Gateway implementation class
emailGateway.description:
The class used by the module to send email.

This class is used by the module to send email. A custom implementation can be provided.

The custom implementation must implement the org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.oauth2.EmailGateway

emailAttribute.title: Email attribute in the Response
emailAttribute.description:
Attribute from the response used to send activation code emails.

The attribute in the response from the profile service of the Provider that contains the email address of the authenticated user. This address will be used to send an email with an activation code when the accounts are allowed to be created dynamically.

smtpUsername.title: SMTP User Name
smtpUsername.description: If the SMTP Service requires authentication, configure the user name here

smtpPassword.title: SMTP User Password
smtpPassword.description: The Password of the SMTP User Name

smtpHost.title: SMTP host
smtpHost.description: The mail host that will be used by the Email Gateway implementation

smtpSslEnabled.title: SMTP SSL Enabled
smtpSslEnabled.description: Tick this option if the SMTP Server provides SSL

enableRegistrationService.title: Use IDM as Registration Service
enableRegistrationService.description:
Whether to use IDM as an external Registration Service to complete registration for new users.

IDM is called and passed these parameters:

  • clientToken: Signed, encrypted JWT of the OAuth 2.0 authentication state.
  • returnParams: Encoded URL parameters, required to be returned to AM to resume authentication after registration in IDM is complete.

accountMapperClass.title: Account Mapper
accountMapperClass.description:
Name of the class implementing the attribute mapping for the account search.

This class is used by the module to map from the account information received from the OAuth Identity Provider into OpenAM.

The class must implement the org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.AttributeMapper interface.
Provided implementations are:
  • org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.JsonAttributeMapper
  • org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.oidc.JwtAttributeMapper (can only be used when using the openid scope)
String constructor parameters can be provided by appending | separated values.

attributeMapperConfiguration.title: Attribute Mapper Configuration
attributeMapperConfiguration.description:
Mapping of OAuth attributes to local OpenAM attributes

Attribute configuration that will be used to map the user info obtained from the OAuth 2.0 Provider to the local user data store in the OpenAM.

Example: OAuth2.0_attribute=local_attribute

attributeMappingClasses.title: Attribute Mapper
attributeMappingClasses.description:
Name of the class that implements the attribute mapping

This class maps the OAuth properties into OpenAM properties. A custom attribute mapper can be provided.

A custom attribute mapper must implement the org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.AttributeMapper interface.
Provided implementations are:
  • org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.JsonAttributeMapper
  • org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.oidc.JwtAttributeMapper (can only be used when using the openid scope)
String constructor parameters can be provided by appending | separated values.

accountMapperConfiguration.title: Account Mapper Configuration
accountMapperConfiguration.description:
Mapping of OAuth account to local OpenAM account

Attribute configuration that will be used to map the account of the user authenticated in the OAuth 2.0 Provider to the local data store in the OpenAM. Example: OAuth2.0_attribute=local_attribute

accountProviderClass.title: Account Provider
accountProviderClass.description:
Name of the class implementing the account provider.

This class is used by the module to find the account from the attributes mapped by the Account Mapper org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.AccountProvider interface.
String constructor parameters can be provided by appending | separated values.

saveAttributesInSession.title: Save attributes in the session
saveAttributesInSession.description: If this option is enabled, the attributes configured in the attribute mapper will be saved into the OpenAM session

anonymousUserName.title: Anonymous User
anonymousUserName.description:
Username of the OpenAM anonymous user

The username of the user that will represent the anonymous user. This user account must already exist in the realm.

createAccount.title: Create account if it does not exist
createAccount.description:
If the OAuth2 account does not exist in the local OpenAM data store, an account will be created dynamically.

If this is enabled, the account mapper could create the account dynamically if there is no account mapped. Before creating the account, a dialog prompting for a password and asking for an activation code can be shown if the parameter "Prompt for password setting and activation code" is enabled.

If this flag is not enabled, 3 alternative options exist:

  1. The accounts need to have a user profile in the OpenAM User Data Store
  2. The user does not have a user profile and the "Ignore Profile" is set in the Authentication Service of the realm.
  3. The account is mapped to an anonymous account (see parameter "Map to anonymous user" and "Anonymous User")

mapToAnonymousUser.title: Map to anonymous user
mapToAnonymousUser.description:
Enabled anonymous user access to OpenAM for OAuth authenticated users

If selected, the authenticated users in the OAuth 2.0 Provider will be mapped to the anonymous user configured in the next parameter.
If not selected the users authenticated will be mapped by the parameters configured in the account mapper.

NB If Create account if it does not exist is enabled, that parameter takes precedence.

promptPasswordFlag.title: Prompt for password setting and activation code
promptPasswordFlag.description:
Users must set a password and complete the activation flow during dynamic profile creation.

If this is enabled, the user must set a password before the system creates an account dynamically and an activation code will be sent to the user's email address. The account will be created only if the password and activation code are properly set.
If this is disabled, the account will be created transparently without prompting the user.

Some authorization servers use non-standard separators for scopes. For example, Facebook takes a comma-separated list.

format.title: File format
format.description:
Indicates what format is used to store the secrets in the files. The available options are:
  • Plain text: the secrets are stored as UTF-8 encoded text.
  • Base64 encoded: the secrets are stored as Base64 encoded binary values.
  • Encrypted text: the plain text secrets are encrypted using AM's encryption key.
  • Encrypted Base64 encoded: the Base64 encoded binary values are encrypted using AM's encryption key.
  • Encrypted HMAC key: the Base64 encoded binary representation of the HMAC key is encrypted using AM's encryption key. Use this format when working with non generic secrets.

suffix.title: File suffix
suffix.description: A suffix to add to the name of each secret to obtain the file name, such as ".txt" (defaults to no suffix).

issuer.title: Token Issuer
issuer.description: Required when the 'openid' scope is included. Value must match the iss field in issued ID Token e.g. accounts.google.com The issuer value MUST be provided when OAuth 2.0 Mix-Up Mitigation is enabled.

cfgMixUpMitigation.title: OAuth 2.0 Mix-Up Mitigation Enabled
cfgMixUpMitigation.description: Enables OAuth 2.0 mix-up mitigation The authorization server must support the OAuth 2.0 Mix-Up Mitigation draft (https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-oauth-mix-up-mitigation-01#section-3.1), otherwise OpenAM will fail to validate responses from the authorization server. If only the OAuth 2.0 protocol is utilized, make sure that the accepted issuer value is set in the "Token Issuer" setting.

openIdValidationMethod.title: OpenID Connect Validation Type
openIdValidationMethod.description:
In order to validate the ID token from the OpenID Connect provider, the node needs either a URL to get the public keys for the provider, or the symmetric key for an ID token signed with a HMAC-based algorithm.

By default, the configuration type is .well-known/openid-configuration_url. This means the node should retrieve the keys based on information in the OpenID Connect Provider Configuration Document.

You can instead configure the authentication node to validate the ID token signature with the client secret key you provide, or to validate the ID token with the keys retrieved from the URL to the OpenID Connect provider's JSON web key set.

String constructor parameters can be provided by appending | separated values.

Attribute configuration that will be used to map the user info obtained from the OAuth 2.0 Provider to the local user data store in the OpenAM.

Example: OAuth2.0_attribute=local_attribute

accountMapperClass.title: Account Mapper
accountMapperClass.description:
Name of the class implementing the attribute mapping for the account search.

This class is used by the module to map from the account information received from the OAuth Identity Provider into OpenAM.

The class must implement the org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.AttributeMapper interface.
Provided implementations are:
  • org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.JsonAttributeMapper
  • org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.oidc.JwtAttributeMapper (can only be used when using the openid scope)
String constructor parameters can be provided by appending | separated values.

attributeMappingClasses.title: Attribute Mapper
attributeMappingClasses.description:
Name of the class that implements the attribute mapping

This class maps the OAuth properties into OpenAM properties. A custom attribute mapper can be provided.

A custom attribute mapper must implement the org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.AttributeMapper interface.
Provided implementations are:
  • org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.JsonAttributeMapper
  • org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.oidc.JwtAttributeMapper (can only be used when using the openid scope)
String constructor parameters can be provided by appending | separated values.

createAccount.title: Create account if it does not exist
createAccount.description:
If the OAuth2 account does not exist in the local OpenAM data store, an account will be created dynamically.

If this is enabled, the account mapper could create the account dynamically if there is no account mapped. Before creating the account, a dialog prompting for a password and asking for an activation code can be shown if the parameter "Prompt for password setting and activation code" is enabled.

If this flag is not enabled, 3 alternative options exist:

  1. The accounts need to have a user profile in the OpenAM User Data Store
  2. The user does not have a user profile and the "Ignore Profile" is set in the Authentication Service of the realm.
  3. The account is mapped to an anonymous account (see parameter "Map to anonymous user" and "Anonymous User")

anonymousUserName.title: Anonymous User
anonymousUserName.description:
Username of the OpenAM anonymous user

The username of the user that will represent the anonymous user. This user account must already exist in the realm.

saveAttributesInSession.title: Save attributes in the session
saveAttributesInSession.description: If this option is enabled, the attributes configured in the attribute mapper will be saved into the OpenAM session

mapToAnonymousUser.title: Map to anonymous user
mapToAnonymousUser.description:
Enabled anonymous user access to OpenAM for OAuth authenticated users

If selected, the authenticated users in the OAuth 2.0 Provider will be mapped to the anonymous user configured in the next parameter.
If not selected the users authenticated will be mapped by the parameters configured in the account mapper.

NB If Create account if it does not exist is enabled, that parameter takes precedence.

promptPasswordFlag.title: Prompt for password setting and activation code
promptPasswordFlag.description:
Users must set a password and complete the activation flow during dynamic profile creation.

If this is enabled, the user must set a password before the system creates an account dynamically and an activation code will be sent to the user's email address. The account will be created only if the password and activation code are properly set.
If this is disabled, the account will be created transparently without prompting the user.

accountProviderClass.title: Account Provider
accountProviderClass.description:
Name of the class implementing the account provider.

This class is used by the module to find the account from the attributes mapped by the Account Mapper org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.AccountProvider interface.
String constructor parameters can be provided by appending | separated values.

enableRegistrationService.title: Use IDM as Registration Service
enableRegistrationService.description:
Whether to use IDM as an external Registration Service to complete registration for new users.

IDM is called and passed these parameters:

  • clientToken: Signed, encrypted JWT of the OAuth 2.0 authentication state.
  • returnParams: Encoded URL parameters, required to be returned to AM to resume authentication after registration in IDM is complete.

accountMapperConfiguration.title: Account Mapper Configuration
accountMapperConfiguration.description:
Mapping of OAuth account to local OpenAM account

Attribute configuration that will be used to map the account of the user authenticated in the OAuth 2.0 Provider to the local data store in the OpenAM. Example: OAuth2.0_attribute=local_attribute

cdssoRootUrl.title: Agent Root URL for CDSSO
cdssoRootUrl.description:
The agent root URL for CDSSO. The valid value is in the following format:
protocol://hostname:port/
The protocol represents the protocol used, such as http or https. The hostname represents the host name of the machine on which the agent resides. The port represents the port number on which the agent is installed. The slash following the port number is required.

authenticatorWebAuthnDeviceSettingsEncry.title: Key Store Type
authenticatorWebAuthnDeviceSettingsEncry.description:
Type of key store to load.

Note: PKCS#11 key stores require hardware support such as a security device or smart card and is not available by default in most JVM installations.

See the JDK 8 PKCS#11 Reference Guide for more details.

authenticatorWebAuthnDeviceSettingsEncry.title: Key-Pair Alias
authenticatorWebAuthnDeviceSettingsEncry.description: Alias of the certificate and private key in the key store. The private key is used to encrypt and decrypt device profiles.

webauthnAttrName.title: Profile Storage Attribute
webauthnAttrName.description:
The user's attribute in which to store WebAuthn profiles.

The default attribute is added to the schema when you prepare a user store for use with AM. If you want to use a different attribute, you must make sure to add it to your user store schema prior to deploying webauthn with AM. AM must be able to write to the attribute.

authenticatorWebAuthnDeviceSettingsEncry.title: Private Key Password
authenticatorWebAuthnDeviceSettingsEncry.description: Password to unlock the private key.

authenticatorWebAuthnDeviceSettingsEncry.title: Key Store Password
authenticatorWebAuthnDeviceSettingsEncry.description: Password to unlock the key store. This password is encrypted when it is saved in the OpenAM configuration. You should modify the default value.

authenticatorWebAuthnDeviceSettingsEncry.title: Device Profile Encryption Scheme
authenticatorWebAuthnDeviceSettingsEncry.description:
Encryption scheme to use to secure device profiles stored on the server.

If enabled, each device profile is encrypted using a unique random secret key using the given strength of AES encryption in CBC mode with PKCS#5 padding. An HMAC-SHA of the given strength (truncated to half-size) is used to ensure integrity protection and authenticated encryption. The unique random key is encrypted with the given RSA key pair and stored with the device profile.

Note: AES-256 may require installation of the JCE Unlimited Strength policy files.

authenticatorWebAuthnDeviceSettingsEncry.title: Encryption Key Store
authenticatorWebAuthnDeviceSettingsEncry.description: Path to the key store from which to load encryption keys.

promptPasswordFlag.title: Prompt for password setting and activation code
promptPasswordFlag.description:
Users must set a password and complete the activation flow during dynamic profile creation.

If this is enabled, the user must set a password before the system creates an account dynamically and an activation code will be sent to the user's email address. The account will be created only if the password and activation code are properly set.
If this is disabled, the account will be created transparently without prompting the user.

attributeMappingClasses.title: Attribute Mapper
attributeMappingClasses.description:
Name of the class that implements the attribute mapping

This class maps the OAuth properties into OpenAM properties. A custom attribute mapper can be provided.

A custom attribute mapper must implement the org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.AttributeMapper interface.
Provided implementations are:
  • org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.JsonAttributeMapper
  • org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.oidc.JwtAttributeMapper (can only be used when using the openid scope)
String constructor parameters can be provided by appending | separated values.

accountMapperClass.title: Account Mapper
accountMapperClass.description:
Name of the class implementing the attribute mapping for the account search.

This class is used by the module to map from the account information received from the OAuth Identity Provider into OpenAM.

The class must implement the org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.AttributeMapper interface.
Provided implementations are:
  • org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.JsonAttributeMapper
  • org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.oidc.JwtAttributeMapper (can only be used when using the openid scope)
String constructor parameters can be provided by appending | separated values.

createAccount.title: Create account if it does not exist
createAccount.description:
If the OAuth2 account does not exist in the local OpenAM data store, an account will be created dynamically.

If this is enabled, the account mapper could create the account dynamically if there is no account mapped. Before creating the account, a dialog prompting for a password and asking for an activation code can be shown if the parameter "Prompt for password setting and activation code" is enabled.

If this flag is not enabled, 3 alternative options exist:

  1. The accounts need to have a user profile in the OpenAM User Data Store
  2. The user does not have a user profile and the "Ignore Profile" is set in the Authentication Service of the realm.
  3. The account is mapped to an anonymous account (see parameter "Map to anonymous user" and "Anonymous User")

saveAttributesInSession.title: Save attributes in the session
saveAttributesInSession.description: If this option is enabled, the attributes configured in the attribute mapper will be saved into the OpenAM session

mapToAnonymousUser.title: Map to anonymous user
mapToAnonymousUser.description:
Enabled anonymous user access to OpenAM for OAuth authenticated users

If selected, the authenticated users in the OAuth 2.0 Provider will be mapped to the anonymous user configured in the next parameter.
If not selected the users authenticated will be mapped by the parameters configured in the account mapper.

NB If Create account if it does not exist is enabled, that parameter takes precedence.

anonymousUserName.title: Anonymous User
anonymousUserName.description:
Username of the OpenAM anonymous user

The username of the user that will represent the anonymous user. This user account must already exist in the realm.

attributeMapperConfiguration.title: Attribute Mapper Configuration
attributeMapperConfiguration.description:
Mapping of OAuth attributes to local OpenAM attributes

Attribute configuration that will be used to map the user info obtained from the OAuth 2.0 Provider to the local user data store in the OpenAM.

Example: OAuth2.0_attribute=local_attribute

accountProviderClass.title: Account Provider
accountProviderClass.description:
Name of the class implementing the account provider.

This class is used by the module to find the account from the attributes mapped by the Account Mapper org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.AccountProvider interface.
String constructor parameters can be provided by appending | separated values.

accountMapperConfiguration.title: Account Mapper Configuration
accountMapperConfiguration.description:
Mapping of OAuth account to local OpenAM account

Attribute configuration that will be used to map the account of the user authenticated in the OAuth 2.0 Provider to the local data store in the OpenAM. Example: OAuth2.0_attribute=local_attribute

enableRegistrationService.title: Use IDM as Registration Service
enableRegistrationService.description:
Whether to use IDM as an external Registration Service to complete registration for new users.

IDM is called and passed these parameters:

  • clientToken: Signed, encrypted JWT of the OAuth 2.0 authentication state.
  • returnParams: Encoded URL parameters, required to be returned to AM to resume authentication after registration in IDM is complete.

emailAttribute.title: Email attribute in the Response
emailAttribute.description:
Attribute from the response used to send activation code emails.

The attribute in the response from the profile service of the Provider that contains the email address of the authenticated user. This address will be used to send an email with an activation code when the accounts are allowed to be created dynamically.

smtpPort.title: SMTP port
smtpPort.description: The TCP port that will be used by the SMTP gateway

emailGateway.title: Mail Server Gateway implementation class
emailGateway.description:
The class used by the module to send email.

This class is used by the module to send email. A custom implementation can be provided.

The custom implementation must implement the org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.oauth2.EmailGateway

smtpHost.title: SMTP host
smtpHost.description: The mail host that will be used by the Email Gateway implementation

smtpPassword.title: SMTP User Password
smtpPassword.description: The Password of the SMTP User Name

smtpFromAddress.title: SMTP From address
smtpFromAddress.description: The email address on behalf of whom the messages will be sent

smtpSslEnabled.title: SMTP SSL Enabled
smtpSslEnabled.description: Tick this option if the SMTP Server provides SSL

smtpUsername.title: SMTP User Name
smtpUsername.description: If the SMTP Service requires authentication, configure the user name here

subjectProperty.title: Subject Property
subjectProperty.description: Property used to identify which attribute an auth server identifies a user by.

provider.title: Social Provider
provider.description: Social Provider for which this module is being setup.

mixUpMitigation.title: OAuth 2.0 Mix-Up Mitigation enabled
mixUpMitigation.description:
Enables OAuth 2.0 mix-up mitigation

The authorization server must support the OAuth 2.0 Mix-Up Mitigation draft, otherwise OpenAM will fail to validate responses from the authorization server. If only the OAuth 2.0 protocol is utilized, make sure that the accepted issuer value is set in the "Token Issuer" setting.

usesBasicAuth.title: Use Basic Auth
usesBasicAuth.description: When enabled, the client will use basic auth for authenticating with  the social auth provider. Enabled by default.

logoutBehaviour.title: Logout Options
logoutBehaviour.description:
Specify logout behavior.

The following options are available for logging out of the OAuth 2.0 Provider when the user logs out of AM:
  • prompt: Ask the user whether to log out from the OAuth 2.0 Provider
  • logout: Log out from the OAuth 2.0 Provider without asking the user
  • donotlogout: Do not log out the user from the OAuth 2.0 Provider

To enable IdP logout, you must also add org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.oauth2.OAuth2PostAuthnPlugin to the Authentication Post Processing Classes setting. Navigate to Authentication > Settings > Post Authentication Processing.

ssoProxyUrl.title: Proxy URL
ssoProxyUrl.description:
The URL to the OpenAM OAuth proxy JSP

This URL should only be changed from the default, if an external server is performing the GET to POST proxying. The default is /openam/oauth2c/OAuthProxy.jsp

clientId.title: Client Id
clientId.description:
OAuth client_id parameter

For more information on the OAuth client_id parameter refer to the RFC 6749, section 2.3.1

scopeDelimiter.title: Scope Delimiter
scopeDelimiter.description: Delimiter used to separate scope values. Default value is space.

authorizeEndpoint.title: Authentication Endpoint URL
authorizeEndpoint.description:
OAuth authentication endpoint URL

This is the URL endpoint for OAuth authentication provided by the OAuth Identity Provider

authenticationLevel.title: Authentication Level
authenticationLevel.description:
The authentication level associated with this module.

Each authentication module has an authentication level that can be used to indicate the level of security associated with the module; 0 is the lowest (and the default).

issuerName.title: Token Issuer
issuerName.description:
Required when the 'openid' scope is included. Value must match the iss field in issued ID Token
e.g. accounts.google.com

The issuer value MUST be provided when OAuth 2.0 Mix-Up Mitigation is enabled.

scope.title: Scope
scope.description:
OAuth scope; list of user profile properties

According to the OAuth 2.0 Authorization Framework, scope is a space-separated list of user profile attributes that the client application requires. The list depends on the permissions that the resource owner grants to the client application.

Some authorization servers use non-standard separators for scopes. For example, Facebook takes a comma-separated list.

tokenEndpoint.title: Access Token Endpoint URL
tokenEndpoint.description:
OAuth access token endpoint URL

This is the URL endpoint for access token retrieval provided by the OAuth Identity Provider. Refer to the RFC 6749, section 3.2

clientSecret.title: Client Secret
clientSecret.description:
OAuth client_secret parameter

For more information on the OAuth client_secret parameter refer to the RFC 6749, section 2.3.1

userInfoEndpoint.title: User Profile Service URL
userInfoEndpoint.description:
User profile information URL

This URL endpoint provides user profile information and is provided by the OAuth Identity Provider

NB This URL should return JSON objects in response

logoutServiceUrl.title: OAuth 2.0 Provider Logout Service
logoutServiceUrl.description:
The URL of the Identity Provider's logout service.

To enable IdP logout, you must also add org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.oauth2.OAuth2PostAuthnPlugin to the Authentication Post Processing Classes setting. Navigate to Authentication > Settings > Post Authentication Processing.

requestHeaderScore.title: Score
requestHeaderScore.description: The amount to increment the score if this check fails.

requestHeaderCheckEnabled.title: Request Header Check
requestHeaderCheckEnabled.description:
Enables the checking of the client request for a known header name and value.

The request header check will pass if the client request contains the required named header and value.

invertRequestHeaderScore.title: Invert Result
invertRequestHeaderScore.description: If the check succeeds the score will be included in the total, for failure the score will not be incremented.

requestHeaderName.title: Request Header Name
requestHeaderName.description: The name of the required HTTP header

requestHeaderValue.title: Request Header Value
requestHeaderValue.description: The required value of the named HTTP header.

timeSinceLastLoginCookieName.title: Cookie Name
timeSinceLastLoginCookieName.description: The name of the cookie used to store the time of the last successful authentication.

invertTimeSinceLastLoginScore.title: Invert Result
invertTimeSinceLastLoginScore.description: If the check succeeds the score will be included in the total, for failure the score will not be incremented.

maxTimeSinceLastLogin.title: Max Time since Last login
maxTimeSinceLastLogin.description: The maximum number of days that can elapse before this test.

timeSinceLastLoginCheckEnabled.title: Time since Last login Check
timeSinceLastLoginCheckEnabled.description:
Enables the checking of the last time the user successfully authenticated.

If this check is enabled, the check ensures the user has successfully authenticated within a given interval. If the interval has been exceeded the check will fail. The last authentication for the user is stored in a client cookie.

timeSinceLastLoginScore.title: Score
timeSinceLastLoginScore.description: The amount to increment the score if this check fails.

saveLastLoginTimeOnSuccessfulLogin.title: Save time of Successful Login
saveLastLoginTimeOnSuccessfulLogin.description:
The last login time will be saved in a client cookie

The Adaptive Risk Post Authentication Plug-in will update the last login time

failureScore.title: Score
failureScore.description: The amount to increment the score if this check fails.

failedAuthenticationCheckEnabled.title: Failed Authentication Check
failedAuthenticationCheckEnabled.description:
Checks if the user has past authentication failures.

Check if the OpenAM account lockout mechanism has recorded past authentication failures for the user.

NB For this check to function, Account Lockout must be enabled.

invertFailureScore.title: Invert Result
invertFailureScore.description: If the check succeeds the score will be included in the total, for failure the score will not be incremented.

knownCookieValue.title: Cookie Value
knownCookieValue.description: The value to be set on the cookie.

knownCookieCheckEnabled.title: Cookie Value Check
knownCookieCheckEnabled.description:
Enables the checking of a known cookie value in the client request

If this check is enabled, the check looks for a known cookie in the client request. If the cookie exists and has the correct value then the check will pass.

invertKnownCookieScore.title: Invert Result
invertKnownCookieScore.description: If the check succeeds the score will be included in the total, for failure the score will not be incremented.

knownCookieName.title: Cookie Name
knownCookieName.description: The name of the cookie to set on the client.

knownCookieScore.title: Score
knownCookieScore.description: The amount to increment the score if this check fails.

createKnownCookieOnSuccessfulLogin.title: Save Cookie Value on Successful Login
createKnownCookieOnSuccessfulLogin.description:
The cookie will be created on the client after successful login

The Adaptive Risk Post Authentication Plug-in will set the cookie on the client response

profileRiskAttributeName.title: Attribute Name
profileRiskAttributeName.description: The name of the attribute to retrieve from the user profile in the data store.

profileRiskAttributeValue.title: Attribute Value
profileRiskAttributeValue.description: The required value of the named attribute.

profileRiskAttributeCheckEnabled.title: Profile Risk Attribute check
profileRiskAttributeCheckEnabled.description:
Enables the checking of the user profile for a matching attribute and value.

If this check is enabled, the check will pass if the users profile contains the required risk attribute and value.

profileRiskAttributeScore.title: Score
profileRiskAttributeScore.description: The amount to increment the score if this check fails.

invertProfileRiskAttributeScore.title: Invert Result
invertProfileRiskAttributeScore.description: If the check succeeds the score will be included in the total, for failure the score will not be incremented.

geolocationValidCountryCodes.title: Valid Country Codes
geolocationValidCountryCodes.description:
The list of country codes that are considered as valid locations for client IPs.

The list is made up of country codes separated by a | character; for example:

gb|us|no|fr

geolocationCheckEnabled.title: Geolocation Country Code Check
geolocationCheckEnabled.description:
Enables the checking of the client IP address against the geolocation database.

The geolocation database associates IP addresses against their known location. This check passes if the country associated with the client IP address is matched against the list of valid country codes.

The geolocation database is available in binary format at MaxMind.

invertGeolocationScore.title: Invert Result
invertGeolocationScore.description: If the check succeeds the score will be included in the total, for failure the score will not be incremented.

geolocationScore.title: Score
geolocationScore.description: The amount to increment the score if this check fails.

geolocationDatabaseLocation.title: Geolocation Database location
geolocationDatabaseLocation.description:
The path to the location of the GEO location database.

The Geolocation database is not distributed with OpenAM, you can get it in binary format from MaxMind.

riskThreshold.title: Risk Threshold
riskThreshold.description:
If the risk threshold value is not reached after executing the different tests, the authentication is considered to be successful.

Associated with many of the adaptive risk checks is a score; if a check does not passes then the score is added to the current running total. The final score is then compared with the Risk Threshold, if the score is lesser than said threshold the module will be successful.

authenticationLevel.title: Authentication Level
authenticationLevel.description:
The authentication level associated with this module.

Each authentication module has an authentication level that can be used to indicate the level of security associated with the module; 0 is the lowest (and the default).

deviceCookieName.title: Cookie Name
deviceCookieName.description: The name of the cookie to be checked for (and optionally set) on the client request

saveDeviceCookieValueOnSuccessfulLogin.title: Save Device Registration on Successful Login
saveDeviceCookieValueOnSuccessfulLogin.description:
Set the device cookie on the client response

The Adaptive Risk Post Authentication Plug-in will set the device cookie on the client response

deviceCookieCheckEnabled.title: Device Registration Cookie Check
deviceCookieCheckEnabled.description:
Enables the checking of the client request for a known cookie.

If this check is enabled, the check will pass if the client request contains the named cookie.

deviceCookieScore.title: Score
deviceCookieScore.description: The amount to increment the score if this check fails.

invertDeviceCookieScore.title: Invert Result
invertDeviceCookieScore.description: If the check succeeds the score will be included in the total, for failure the score will not be incremented.

ipHistoryCount.title: History size
ipHistoryCount.description: The number of client IP addresses to save in the history list.

ipHistoryCheckEnabled.title: IP History Check
ipHistoryCheckEnabled.description:
Enables the checking of client IP address against a list of past IP addresses.

If this check is enabled; a set number of past IP addresses used by the client to access OpenAM is recorded in the user profile. This check passes if the current client IP address is present in the history list. If the IP address is not present, the check fails and the IP address is added to list if the overall authentication is successful (causing the oldest IP address to be removed).

ipHistoryProfileAttribute.title: Profile Attribute Name
ipHistoryProfileAttribute.description:
The name of the attribute used to store the IP history list in the data store.

IP history list is stored in the Data Store meaning your Data Store should be able to store values under the configured attribute name. If you're using a directory server as backend, make sure your Data Store configuration contains the necessary objectclass and attribute related settings.

ipHistoryScore.title: Score
ipHistoryScore.description: The amount to increment the score if this check fails.

invertIPHistoryScore.title: Invert Result
invertIPHistoryScore.description: If the check succeeds the score will be included in the total, for failure the score will not be incremented.

saveSuccessfulIP.title: Save Successful IP Address
saveSuccessfulIP.description:
The IP History list will be updated in the data store

The Adaptive Risk Post Authentication Plug-in will update the IP history list if the overall authentication is successful.

ipRangeScore.title: Score
ipRangeScore.description: The amount to increment the score if this check fails.

ipRange.title: IP Range
ipRange.description:
The list of IP address to compare against the client IP address.

The format of the IP address is as follows:

  • Single IP address: 172.16.90.1
  • CIDR notation: 172.16.90.0/24
  • IP net-block with netmask: 172.16.90.0:255.255.255.0

ipRangeCheckEnabled.title: IP Range Check
ipRangeCheckEnabled.description:
Enables the checking of the client IP address against a list of IP addresses.

The IP range check compares the IP of the client against a list of IP addresses, if the client IP is found within said list the check is successful.

invertIPRangeScoreEnabled.title: Invert Result
invertIPRangeScoreEnabled.description: If the check succeeds the score will be included in the total, for failure the score will not be incremented.

Active secrets are used for signature generation and encryption, while the non-active secrets are mainly used for signature verification and decryption.
