com.sun.identity.sm.enableDataStoreNotif.title: Enable Datastore Notification
com.sun.identity.sm.enableDataStoreNotif.description: Specifies if backend datastore notification is enabled. If this value is set to 'false', then in-memory notification is enabled. (property name: com.sun.identity.sm.enableDataStoreNotification)

com.sun.identity.sm.notification.threadp.title: Notification Pool Size
com.sun.identity.sm.notification.threadp.description: Specifies the size of the sm notification thread pool (total number of threads). (property name: com.sun.identity.sm.notification.threadpool.size)

com.iplanet.am.event.connection.num.retr.title: Number of retries for Event Service connections
com.iplanet.am.event.connection.num.retr.description: Specifies the number of attempts made to successfully re-establish the Event Service connections. (property name: com.iplanet.am.event.connection.num.retries)

com.iplanet.am.event.connection.delay.be.title: Delay between Event Service connection retries
com.iplanet.am.event.connection.delay.be.description: Specifies the delay in milliseconds between retries to re-establish the Event Service connections. (property name: com.iplanet.am.event.connection.delay.between.retries)

com.iplanet.am.event.connection.ldap.err.title: Error codes for Event Service connection retries
com.iplanet.am.event.connection.ldap.err.description: This secifies the LDAP exception error codes for which retries to re-establish Event Service connections will trigger. (property name: com.iplanet.am.event.connection.ldap.error.codes.retries)

com.sun.am.event.connection.disable.list.title: Disabled Event Service Connection
com.sun.am.event.connection.disable.list.description: Specifies which event connection (persistent search) to be disabled. There are three valid values - aci, sm and um (case insensitive). Multiple values should be separated with ",". (property name: com.sun.am.event.connection.disable.list)

com.iplanet.am.ldap.connection.num.retri.title: Number of retries for LDAP Connection
com.iplanet.am.ldap.connection.num.retri.description: Specifies the number of attempts made to successfully re-establish LDAP Connection. (property name: com.iplanet.am.ldap.connection.num.retries)

com.iplanet.am.ldap.connection.delay.bet.title: Delay between LDAP connection retries
com.iplanet.am.ldap.connection.delay.bet.description: Specifies the delay in milliseconds between retries to re-establish the LDAP connections. (property name: com.iplanet.am.ldap.connection.delay.between.retries)

com.iplanet.am.ldap.connection.ldap.erro.title: Error codes for LDAP connection retries
com.iplanet.am.ldap.connection.ldap.erro.description: This secifies the LDAP exception error codes for which retries to re-establish LDAP connections will trigger. (property name: com.iplanet.am.ldap.connection.ldap.error.codes.retries)

com.iplanet.am.sdk.cache.maxSize.title: SDK Caching Max. Size
com.iplanet.am.sdk.cache.maxSize.description: Specifies the size of the cache when SDK caching is enabled. The size should be an integer greater than 0, or default size (10000) will be used. Changing this value will reset (clear) the contents of the cache. (property name: com.iplanet.am.sdk.cache.maxSize)

com.iplanet.am.sdk.cache.entry.expire.en.title: Cache Entry Expiration Enabled
com.iplanet.am.sdk.cache.entry.expire.en.description: If this property is set, the cache entries will expire based on the time specified in User Entry Expiration Time property. (property name: com.iplanet.am.sdk.cache.entry.expire.enabled)

com.iplanet.am.sdk.cache.entry.user.expi.title: User Entry Expiration Time
com.iplanet.am.sdk.cache.entry.user.expi.description: This property specifies time in minutes for which the user entries remain valid in cache after their last modification. After this specified period of time elapses (after the last modification/read from the directory), the data for the entry that is cached will expire. At that instant new requests for data for these user entries will result in reading from the Directory. (property name: com.iplanet.am.sdk.cache.entry.user.expire.time)

com.iplanet.am.sdk.cache.entry.default.e.title: Default Entry Expiration Time
com.iplanet.am.sdk.cache.entry.default.e.description: This property specifies time in minutes for which the non-user entries remain valid in cache after their last modification. After this specified period of time elapses (after the last modification/read from the directory), the data for the entry that is cached will expire. At that instant new requests for data for these non-user entries will result in reading from the Directory. (property name: com.iplanet.am.sdk.cache.entry.default.expire.time)

1.0.title: Default SDK Properties
1.0.description: An object of property key-value pairs

actions.description: Obtain the value schema for this resource.
actions.name: schema

authenticationChains.title: Authentication Chains
authenticationChains.description:
The name of the authentication chains that are the entry points to being authenticated by each respective social authentication provider. The key should correspond to a key used to define a Display Name above.

For example:
KeyValue
googlesocialAuthChainGoogle

displayNames.title: Display Names
displayNames.description:
The display names for the implementations - this will be used to provide a name for the icon displayed on the login page. The key should be used across all the settings on this page to join them together.

For example:
KeyValue
googleGoogle

enabledKeys.title: Enabled Implementations
enabledKeys.description:
Provide a key that has been used to define the settings above to enable that set of settings.

For example: google

icons.title: Icons
icons.description:
Either a full URL or a path relative to the base of the site/server where the image can be found. The image will be used on the login page to link to the authentication chain defined above. The key should correspond to a key used to define a Display Name above.

For example:
KeyValue
google/images/google-sign-in.png

sslState.title: Mail Server Secure Connection
sslState.description: Specifies whether to connect to the SMTP mail server using SSL.

hostname.title: Mail Server Host Name
hostname.description: Specifies the fully qualified domain name of the SMTP mail server through which to send email notifications.

subject.title: Email Subject
subject.description: Specifies a subject for notification messages. If you do not set this, OpenAM does not set the subject for notification messages.

emailAddressAttribute.title: Email Attribute Name
emailAddressAttribute.description: Specifies the profile attribute from which to retrieve the end user's email address.

emailImplClassName.title: Email Message Implementation Class
emailImplClassName.description: Specifies the class that sends email notifications, such as those sent for user registration and forgotten passwords.

port.title: Mail Server Host Port
port.description: Specifies the port number for the SMTP mail server.

password.title: Mail Server Authentication Password
password.description: Specifies the password for the SMTP user name.

from.title: Email From Address
from.description: Specifies the address from which to send email notifications.

message.title: Email Content
message.description: Specifies content for notification messages. If you do not set this, OpenAM includes only the confirmation URL in the mail body.

username.title: Mail Server Authentication Username
username.description: Specifies the user name for the SMTP mail server.

requestHandlers.title: Request Handler List
requestHandlers.description:
List of handlers to deal with SAML v2.0 requests bound to SOAP.

The required format is: key=Meta Alias|class=Handler Class

Set the key property for a request handler to the meta alias, and the class property to the name of the class that implements the handler.

For example: key=/pdp|class=com.sun.identity.xacml.plugins.XACMLAuthzDecisionQueryHandler

maxThreads.title: Maximum thread pool size
maxThreads.description:
The maximum size of the thread pool from which scripts will operate.

New threads will be created up to this size once the task queue reaches capacity. Has no effect if the queue is unbounded.

coreThreads.title: Core thread pool size
coreThreads.description: The core size of the thread pool from which scripts will operate.

whiteList.title: Java class whitelist
whiteList.description:
List of patterns of allowed Java classes that may be loaded/accessed by scripts.

Each Java class accessed by a script must match at least one of these patterns. Use '*' as a wildcard, e.g. java.lang.*

idleTimeout.title: Thread idle timeout (seconds)
idleTimeout.description:
Length of time (in seconds) to wait before terminating threads.

Length of time (in seconds) to wait before terminating threads that were started when the queue reached capacity. Only applies to threads beyond the core pool size (up to the maximum size).

queueSize.title: Thread pool queue size
queueSize.description:
Size of queue to use for buffering script execution request when core pool is at capacity.

Use -1 for an unbounded queue (this disables the maximum pool size setting). For short, CPU-bound scripts, consider a small pool size and larger queue length. For I/O-bound scripts (e.g., REST calls) consider a larger maximum pool size and a smaller queue. Not hot-swappable: restart server for changes to take effect.

blackList.title: Java class blacklist
blackList.description:
List of patterns of Java classes that must not be accessed by a script.

This blacklist is applied after the whitelist to apply additional restrictions. For instance you may whitelist java.lang.* and then blacklist java.lang.System and java.lang.Runtime. It is recommended to always prefer specific whitelists where possible.

useSecurityManager.title: Use system SecurityManager
useSecurityManager.description:
Indicates whether the system SecurityManager should also be consulted when checking access to Java classes.

If enabled, then the checkPackageAccess method will be called for each Java class accessed. If no SecurityManager is configured, then this has no effect.

serverTimeout.title: Server-side Script Timeout
serverTimeout.description:
The maximum execution time any individual script should take on the server (in seconds).

Server-side scripts will be forcibly stopped after this amount of execution time.

org.forgerock.services.cts.store.page.si.title: Page Size
org.forgerock.services.cts.store.page.si.description: The number of results per page returned from the underlying datastore. If the result set is smaller than the page size, the number of results will never be paginated. If larger, the number of pages returned will be result set size / page size. Larger values will result in fewer round trips to the datastore when retrieving large result sets. Leave as 0 to not enable pagination, and return all results in a single page.

org.forgerock.services.cts.store.vlv.pag.title: VLV Page Size
org.forgerock.services.cts.store.vlv.pag.description: The number of results per page returned from the underlying datastore when using VLVs. Larger values will result in fewer round trips to the datastore when retrieving large result sets.

org.forgerock.services.cts.store.directo.title: Connection String(s)
org.forgerock.services.cts.store.directo.description: An ordered list of connection strings for LDAP directories. Each connection string is composed as follows: HOST:PORT[|SERVERID[|SITEID]], where server and site IDs are optional parameters that will prioritize that connection to use from the specified nodes. Multiple connection strings should be comma-separated, e.g. host1:389,host2:50389|server1|site1,host3:50389.

org.forgerock.services.cts.store.affinit.title: Affinity Enabled
org.forgerock.services.cts.store.affinit.description: Enables affinity based request load balancing when accessing the CTS servers. It is imperative that the connection string setting is set to the same value for all OpenAM servers in the deployment when this feature is enabled.

1.0.title: CTS Data Store Properties
1.0.description: An object of property key-value pairs

invertNotEnforcedUrls.title: Invert Not Enforced URLs
invertNotEnforcedUrls.description:
Only not enforced list of urls will be enforced. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.notenforced.url.invert)
Hot-swap: Yes

sessionAttributeMap.title: Session Attribute Map
sessionAttributeMap.description:
Maps the session attributes to be populated under specific names for the currently authenticated user. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.session.attribute.mapping)
Hot-swap: Yes
Example:
To populate the value of session attribute UserToken under name CUSTOM-userid: enter UserToken in Map Key field, and enter CUSTOM-userid in Corresponding Map Value field.

attributeMultiValueSeparator.title: Attribute Multi Value Separator
attributeMultiValueSeparator.description:
Specifies separator for multiple values. Applies to all types of attributes i.e. profile, session and response attributes. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.attribute.multi.value.separator)
Hot-swap: Yes

continuousSecurityHeaders.title: Continuous Security Headers
continuousSecurityHeaders.description: The name of the headers in the user's original request, that will be sent as part of the payload during policy evaluation, which can then be accessed via the 'environment' variable in a policy script. The 'key' is the name of the header to be sent, and the 'value' is the name which it will appear as in the policy evaluation script.It is possible to map multiple headers to the same name (they will simply appear as an array in the evaluation script). If the header doesn't exist, then the empty string will be sent.

notEnforcedIps.title: Not Enforced Client IP List
notEnforcedIps.description:
No authentication and authorization are required for the requests coming from these client IP addresses. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.notenforced.ip)
Hot-swap: Yes
Examples:
192.18.145.*
192.18.146.123

responseAttributeMap.title: Response Attribute Map
responseAttributeMap.description:
Maps the policy response attributes to be populated under specific names for the currently authenticated user. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.response.attribute.mapping)
Hot-swap: Yes
Example:
To populate the value of response attribute uid under name CUSTOM-USER-NAME: enter uid in Map Key field, and enter CUSTOM-USER-NAME in Corresponding Map Value field.

profileAttributeMap.title: Profile Attribute Map
profileAttributeMap.description:
Maps the profile attributes to be populated under specific names for the currently authenticated user. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.profile.attribute.mapping)
Hot-swap: Yes
Example:
To populate the value of profile attribute cn under name CUSTOM-Common-Name: enter cn in Map Key field, and enter CUSTOM-Common-Name in Corresponding Map Value field.
To populate the value of profile attribute mail under name CUSTOM-Email: enter mail in Map Key field, and enter CUSTOM-Email in Corresponding Map Value field.

continuousSecurityCookies.title: Continuous Security Cookies
continuousSecurityCookies.description: The name of the cookies to be sent as part of the payload during policy evaluation, which can be accessed via the 'environment' variable in a policy script. The 'key' is the name of the cookie to be sent, and the 'value' is the name which it will appear as in the policy evaluation script. It is possible to map multiple cookies to the same name (they will simply appear as an array in the evaluation script). If the cookie doesn't exist, then the empty string will be sent.

clientIpValidation.title: Client IP Validation
clientIpValidation.description:
This validates if the subsequent browser requests come from the same ip address that the SSO token is initially issued against. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.client.ip.validation.enable)
Hot-swap: Yes

notEnforcedUrls.title: Not Enforced URLs
notEnforcedUrls.description:
List of urls for which no authentication required. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.notenforced.url)
Hot-swap: Yes
Example:
http://myagent.mydomain.com/*.gif

ignorePathInfoForNotEnforcedUrls.title: Ignore Path Info for Not Enforced URLs
ignorePathInfoForNotEnforcedUrls.description:
Indicate whether the path info and query should be stripped from the request URL before being compared with the URLs of the not enforced list when those URLs have a wildcard '*' character. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.ignore.path.info.for.not.enforced.list)
Hot-swap: Yes

fetchAttributesForNotEnforcedUrls.title: Fetch Attributes for Not Enforced URLs
fetchAttributesForNotEnforcedUrls.description:
Agent fetches profile attributes for not enforced urls by doing policy evaluation. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.notenforced.url.attributes.enable)
Hot-swap: Yes

logonAndImpersonation.title: Logon and Impersonation
logonAndImpersonation.description: Set to true if agent should do Windows Logon and User Impersonation. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.iis.logonuser)

customProperties.title: Custom Properties
customProperties.description:
Additional properties that allow users to augment the set of properties supported by agent. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.freeformproperties)
Hot-swap: Yes
Examples:
customproperty=custom-value1
customlist[0]=customlist-value-0
customlist[1]=customlist-value-1
custommap[key1]=custommap-value-1
custommap[key2]=custommap-value-2

checkUserInDomino.title: Check User in Domino Database
checkUserInDomino.description: If true, agent checks user existence in Domino name database. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.domino.check.name.database)

useLtpaToken.title: Use LTPA token
useLtpaToken.description: Set to true if agent needs to use LTPA Token. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.domino.ltpa.enable)

filterConfiguredWithOwa.title: Filter configured with OWA
filterConfiguredWithOwa.description: Set to true if the IIS agent filter is configured for OWA. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.iis.owa.enable)

ltpaTokenOrganizationName.title: LTPA Token Organization Name
ltpaTokenOrganizationName.description: The organization name to which the LTPA token belongs. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.domino.ltpa.org.name)

filterPriority.title: Filter Priority
filterPriority.description: The loading priority of filter. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.iis.filter.priority)

clientHostnameHeader.title: Client Hostname Header
clientHostnameHeader.description:
HTTP header name that holds the Hostname of the client. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.client.hostname.header)
Hot-swap: Yes

overrideRequestPort.title: Override Request URL Port
overrideRequestPort.description:
Set to true if the agent is sitting behind a ssl/tls off-loader, load balancer, or proxy to override the port with the value from the property com.sun.identity.agents.config.agenturi.prefix. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.override.port)
Hot-swap: Yes

changeProtocolToHttps.title: Change URL Protocol to https
changeProtocolToHttps.description: If true, avoids IE6 security pop-ups. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.iis.owa.enable.change.protocol)

loadBalanced.title: Load Balancer Setup
loadBalanced.description:
Set to true if a load balancer is used for AM services. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.load.balancer.enable)
Hot-swap: No

replayPasswordKey.title: Replay Password Key
replayPasswordKey.description: DES key for decrypting the basic authentication password in the session. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.replaypasswd.key)

overrideRequestProtocol.title: Override Request URL Protocol
overrideRequestProtocol.description:
Set to true if the agent is sitting behind a ssl/tls off-loader, load balancer, or proxy to override the protocol with the value from the property com.sun.identity.agents.config.agenturi.prefix. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.override.protocol)
Hot-swap: Yes

ltpaTokenCookieName.title: LTPA Token Cookie Name
ltpaTokenCookieName.description: The name of the cookie that contains the LTPA token. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.domino.ltpa.cookie.name)

idleSessionTimeoutUrl.title: Idle Session Timeout Page URL
idleSessionTimeoutUrl.description: URL of the local idle session timeout page. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.iis.owa.enable.session.timeout.url)

overrideProxyHostAndPort.title: Override Proxy Server's Host and Port

ltpaTokenConfigurationname.title: LTPA Token Configuration Name
ltpaTokenConfigurationname.description: The configuration name that the agent uses in order to employ the LTPA token mechanism. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.domino.ltpa.config.name)

overrideNotificationUrl.title: Override Notification URL
overrideNotificationUrl.description:
Set to true if the agent is sitting behind a ssl/tls off-loader, load balancer, or proxy to override the URL with the value from the property com.sun.identity.agents.config.agenturi.prefix. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.override.notification.url)
Hot-swap: Yes

overrideRequestHost.title: Override Request URL Host
overrideRequestHost.description:
Set to true if the agent is sitting behind a ssl/tls off-loader, load balancer, or proxy to override the host with the value from the property com.sun.identity.agents.config.agenturi.prefix. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.override.host)
Hot-swap: Yes

postDataCachePeriod.title: POST Data Entries Cache Period
postDataCachePeriod.description:
POST cache entry lifetime in minutes. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.postcache.entry.lifetime)
Hot-swap: Yes

postDataPreservation.title: POST Data Preservation
postDataPreservation.description:
Enables POST data preservation. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.postdata.preserve.enable)
Note that this feature is not supported in all the web agents. Please refer individual agents documentation for more details.
Hot-swap: Yes

clientIpHeader.title: Client IP Address Header
clientIpHeader.description:
HTTP header name that holds the IP address of the client. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.client.ip.header)
Hot-swap: Yes

showPasswordInHeader.title: Show Password in HTTP Header
showPasswordInHeader.description: Set to true if encrypted password should be set in HTTP header AUTH_PASSWORD. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.iis.password.header)

userIdParameterType.title: User ID Parameter Type
userIdParameterType.description:
User ID can be fetched from either SESSION and LDAP attributes. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.userid.param.type)
Hot-swap: Yes

retrieveClientHostname.title: Retrieve Client Hostname
retrieveClientHostname.description:
Gets the client's hostname through DNS reverse lookup for use in policy evaluation. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.get.client.host.name)
Hot-swap: Yes

amLoginUrl.title: AM Login URL
amLoginUrl.description:
AM login page URL. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.login.url)
Hot-swap: Yes
Example:
http://host:port/opensso/UI/Login

policyEvaluationApplication.title: Application
policyEvaluationApplication.description:
Which application contains the policies to evaluate with (property name: org.forgerock.openam.agents.config.policy.evaluation.application)
Hot-swap: Yes

userIdParameter.title: User ID Parameter
userIdParameter.description:
Agent sets value of User Id to REMOTE_USER server variable. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.userid.param)
Hot-swap: Yes

logoutRedirectUrl.title: Logout Redirect URL
logoutRedirectUrl.description:
User gets redirected to this url after logout. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.logout.redirect.url). This property should be specified along with the above Logout URL List.
Hot-swap: Yes

amLogoutUrl.title: AM Logout URL
amLogoutUrl.description:
AM logout page URL. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.logout.url)
Hot-swap: Yes
Example:
http://host:port/opensso/UI/Logout

agentConnectionTimeout.title: Agent Connection Timeout
agentConnectionTimeout.description:
Timeout period in seconds for an agent connection with AM auth server. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.auth.connection.timeout)
Hot-swap: Yes

primaryServerPollingPeriod.title: Polling Period for Primary Server
primaryServerPollingPeriod.description:
Interval in minutes, agent polls to check the primary server is up and running. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.poll.primary.server)
Hot-swap: No

logoutResetCookies.title: Logout Cookies List for Reset
logoutResetCookies.description:
Any cookies to be reset upon logout in the same format as cookie reset list. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.logout.cookie.reset)
Hot-swap: Yes
Cookie1
Cookie2=value;Domain=subdomain.domain.com

policyClockSkew.title: Policy Clock Skew
policyClockSkew.description:
Time in seconds used adjust time difference between Agent machine and AM. Clock skew in seconds = AgentTime - AMServerTime. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.policy.clock.skew)
Hot-swap: No

fetchPoliciesFromRootResource.title: Fetch Policies from Root Resource
fetchPoliciesFromRootResource.description:
Agent caches policy decision of the resource and all resources from the root of the resource down. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.fetch.from.root.resource)
Hot-swap: No

ssoCachePollingInterval.title: SSO Cache Polling Period
ssoCachePollingInterval.description:
Polling interval in minutes to refresh agent's sso cache. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.sso.cache.polling.interval)
Hot-swap: No

applicationLogoutUrls.title: Logout URL List
applicationLogoutUrls.description:
List of application logout URLs. User gets logged out from AM session when these urls accessed. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.agent.logout.url). If this property is used, user should specify a value for the below Logout Redirect URL property.
Hot-swap: Yes
Example:
http://myagent.mydomain.com/logout.html

policyCachePollingInterval.title: Policy Cache Polling Period
policyCachePollingInterval.description:
Polling interval in minutes to refresh agent's policy cache. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.policy.cache.polling.interval)
Hot-swap: No

policyEvaluationRealm.title: Realm
policyEvaluationRealm.description:
Which realm to start evaluating from (property name: org.forgerock.openam.agents.config.policy.evaluation.realm)
Hot-swap: Yes

debugLogRotation.title: Agent Debug File Rotation
debugLogRotation.description:
Debug file gets rotated based on the size specified. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.debug.file.rotate)
Hot-swap: Yes

configurationPollingInterval.title: Configuration Reload Interval
configurationPollingInterval.description:
Interval in minutes to fetch agent configuration from AM. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.polling.interval)
Hot-swap: No

remoteLogFilename.title: Remote Log Filename
remoteLogFilename.description:
(Not used in Agent 5 onwards)
Name of file stored on AM server that contains agent audit messages. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.remote.logfile)
Hot-swap: No

localAuditLogRotation.title: Rotate Local Audit Log
localAuditLogRotation.description:
Flag to indicate that audit log files should be rotated when reaching a certain size. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.local.log.rotate)
Hot-swap: Yes

fqdnCheck.title: FQDN Check
fqdnCheck.description:
Enables checking of fqdn default value and fqdn map values. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.fqdn.check.enable)
Hot-swap: Yes

jwtName.title: JWT Cookie Name
jwtName.description: The name used by the agent to set the OIDC JWT on the user's browser. (Agent 5 only).

agentgroup.title: Group
agentgroup.description:
Add the agent to a group to allow inheritance of property values from the group.
Changing the group will update inherited property values.
Inherited property values are copied to the agent.

agentConfigChangeNotificationsEnabled.title: Agent Configuration Change Notification
agentConfigChangeNotificationsEnabled.description:
Enable agent to receive notification messages from AM server for configuration changes. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.change.notification.enable)
Hot-swap: Yes

fqdnMapping.title: FQDN Virtual Host Map
fqdnMapping.description:
Maps virtual, invalid, or partial hostnames, and IP addresses to the FQDN to access protected resources. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.fqdn.mapping)
Hot-swap: Yes
Examples:
To map the partial hostname myserver to myserver.mydomain.com: enter myserver in the Map Key field and myserver.mydomain.com in the Corresponding Map Value field. To map a virtual server rst.hostname.com that points to the actual server abc.hostname.com: enter valid1 in the Map Key field and rst.hostname.com in the Corresponding Map Value field.

configurationCleanupInterval.title: Configuration Cleanup Interval
configurationCleanupInterval.description:
Interval in minutes to cleanup old agent configuration entries. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.cleanup.interval)
Hot-swap: No

accessDeniedUrl.title: Resources Access Denied URL
accessDeniedUrl.description:
The URL of the customized access denied page. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.access.denied.url)
Hot-swap: Yes

debugRotationSize.title: Agent Debug File Size
debugRotationSize.description:
Agent debug file size in bytes. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.debug.file.size)
Hot-swap: Yes

localAuditRotationSize.title: Local Audit Log Rotation Size
localAuditRotationSize.description:
Size limit in bytes when a local audit log file is rotated to a new file. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.local.log.size)
Hot-swap: Yes

auditAccessType.title: Audit Access Types
auditAccessType.description:
Types of messages to log based on user URL access attempts. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.audit.accesstype)
Hot-swap: Yes

repositoryLocation.title: Location of Agent Configuration Repository
repositoryLocation.description: Indicates agent's configuration located either on agent's host or centrally on AM server.

fqdnDefault.title: FQDN Default
fqdnDefault.description:
Fully qualified hostname that the users should use in order to access resources. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.fqdn.default)
Hot-swap: Yes

webSocketConnectionIntervalInMinutes.title: Web Socket Connection Interval
webSocketConnectionIntervalInMinutes.description: Interval in minutes by which agents reopen their web socket connection to ensure a fair distribution of connections across AM servers. (Agent 5 only).

cdssoRootUrl.title: Agent Root URL for CDSSO
cdssoRootUrl.description:
The agent root URL for CDSSO. The valid value is in the following format:
protocol://hostname:port/
The protocol represents the protocol used, such as http or https. The hostname represents the host name of the machine on which the agent resides. The port represents the port number on which the agent is installed. The slash following the port number is required.

notificationsEnabled.title: Enable Notifications
notificationsEnabled.description:
The notifications help in maintaining agent's sso, policy and configuration caches. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.notification.enable)
Hot-swap: No

remoteLogSendInterval.title: Remote Audit Log Interval
remoteLogSendInterval.description:
Periodic interval in minutes in which audit log messages are sent to remote log file. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.remote.log.interval)
Hot-swap: No

agentNotificationUrl.title: Agent Notification URL
agentNotificationUrl.description:
(Not used in Agent 5 onwards)
URL used by agent to register notification listeners. (property name: com.sun.identity.client.notification.url)
Hot-swap: No

auditLogLocation.title: Audit Log Location
auditLogLocation.description:
Specifies where audit messages should be logged. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.log.disposition)
Hot-swap: Yes

ssoOnlyMode.title: SSO Only Mode
ssoOnlyMode.description:
Agent will just enforce authentication (SSO), but no authorization for policies. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.sso.only)
Hot-swap: Yes

gotoParameterName.title: Goto Parameter Name
gotoParameterName.description:
Property used only when CDSSO is enabled. Default value should be changed only when the login URL has a landing page specified
Example : com.sun.identity.agents.config.cdsso.cdcservlet.url = http://host:port/opensso/cdcservlet?goto=http://agent:port/landing.jsp
The parameter is used by the Agent to append the original request URL to this cdcserlet URL. This parameter is consumed by the landing page to redirect to the original URL. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.redirect.param)
Hot-swap: Yes
Example: com.sun.identity.agents.config.redirect.param = goto2
The complete URL sent for authentication will be
http://host:port/opensso/cdcservlet?goto=http://agent:port/landing.jsp?goto2=http://agent.port/original.jsp

ignoreServerCheck.title: Ignore Server Check
ignoreServerCheck.description:
Agent uses this value to check AM is up before doing a 302 redirect. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.ignore.server.check)
Hot-swap: Yes

encodeUrlSpecialCharacters.title: Encode URL's Special Characters
encodeUrlSpecialCharacters.description:
Encodes the url which has special characters before doing policy evaluation. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.encode.url.special.chars.enable)
Hot-swap: Yes

anonymousUserId.title: Anonymous User Default Value
anonymousUserId.description:
User id of unauthenticated users. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.anonymous.user.id)
Hot-swap: Yes

ignorePreferredNamingUrl.title: Ignore Preferred Naming URL in Naming Request
ignorePreferredNamingUrl.description:
Agent uses this value to send preferred naming url in the naming request. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.ignore.preferred.naming.url)
Hot-swap: Yes

profileAttributesCookieMaxAge.title: Profile Attributes Cookie Maxage
profileAttributesCookieMaxAge.description:
Maxage of attributes cookie headers. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.profile.attribute.cookie.maxage)
Hot-swap: Yes

anonymousUserEnabled.title: Anonymous User
anonymousUserEnabled.description:
Enable/Disable REMOTE_USER processing for anonymous users. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.anonymous.user.enable)
Hot-swap: Yes

encodeSpecialCharsInCookies.title: Encode special chars in Cookies
encodeSpecialCharsInCookies.description:
Encode special chars in cookie by URL encoding. Useful when profile, session and response attributes contain special chars and attributes fetch mode is set to HTTP_COOKIE. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.encode.cookie.special.chars.enable)
Hot-swap: Yes

ignorePathInfo.title: Ignore Path Info in Request URL
ignorePathInfo.description:
The path info will be stripped from the request URL while doing Not Enforced List check and url policy evaluation if the value is set to true. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.ignore.path.info)
Hot-swap: Yes

profileAttributesCookiePrefix.title: Profile Attributes Cookie Prefix
profileAttributesCookiePrefix.description:
Sets cookie prefix in the attributes headers. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.profile.attribute.cookie.prefix)
Hot-swap: Yes

agentLocale.title: Agent Locale
agentLocale.description:
The default locale for the product. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.locale)
Hot-swap: No

caseInsensitiveUrlComparison.title: URL Comparison Case Sensitivity Check
caseInsensitiveUrlComparison.description:
Enforces case insensitivity in both policy and not enforced url evaluation. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.url.comparison.case.ignore)
Hot-swap: Yes

encodeProfileAttributes.title: Native Encoding of Profile Attributes
encodeProfileAttributes.description:
Agent encodes the ldap header values in the default encoding of OS locale. If false, UTF-8 gets used. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.convert.mbyte.enable)
Hot-swap: Yes

cdssoUrls.title: CDSSO Servlet URL
cdssoUrls.description:
List of URLs of the available CDSSO controllers that may be used by the Agent for CDSSO processing. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.cdsso.cdcservlet.url)
Hot-swap: Yes
Example:
http://host:port/opensso/cdcservlet

cookieResetList.title: Cookies Reset Name List
cookieResetList.description:
List of cookies in the format: name[=value][;Domain=value]. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.cookie.reset)
Hot-swap: Yes
Examples:
Cookie1
Cookie2=value;Domain=subdomain.domain.com

cdssoCookieDomain.title: Cookies Domain List
cdssoCookieDomain.description:
List of domains in which cookies have to be set in CDSSO. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.cdsso.cookie.domain)
Hot-swap: Yes
Example:
.sun.com

cdsso.title: Cross Domain SSO
cdsso.description:
Enables Cross-Domain Single Sign On. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.cdsso.enable)
Hot-swap: Yes

cookieResetEnabled.title: Cookie Reset
cookieResetEnabled.description:
Agent reset cookies in the response before redirecting to authentication. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.cookie.reset.enable)
Hot-swap: Yes

cookieName.title: Cookie Name
cookieName.description:
Name of the SSO Token cookie used between the AM server and the Agent. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.cookie.name)
Hot-swap: No

cdssoRedirectUri.title: CDSSO Redirect URI
cdssoRedirectUri.description:
An intermediate URI that is used by the Agent for processing CDSSO requests. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.cdsso.redirect.uri)
Hot-swap: Yes

secureCookies.title: Cookie Security
secureCookies.description:
Agent sends secure cookies if communication is secure. (property name: com.sun.identity.agents.config.cookie.secure)
Hot-swap: No

1.0.description: Agents handler that is responsible for managing agents

cfgAttributeMappingClasses.title: Attribute Mapper
cfgAttributeMappingClasses.description: Name of the class that implements the attribute mapping This class maps the OAuth properties into OpenAM properties. A custom attribute mapper can be provided. A custom attribute mapper must implement the org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.AttributeMapper interface. Provided implementations are: org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.JsonAttributeMapper org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.oidc.JwtAttributeMapper (can only be used when using the openid scope)

cfgAccountMapperConfiguration.title: Account Mapper Configuration
cfgAccountMapperConfiguration.description: Mapping of OAuth account to local OpenAM account Attribute configuration that will be used to map the account of the user authenticated in the OAuth 2.0 Provider to the local data store in the OpenAM. Example: OAuth2.0_attribute=local_attribute

basicAuth.title: Use Basic Auth
basicAuth.description: When enabled, the client will use basic auth for authenticating with the social auth provider. Enabled by default.

saveUserAttributesToSession.title: Save Attributes in the Session
saveUserAttributesToSession.description: If this option is enabled, the attributes configured in the attribute mapper will be saved into the OpenAM session

issuer.title: Token Issuer
issuer.description: Required when the 'openid' scope is included. Value must match the iss field in issued ID Token e.g. accounts.google.com The issuer value MUST be provided when OAuth 2.0 Mix-Up Mitigation is enabled.

cfgAccountMapperClass.title: Account Mapper
cfgAccountMapperClass.description: Name of the class implementing the attribute mapping for the account search. This class is used by the module to map from the account information received from the OAuth Identity Provider into OpenAM. The class must implement the org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.AttributeMapper interface. Provided implementations are: org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.JsonAttributeMapper org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.oidc.JwtAttributeMapper(can only be used when using the openid scope) String constructor parameters can be provided by appending | separated values.

scopeDelimiter.title: Scope Delimiter
scopeDelimiter.description: Delimiter used to separate scope values. Default value is space.

authorizeEndpoint.title: Authentication Endpoint URL
authorizeEndpoint.description:
OAuth authentication endpoint URL

This is the URL endpoint for OAuth authentication provided by the OAuth Identity Provider

provider.title: Social Provider
provider.description: Social Provider for which this module is being setup.

clientSecret.title: Client Secret
clientSecret.description:
OAuth client_secret parameter

For more information on the OAuth client_id parameter refer to the RFC 6749 (http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749#section-2.3.1), section 2.3.1

cfgAttributeMappingConfiguration.title: Attribute Mapper Configuration
cfgAttributeMappingConfiguration.description: Mapping of OAuth attributes to local OpenAM attributes Attribute configuration that will be used to map the user info obtained from the OAuth 2.0 Provider to the local user data store in the OpenAM. Example: OAuth2.0_attribute=local_attribute

clientId.title: Client ID
clientId.description:
OAuth client_id parameter

For more information on the OAuth client_id parameter refer to the RFC 6749 (http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749#section-2.3.1), section 2.3.1

cfgAccountProviderClass.title: Account Provider
cfgAccountProviderClass.description: Name of the class implementing the account provider. This class is used by the module to find the account from the attributes mapped by the Account Mapper org.forgerock.openam.authentication.modules.common.mapping.AccountProvider interface. String constructor parameters can be provided by appending | separated values.

tokenEndpoint.title: Access Token Endpoint URL
tokenEndpoint.description: OAuth access token endpoint URL This is the URL endpoint for access token retrieval provided by the OAuth Identity Provider.Refer to the RFC 6749 (http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749#section-3.2), section 3.2

scopeString.title: OAuth Scope
scopeString.description:
List of user profile properties

According to the OAuth 2.0 Authorization Framework, scope is a space-separated list of user profile attributes that the client application requires. The list depends on the permissions that the resource owner grants to the client application. Some authorization servers use non-standard separators for scopes.

cfgMixUpMitigation.title: OAuth 2.0 Mix-Up Mitigation Enabled
cfgMixUpMitigation.description: Enables OAuth 2.0 mix-up mitigation The authorization server must support the OAuth 2.0 Mix-Up Mitigation draft (https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-oauth-mix-up-mitigation-01#section-3.1), otherwise OpenAM will fail to validate responses from the authorization server. If only the OAuth 2.0 protocol is utilized, make sure that the accepted issuer value is set in the "Token Issuer" setting.

userInfoEndpoint.title: User Profile Service URL
userInfoEndpoint.description:
User profile information URL

This URL endpoint provides user profile information and is provided by the OAuth Identity Provider NB This URL should return JSON objects in response

org.forgerock.services.cts.store.page.si.title: Page Size
org.forgerock.services.cts.store.page.si.description: The number of results per page returned from the underlying datastore. If the result set is smaller than the page size, the number of results will never be paginated. If larger, the number of pages returned will be result set size / page size. Larger values will result in fewer round trips to the datastore when retrieving large result sets. Leave as 0 to not enable pagination, and return all results in a single page.

org.forgerock.services.cts.store.vlv.pag.title: VLV Page Size
org.forgerock.services.cts.store.vlv.pag.description: The number of results per page returned from the underlying datastore when using VLVs. Larger values will result in fewer round trips to the datastore when retrieving large result sets.

org.forgerock.services.cts.store.directo.title: Connection String(s)
org.forgerock.services.cts.store.directo.description: An ordered list of connection strings for LDAP directories. Each connection string is composed as follows: HOST:PORT[|SERVERID[|SITEID]], where server and site IDs are optional parameters that will prioritize that connection to use from the specified nodes. Multiple connection strings should be comma-separated, e.g. host1:389,host2:50389|server1|site1,host3:50389.

org.forgerock.services.cts.store.affinit.title: Affinity Enabled
org.forgerock.services.cts.store.affinit.description: Enables affinity based request load balancing when accessing the CTS servers. It is imperative that the connection string setting is set to the same value for all OpenAM servers in the deployment when this feature is enabled.

1.0.title: Default CTS Data Store Properties
1.0.description: An object of property key-value pairs

jwkStoreCacheTimeout.title: JWK Store Cache Timeout (in minutes)
jwkStoreCacheTimeout.description: The cache timeout for the JWK store of the authorization server, in minutes.

clientId.title: Client Name
clientId.description: The name used to identify this OAuth 2.0 remote consent service when referencedin other services.

jwksUriAS.title: Authorization Server jwk_uri
jwksUriAS.description: The jwk_uri for retrieving the authorization server signing and encryption keys.

signingKeyAlias.title: Signing Key Alias
signingKeyAlias.description: The alias of the key in the default keystore to use for signing.

consentResponseTimeLimit.title: Consent Response Time Limit (in minutes)
consentResponseTimeLimit.description: The time limit set on the consent response JWT before it expires, in minutes.

encryptionKeyAlias.title: Encryption Key Alias
encryptionKeyAlias.description: The alias of the key in the default keystore to use for encryption.

jwkStoreCacheMissCacheTime.title: JWK Store Cache Miss Cache Time (in minutes)
jwkStoreCacheMissCacheTime.description: The length of time a cache miss is cached, in minutes.

errors.title: Validation errors

queries.description: Query for all authentication trees. Only a query filter of 'true' is supported.

radiusServerPort.title: Listener Port
radiusServerPort.description:
The UDP port on which each OpenAM server will listen for RADIUS Access-Request packets

According to the RADIUS Authentication Specification, RFC 2865, the officially assigned port number for RADIUS is 1812. Specify a value from 1024 to 65535. All client requests are handled through the same port.

radiusThreadPoolQueueSize.title: Thread Pool Queue Size
radiusThreadPoolQueueSize.description: The number of requests that can be queued for the pool before further requests will be silently dropped. See also "Thread Pool Core Size" and "Thread Pool Max Size". Specify a value from 1 to 1000.

radiusThreadPoolMaxSize.title: Thread Pool Max Size
radiusThreadPoolMaxSize.description: Maximum number of threads allowed in the pool. See also "Thread Pool Core Size".

radiusThreadPoolCoreSize.title: Thread Pool Core Size
radiusThreadPoolCoreSize.description: When a RADIUS request is received and fewer than corePoolSize threads are running, a new thread is created to handle the request, even if other worker threads are idle. If there are more than "Thread Pool Core Size" but less than "Thread Pool Max Size" threads running, a new thread will be created only if the queue is full. By setting "Thread Pool Core Size" and "Thread Pool Max Size" to the same value, you create a fixed-size thread pool. Specify a value from 1 to 100.

radiusListenerEnabled.title: Enabled
radiusListenerEnabled.description: Enables the OpenAM RADIUS server to listen for requests on the listener port and to handle the requests.

radiusThreadPoolKeepaliveSeconds.title: Thread Pool Keep-Alive Seconds
radiusThreadPoolKeepaliveSeconds.description: If the pool currently has more than Thread Pool Core Size threads, excess threads will be terminated if they have been idle for more than the Keep-Alive Seconds. Specify a value from 1 to 3600.

forgottenUsernameKbaEnabled.title: Security Questions
forgottenUsernameKbaEnabled.description: If enabled, users must answer their security questions during the forgotten username process.

forgottenUsernameTokenTTL.title: Token LifeTime (seconds)
forgottenUsernameTokenTTL.description: Maximum lifetime for the token allowing forgotten username, in seconds.

forgottenUsernameCaptchaEnabled.title: Captcha
forgottenUsernameCaptchaEnabled.description: If enabled, users must pass a Google reCAPTCHA challenge during the forgotten username retrieval process to mitigate against software bots.

forgottenUsernameEmailSubject.title: Outgoing Email Subject
forgottenUsernameEmailSubject.description: Customizes the forgotten username email subject text. Format is locale|subject text.

forgottenUsernameShowUsernameEnabled.title: Show Username
forgottenUsernameShowUsernameEnabled.description: If enabled, users see their forgotten username on the browser page.

forgottenUsernameEnabled.title: Forgotten Username
forgottenUsernameEnabled.description: If enabled, users can retrieve their forgotten username.

forgottenUsernameEmailUsernameEnabled.title: Email Username
forgottenUsernameEmailUsernameEnabled.description: If enabled, users receive their forgotten username by email.

forgottenUsernameEmailBody.title: Outgoing Email Body
forgottenUsernameEmailBody.description: Customizes the forgotten username email body text. Format is locale|body text.

userRegistrationKbaEnabled.title: Security Questions
userRegistrationKbaEnabled.description: If enabled, users must set up their security questions during the self-registration process.

userRegistrationValidUserAttributes.title: Valid Creation Attributes
userRegistrationValidUserAttributes.description: Specifies a whitelist of user attributes that can be set during user creation.

userRegistrationEnabled.title: User Registration
userRegistrationEnabled.description: If enabled, new users can sign up for an account.

userRegistrationEmailVerificationEnabled.title: Email Verification
userRegistrationEmailVerificationEnabled.description: If enabled, users who self-register must perform email address verification.

userRegisteredDestination.title: Destination After Successful Self-Registration
userRegisteredDestination.description:
Specifies the action to be taken after a user successfully registers a new account. Choose from:
  • default. User is sent to a success page without being logged in.
  • login. User is sent to the login page to authenticate.
  • autologin. User is automatically logged in and sent to the appropriate page.

userRegistrationEmailSubject.title: Outgoing Email Subject
userRegistrationEmailSubject.description: Customize the User Self-Registration verification email subject text. Format is locale|subject text.

userRegistrationTokenTTL.title: Token Lifetime (seconds)
userRegistrationTokenTTL.description: Maximum lifetime of the token allowing User Self-Registration, in seconds.

userRegistrationEmailBody.title: Outgoing Email Body
userRegistrationEmailBody.description: Customize the User Self-Registration verification email body text. Format is: locale|body text.

userRegistrationEmailVerificationFirstEn.title: Verify Email before User Detail
userRegistrationEmailVerificationFirstEn.description: If enabled, email address verification will be performed first before user details screen is displayed. This will take effect only if Verify Email is enabled.

userRegistrationCaptchaEnabled.title: Captcha
userRegistrationCaptchaEnabled.description: If enabled, users must pass a Google reCAPTCHA challenge during user self-registration to mitigate against software bots.

forgottenPasswordTokenTTL.title: Token Lifetime (seconds)
forgottenPasswordTokenTTL.description:
Maximum lifetime for the token allowing forgotten password reset, in seconds.

Specify a value from 0 to 2147483647.

forgottenPasswordEmailSubject.title: Outgoing Email Subject
forgottenPasswordEmailSubject.description: Customize the forgotten password email subject text. Format is locale|subject text.

forgottenPasswordEmailVerificationEnable.title: Email Verification
forgottenPasswordEmailVerificationEnable.description: If enabled, users who reset passwords must perform email address verification.

forgottenPasswordEmailBody.title: Outgoing Email Body
forgottenPasswordEmailBody.description: Customize the forgotten password email body text. Format is locale|body text.

forgottenPasswordCaptchaEnabled.title: Captcha
forgottenPasswordCaptchaEnabled.description: If enabled, users must pass a Google reCAPTCHA challenge during password reset to mitigate against software bots.

forgottenPasswordKbaEnabled.title: Security Questions
forgottenPasswordKbaEnabled.description: If enabled, users must answer their security questions during the forgotten password process.

numberOfAllowedAttempts.title: Lock Out After number of attempts
numberOfAllowedAttempts.description: Can be set to 1 or more attempts for a user to correctly answer all their security questions. After the number of configured attempts the user has not correctly answered them the password reset feature will be disabled.

numberOfAttemptsEnforced.title: Enforce password reset lockout
numberOfAttemptsEnforced.description: If enabled, users will be prevented from resetting their password after the configured number of failed attempts.

forgottenPasswordEnabled.title: Forgotten Password
forgottenPasswordEnabled.description: If enabled, users can reset their forgotten password.

minimumAnswersToDefine.title: Minimum Answers to Define
minimumAnswersToDefine.description: Specifies the minimum number of KBA answers that users must define.

kbaQuestions.title: Security Questions
kbaQuestions.description:
Specifies the default set of knowledge-based authentication (KBA) security questions. The security questions can be set for the User Self-Registration, forgotten password reset, and forgotten username services, respectively.

Format is unique key|locale|question.

signingSecretKeyAlias.title: Signing Secret Key Alias
signingSecretKeyAlias.description: A signing secret key alias in the OpenAM server's JCEKS keystore. Used to sign the JWT token that OpenAM uses to track end users during User Self-Service operations.

encryptionKeyPairAlias.title: Encryption Key Pair Alias
encryptionKeyPairAlias.description: An encryption key alias in the OpenAM server's JCEKS keystore. Used to encrypt the JWT token that OpenAM uses to track end users during User Self-Service operations.

validQueryAttributes.title: Valid Query Attributes
validQueryAttributes.description: Specifies the valid query attributes used to search for the user. This is a list of attributes used to identify your account for forgotten password and forgotten username.

minimumAnswersToVerify.title: Minimum Answers to Verify
minimumAnswersToVerify.description: Specifies the minimum number of KBA questions that users need to answer to be granted the privilege to carry out an action, such as registering for an account, resetting a password, or retrieving a username. Specify a value from 0 to 50.

userRegistrationConfirmationUrl.title: User Registration Confirmation Email URL
userRegistrationConfirmationUrl.description: Specifies the confirmation URL that the user receives during the self-registration process. The ${realm} string is replaced with the current realm.

forgottenUsernameServiceConfigClass.title: Forgotten Username Service Config Provider Class
forgottenUsernameServiceConfigClass.description: Specifies the provider class to configure any custom plugins.

userRegistrationServiceConfigClass.title: User Registration Service Config Provider Class
userRegistrationServiceConfigClass.description: Specifies the provider class to configure any custom plugins.

forgottenPasswordConfirmationUrl.title: Forgotten Password Confirmation Email URL
forgottenPasswordConfirmationUrl.description: Specifies the confirmation URL that the user receives after confirming their identity during the forgotten password process. The ${realm} string is replaced with the current realm.

forgottenPasswordServiceConfigClass.title: Forgotten Password Service Config Provider Class
forgottenPasswordServiceConfigClass.description: Specifies the provider class to configure any custom plugins.

profileProtectedUserAttributes.title: Protected Update Attributes
profileProtectedUserAttributes.description: Specifies a profile's protected user attributes, which causes re-authentication when the user attempts to modify these attributes.

.+.description: The (potentially) localised description of the outcome ID.

serverUrls.description: An ordered list of connection strings for LDAP directories.Each connection string is composed as follows: HOST:PORT. serverHostname = Host Name
